author: {'steamid': '76561198010861238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1559846910}
review: I played for many years (mostly before Steam launch) and would still be playing if not for some real life obligations that eat up a lot of my time. It's not as polished as a lot of other shooters, graphics are dated but improving, and the learning curve a heck of a lot harder than most. I think that turns people off initially, but the difficulty makes it all the more rewarding once you figure stuff out. When I was playing, the community was smaller than most mainstream games, but most were dedicated and willing to help out if you asked. Find a good squad, participate in squad activities, and learn, I promise you will enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053777243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 173263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164709, 'last_played': 1709061520}
review:
Small company based on volunteers free work off-work time, on a tight budget. Game have old graphics and only use 1 computer CPU core, 1 RAM-stick memory and hardly GPU but almost all 1 core CPU load.
Fish bowl map. Old bugs +20 years old. When new patches get released often a lot of problems appear. It is like they don't even try stuff before new game code go live.

What else. Low population on players. Softcap is part of the game and is when 1 of the 2 sides have almost no players logged into game. Whole towns get captured without a single bullet fired.
Not even the latest fundraise which made the company rich enough to pay influencers (themself admitted to pay off influencers to play) to play didn't help to increase player numbers much.

The game idea is great though, but game is filled to the brim with bugs and errors. Company has a bunch of entusiasts but work on free stuff as mostly volunteers.

Been both HighCommand officer and Trainer, for new players but have resigned bc game have to many problems. And they made the AO from HC to a proximity AO which lead to a guerilla warfare without the game strategy HC war rank level. 4 players or 1 player with 4 accounts as multiple can high-jack the whole game play for 1 side when the side only have 1 AO avaible. HC can not pull the AO or do anything about it.

On the + side. Player community is amazing. Lots of great people.

I will keep playing. But recommend for ex HLL if you want to play a ww2 game. Play DCS if you want to fly.

review:
[h1]WWII Online - Uma Imers√£o Intensa na Segunda Guerra Mundial Online[/h1]

[b]Avalia√ß√£o do Jogo: WWII Online[/b]

WWII Online oferece aos jogadores uma experi√™ncia imersiva em um campo de batalha online ambientado na Segunda Guerra Mundial. Nesta avalia√ß√£o, exploraremos os elementos que fazem de WWII Online uma escolha √∫nica no cen√°rio dos jogos de guerra online.

[b]Ambiente de Guerra Realista e Autenticidade Hist√≥rica[/b]
O jogo se destaca por criar um ambiente de guerra realista, com mapas extensos e autenticidade hist√≥rica. A aten√ß√£o aos detalhes nos uniformes, ve√≠culos e armas contribui para uma experi√™ncia que transporta os jogadores de volta √† Segunda Guerra Mundial.

[b]Teatro de Opera√ß√µes Massivo e Estrat√©gia em Tempo Real[/b]
WWII Online destaca-se por seu teatro de opera√ß√µes massivo, onde os jogadores participam de batalhas em larga escala. A estrat√©gia em tempo real √© essencial, com comandantes e jogadores trabalhando juntos para alcan√ßar objetivos t√°ticos e ganhar vantagem sobre o inimigo.

[b]Variedade de Ve√≠culos e Classes Militares[/b]
O jogo oferece uma ampla variedade de ve√≠culos, desde tanques e avi√µes at√© ve√≠culos terrestres. As diferentes classes militares proporcionam uma experi√™ncia variada, permitindo aos jogadores escolherem entre infantaria, tanqueiros, aviadores e muito mais.

[b]Colabora√ß√£o e Coordena√ß√£o Essenciais[/b]
WWII Online incentiva a colabora√ß√£o e a coordena√ß√£o entre os jogadores. A comunica√ß√£o eficaz √© fundamental para o sucesso, seja organizando estrat√©gias com aliados ou coordenando ataques precisos contra as for√ßas inimigas.

[b]Desafios Din√¢micos e Atualiza√ß√µes Regulares[/b]
Os desafios din√¢micos, como conquista de cidades e campos de batalha em constante mudan√ßa, mant√™m o jogo emocionante. As atualiza√ß√µes regulares introduzem novos conte√∫dos, melhorias e ajustes, mantendo a comunidade envolvida e interessada.

[b]Curva de Aprendizado Desafiadora e Recompensadora[/b]
WWII Online apresenta uma curva de aprendizado desafiadora, exigindo que os jogadores entendam as mec√¢nicas do jogo e as estrat√©gias militares. A recompensa vem na forma de conquistas significativas e contribui√ß√µes para o esfor√ßo de guerra global.

[b]Conclus√£o[/b]
WWII Online oferece uma experi√™ncia √∫nica e imersiva para os f√£s de jogos de guerra online, com sua abordagem realista, estrat√©gia em tempo real e colabora√ß√£o essencial. Se voc√™ procura uma experi√™ncia aut√™ntica da Segunda Guerra Mundial com uma comunidade envolvente, WWII Online √© uma escolha recomendada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032491332', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1703030697}
review:
What sucks: 24 year old graphics with clunky and half baked gameplay, this thing is the same as it was more than ten or fifteen years ago. terrible latency issues as well. The last straw for me was the terrible player count combined with a distinct lack of communication.
What's good: the community and the scale of the map. that's pretty much it. have fun spawning a tank, driving it somewhere for like 30 minutes and then blowing up over and over. Good stuff.

review:
This game is actually OK alright, but its not the type of action game you would expect, I mean yes, sure it does have decent action, when you capture the checkpoints, etc a lot of action. But if you are specifically looking for action, this game is not right for you. But If you interested in little action and World war II gear, guns, tanks, airplanes, it is right for you but remember tanks and airplanes are moderately difficult for even a proffessional player to operate. Reccomend you to try it out.

Rate: 80/100
Try it, you'll probrably like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965870879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1710111216}
review: excellent, huge, immersive game. I love it. Its for people who like fighting uncertainty. Like xcom2 you have to be smart long before you even know where the enemy is and what kind of enemy it is. This creates a lot of tension. In contrast to maybe dungeon of naheulbeuk, where you always know whats going on, wether you are in a fight at all or what kind of enemys you are facing and what your chances are. Be smart, and plan for things that might happen not only for thtings that will happen. A tank hiding in bushes 1km away whith 4x scope on its guns and machineguns can give panic attacks quickly. Tactics is THE BIG THING in this game, except being a good shooter of course. Its the xcom2 of firstperson realttime war games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199203081565', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1699742165}
review: If you dont mind graphics and the idea of an entire war going on with hundreds of players fighting over territory that could last weeks sounds great to you then you would like this game.. but unfortunately the game is dead theres only like 30 or 20 people playing at max. Sure the game it self is super old but the thing that really makes it not worth the download is the player count. Plus the allies out number the axis 3 or 4 to 1 so if you play allies its not challenging really and if you play axis your just going to continue to lose over and over again which isnt fun for anybody. Plus for some reason the players that play as allies have a weird contempt for the axis like one time they were talking about team imbalance and how the axis were protesting about it and the allies were like "well just hand over the keys and leave them on the table then." Then who would you play with lol? Why the hate is there i have no idea. The players are friendly to new players though and other then that weird interaction people are generally friendly But unfortunately the game is a shadow of its former self. Which i hate i always come to the party late for these types of games. The game was probably fantastic at the begining with all the players but it just isnt anymore. Theres supposed to be a WWII online 2 so ill keep that in the back of my mind til it comes out but until then you might want to try another MMO shooter like foxhole or maybe planet side 2 idk.

author: {'steamid': '76561199049145882', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7562, 'last_played': 1700848847}
review:
Honestly the game is pretty good for how old it is (cant wait for the remake with the new engine).
The learning difficulty depends on what you wanna do. If you wanna do infantry then its a piece of cake (just gotta learn some things like terms and what things mean etc etc). If you wanna do air, well good luck. If you wanna do armor (tanks basically) its pretty easy. Naval I dunno, I'm assuming naval is beginning of the campaign, other then that naval is ??????, don't try it.
The subscription is a little too much in my opinion, but this is a free game being supported by the community sooo.
In conclusion if you know what you are doing its pretty fun. 9.1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199161089366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1698351092}
review:
Das spiel ist m√ºll. ich werde jetzt stichpunktartig erkl√§ren warum, und mich dabei m√∂glichst kurz halten.

- viel zu viel tutorial text. man muss sich erstmal durch hunderte von texten durchqu√§len, ohne die man leider √ºberhaupt nicht versteht, was im spiel so abgeht

- katastrophales interface. alles EXTREM monoton, das macht es schwierig, sich eine gewisse ordnung in dieses sehr komplexe spiel zu bringen. normalerweise ist interface monotonie ja f√∂rderlich f√ºr eine gewisse ordnung, aber hier ist wie gesagt so viel text drin dass man den √ºberblick verliert. wichtige buttons sind winzig und versteckt und umgeben von einer vielzahl an buttons f√ºr mega unwichtige funktionen

- ganzes spiel nur auf englisch - was nicht schlimm w√§re, wenn man sich nicht durch tausende seiten mit teilweise sehr detailliertem fachvokabular lesen m√ºsste

- tastatur layout ist englisch, das bedeugtet dass deutsche spieler manche tasten f√ºr wichtige funktionen nicht haben

- grafik ist alt, was ja ok ist, weil das spiel auch sehr alt ist, aber k√∂nnte trotzdem ein update kriegen

- mapdesign ist schei√üe, die ganze map schaut behindert aus, weil immer die selben umgebungen genutzt werden

- keine schnelle teamkommunikation m√∂glich

- man kann nicht aus fahrzeugen aussteigen. also selbst wenn da nur ein gegner mit der pistole auf dich schie√üt, bist du tot, weil man quasi "als" fahrzeug spawnt, nicht "im" fahrzeug"

- fahrzeug-beifahrer sterben extrem schnell und zuf√§llig. passiert gut und gerne, dass nur noch der fahrer lebt, nicht mehr der richtsch√ºtze. da bringt einem der beste panzer nix. sehr √§rgerlich.

- zuguterletzt: das game ist auf 1000 spieler ausgelegt - is nat√ºrlich bl√∂d, wenn die meiste zeit nur 4!!!!!!! leute WELTWEIT f√ºr eine fraktion k√§mpfen (zB die deutschen)

edit: alles schei√üe an dem game, steuerung schei√üe, entwickler schei√üe, grafik schei√üe, die eingaben funktionieren nicht weil das schei√ü spiel nur auf die englische tastatur eingestellt is, also auch das schei√üe, community is in ordnung, teilweise sogar echt nett, aber daf√ºr is das schadensmodell schei√üe, weil man auch durch pistolenschuss in den VERKACKTEN FUSS stirbt. ja eigentlich ist 90 % an dem game schei√üe, der rest is gut aber kann das ergebnis nicht afwerten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980160604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1696692649}
review:
One of those games that I purchase way back when (so my steam hours are far out). And playing it recently on steam? has made me re-download the client directly from WW2 Online again. And here lays much about the 'numbers' issue. Steam doesn't count those (who are most) who play the game from the standalone client.

The game does need a little update, but there is a committed team who are doing so. I mean I remember the graphics now look better than what I recall from first launch? And now a project to move it all to Unreal 5!? Sign me up.

This game? Is honestly (when you work as a team) one of the most fun and "OMG" experiences I've had in FPS. That since i played it back then, I've yet to be 'amazed' by numbers of guys running about on screen. Or seeing a large amount of planes and players parachuting out them. Or a line of tanks in formation coming down a hill and sudden flashes. Playing Arma and Squad in hopes to get something similar, it never hit in the same way.

I eagerly await to see the development of this having seen the road map.

If you can see past the graphics, audio, bit of an OG feel. And are wiling to give it go, with sincerity? You may be surprised at the charm of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973884476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4148, 'last_played': 1696828242}
review:
There's nothing like WWIIOL.  No MMOFPS has the map size and system, supply system, unit count, or camaraderie.  It's more of a war simulator than an FPS.  Give it a few hours to start overcoming the learning curve and the older graphics will not concern you.  You'll have frustrating moments, but the victories are hugely fulfilling.

There's a reason WWIIOL has lived long enough to have 20-year-old graphics.  If you haven't played it before, you've never played anything like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199522497192', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1689358142}
review:
I hope that this review provides a comprehensive overview of the game. There seems to be some misunderstandings about the game, and there are also some perhaps overly-favorable reviews out there that don't really communicate the strengths and weaknesses of the game.

So, first off. I began playing this game about 6-7 years ago, and had a Free Trial account (that went through many different evolutions and devolutions as the devs tried to hammer out what they wanted as far as a Free to Play trial account went) until late last year, after I subscribed to the game.

I have played a LOT of games, of many different genres. Most of these are WW2-related, including the first real computer games I ever played: the Close Combat series. The originals, not the re-releases.

This game is a WW2 Massively Multiplayer First Person Shooter/Tanker/Pilot/Sailor Historical Accuracy Simulator game. This is not an Arcade shooter, like you might see, for example, in titles such as Call of Duty, Heroes & Generals, Planetside 2, Squad, etc. There are no medics to magically heal you up to perfect, there are no mechanics that can magically repair vehicles. There are no crosshairs allowing you to accurately fire from the hip. The flight mechanics are not arcade flight mechanics. It is very unlikely that you'll be able to even attempt to fly with keyboard & mouse controls, because there is just too much fine control required to actually pilot a plane. There is bullet drop, even from large-caliber guns.

Given that the game is a Historical Accuracy Simulator, there is definitely some Asymmetical Warfare going on. The different guns and equipment of either side are NOT carbon copies of things on the other. There is no equivalent to an 88mm Flak gun on the Allied side, and no equivalent to a Matilda on the Axis (at least not at the time that the Matilda is used). Fighter planes and bombers are not identical to each other, and have very different flight models. However, it is still a game, so sides are roughly balanced with the types and amounts of equipment they can bring to bear in the game.

The game is also absolutely massive. It uses a 1/2 scale map of Western Europe based on satellite data. It is the largest MMO world map, period. It's also completely open: you can spawn in at one end of the map and fly to the other; this actually happens when players organize bombing runs on enemy production factories. Keep in mind, however, that means it can take literal minutes when initially setting up an attack on a town, because players have to drive out, set up mobile spawn points, etc. Walking from one town to another, or even from a forward base to a town, can definitely take 10+ minutes. 

There are 2 layers to the game: Fighting as soldiers/tanks/planes/ships, and moving around Divisions and Brigades on the world map as well as coordinating attack and defense objectives. Only High Command players have access to moving supply around the map, and HC accept applications from individuals and train them up on how to use the game tools to move around supply, and when it's a good idea to do so. As for fighting on the ground, in the air, or on the seas, players spawn in, using up supply from said divisions and brigades, in order to achieve objectives. These objectives can be attacking or defending towns, blowing or repairing bridges, blowing or defending forward bases, etc. When players are killed, despawn without being in a "Return to Base" area, or are sufficently wounded/damaged, then that supply doesn't go back to the division or brigade it came from. Supply trickles in based on the production rates of a side's factories.

Additionally, it can be said that there are two different ways to play the game in terms of fighting in the actual game world: tactically and strategically. Tactical play is basically anything that's fun and exciting: attacking a hotly contested area, defending a hotly contested area, assaulting defensive positions, shooting down planes, bombing towns, etc. Strategic play is basically anything that your side really needs you to do that's NOT fun or exciting: defending critical control points from sneaky enemies infiltrating behind enemy lines, defending forward bases from intermittent attack, etc. It's VERY LIKELY that some newer players will happen upon these strategic missions, and may mistake the lack of action that's due to the strategic importance of a given mission for the game being boring. In this case, newer players should leave that mission and go to one that's more immediately satisfying, so they can get a feel of the actual meat of the game, which is that wonderful tactical play.

At the present time, there is no integrated voice chat. You will have to rely on the third-party application Discord. However, Discord is a very solid application to use in the mean time while the developers work on integrated natively supported voice communication in the game.

The in-game groups are known as "squads" - these are basically the same thing as "clans" or "gaming clubs" that you might see in other games. Playing this game solo is like playing a single individual soldier who knows no one around them while fighting in an actual war. You're going to die A LOT. Everyone does, even 16-year veterans to the game. Doing that over and over, without being a part of a group, is going to wear you down. You're just not going to enjoy the gameplay, because it's not going to feel personal. You're not going to be able to know what's happening around you. You're not going to be able to coordinate movements or attacks while playing if you're not in a squad or if you're not on voice comms. I implore new players to use Discord whether or not they're in a squad, and to immediately try using Discord. Almost all of the current players have been trying to do everything they can to help the new players coming in, and that includes helping them out on voice comms.

The biggest thing I have been seeing is that there are complaints about the Free to Play accounts. There are accusations of hiding content behind a pay wall. There is a lot of disgruntlement over just what and how much Free to Play accounts should get access to. The reality of the situation is that World War II Online uses a PAY TO PLAY business model. This is the same business models that MMOS up to and prior to World of Warcraft use, in that to actually play the game, you need to pay. However, your account is still left ACTIVE after the initial trial period. This is meant to allow you to continue to see what the game has to offer, in the hopes that you eventually subscribe. Therefore, once an account loses its premium status, it is HEAVILY RESTRICTED. You get access to the mainstay of the infantry, which is the standard bolt-action rifles everyone, including premium players, use. This is because weapons are tied to supply, and there could be hundreds of bolt-action rifles to spawn with, but only a few dozen sub-machine guns. You also get access to early sub-machine guns, trucks, and perhaps some other early equipment. You can, and this is the HUGE one, create your own missions, and run out and make your own mobile spawn points. That allows you to not only play at the tactical level, but also on the strategic level, so you can contribute meaningfully to the side that you play on. Considering that the game is Pay to Play, in my personal opinion, the Free to Play accounts have enough content, because they're meant to keep you around if you're interested but can't afford it or aren't sure until you can afford it or until you're sure whether or not it's worth it for you.

Lastly, there is simply nothing else like this game. I mean that very seriously. A lot of people have been throwing out "Heroes & Generals", but that's not close. A better comparison is a combination of Foxhole and Planetside 2, but with the mechanics of a Red Orchestra game. Still, none of those, on their own, offer what this game does.
developer_response:
One correction is needed.

WWII Online has in-game voice communications.  Press V to communicate and use CTRL+Tab to switch channels.

author: {'steamid': '76561199486401751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1706380410}
review: Honestly I don't mind the graphics at all, they're really not bad! For an older game, it was definitely ahead of its time. Even now. What FPS game, do you know that takes 30 plus minutes to walk to the next town to help defend / invade! haha! I do wish there was a button to "hold your breath" for a couple seconds to stop the swaying of the rifle. But otherwise, ive got no complaints. I only have 74 minutes of play time a the moment, but im sure ill have way more soon enough.
developer_response:
@SurvivorCB

Welcome to the game.  Please look for mobile spawn points which allow you to get into a battle very quickly and cuts down on the walking. :)

Give a shout on SIDE Channel and ask where you should spawn, whomever responds will ask you to follow them or mentions another players name.

You can use the .j command by simply typing that player's nick.  Hope this helps and welcome to the war!

review: Greedy developer(s), stealing thousands of donated dollars for their own personal use stating "Don't worry, it's all going towards the game!" When in one notable circumstance a dev bought a luxury car. All while half of the game is locked behind a paywall and atop that the port to UE4 is YEARS late. author: {'steamid': '76561199259887309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 405, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1710731774}
review:
Map 9.5/10= -0.25= Missing some iconic locations, ie. Saint Michel, and the ones that are there have a great lack of detail, ie. Paris, London, Caen, Berlin etc. -0.25= At some point the map just starts loosing detail.

Realism 9/10= Don't get me wrong the game play, and historical accuracy are great, although not as detailed in some areas as Brothers In Arms, but that is understandable, but now my main problems are these things; -1= The game has lots of immersion breaking bugs, ie. bullet round casings sticking out of the M1 Garand, and some guns having messed up reload animations etc. and etc. I may also include that the pictures framed on the walls of the buildings in-game, are not historically accurate, nor are the golden sheep shrine memorials, but those don't count to the point being took away, because those are cool, fun, and important Easter eggs.

Game play 8/10= -1= Due to the aforementioned, bugs, and glitches in the game, the game play suffers a lot from these unfortunate mishaps; if you want a very big example of one such, unfortunate mishap: You may start up the game at any given time, and it may start glitching out, and then crash, upon entering the game. Now I have found a way to fix this, for me, but I do not know just how well it may work for someone else, but the thing that I always do when it happens is immediately turn the computer off, and then back on, and start the game up again, form the steam tab. -0.5= Obviously, the game is very old, and the game play is almost as messed up, but still I believe that the game play itself has aged fairly well (personally I believe that). -0.5= I know that this is not what the game is about, but it sure would be nice if I could set up a recreation of the beach invasions of Normandy, or the liberation of Paris, with a "Gamemaster" type mode, like in ARMA, which had you creating your own battles, and scenarios, it is still, like the coolest thing ever, (I am thinking of a single player version of that). Now I just thought I would bring this up now, but the User Interface is awful, but it is definitely usable, so no points are being taken away.

Graphics 6/10= -2= Although there is Destruction, and some cool effects ie. when you look at the sun you get blinded by the light. When flying planes, it has a mist effect. There is a lot of awesome explosion effects etc. and etc. but despite this the game still lacks in visuals, with outdated technology= bad lighting, low polygon counts on models, low resolution textures etc. and etc. the graphics are also very inconsistent, going back to what I said about the, "Low resolution textures", there will sometimes be those, ugly low resolution textures, but then there will be high resolution textures in other areas, not only that, but the game also has bad geometry, all due to this game's outdated technology. Side note: Please add in gore, and dismemberment. -2= There are a lot of visual bugs, and glitches, too many to even attempt to count, definitely takes away from the visuals of the game, by a lot. Now obviously all of these things like; game play, and graphics will be improved once the game gets updated in Unreal Engine 5, (UE5).

Finishing things up for my review: WWII ONLINE is a great game, 9/10 so far, cannot wait until the next big updates to happen, I would also like to mention that my review does not really mean to much to experienced MILSIM players, because I am definitely not very good at MILSIMs, therefor I am not the greatest source. Obviously this game is mainly, if not entirely, aimed at MILSIM/tactical shooter players, so if you are more into less complicated fast paced games like, COD, or maybe even, Battlefield, then just expect a VERY BIG LEARNING CURVE, when going into this game, so just keep that in mind. Big fan, cannot wait for WWII ONLINE: CHOKEPOINT/Resistance & Liberation, I hope whoever you may be, have found this very long and detailed review informative, if you can check out this game, I very highly recommend it, to most people, and I heard that these developers also have a discord, so I am going to check that out, and see what it is all about, you probably should to, and if I am around I would definitely be more than happy to see everyone else's comments, thoughts, responses, and reviews, all in the comments section. (I am not a you tuber).

author: {'steamid': '76561198000495350', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1590868165}
review:
its an old but still very  fun game if you find a good group to play with, like one of the various clans. join the discord, meet people, see who you like playing with, who fits your playstyle (tank busting? fighters? bombing? tanks? infantry fighting?)

they're updating to UE5 slowly and porting the new models back to the current version to give it a nice little facelift and updates as they move along with the big upgrade, its gonna be great.

you can play as tanks, planes, ships (not super useful most of the time sadly), self propelled guns, AA guns, AT guns, and a bit more. you also have tons of inf classes like bazooka, AT rifle, diff kinds of SMGs, rifles, grenade launcher rifle classes, etc. vehicles could be tanks, field guns, howitzer type guns, armored cars, and so on.

combine this with the new automatic Attack Order system so any group of 5 people can start an attack on a town and get things rolling, as well as high command moving supplies around to make sure you have gear for a big planned push, its all very engaging at times (When HC works together >.>)

they re-added their starter subscription, and i think they upped their free version a bit too, so you can get access to a good ammount of stuff while you level up your branches (land/sea/air levels up seperately) so it's one of the best times to get in, even if you have little/no money for subscriptions. they've been doing 'all access' events pretty often recently too.

author: {'steamid': '76561199176893198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1693167981}
review: First off, amazing game, I love the feel of flying over a vast map or driving tanks over endless hillsides. This game feels limitless! The amazing game community and teamwork mechanics combined make for a great, addictive, and satisfying game. Only issue I have is the steep learning curve and the game being extremely hard without a joystick, but the community's helpful nature and wondrous patience made learning the game a lot easier than it would've been otherwise. Great game 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086715101', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5721, 'last_played': 1693255774}
review: If you like tactical shooter games that require patience, coordination and communication, then this game is for you! I now play on the organic version downloaded from the website versus steam. It is not a pay to win as you can definitely deal some damage using the most basic classes available as a free-to-play account. The rifleman class is by far one of the best classes in the game for infantry! The FTP tanks and air are useful in the beginning of a campaign. Which is a war that starts off in 1939 and progresses through 1944 via a tier system in which more equipment will be introduced to the game. An average campaign length can be anywhere from a few days to a few months. I highly recommend hopping onto the discord and jump into a a voice chat channel and use the Voice comms in-game to ask questions if you need any help. This game has a steep learning curve much like the ARMA games. Most of the playerbase has been here since day 1 which started June 6, 2001.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971132633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1688764082}
review:
This has always been more of a cool idea than it has ever been a working game, realized simulation, or fun experience. 
 
I bought this game on a Windows disk at a brick and mortar store back when everyone was still on dial-up and the game wouldn't even attempt to play without a 70mb patch. That seems like nothing these days but it was a debacle on launch at those speeds. Once you had the patch, it was a nightmare without the MMO aspect we were all promised. The servers could support a fraction of what they promised, very little of the equipment was in the game, and whole aspects of the war didn't exist (naval, progression, and logistics for example). The servers were so laggy your tank, covered in hitch-hiking infantry, would sometimes just fly straight up in the sky, fall down through the ground itself, and then everyone would error out. This was LONG before the current forward base systems were implemented. You were now attempting to slot back in for another long and boring transit back to the objective area through environments that looked like pool tables. It was far, FAR, from feature complete or even working reliably. Most of the people who checked out the game during that initial rush never came back to play regularly. 

From what I can tell, from checking in from time to time during the 22 years this has been in supposedly continuous development, it has been very slowly iterated on by a team of developers who have been kept on life support by cash injections from a community who want it to be the promised thing and subscriptions that should be relabeled as donations. You're certainly not getting what you pay for. They've never achieved their ambitious vision.

The devs, or at least their public facing folks who interface with the community, are, like some of the worst of the community, varying degrees of toxic and delusional. I have no hope this will ever be the ambitious experience they had planned and it certainly is NOT in a state that they should be charging a monthly subscription for. 

War gaming and simulation games have only become more niche over the 22 years since I first played this game but I still feel like there's room in the world for massively scaled multi-player wargaming like this. The concept is cool, even if they'll probably never have the player counts to support their vision. They plan to port it to Unreal 5, which I think is a waste of time and resources, but who am I to dictate what people do with their lives? If you believe them, as I once did playing their busted game for many many hours in organized units (there really isn't anything like it), then feel free to donate them money, play a game that has been around since the Global War on Terror began but unlike that series of costly mistakes is still flying the Sunk Cost Fallacy Flag proudly on their heap of broken promises. Maybe they'll get the next one right, maybe we've all learned our lessons... but I doubt it.

Currently, there isn't much value in what they're offering. Rather than publicly embarrass themselves, they probably should have just started a Patreon. If you read some of the responses from developers to valid criticism from the community, then maybe you'll see this as the desperate cash grab it is by people who were far too ambitious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031391328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1529877761}
review: I've played this game for 12 years. Yes it's old, no it doesn't have the best graphics and such. It about the community and all the fun we've had here for years. There is simply no other game to compare this to on the scale presented. They are still improving the base game (1.0) while working on 2.0. You can fight as infantry, grab a vehicle, AA/AT gun, boat/ship, bomber/fighter, and get to work. There's voice comms, both in game and Discord. Do not expect to step in and shake the world, it's the steepest learning curve around, and you will be facing vets with 20+ years experience. Join a squad, get on voice comms, make some friends, and start training to go to war! It may take several months to really get the hang of it, and yes, you will die a lot. But in the end it is worth it. A fun and fulfilling game!

review: guys i would love for this game to take off like we all would want but guys the best thing for you to do is just completely revamp the game, start from the ground up, new graphics, new sound designs, new character models, etc etc, i know that you say the full steam launch will bring in a lot of players but fellas lets be realistic, theres not that many people that play the game, last i looked the peak in the last 30 days was maybe close to 100 people, thats not even one full server, im just hoping that you are aware that this may not meet you guys expectations

author: {'steamid': '76561198006518055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1582499514}
review: Great Game been playing for awhile.  There is a learning curve, however, there is not a game out in the market that combines air, land and sea at this scale, there are tons of places to fight, and it is not just a limited amount of combatants.  We have parachuted onto a town with over 60 paras while tanks and infantry are attacking the town and air planes fighting overhead.  It is a great game to check out, after it has a free to play with limited equipment however if you want full experience there is monthly charge.  I strongly suggest checking it out.  Get into a squad and join the Allies or the Axis.  You will have a lot of fun!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198414929896', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1700343938}
review:
I absolutely love this game, It's a older game, but the concept behind the game is A1. The developers are incredible and constantly working to improve the game for the playerbase. I've played this game on and off for almost 5 years now, and I've loved every minute i've played. I don't have many hours on the steam version, as I used to use their launcher years ago.

The developers are currently working to get this game into the unreal engine 5 soon aswell, and it will be taking the game market by surprise once they get UR5. Incredible game, definitely check it out!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037006481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3609, 'last_played': 1709520713}
review: This is one of those games you always come back too for that good old classic game play of the early 2000s and not only that it holds multiple world records for reasons. If it was not for this game you would not see may cool things you see in games today and even then most games still don't hold up to this standard anymore. 24 hour battles that never end is what more games need to do and i'm confused on why more devs don't .  All I know is i'm supporting this game and your new title choke point. You guys are doing great things and I can't wait see our community truly grow when they see your dreams and passion unfold. All I know is when this game gets revamped on unreal 4 best beleave you will be making history once again. All in all thanks for everything you guys do for this game.

Obviamente o jogo √© antigo e n√£o √© t√£o bem feito quanto jogos mais atuais como Arma ou Squad, mas ainda sim por ser leve, gratuito e ter a experi√™ncia que esse jogo proporciona vale a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198965753064', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1678008542}
review:
My grandpa was in this war and what he remembers most about it was the membership hooks I couldn't believe that a 20 yr
old WW2 game could be so realistic I remember when my grandpa would tell me that Every single time he got shot no kidding he would get a popup saying spend $17 a month on extra guns, This is the most accurate WW2 game I have ever seen, Also to add the graphics are realistic, The second my grandpa saw the popup he had a aneurysm from the overwhelming memories and features of this game
Gotta rate it 6.9/10 Killed My grandpa VERY ACCURATE GAME THE REALISM IS CRAZY

author: {'steamid': '76561197963095501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5797, 'last_played': 1692653842}
review:
First of all, the game is fun when there are many, then the battles are epic. But the game is now pay-to-win. You don't stand a chance with 1940 equipment against 1942 equipment. The developers don't even see this or don't want to see it. They should think about how to achieve a level playing field and still pay for something that gives you privileges. Also, the XP system is only responsible for unlocking vehicles. You could do so much more with it like run faster, carry more, aim better or whatever. 
They just bring new equipment into the game but don't change anything in the code, probably because they can't code. The game is just frustration. Even switching to the Unreal 5 engine won't change anything in the outcome. Clearly better graphics but if the game experience remains the same, then they will quickly lose players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003074053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9586, 'last_played': 1639592089}
review: Open world WW2 game, where you can control anything from an infantry man to a tank, aircraft and ship. It can be fun when playing with a few friends. Unfortunately it is extremely limited, clearly showing its age, sporting bugs/issues that are two decades old now. The occasional cheaters, lag, lack of players at hours when I could play and trolling developers who (for example) tell you that the weakest point where to shoot a ship is the turret ring don't really help. It could have been an epic game, but poor developer choices buried it. RIP WW2 Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561199111772867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 18090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17759, 'last_played': 1670535777}
review:
Save yourself the time and space on your computer. This game is not what it used to be or currently claims to be. Game Managers and Discord Admins are peak man-babies banning people over being "too negative" about the state of the game. I posted a Garfield meme and got banned from posting for 48 hours on the Discord. I used to be very active in the game's community, playing as Allied High Command and as a Trainer in the Training Corps. The game's developers really don't like criticism or anything like that, you can see this by how the interact with negative reviews here on Steam. Don't get me started on the changes they made to how Attack Objectives work and the now uselessness of the HC program, (the only thing that really made the game unique). I have lots of hours in this game, and even more on the organic client that they insist people use.

If you look through the positive reviews on this game all of the players have about 10 hours total and then none after that. All the higher hour counts are negative reviews. That should speak for itself as to how this game is operated now. I logged in a week ago and there was four people online for the Allies and we were overpopulated.

It is infiltrated with cheaters, (another soft spot the devs have) I mean c'mon this game has an engine from 2001? Of course there are cheaters, we're not fucking stupid Xoom. If there are no cheaters, then why would you make up some shitty excuse for an anti-cheat for the game? Also, you expect me to believe that some spaghetti code will catch cheaters? Still get beamed through walls and shot from under the ground, too bad the GMs are as useful as a pair of tits on a nun. 

If you are looking for a WWII shooter, I highly recommend Hell Let Loose or Squad 44. The combat is actually good and not some ghost town softcapping BS that WWIIOL is. Gunplay is fair and balanced rather than some wehraboo wunderwaffen shit. 

If you are looking for a persistent war game, Foxhole is a good option. The combat is not my favorite in that game but it does scratch the itch. All the logistics and supply stuff exists in Foxhole and is by far more developed than WWIIOL. 

Don't even get me started on the predatory payment system this game has. On multiple occasions players have cancelled their subs only to continue to be charged. This subscription price isn't small either, at nearly $20 USD a month. A Netflix subscription is cheaper than that.  Sure they might need money to continue the project with a small development team, but if the thousands of players they claim to have are paying subs like the developers claim they do, then why is there zero progress towards the UE5 port? Chokepoint is still a buggy piece of code. What happened to the Resistance and Liberation modder team go? Also, how are they working on UE5 when RnL was a Source engine game?

The developers love to not give any kind of information about updates and progress. They say they are focusing all their effort on the UE5 port of the game. Yet the only models they have shown the community is grass and some up scaled, low-poly vehicle models. How are they going to replicate the current version's scale to UE5, (a demanding engine), to run properly? At the rate that they are developing Rockstar will have GTA VII released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123472545', 'num_games_owned': 2491, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1669738125}
review:
This game does not have to be dead, Right now there are 20 players online on steam, you would think the developers would realise they have to change something, since an MMO requires players. To put it simply, shooter players are spoiled for choice, and have a large variety of games like this that dont require exorbitant fees and are much more modern feeling. Squad, Arma, Foxhole, Planetside, and soooo many more shooters offer far better value than an overpriced subscription. If you want to make more money, and have a community again, have some sort of relaunch event, Either make the game completley free and community run, buy to play with everything included, or keep the subscription model but give free to play players access to the bulk of the content. 
This could give you good will (something you're lacking right now), and if you market it by getting streamers to play with their communities or something, you could get a surge in players, creating a surge in funding to make your next MMO. I want to play this game, it has some really amazing and unique aspects, but the game is dead and most people who play shooters (myself included) will not pay a subscription for any game let alone one this ancient. This game doesn't have to be dead, but the developers seem to be stuck in their ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023007655', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1700089639}
review:
i really wanted to get back into this one. it was a gem from the past.
talk about epic scale war and long distances.
at times it felt like a running simulator.
but the scope of the war is great and very immersive at times.
i remember para dropping into enemy territory,camping out in bunkers with the few remaining squadies, smoking joints and enjoying the carnage and spectacle of taking towns and cities.
i may get into it again. there doesnt really seem to be anything of this size and scope still.
it feels like the graphics are the only downside. very dated for this type of gameplay. and at 18$ a month you got to be #$%% kidding me, nope, #$% that, spend some of that money on updating your engine graphics ffs...
developer_response:
S! Doc, thanks for having tried the game. We are indeed migrating the game to unreal engine 5 and the subscription is helping us moving forward since we are independent. 

https://www.wwiionline.com/company-news/the-future-of-wwii-online

author: {'steamid': '76561198019225795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1664834432}
review: Not enough players first of all and when you do find a server they spawn kill you. Also no one ever wants to be on the axis side. I could go on all day about this game. I also used to play this game along time ago literally have it on cd and i still would not recommend this, same problems then as now.
developer_response:
Thanks for playing.  You mention 'finding a server'  - we have historically (initial launch issues aside) only had 1 Campaign server for the live game (though there are at times others available for beta/training/testing/events).  

As for side numbers, the Axis side has won the last 2 campaigns.  Those who play this game have shown an awesome tendency to 'self-level' when one side or the other goes onto a multi-campaign winning streak.  It is possible that you are experiencing this effect.

review:
I wish i could give this a 50/50 rating its great but then its really frustrating with the cheating going on.

UPDATE MAJOR CHEATING GOING ON -

AIM BOTS 
UNREAL LONG RANGE SNIPING , 1 hit kills while running and moving 
TANKS TAKE MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF HITS (UNREAL AMOUNTS)
GERMANS win the war in 16 days (what the hell) allied it takes 160+ days (something is wrong )
also i shoot a german 5-6 times he gets up and kills me (what the hell) and its not lag.
SO MUCH CHEATING ON THE GERMAN SIDE 
Overpowerd tanks and inf guns vs allied in early game 
overpopulation problems 
allied could have 10 ppl the germans 30 this is not fair in any way and you WILL lose all the time.

I  DO NOT RECOMEND THIS GAME ANYMORE
I AM LEAVING IT FOR A WHILE, UNTIL THEY GET A GRIP ON THE CHEATING.
Just fantastic. NOT ANYMORE 

Really easy to get into but a long time to play well and learn the correct tactics.
older but still ok graphics. realistic ammo physics and bombs . 
lots of choice of inf,tanks and aircraft.
free to play but limited to basic inf and tanks aa + at guns 
but if you do pay it opens up a whole new world to you as a player.

pay to play is a little high but you do support a huge game and it will make your ingame play better.

Ask anyone for help and you will normally get really helpful players with great answers.

there is also lots of help and information online for anything you need.
so check it our its a really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067778667', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1506195995}
review:
Mmmm... por donde empezar, no lo he jugado lo suficiente pero a mi parecer es un juego que quiere recrear al batallas masivas de la ww2 con esto me refiero al uso de infateria, motorizado, artiller√≠a, aviaci√≥n y entre otros. La idea no es mala pero el problemas vienen al querer jugar partidas multijugador(que basicamente este juego esta dise√±ado para eso). Tener que pagar una cuota mensual para poder jugar(tiene su modo free tambien), no se, a mi gusto, creo que se la volaron tanto el precio como en utilizar esa opci√≥n para jugar en oline.

En otra comparativa con juegos ambientados en la WW2 que compras y listo acceso al multijugador (claro que en algunos casos tiene que comprar dlc's para tener un juego completo). Pero como he dicho, no he tenido la oportunidad de jugarlo mucho pero no creo que valga la pena pagar la suscripci√≥n por mes.

La variedad de roles, veh√≠culos, aeronaves, piezas de artiller√≠a y hasta barcos es muy buena, lo recomendar√≠a si: te gusta la tem√°tica de la WW2, tienes o le dedicarias bastante tiempo y si te unes a una comunidad que lo juegue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401503693', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1654972803}
review:
*DISCLAIMER*
- This may consist of a lot of reading which may be offensive to some audiences (and I know it will), you have been advised.

I have been hesitant on making this review for a long time, but I have gained the confidence to finally post it. I have 2 parts to this review: The game, and external interactions with the devs.

GAME REVIEW === To start off, I first played this game off an external client in 2015 when I had some leftover cash to be able to try this game. I played for 2 months before I quit until I returned in 2020... Over 5 years later and when I already had steam I was amazed at a free month of premium, so I had to try this game out... 
I played with a friend and we drove in many tanks but mainly kept dying to tanks super far away out of sight. I hate trying to find tanks, but I hate driving 45 minutes to be one shot by a 57mm AT gun 200 meters away... In a Tiger tank... at a front angle. Main point here is, this game requires a LOT of patience and awareness of your surroundings. I have spent 80% of my game time driving to the destination to be killed almost instantly. The graphics hold up for 2000 (straight up ugly during winter), and game play in general is aight, but that's really it. 
 
A lot of variety in classes, and super large map make for much fun, but 18$ a month though... with incredibly low player count... ummmm unsure about that one.. I'll talk more about that later. The subscription model basically trumps the DLC (which isn't worth it to begin with).

My main thing was the talk with the developers. I was able to meet and talk with the team leader Xoom on the discord and I was glad to be able to exchange ideas and thoughts while partaking useful information about the team and the upgrade to Unreal 5. The talk was great, but there were some problems. Mentioning how the team uses programs compatible with Unreal 5 and other things, the main program for modelling they use is 3DSmax, which is a great program, if it wasn't 225 DOLLARS A DAM MONTH TO USE! I am not making that up either... I was offered to become a Hero and support the team, and I was willing to do and be able to submit my portion to the table, but 30-50$ a month to be able to receive special testing and classes. The fees make tier 3 twitch subscriptions seem moderately worth it.

This review most likely will not stay like this, I do want to continue talking with the devs if I can, it has been a while and I may have forgotten some things, but right now imma hold off until further discussion. I will 100% keep my eyes out for the projects though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870083561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 33285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32183, 'last_played': 1683419183}
review:
If it wasn't obvious, i loved this game. But i'm only able to play every once and a while due to the $18 paywall. game-play is pretty fun, but there are real issues with lag spikes and "laggers" ( people who play on a potato computer so they can teleport around.) The community is pretty awesome and welcoming.
But there are a lot of downsides:
1. paywall. like, really? why don't you just make it buy it once and you have it. but $18 a MONTH? I would honestly rather buy it for like $40 and be done with any paying
2. if you like authentic stuff, like the 190 completely outclassing the spitfires (any model) then good for you, but the game does not focus on balance. German equipment is extremely over powered.
3. not very friendly to those who a. don't want to pay $18 a month to get stuff or b. new players, you have to go on the discord to learn fast otherwise its a heavy learning curve
4. game-play is most of the time slow and frustrating

But there is one way to fix these ( at least for me): get on discord and interact with the community. This game has probably one of the nicest most welcoming to new players community i have witnessed.

sadly though the cons outweigh the pros, therefore i am giving it a negative review. I spent way to much money on this game, and am going to have to only play intermittently.

Note: I wish there was a thumb in the middle review for steam because, like i said before, I had waaaaaaay too much fun on this game. I was quite torn on weather i should make this review negative or positive. I, as you can guess, decided with a negative one.

P.S. Devs are tone def greedy bastards, this player base and community deserves better

author: {'steamid': '76561199115205063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1656471946}
review: One of the most impressive games I've ever seen. It's an MMO WW2 shooter with a 1/2 scale map of all of Western Europe, made in 2001. Unfortunately that means it honestly isn't fun in really any way. For example, similar to how milsim games are "walk with gun for 2 km before getting sniped simulator," this is "walk with gun for 20 km before getting sniped simulator." And I am not exaggerating when I say 20 km, as that's sometimes how far apart the objectives are from each other. Spawn points can be either too close to the action to where a machine gunner is watching the barracks constantly, or easily 4km away. Basically if you can look past all of that and have a group to play it with, it might be enjoyable, but just hopping into a game is not fun. It's free, so sure give it a try, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone that isn't hyper-dedicated to this sort of thing

author: {'steamid': '76561197991252272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1658727611}
review:
I used to spend many, many, many hours in this game, off and on for more then ten years since release. It has many flaws, but it was worth it. Awesome community.
However, now coming back to it, it seems to have lost that very community since opening up to casual players via steam.
I've been trying to come back in to the game after a pretty long hiatus. This is not possible through the current client for some reason. There has been absolutely no response to my pleas. 

I will not be back again, my memories will have to suffice.
developer_response:
Hi Teskai, steam doesn't allow you to connect using your sold organic account. You can still crete a new account, or just create an organic launcher shortcut that you add to your game list.
The majority of players are still organic ones, steam don't account for a significant part, unfortunately.

But stay with us, we are in the process of porting the game over to unreal engine 5!

author: {'steamid': '76561199277455617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3466, 'last_played': 1690402651}
review:
WWII Online is a rather old game, and very tedious at times. Then again, it was originally created in 2001, so it made due with what it had, with some interesting aspects that still actually hold up someone today. Now, many people simply can't handle the tedious and rather infuriating gameplay that comes with 'realistic' elements of the game's design. You probably will get killed out of nowhere it seems at times. But it also brings some things to the table. There is very little in the gaming world that can compare to the feeling of storming a strongpoint or bunker and eliminating the enemies inside with very little chance of success. Or sneaking up to a tank during a night battle and sapping it, popping it like a heated tin can. Or holding the last capture point in a town while reinforcements rush to get to your location. Huddled next to the window, while the stairs is your ever increasing fear. Will it be a friendly? An enemy? Suddenly, a grenade appears from below and you jump to the ground before hordes of enemies rush up and you make your last stand. 

The game truly has its moments. The fact, however, is that it is not a fast paced shooter like most games today, like COD or Battlefield. The game is much more like a more complex Battlefield 1942 than Battlefield V. And the other fact is, you will die. It happens to everyone. But it makes the moments you do survive so much better. Finally, many reviews complain of the subscription. Some context is needed here. The studio, Cornered Rat Software, does indeed have this as a free-to-play game. There are quite a few f2p players in the ranks of the fanbase. However, quite simply, money is needed to keep the lights on and servers going, as well as development to turn the game into a modern day classic. So subscriptions are unfortunately needed. However, there is some relief for f2p and cash-strapped players who prefer to not spend a monthly subscription on something that is of occasional use, DLCs are available as one-time purchases. Granted, not everything can be unlocked by DLC, lest why should subscription players play? But it certainly serves to bridge the gap between funding for CRS and f2p players, a vital step if they wish to achieve their goal of an active fanbase to rival other major realistic WW2 sims of the genre. Could they improve this aspect? Yes, sapper units are near vital and some of the most fun gameplay in the game, and are unavailable for purchase from a DLC, but there's always room to grow. 

So, in conclusion, it's free. Why not try it? You like it? Maybe consider a subscription or DLC, or just be a F2P player. There's nothing to lose in trying the game. So try it if you like WW2 Sims and tedious, but rewarding gameplay. See you on the battlegrounds, comrade!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976086720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1708295930}
review:
Don't let my .6 hours of "playtime" fool you. I played the hell out of this game when I was younger through the standalone launcher. I have a couple thousand hours of playtime in game. It was the first mmofps game I ever played (one of the first ever made) and was such a blast! 

My favorite thing to do was taking a sapper and waiting out in the fields around a city that was being attacked by the enemy. You had to learn the weak points of each enemy tank make/model so that you could place  your satchel charges in the right spot to get a one hit kill. The thrill of waiting 'till an enemy tank got distracted with other infantry or vehicles and then making a mad dash up to its side; or slowly crawling on your belly to it over an open field is and experience that is entirely unique in gaming world.

The game also had a newspaper on the developers website that would auto-update with blurbs about recent sorties that had been completed by players. It was so awesome to have a great sapper run where you took out 2-5 enemy tanks and then to log onto the WW2Online website and read about your exploits. It really made the game come alive and feel like you were actually a soldier on the frontlines; and that your actions in-game had real and important consequences.

That being said; the game has always had its technical issues. Since inception, it's been plagued with an under-performing engine that leads to extremely bad fps and janky game play. It's always extremely frustrating to try and play a first person shooter with such terrible frame rate and player movement. I'm sure this has been improved on over the years but in it's hay day it was a constant nagging problem. Graphics fidelity was/is an issue as well. To be frank, the game is an eye soar. The developers have made attempts to put new assets in and improve the fidelity over the years but it still is a game that very much looks its age. This makes it hard to spot enemies and can lead to the play becoming bored by the tedious visuals. 

At the end of the day the layers of strategy, planning, and cooperation that WW2Online required were truly groundbreaking and way ahead for its time. I'm still waiting for a modern game that takes the general concept of WW2Online (a persistent massive scale war simulator with a focus on strategy) and brings it into the modern era of gaming; with improved netcode, graphical fidelity, and user interfaces. 

Unfortunately, I think I am in a very small niche of players that want such a game. I know there are projects like Foxhole and Planetside 2 out there that are in the same general vane as WW2Online; but they both fail to capture the scale and strategic depth that WW2Online brought to the table. Hopefully the developers will deliver on their promises and bring us an updated version of this game on the unreal engine. One can only hope!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105179895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1701058383}
review:
I have thousands of hours in this game, before it was available on steam. What a lot of people don't realize is the absolute scale of this. Not just the map but the deep mechanics of an actual battle. From logistics to air support, armor and infantry all working like clockwork to get the job done and capture the city or town from the enemy. I have been a part of an epic struggle for a city that spanned several days. Each evening major offensives and heroic battles. I have flown paratroopers to their deaths, their victories. I once had 50 people in my plane going to a major city battle, we sustained major damage and while under fire I safely landed on a beach saving all 50 men who cheered and went onto battle. I watched the sun set as the navy bombarded that same city that evening. I have also flown countless hours in the airforce and been in some of the best dog fights I have yet to recreate in any game. Flew many bombing missions with 60-70 fellow bombers raiding the enemy factories. To this day I talk about the epic moments I had in that game. 

I am extremely excited to see it is being taken further with unreal engine. I can not wait for that to happen. I tried really hard to convince my friends to play and experience some of what I have, but they all can't look past the graphics and joke that is this minecraft. I just chuckle. 

Salute! Cornered Rats

author: {'steamid': '76561198094218494', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1520098205}
review:
I remember playing this game in high school.

Was fun at first but was seriously turned off when I joined their official discord and was told to change my profile picture for being "offensive" by one of the head developers. 

They are also reviving an old source mod called Resistance and Liberation but branding it as part of the WWII online name. "WWII Online Chokepoint". It has no correlation to WWII Online other than being developed by the same people.

I feel as if they are just using that as advertisement to play their original game.

The engine itself is obsolete and so is the gameplay, the only players left are hardcore fans who have stuck with it from early on. On top of that most of the features are locked by a pay to access system. I get it's a way to fund the game and keep the servers alive but still kinda sad.

Don't bother unless you have nothing else to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000127461', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1699822835}
review:
Considering its age it still holds up on a lot of aspects. I can't remember any other games on this scale. The map is massive and everything happens in real-time and seamlessly. 
You have a lot of options to chose from, even as a free player. 

On the other hand the game is quite dated. From the simple visuals to the clunky UI and movement, it all could really need an overhaul.

As others have mentioned the devs are working on upgrading the game by switching to Unreal and updating the assets/map. It is a huge undertaking and on top of that the team consists mostly of volunteers. 

If you can see the potential in the game, and can live with it being dated I would say give it a try and support them if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828139407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8774, 'last_played': 1661840450}
review: This Game is one of a kind, and if you ever had an interest in being a soldier in the second world war air, land or even sea be sure to check it out. it wont cost you, there are definitely some things that could be improved such as getting spawn killed in your barracks because the enemy can shot and you cant but most of the time that i get annoyed is when realism and dated graphics combine like the usual 4-8 minutes to get to battle every death all while being visually quite bored. waiting for the split second you get when you see the enemy colours to fire at before they do the same to you other than some minor complaints id have to say for how old this game is it has held up exceptionally well and i see myself pouring several more hours into it. hopefully others continue as well so that the fight can never die! definitely give it a shot if your thinking about it.

review:
Game play, scope and dynamics are awesome. Community is obviously great - and a sense of team spirit is like no other game. However, it is somewhat let down by the graphics - there are plenty of free games out there that do the visuals so much better - but this distracts only a little. 
Of all the WW2 FPS I've played (pretty much pf them) this is the one that has me the most on the edge of my seat.

review:
Dieses Spiel stellt ein klares Verbrechen gegen die Haagener Landkriegsordnung dar. Grafik aus dem letzten Jahrtausend, Ping direkt aus der H√∂lle und Pay2Win, die man selbst in Spielen von EA vergebens sucht. Ungleiche K√§mpfe, wie Infranterist gegen Panzer, wobei zuerstgenannter vollkommen seinem Schicksal ausgeliefert ist, da aufgrund von Sparma√ünahmen ja nicht einmal eine Geballte Ladung einsatzbereit ist.
Zudem hat man dauernd Standbilder und sonstige Spielabst√ºrze, der Ping befindet sich oft im vierstelligen Bereich. 
Wer diesem Schund eine positive Bewertung gibt, hat eindeutig die Kontrolle √ºber sein Leben verloren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200082677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1640871619}
review: I'm afraid the stiff controls don't hold up well, the animations and running speed is very poor, the maps are too large for the lack of players that are present in the servers and the GUI is complicated for new players.  A lot of people are said to have enjoyed this title many years ago but it's not the same anymore. Personally I wouldn't know. It may improve as time goes on however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120875941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1740, 'last_played': 1665270729}
review: You may not like the graphics, the high level of realism, or some of it's flaws - but you won't get another experience like this incredibly immersive MMOFPS. If you get disheartened in your gameplay, join a squad, do squad events - get involved with HC. The game is as good as its community, and it won't be as great as it can be without you! Enlist now, and hope to see you on the battlefield!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979538976', 'num_games_owned': 7718, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1572974250}

developer_response: Hey Sarblade, thanks for mentioning that. For anyone checking out this review seeking more information, here is the future of WWII Online: https://www.wwiionline.com/company-news/the-future-of-wwii-online

author: {'steamid': '76561199218184011', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5235, 'last_played': 1689216517}
review:
With graphics comparable to Runescape, and a Dev team that endorses Cheating/Hacking and allows those players to continue cheating/hacking, and ban evade to continue playing all because they have spent a lot of $$$ towards the game, The game Devs also publicly acknowledge allowing this, Connection issues and a distasteful amount of desync this game feels like it's still in Beta/Alpha. If you ask me I would never recommend this game to anyone who doesn't already play it. DON'T EVEN GET ME STARTED ON THE OVERLY PRICED MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION....

Edited: 5/19/22
*Decided to give this game a second try played it maybe for 45 minutes before I once again uninstalled it, really weird to have a developer reply who only seems focused on the cheater comment in my last post, any psychologist can see something wrong here. PREPARE TO BE OVERWHELMED WITH AUTOMATED IN-GAME MESSAGES ASKING YOU TO GO DONATE TO THERE CROWD FUNDING, THIS IS ALSO SOMETHING SPAMMED IN THERE DISCORD CHANNEL.
*They encourage steam users to make an account & pay for the game via there official website, because they know Steam makes commission off each payment when users pay via steam. I can guarantee this breaks the "Steam ULA" in some way.
(Should be noted for the record that not all developers and interns who operate this game are never paid and are required to sign an (NDA) with the company, this is just another concern for a potential law suite in the future.)
*The game has a lot to offer but, the lack of updates and new implementations too the game is slow coming.
developer_response: Sorry - but CRS does not endorse cheating or hacking. Name any game developer on the planet and they'll say the same thing. We have several game moderators and counter measures in place to help us avoid such scenarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561199108912642', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1707137996}
review: I think you can add scene destruction, which will bring greater appeal and even make this game known again. I hope you can notice me, thank you„ÄÇÊàëÂ∏åÊúõÂä†ÂÖ•Âú∫ÊôØÁ†¥Âùè
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for the support and proposition!
We are migrating our game to Unreal Engine 5, which will someday offer such a possibility. 

But remind that every player must see exactly the same assets to keep the gameplay fair. Data sharing is a challenge when your server can host 5000 players at once. Maybe with cloud computing we will someday get to that point?

author: {'steamid': '76561198058585879', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1638831484}
review:
Surprisingly enjoyable despite not being my type of game. Obviously fairly dated and could do with some of the modern features current FPS games have but I can see there being a niche for this. There's obviously still somewhat a playerbase around (provided that they aren't all AI but didn't seem to be). 
Although seems to be the vast majority playing as Nazi Germany which is mildly concerning to say the least.

review:
This actually can be a great game, despite it's steep learning curve, and subscription model. 
One downside: Politics by the "Rats", as these developers call themselves, has led to an exodus of steady players, in the past. The current community is not large (< 50 online at any given time), despite it's game world being large enough to house many more players. On the upside, this game has been around for about 2 decades (Launched 2001). 

With that said, the current guy in charge, going by the name of Xoom, is pushing nice innovation efforts - With the aim to get this game up to date with the Unreal engine, and also to include more playable WWII models.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399598042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1691911350}
review: Shortly after I found out this game I quickly fell in live with it. It is a realistic WWII Online FPS game, hence the title. In this game you can play as a British, French, American or a German and fight on land, sea and air. Now onto my thoughts. This game is one of the best world war 2 games I have ever played. I love how big the map is like VERY HUGE!!! It's almost the same size as Western Europe. Sometimes the internet is kinda crappy, probably because I live in Australia which doesn't have the best internet. The graphics might be a bit outdated but I still freaking love this 20 year-old masterpiece. I hope you will enjoy it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136322756', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1642287281}
review: Could be good. The attention to detail is great and realistic multiplayer combat in a game that doesn't require an absurdly powerful PC is something i think we desperately need more of. Some really confusing design decisions however. Namely the fact that there are some NPC soldiers that operate mounted MGs and so on. Bafflingly you can't kill these NPCs unless you use explosives. It seems odd to me that in a game with rifle zeroing and wonderful realism that you can see an enemy soldier. Pull out your rifle. Send hot led through his skull and not do any damage at all. It pulls me out of the game so bad. i mean honestly it's hard to overstate how overwhelmingly F****** stupid this is IMO. to look past it is a huge ask for me. seriously. please change this. No one should be immune to bullets. Additionally the fact that if you choose to be a truck driver (for example) you can't then leave the vehicle. and are stuck driving a truck until you die or re-spawn. Seems odd. if you have a group of 2 or 3 buddies you will have to pretty much draw straws to see who among you will have zero fun and drive the rest of you to a gunfight that they will not be able to join. The biggest problem with the game however is that the player count is simply way too low. understandable for such an old game but if there were a few changes and they allowed FTP players to use a little more stuff i think they could bring in enough players to get back to at least somewhat replicate the scale of battles that they want. really unfortunate that the game is pretty much dead because it had great potential.
