author: {'steamid': '76561198002376502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1632278008}
review:
Dont let my Steam game time fool you, I played WWII Online before it was Battleground Europe then back to WWII Online.  My first day was June 6 2001.  The game stayed down more  than it was up during that time and they didnt charge  a subscription for nearly a year because of the issues.   Now on to how the game is now.

Still pretty rough.  The frame rates have improved but I am no longer running a Celeron CPU with a VOODOO 3 GPU.   The graphics that they show are on MAX settings.   The game is never that packed now.. at most you will see 20-40 people in any one area at peak times in peak battles.  Most of the large orgs or squads have long since moved on... or literally died.    

For the money of the add ons, just save your money and get IL-2.

author: {'steamid': '76561199091808218', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33699, 'last_played': 1635659873}
review:
Terribly optimized game, corrupt staff members that promotes political discussion within game, many bugs and issues when you try to report a bug or give feedback it is generally days later that they reply and most of the time the reply is not very helpful or hopeful. some of the Terrain and in game models are exploitable and can only be fixed with other in game items using clever in game mechanics by players and are not always guaranteed a fixed at a later date. a lot of discussion about imbalances of load-outs, and how certain item load-outs should have come before others, this is both talked about directly in game and on the discord that they recommend you to join. Game is otherwise very in depth and includes an immersive feeling. The DLC is misleading and a large portion of the steam DLC is already free, and the monthly subscription pricing is expensive for the quality out of a modern game, in it's current state I would not call it a modern game, but a game with potential. 

Would I recommend this game? 
NO

author: {'steamid': '76561199094483975', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1629922659}
review: Okay, I've played many shooters (and am branching into pc gaming now), I was expecting low textures and all that, but it felt like I was playing the ps2 again. I read that this games graphics didn't change much but damn, When's the remastered version coming, cuz I like the concept and it still works, but the fact that the graphics look like I'm playing graphics that look similar to Rainbow Six 3 (If not worse) scared me. I like the game, but it came out 2 yrs after I was born FFS. If you don't have the best setup and can't play new gen games, sure. It works. But you're better off playing something past 2010 at that point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962647120', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1629945701}
review:
An ambitious idea, and nothing more.

The game doesn't run well on a 2080TI and i9 CPU. The vertical and horizontal mouse sensitivities are different by default and cannot be changed inside the game menu. Understanding how to play requires reading a PDF manual.

This makes Heroes and Generals look like a masterpiece...think about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183297647', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1658381193}
review: game wants a subscription to unlock other guns and vehicles to use.  Pay for said subscription and dont recieve it.  large world good but not when you spend thirty or forty minutes running from the fob base to the action just to die in three seconds when you finally get there and have to run that far all over again.  good game graphic dated for large game.  but all i did was run and run.  pay for subscription through steam and it didnt unlock nothing.
developer_response:
Hi, sorry to hear about these issues. Have you submitted a support ticket for that subscription issue? I didn't hear about that. Here is the link: 
https://crs.zendesk.com/hc/en-us?mobile_site=true

I also invite you to read the game manual as it explains some basic gameplay mechanics, e.g. mobile spawns. Never walk long distances!
https://store.steampowered.com/manual/251950

author: {'steamid': '76561198822586599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1710895255}
review: Good game, despite graphics being so dated. Requires some effort to learn how to do things. You will die a lot early on. This is not a run and gun type of game. Patience is key. The map is huge, and you are always being directed to the next battle as needed. Friendly community. This is what some may consider a "hobbyist" game, and from I can gather doesn't have a very huge player base, and it is not for everyone, particularly if you want a high quality looking game. If you want to do lots of other things like blow stuff up, fly planes, tanks, man boats and battleships, and supply trucks, then this game has all of that for you. Looking forward to what the future holds for their upcoming WWIIOL: CHOKEPOINT, and eventually (probably years down the road) WWII Online 2.0.

review:
nice game with an almost non existent player base. I don't remember WW2 being 6 guys fighting for a whole city.

December 25 2021 

  Devs just don't care, you better buy Red Orchestra than play this game. I'm hyped for the new WW2 online chokepoint tho. DON'T play this game if your pc have an AMD, steam version is just a test and they don't really want to improve it in any means. 8gb ram for minimun is just nonsens since the game looks worse than Halo (2001). Not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019645217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1623318174}
review:
This game was actually fun and had some potential, It gave me the vibes that Arma secretly made a WWII game. Played the game when it was first launched and it actually had some promise.

[b]Now get this...[/b]: You have to pay for a subscription in-order to play the game... Which I've always had a problem with.

And asking their support team to activate your own account is a chore, Which they refuse to link your account to your Steam account, despite being clear and instructed to ask them to link it in the first place...

If you enjoy the game and their poor choices, all power to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446412550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3538, 'last_played': 1623540351}
review: I would recommend the game but... the SMG spam and the excessive camping ruin any and all enjoyment I might've gotten from the game. On top of that long range engagements are kinda difficult to do since the monotony of the map makes it hard to guess the range. Overall I just had a really bad experience when I played.

Hi Chris, thanks for your positive review and support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097613995', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1636039387}
review:
stinky WWII ARMA 1 but 1000x more difficult and frustrating.
Probably fun if you have like 100 friends and half of them like cosplaying as nazis.
i would not actually recommend at all because you start with only a basic rifle usually one hundred thousand km from your objective and then get shot before you get there as you get no real tutorial beyond "move and shoot to move and shoot :)"
I really really would like to love this game but nobody seems willing to answer questions in game and out of game the dev is weird and toxic if you mention other similar games and the community is DIE HARD so they will jump down your throat over saying the game isn't the best thing since sliced bread (which they all remember happening because they're boomers).
In conclusion if you really like arma, world war 2, milsims, or listening to podcasts while you feel frustrated and alone give it a shot, it's free and its actually really fun! probably! for someone who played it since it came out and became one with the machine and can see the code and never misses a shot this game is probably fun. i am not that person.
also the hit detection is broken and its a like a 80% chance you wont hit anyone but hey free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978327333', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1677270199}
review: This game used to be a blast back in the early 2000's but it has not aged well. The devs need to do a complete overhaul on EVERYTHING in a new engine. The player population used to be booming but is essentially dead for the size of the game world. I would be surprised if most new players even make it past the main menu with how clunky and confusing it can all be seeing it for the first time. It is great as free to play but I am astounded people pay a monthly fee for this when there are other titles that dominate this space like Post Scriptum and Hell Let Loose. I actually prefer WW2 Onlines mechanics, map and team play but you have to make a change if you want this game to grow. Doubtful though, development has always been slow and not all that innovating. I will recommend because you might like it if you are in to this team based open world WW2 style game - it really is fun when you have Inf, Tank and air all coordinating together to take a town but its hard to look past all of the glaring issues with the game as a whole(too many weird issues to even list). Just join and shoot at someone and you will notice immediately. The strange weapon sounds, seeing bullets hit someone and no reaction at all, they fall like 5 seconds later after a whole mag dump, hideous textures. None of these issues were that noticeable many years ago but it just doesn't meet standards of today's games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972514737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1692938842}
review:
I don't normally review games but this one deserves it. 

I have been playing this game on and off for the past 15 years. I absolutely love this game because it offers a lot of things modern games don't. Something older games around the early 2000's such as EverQuest, PlanetSide 1, and WW2 Online did right was the persistent worlds that feel alive. There is a day/night cycle, random weather events, a persistent map. It just makes the world feel alive.

This game in particular also offers communication, planing, tactics and strategy. You can have a fight come to a stalemate over a bridge. So you have to plan with the high command and figure out how to break it. You can have a massive tank surge and try to spearhead your way through. Or you can plan for Paratroopers to be dropped behind enemy lines to disrupt their supply lines. You just don't see those type of options available in modern games.

While I leave this game a positive review, I must add a caveat and say it is only missing one thing. Active players. The game does feel dated for sure, but everything about it still holds up fine. I enjoy the graphics, I believe there is a certain charm to those graphics from the early 2000's. In my opinion, not everything needs ray tracing. Game play will always beat graphics in my book.

Back to my point, the only thing this game is missing is active players. And sadly, there just isn't enough players. 50 players on each side during prime time isn't enough for a map that is 1/2 the scale of Western Europe. I'm torn. On one hand, I want everyone on Steam to download this game right now so we can get the numbers back up. But we all know that just isn't going to happen. 

I think the best option is for Cornered Rat studios to let this game die. And create a WW2 Online 2. I know it is a hard pill to swallow, as this game is a labor of love and NO ONE wants it to die. But I believe if they did, they could concentrate on a new game. Just make the same game with slightly updated graphics, and with all the same core concepts and features. They have a great platform to market the game, being the worlds first war MMO, and a great track record. Just for the exposure and numbers which this game so desperately needs.

********************************************************************************************
TLDR - The best and most immersive WW2 game ever made. It is still fun but sadly the number of active players keeps it from its past full potential.  Just download the free version and give it a try, we would love to have you.

review:
[h1] No recommendation [/h1]

It's done so stupidly you can't actually select most units at all with the Americans. Otherwise everything is nonsense. As soon as you are in the weapons or class selection you do not come back to the main menu to play another nation. Nothing works. The vehicles do not even drive or operate, you start the engine and nothing moves no matter what you press. The tanks cannot fire with a left click either, but the controls are there. I strongly advise against this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154657088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19166, 'last_played': 1706901844}
review:
Of all the WWII games, this may be the most ambitious and unique. If nothing else, the sheer scale of the game world lets your imagination go wild, and more than make up for the outdated graphics and learning curve. For 20 years, this is what has kept alive the dream of a live, one-server, player-managed land/sea/air campaign. 

This is something of a hobbyist's game - it is tough to learn, but rewards your patience, time, and cooperation with others. There's nothing else quite like it.

Integrated voice comms will be a massive step for WWII Online as far as retaining newcomers, and is finally coming sometime this year,

Conclusion: This is one of the best WWII games I've ever played. It has realistic gameplay, a dedicated community, and most of all, the largest videogame map ever created (It's won awards for it!). As bad as the graphics are, the game is very immersive and you often never see who hit you. The best description that I could think of is that it's Operation Flashpoint, but in WWII. Please get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036247511', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1670908585}
review:
Clarification: I do not play the game through Steam, hence the low playtime.

You think the graphics are shite now look at some old screenshots lol.  Also I know it says it's a free to play game here on steam but it isn't, It's always required a subscription to play the full game (used to have 2 week trials then went to rifleman are free).  So no the game is not pay to win, we just pay the sub, but if that's not your thing or can't afford it, no sweat.  

That aside, this game is great and I've been playing it since 2010.  New players if you really wanna get better and not get killed by a bush 300m away everytime you spawn join a squad, join the discord and hop on comms.  Ask for help!  Lotta squads do their ops on fridays, mine does weds/sat so lookout for that, this game revolves around teamwork and communication.  Think before you move and don't stay in one place for too long..Take advantage of intermissions or events to try out different equipment you may not have unlocked yet.  Play the obj, play with your team, cap that town, when you succeed in your mission it is so satisfying.  

Goodluck and have fun, cya on the battlefield
ToeJamb (Axis player, if you see me say hello or ask any questions)

author: {'steamid': '76561199050055837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 41321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 103, 'playtime_at_review': 24081, 'last_played': 1710893708}
review:
Though the graphics may not be the best at the present time it is a one of a kind game nothing quite like it.  If you are going to play don't judge it on its graphics and just play for a couple of days and you will understand why WWII Online is a one of a kind game that will give you experiences that can only be found here.  The game is constantly being updated to bring a better experience.  Note: Voip will be added soon and the game is being modernized.  Also great customer support on the discord.  (also pay no mind to reviews with under 15 to 10 hours you need to play for about that time to get the true experience)

Edit WWII Online 2.0 will be coming out in the next few year in the Unreal Engine and you can support by buying premium which is now only 10$ instead of 15$ a month!

author: {'steamid': '76561198195425503', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 5402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5309, 'last_played': 1681629990}
review:
Fun game at times, more frustrating than anything else to be honest. If you intend on playing Axis, well then you're VERY out of luck, as there is a pretty major Allied bias going on, and apparently has been going on for quite a number of years, only now it just seems like it's gotten worse. 

To put things into perspective, I was on the Allied side (just to try things out), and got into a Sherman. Well, after some time, I had a Tiger Tank (which, mind you, has an 88mm) sneak up on me and get a clear flat rear shot from about roughly two car-lengths away. Not only was I not dead, my engine was still running, and all my crew were still alive. I ended up managing to get the kill on him, and after his 5TH shot into the back of my tank, only then did my engine get wiped.

Don't get me wrong, I understand the Shermans had some decent armor, but it was NEVER that good, especially not in the rear. In short, unless you plan on playing Allied, I would not recommend playing this game. The bias is far too obvious to just basically "let it be". That's just my take on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081895748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8605, 'last_played': 1692727714}
review:
Been playing the game since 2010. Community is still full of ww2 wannabes and patronizing guys. No teamplay and i guess servers are at Mars bcs it's fix 300 ms. Never ever recommend this game. 

Yes it has a huge map but all the cities are about the same to each other. No one multicrews a vehicle. Not offers that much of a realistic gameplay. Modelling of the crafts are poor so does the graphics.

Very awful game both in means of gameplay and display. Waste of hours, really don't play it. Also every feauture of the game is priced so its also not a free2play game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878140393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5893, 'last_played': 1679352172}
review:
I‚Äôve recently started playing this game with one of my friends and I enjoyed it very much, I had a lot of fun fighting and reliving the battles of WW2, the graphics may seem poor, but the excuse of graphics means way more game play ability as this means the devs put more time into mechanics and that is great! Rather have a working game then a high graphic games that fails to work *Cough* Cyberpunk...
Anyway, I‚Äôve only been playing since September and I‚Äôve lived through my first campaign, it was soooo fun! The community is great and they helped teach me some of the ropes of the game I didn‚Äôt know how to play! The game offers a wide range of choices including tanks, infantry, snipers, planes, and ships! The game allows me to turn the tide and change history in WW2, the game updates in small patches that fix bugs and add new stuff over time! The game progresses in technology almost exactly the same as WW2. Ignore the poor reviews as they expect a 21 year old game to meet up to modern day standards. The game legit has the best screenshot moments also, and makes beautiful pictures that make you seem like you are back in 1940 in Europe during World war 2. If you love history and are looking for a WW2 game, this is your choice.
developer_response: Thanks for your support! We try to accelerate our roadmap deliveries, and to open new improvement opportunities. Your support definitely helps us move forward and we wouldn't be there anymore without such a great community for 20 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105124447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 98261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3635, 'playtime_at_review': 5769, 'last_played': 1710738241}
review: Don't judge this game on its graphics.   It is one of the most engaging, most stimulating and most challenging to master (keeping it very interesting for years on end) in the gaming universe.    It has an extremely dedicated core player base that is supportive of newbies and will help you learn the ropes.   I consider it one of the most ambitious MMOs ever built due to its vast scope and hundreds of detailed (with correct physics) units.     Although I've played every WWII game ever published, and own at least 70%  of them, this classic is my favorite.   I never get tired of playing it.   Sometimes I'll take 5-6 month breaks because I'm playing the newest wwii game, but I always end up coming back.    And I've been coming back, faithfully, for almost 20 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056257760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1608846509}
review: Game is garbage, need an email verification that doesn't even work. Many players experience this same stupid issue. How do you fix it? You go to the dev support and send a stupid code to get it fixed, just seems like a lot of work to get a dumb game to work. Let alone the subscription fee, glad I am not paying for this garbage. Offline doesn't seem all that great, seems far way too confusing. It might be the fact I didn't play for very long but it would be nice to get past the ERROR SCREEN. I've watched a tad bit of game play, and it seems like all you do is travel to just get killed most likely. At least in most World War 2 games, you don't have spend your day travelling to your destination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041624113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8399, 'last_played': 1705855164}
review:
Both the ugliest and the best mmo fps.

It made a great mix of large scale strategies and personal actions on the ground (or air or sea) that I never found elsewhere. Wide range of group and individuals tactics can be used, from long range tank, guns to soldier infiltration.

Despite the basic modelisation of the cities and fields, the combat part is close to a simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334640587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8542, 'last_played': 1689271608}
review:
J'ai beaucoup aim√© WW2 Online car contrairement √† un FPS tel que Battlefield, celui-ci se rapproche plus de la r√©alit√© avec sa map gigantesque. 
    Je le recommande si vous avez de la patience, que vous √™tes pr√™t √† en baver et que vous avez du temps devant vous:
-le jeu est majoritairement composer de v√©t√©ran (sa fais quelque mois que j'y joue et je n'ai toujours pas compris toute les abr√©viations utilis√©s)
-les commandants sont n√©cessaire au jeu (sans eux impossible d' effectuer la moindre attaque, donc au revoir la blitzkrieg √† deux heure du matin).
-les armes allemande (tanks car c'est surtout √ßa que je joue) sont moins bonne que les armes alli√©s, une grande complexit√© des avions se qui fait que peu de joueurs les jouent (si tu joues un tank et que les ennemies ont des avions, tu risques de rester clou√© dans ton spawn).
-parler anglais est n√©cessaire pour jouer au jeu sauf si vous arrivez √† trouver des joueurs fran√ßais qui peuvent jouer avec vous, mission quasi impossible.
-Il faut √™tre pr√™t √† faire 30 minutes de conduite en tank pour arriver au point voulu, se jeu se veut r√©aliste: le temps de conduite peut √™tre donc tr√®s long.

Je crois que j'ai tout r√©sumer, bon jeu √† tous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251964720', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1696702053}
review:
So, I went in to this game with no expectations at all. I thought it was going to be one of those generic MMO WW2 games that seem to have oversaturated the market, imo. After doing some training and jumping in, I found it to be very fun in some aspects and difficult in others.
For the good, Planes fly like planes would, like pigs. Theres a lot of different settings and a lot to look out for, but theres nothing more satisfying than a gun run on enemy armor. The tanks, are pretty cumbersome and i didnt go too deep into them but just from driving around and taking potshots at passerbys, i had fun.
For the bad, this game was released in 2001 and looks very much like a refined goldeneye. Don't let this fool you, graphics arent everything (to most). The infantry fighting can seem pretty futile and frustrating, but that just makes it better when you score a kill.
I'd recommend this game for anyone who likes flight sims, MMOs, WW2 era games and the such. It's a lot of fun and you can even get together with your team and do 20 player paras on an enemy town and overwhelm them in minutes. Don't let the release date fool you, the game is still very much alive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055242124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6822, 'last_played': 1680022480}
review:
EDIT: I'm getting off another month of premium to see if something has changed, this game was part of my childhood and I really want to see it shine, but if things are still the same or even worse well, I'll simply redo this review better and keep hammering it. 

Played this 8 years ago, recently got back on it and got a month of premium on discount to finally see how it is. Original review was turning into an essay and then I discovered there's a max size of 8000 characters for the review. Oh RIP. 
   Basically, you got a good amount of units, tho (mostly during early campaign) it's deeply unbalanced in favor or Allies, Chars and Matildas if well-played can easily harass and dominate alone whole army bases, if not towns, with enough infantry support. That plus the fact that Axis is usually badly-commanded (too many contrary orders, or ones which are given up once everyone has setup the attack and spawn points) and seriously outnumbered 90% of the time, means that nowadays, the campaigns that lasted months, with coordinated strategic bombings, interceptor squadrons, destroyer flotillas, and huge batallion-sized attacks, are just a steamroll which decides the campaign in weeks. The Axis chat feels like a huge chat from Der Untergang, the playerbase just panics around trying to get help to defend the last bits of the town's ruins while High Command moves around imaginary armies to attack objectives in points where the supply level is usually low, or at moments when everyone else is engaged in defending that one last factory in an industrial city. Allies can even use the lowest-level tech if they want to, I recall a match before my premium ran out, basically 11 enemy tanks (Somuas, Chars and a few Renaults) were driven into the town, plus waves and waves of foot soldiers supporting. On the other side we had a few F2P people firing from windows and throwing grenades to scare off a bit the tank formations and forcing them to stop and engage us just so we could buy time.. And that's basically what Axis does in the game right now. The faction-balance system isn't enough to keep the game equal in any way.
  The cost of most bundles isn't cheap (nor are they worth it IMO, such as ammo bearer or light tank ones), nor is the cost of premium, if you consider that you gotta pay it every single month, rarely getting it at discount. There's a good variety of vehicles and whattanot but well, AA guns (even 40mm Bofors) feel deeply underpowered, early-campaign German tanks only got the advantage of carrying HEAT (which is not that reliable, both accuracy and damage wise) and well, the StuG 3 which is basically the shining-star at the campaign start due to HEAT and 50mm sloped armor combo. Besides that, until Pz 4 Gs and late-war StuGs arrive, Axis are quite likely to be severely underpowered during encounters against things such as Matildas and Char B1s. In real historical conditions other factors made it easier for Germans to overcome those, in the game tho those don't apply as much.
  Back to the cost aspect, being a F2Player years ago was doable and could be fun ( I had potato PC and no friends, anything was fun), tho nowadays, with the bigger diversity in the game market, you can simply move on to much more polished yet similar games which involve combined arms, and which you'll only have to pay a single time to play it forever. The subscription system for sure is what keeps many from putting their money in, prices are quite high and well, if you pay it monthly you're likely to feel forced to play to make your money worth it, not a nice feeling IMO.
  Well, after 20 years the old graphics feel like the smallest of the problems of the game, sadly some of these issues are old and weren't given much if any attention at all.
  
   TDLR; Good vehicle variety, old graphics which don't bother me but that's my opinion, map has some nice locations but 90% feels ctrl c+v, damage system is kinda confuse and sometimes feels broken, even after 20 years of the game around it's hard to find decent guides on vehicle's weakspots or gun's penetration values, the community which 8 years ago could set up HUGE field battles nowadays feels long gone to some extent, and the campaigns are always Allies-sided due to population balance issues. Some people complain about the developers in forums etc tho I never cared much about this aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561199029342206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1619298060}
review:
World War 2 Online. Ce jeu ne peut tout simplement pas √™tre d√©fini en un mot. 

C'est bien la premi√®re fois que je me sens vraiment dans mes bottes dans un jeu vid√©o.
On y retrouve une communaut√©, certes relativement peu nombreuse, mais forte.

Pour aimer ce grand MMO FPS  il faut √™tre curieux sinon vous abandonnerez au bout d'une heure 
 ( Des gens y jouent depuis 20 ans ! ). 

R√©fl√©chissez ! Vous ne reverrez jamais un jeu comme celui ci ! 
Ce n'est pas un post-scriptum ( et heureusement ) ni un red orchestra.

Attendez vous a mourir 50 fois et a ne rien comprendre au d√©but. Et c'est normal ! 

La c√©l√®bre phrase du chant des partisans 
 ( ici, chacun sait ce qu'il veut, ce qu'il fait, quand il passe ) 
n'a jamais eu autant de sens.

Les d√©veloppeurs sont, pour la plupart, d'anciens joueurs. Je ne trouve pas que le syst√®me d'abonnement soit aberrant, bien au contraire. Il permet de faire avancer des projets qui am√©lioreront votre exp√©rience de jeu. 

Pour r√©sumer:

Soyez patients, pers√©v√©rez et n'abandonnez pas.

review:
Game has the potential to be the most popular WW2 shooter out there but they throw it away.
The game has an engine older than myself, the microtransactions and subscription system is OUTRAGEOUS, new players playing the game aren't very welcome and often have no idea what to do, and the amount of veterancy with other players is severely outnumbered to new players. 
Played this game back when it was on Steam's old 'greenlight' system and it wasn't as bad as it was today.

author: {'steamid': '76561199000615275', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1597928851}
review:
i want to like this game, on paper its amazing, an ongoing constant online depiction of WW2 is an amazing concept, but only the most patient fan can bear to slog through hours of running in and dying, to then have to run across the same blank environments yet again

This game is very dated, and ultimately, should cease support after 19 years, in that time a modernised version could've been on the way, but this is still "early access" so any hope of a modern equivalent lies in the hands of games like Post Scriptum, implementing an online campaign system, similar to that of Rising Storm 2

review: Very addictive once you learn how to play the game. Similar to a Capture the Flag scenario, where you work as a team to capture enemy territory, and defend against attacks from land, sea and air. Different from typical (constant action) FPS games, because of the strategy to win a battle, and the skill you need to survive. I use a joystick with a twist handle (rudder control) to fly, scroll mouse and keyboard (with number-pad) to  battle on the ground, but you can set your joystick with keybindings to suit your own play style. Favourite game by far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045784570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1677412383}
review:
Long time player, 2002-2012, came back to test on steam.

Its pure tactical shooter, strategy map with Europe scaled down a bit.
You can be a Tank, AA/AT Gun, Aircraft, Small Boat for rivers or a big one for the ocean, all kinds of trucks and infantry.

The pricing of the game is wrong in my opinion, should be super cheep with a small $12 one time payment and then something like $3 monthly for basic and $5 for full, those that want to help the game could buy in game stuff or pay for events they want to setup.

Learning curve is high but it can be really fun and adrenaline packed battles, best to play with friends but lone wolfing is possible too.

Play for free and if you like it, help the developers with a subscription.

review: This game is extremely ambitious. This is simultaneously a first person shooter and a tactical map game. I don't know of any other shooter with such extreme scale. However, that comes at a cost. The UI is difficult to navigate for new players and the shooting mechanics need a bit of work. This is understandable, as this seems to be a passion project of a small team. This game is full of potential and if you're a history buff, you might enjoy it quite a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011984232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 93, 'playtime_at_review': 2267, 'last_played': 1710846832}
review:
This review is under a second free account through Steam, Hyo2, that only shows 100+ hours or so played.  But I use this free account to help me with demonstrations for my video productions and tutorials. I've played under my main account for over  22 years. Read to the end to see how many hours I have really played this game, you will be surprised ! 

 If you recognize Hyoslvr then you know who I am.  Hey this game is old but it is the only game of it's kind.  Over 300,000  square km of continuous map including parts of England, France, Belgium, Holland and parts of Germany is not like any other game out there where in those once you learn the ropes you breeze through knowing almost exactly what will happen and very limited territory, a few square blocks or even a few square miles of a map.  Actually in WWII Online no two missions or sorties are the same.  Similar elements yes but believe me since your up against LIVE people 24/7 it will never be exactly the same or boring.   I started playing in late Feb and early March 2001.  Yes that's right the game didn't go official until June 6th of 2001 so I was in it when it was coming out of Beta. Then WHOO! HOO! 

All kinds of things have changed over the years.  This was the first game of it's kind, is listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the first MMO and the longest running game out there.  And its still here.  There have been changes in operators and developers, heck probably 75-80% or more of the people who work on it are volunteers.  Players, who like myself, have come to love it, play and want to keep making it better.  With combined land, sea and air you have over a hundred types and variants of units to choose from pitting yourself against other live players you can never get bored!

If i go more than a couple days without playing then I get restless.  I like being a pilot and I love to fly. So if you see a 110-C or 110-FB or HE-111 or JU-88  loitering over head watch out!  I do fly other things, fighters for example, but if we have enough fighter's in game to cover units from above to keep the EA off my back then I love nothing more than to do close air support, strafe squishes,  blow up FB's, that's forward bases, tanks, FMS's or forward mobile spawns, buildings, smash towns, trucks, flak, player placed objects or PPO's like trenches, barbed wire, sand bags, gun bunkers and did I mention Squishes?    Of course ships round out the list.   

There are literally over a hundred different types and variations of units to choose from.   With the new Server Tracked Objects I don't have to see the whites of your eyes or the green of your fatigues to kill your avatar.  I can drop from 5 km up.  .... Hey there is a streaming video out there where I was watching a forward base as it was being attacked.   There were a few fighter planes, low, strafing etc and all of the sudden 8 X 250 Kg bombs, 551 lbs each for 4408 lbs total, hit the center of the FB, the vehicle spawn, taking out trucks, tanks and infantry.  I looked up and the plane was just a gray halo at 4 km, 13,100 feet up.  Perfect drop who ever you were! That took some skill, believe me.  I got it on video!  .... Any way its not a perfect game. Having started with a proprietary gaming engine which was the only way they could handle such a large continuous map of that size. It's of ancient design it's graphics are a little dated. They have improved on it over the years and are constantly working to make everything work and look better especially now!

 I don't expect anything to be perfect however they are always striving to improve the game create new content and are now moving forward, again, working to make WWII Online one of the best out there with version 2.0 coming in the near future by converting it to Unreal Engine 5.0.  Believe me when I say they are trying, every day,  to make this game the better and the best out there.   

It has kept me sane for 21 and a half years going on 22 now and I can hardly wait to see what else the crew has in store for us. Like I said most of the developers, animators, coders are players like myself who volunteer our time to continue to develop and improve the game.   It's also the community of loyal players on both sides makes this a unique and ever lasting game. More so than those run and gun shooter games out there. You really should take a look at it! Try it out with a free trial or do the free to play thing you will really like it, that I am sure of!   

Thanks for your hard work CRS and keep it rolling.  :) 

S! Hyoslvr,   Long time player, volunteer, sim enthusiast video producer and voice over.

PS.  22+ years at an average time played 2 - 4 hours a day, most of the time, and sometimes more, on special occasions, taking some breaks here and there is still over 32,000 hours of enjoyment over that time span and I have no regrets.  Any game that can deliver that much non boring activity, stimulating the mind, reflexes, and offering a release from daily stress can't be all bad, right?  Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164690563', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1594344892}
review: This game Provides you with a Plethra of Things you cannot Understand like why cant I damage AI MG Emplacments with my Rifle ? The Game Provides a Very detailed Arsenal of which to Choose from (If only you were a Higher Level) You will find yourself Trying to hit a Strafing SMG Trooper Where his SMG Will beat you in most Combat Situations. If you find yourself Surrounded by Tanks GOOD LUCK ! the AT Trooper isint Avaliable at first so you and your rifle will have to cour in a house or Spend 10 more minutes Running back into the Engaement to only be Killed by a Paratrooper,Sniper,Machinegunner, that fucking SMG Trooper or a Tank Platoon. one Saving Grace of this game is the Tank play the Tanks Are effectivly blind so If you ever had any at a Infantry man could out smart a tank and tankes have to expose themselves to see clearly. The only thing is if you want to be in something more than a Prewar armoured car you have to pay 10 bucks. The money for the Special troops Ussualy isint worth it as the Tank has to be Avaliable and you have to be the Right Level to play it TBH they should make it a Paid game instead of having Monthly Premium purchases legit dont bother if you want a good ww2 game go to the old brother in arms series or if you want a free Expreience go to war thunder

author: {'steamid': '76561197973496360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1874, 'last_played': 1679185325}
review:
probably the longest running MMO WWII game on the internet.  The map is vast and the learning curve on tanks, and aircraft can be challenging as they are fairly representative in mechanics of the real deal.  
The community in game is very mature and helpful to those wanting to learn and be a part of a team.  I actually came back to this game after 8 years of absence and found quite a few players that were still playing and having fun.  
One of the few games out there where you still need to earn the right to use top tier equipment and can't simply buy your way to better stuff.
I was told by a brand new player the other night that the word on this game is it's a bunch of 40+ year old guys that play this game... have to agree with him and it's most likely why it's still around today after 20 years and supported so well by its community of 40+ year old players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007798015', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1593471917}
review:
Honestly... Let it die already... make a new one... Or put it on kickstarter to get the funds to transition it to a modern engine, so you can easily sell it and get rid of the subscription model...

This game COULD dominate the tactical multiplayer shooter market with ease, if it wasn¬¥t using technology that had been outdated 15 years ago... instead of putting your efforts into "updating" its visuals to little noticable effect, (yeah, seen the screenshots, now it¬¥s been outdated for 12 years, not 15, wow)  which won¬¥t help the game in any way... remake it or at least sell it to someone who can... This game with modern technology (maybe even in a more modern setting?) would be THE genre-defining game, especially at moment, while alot of these games are coming up and can only dream of being close to what WW2O once was... 

i know, you¬¥re trying to update it, but at the rate all this happens, if you¬¥re done even these "upgrades" will be extremely outdated  and you¬¥ll still be where you are now... are you that needy that you have to rely on a handful of paying customers? You won¬¥t safe the game by keeping it artificially alive... There will never be enough people paying 10$+ a month to make it worthwhile, and i¬¥m sure, deep inside your hearts you know that...  if no one is there, no one will stay... 

but what do I know, i¬¥m just a player, right? That¬¥s what others said, too... if only they listened ;) 

((disclaimer: only started the game to write a review, even if i wanted, i¬¥d not be able to play it, maybe it would look decent on a 4X4-inch display... played it many years ago and been occasionally following its misery since then... really sorry for being harsh, but a good friend tells you the truth if you¬¥re messing up)) 

anyway, best of luck, you need it if you stay on this path...

author: {'steamid': '76561198371187781', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1654262597}
review:
Unless you are willing to pay mounthly to fly planes. I wouldnt recommend this game. Even if you pay you still NEED to rank up in planes to be able to play with the newer, lets say bf109 G, or F4 or G2 you have to rank up with them. And let me tell you. Ranking up isnt easy at all. I would totally not recommend this game if you are willing to play planes. This game looks like its free but it isnt
Edit: Okay i wanna make clear something, ive played this game a lot, like, 10 hours not  2,i only have 2 hours because My brother used my Steam account ot register with his username so i need to use a standalone version, but there is something cool i found out. During the time in between Campaigns (its called intermissions), everything is free to use, no need to level up to use it and no need to pay to use it. Honestly i would say just leave the game free to play, all the content is free, and the only thing that is left from the old system is that you need to level up to use other vehicles and stuff, I would say tho, for tanks and ships, set your turret movement using arrow keys or some other keys and not the mouse, aiming with the mouse is broken. I would still not recommend the game because of its pay wall. The only thing is that intermissions last a few days, and its the time people have to most fun in i bet, because players play tanks, planes, ships, infantry, everything they wanna play but dont wanna pay for it. Controls are buggy, physics too, Sometimes you see an explosion and hit, but the hit is actually not registered which is quite annoying, i wouldn't stop playing the game for that but this just goes to show that its not worth it to pay so much money for a buggy game. I would recommend the game for the 5 days intermission period because its actually fun, but unless the game is actually free to play everything, no, dont waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150441129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1616724979}

review:
Absolutely outstanding idea,,, unfortunately the complete opposite for execution!
graphics are old as hell which would be fine if gameplay actually countered it. 
spent 91 minutes playing and must have spent 80 trying to find out how to fly, when i got into the air the controls just dont match what my input was and the aircraft kept barrel rolling into the ground.
the last 11 minutes was spent running across the map looking for people to shoot which failed as there was no one around that i could see.
if this game was remastered with decent controls and maybe a bigger player base  then it would be epic

review:

Al limite potrete divertirvi ad ammassare i vostri cadaveri nello spawn e creare ostruzionismo agli altri 4 giocatori sfortunati che avranno deciso di provare questo gioco di merda.

Sono bastati 10 minuti per farmi capire l'essenza e il profumo di un titolo dal cos√¨ ampio raggio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020268890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2997, 'last_played': 1592360642}
review:
Pros:
- Cool concept.
- Friendly(ish) community.

Cons:
- Game is nearing 20 years old and looks it.
- Game is free to play, but pay to win (will elaborate on this).
- Hardly any players, the largest battle you're likely get to see will involved around 50 players total counting both enemies and allies.
- Controls are convoluted and clunky.
- UI is aged and not streamlined.

To elaborate on pay-to-win, this game has operated on a subscription base since launch, and tacked on DLC after their debut on Steam. People that subscribe or buy the DLC gain access to the full equipment list of their given army, whether it be ground infantry loadouts and weapons, armored vehicles, AT or AA guns, trucks, whatever. 

When it's infantry versus infantry that's one thing, at least you're still capable of caving in the face of a guy with a premium machine gun with your freebie bolt-action rifle. Every other aspect of paid-for content beyond infantry is obscenely skewed and free players have no hope of countering it reasonably.

For example, Armored units and AT/AA guns. Free players have access to two different light tanks, one type of AT gun, and one type of AA gun. Here's the problem, those vehicles and guns are completely useless against ANYTHING but their own freebie counterparts on the opposing team. I have tried and failed again and again to do even SOME damage to a premium enemy tank with both freebie tanks, the freebie AT gun, and even the freebie AA gun loaded with AP, they do NOTHING to premium armor.

To sum it up, whichever side has the most players shelling out will be the side that wins through sheer volume of spammed armored units or ground units with better offensive and defensive small-arms. 

There's "pay-to-win" F2P games, and then there's pay-to-win F2P games. Guess which one this is?

review:
Not worth your time anymore, this game is NOT in early access, it fully released back in 2001. The Developers have dropped the game into oblivion, thus, destroying the community. It would be better if they would remaster the game or just straight up make another game all together. 

If you want a realistic WW2 experience look somewhere else, because this is not it.

EDIT: Developer responded with stupid comment saying I made a bold statement with only 1.2 hours in game without understanding that I've been playing this game since 2007 just not on steam. If my statement was so bold, why do others think the same? Hmm?
developer_response: That's a pretty bold statement to make after only 1.2 hours of game playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980448608', 'num_games_owned': 1095, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1587235347}
review:
Joined during a special event. I had a hard time getting people to walk me through how to join them after doing the basic tutorials and the most interaction i was able to get got asked to leave a channel because they were doing special ops not suitable for noobs.  I could have been more insistent but got the vibe that i was interrupting people's good time and that i should just RTFM if i want to understand how to play.  I didn't want to be a nuisance so just went back to other games.

I get it's inimical to the grognard ethos of the game to have an "instant action" button or to make it too easy for new players, but it would be good if there was some kind of formal onboarding for noobs.
developer_response:
hi and sorry for this bad experience, there is a dedicated help channel that receive support from online veterans, high commands and developers.

Did you also have a look at the game manual, and did you call out for support on the Allied or the Axis Discord?

https://store.steampowered.com/manual/251950

Allied channel https://discord.gg/37mNNdm
Axis channel https://discord.gg/hZySQUR

author: {'steamid': '76561198335469057', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6569, 'last_played': 1676572390}
review:
Aboslutely love the game it has a great community, one of the best games I've seen with such good mechanics in fact THE BEST. How you can take out tanks, planes, ships etc with its high military grade ballistics. And that its all player driven. A few 

Pros and Cons though. I think most people who play this game are using the website and not steam.

Pros- Absolutely love the mechanics as its player driven. Decent destruction. Depends entirely on players HighCommand the effort and planning.  Everything is locked together depends on each other Land forces need Air Force, and some Naval too. I strongly reccomend it to players for a new war experience on ONE SERVER 24/7.    

Cons everything has its downside.

1.  You have to pay for the subscription just to roll out in a tank or plane. Unless there's some free infantry access event etc. As axis your restricted to a kar98k, mp34, mp40, and few moreas infantry. A Panzer2C, and Panzer III F. And no aircraft. Unless sometimes your randomly given access. Should be free because sometimes players will flake off when paying subscriptions. I kind of find it a little greedy with the developer. Need to make money with the game but another way please.

2. Graphics. I honestly can be a little picky aobut them not as much now. But it still has an early 2000's look. Looks good  though usually. If they can be updated it'll be alot better like how "Fog of War" Is kind of based on this game I noticed just on a different front. The Eastern Front. Just update the graphics.

3. New loadouts, items. I feel the game lacks a few things considering its going from 1939 - 1944. Morew vehicles and infantry. I play mainly Axis sometimes Allies you can go on the website and see the development roadmap. Trenches, a new JU-88 and BF 109 1G. I tihnk its a 109 1G? Game needs more. Such as the Tiger2, Maus, Panther. M4A3 Wolverine. Lancaster bomber, Halifax. Are all missing but may come soon in the future. 

4. Evens and Odds. I've noticed that the Allies are pretty STACKED in the beginning and a little bit in the duration of a campaign. Which may be historically accurate since the Panzer 3 F's have awfully thin armor especially since the turret is as armored as a water bottle.  Allied aircraft dominate sometimes like the DB7 aka Douglas7, Blenheim, and the Havoc A.K.A. Douglass. Are as maneuvrable and agile as a Heavy interceptor or even a fighter interceptor. While the Axis Heinkel is more elegant as a level bomber. But usually im okay with it. ( Aside from the fatc a DB7 was able to take out my BF 109 F-4)


5. Map issue is that if you look on the map there's gaps between towns I'd love to have small , villages, farms and communities in between Such as rolling down from a FB (Forward Base) To a town in a long marching column.

Overall. In Overall I HIGHLY RECCOMEND this game to players who desire a good community base and entirely player driven experience with multiple campaigns having multiple outcomes where everyone depends on each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982150547', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1647842585}
review:
I played this game way, way, way back in the day. I'm talking, 2011, 2012. In those days, I was hooked and could not get enough of it. I stayed up all night, fighting for a city, waiting for the High Command to put an AO on a new town we could attack, paradrop on, et cetera. Plus it was one of the few games you could play Infantry, Paratrooper, Tank commander, AA/ATG gunner, Navy, AND Air force, all going on at the same time. Made for fantastic battles i'll never forget!

However, the game has died down over the years. It's common for that to happen to old games. Older games fade out, new ones fade in. In most cases, older games like this would open it all up for free. There aren't nearly enough people playing anymore to warrant a subscription this day and age.. On top of that, DLC?!?! Seriously?! If I don't want to shell out money for a monthly subscription, I have to PAY to be able to play as a paratrooper or fighter pilot?!! That's ridiculous.. And honestly, greedy on the developer's part.
I loved the community, but with all that's happened to this game. I will not be returning anytime soon. I loved it back in the golden days, but now, it's a laughable excuse for a paid product that has almost no players, is P2W and requires DLC to play roles that were FREE in the past. 
I predict this game will die out in the next year or two. If it hasn't already...
developer_response:
The subscription model that we have is the single reason for our almost 20 year existence. WWII Online has a server base that it has to operate to provide services, remember: it's configured to operate as an MMO, because it is the first MMO FPS ever created. The game is in a consistent state of development, in fact, we just released our first 64-bit compatible client. 

We are not a standard Free to Play game where we offer micro-transactions or advertisements to make monies in that way. So subscriptions and DLC is what we have to offer, plus a perpetual Free Play subscription. And the Free Play subscription is no strings attached, 100% free. That's a fair deal.

In terms of calling our development studio, "greedy," I think you should get to know us a little better because we're extraordinarily community-centric and are actively engaged with our community and more transparent than pretty much any other studio I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976931803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 33930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 331, 'playtime_at_review': 5687, 'last_played': 1710802157}
review:
Edit: I feel I should edit this review as I've put in, erm, a LOT more hours into this game since review. I've really come to enjoy the pace of this game. This is not a twitch shooter where you will be gunned down within five seconds of spawning. Quite the opposite. Things take time in WWIIOL, and that's for the better. The physical scale is already epic enough, but what really makes it stand out is the amount of time, effort, commitment, teamwork, and tactics needed to prevail against the enemy. There's simply nothing else like it in video games, it's almost like the EVE Online of shooters. 

I originally bashed the game for it's combat when outside of towns, and I've learned a lot since. There is always something to do, always something to help out your team. Whether it's guarding, pulling a vehicle (huge thing I missed out on when I posted my original review!) or scouting out enemy positions, the game simply never stops. It truly is a virtual battlefield, and it never sleeps.

So yeah, it's a steep learning curve, and if you're ADD inclined, well, it may not grab you right away. But this game is simply one of a kind. It gives me a rush I don't find anywhere else. Delayed gratification is a hell of a thing. S! - sullivca

P.S. The people complaining about graphics are children. The gameplay is what counts, and this one has it in spades. 

---

A truly unique game with some terrible flaws. WWII Online is at its best when you're fighting building by building for a town. The in-game communication and combined arms model really shine here. There's nothing else like it. Due to low population and the massive amount of space between towns though, this doesn't happen as much as you'd like. You'll often find yourself spawning kilometers from a town or spawning into a town where the enemy is kilometers away. The shooting is jank but if you can get access to SMG's or get good with the rifle, it is manageable. Additionally, the stamina model is annoying as hell. I think you can get away with the sheer size of the map or the very limited stamina model, but not both. The vets are genuinely helpful and there are some good online guides (definitely familiarize yourself with the glossary on the WWII Online wiki; astounding number of acronyms in this game.) 

Overall, a very frustrating game. A game like no other that seems reluctant to give players the best of itself. Still, it's gotten it's hooks into me, so maybe it will work for you as well. Just come into the experience with a lot of patience and this game might be magic for you. 

Not going to touch on the horrible subscription model, others have spoken on it here.
developer_response: Hi sullivca, thank you for your support. Some relevant suggestions here and we are continuing our efforts to identify the next priorities considering our limited and volunteering ressources. This is Not easy as not everyone is providing constructive feedback. we have the chance to have lots of different gamers but who are also expecting as much unique features... Expect more content to be delivered faster

review: It took a little while to get used to but once you do get used to this game it is unlike any other. Weirdly it has some really relaxing elements and some intense action. The gameworld is always ongoing and there are so many small battles/tasks you can take part in. Me and my son love going on our own little missions to bust the forward bases, the bases required to attack a town. Then sometimes we team up attacking towns. Graphics are old but in all honestly it just doesn't matter considering the basic principles of gameplay are so good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198852141160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1707634498}
review: Miss 100 campaigns. I believe more than 200 players were playing on both side. Another one game developer think they set up the high cost can earn more money and they do not know how to attract more people to play this game. No idea why they make medium armor pack and light armor pack dlc. That is totally useless on mid to late campaigns. For example, panzer IIIF vs sherman M4A2 . The only way to destroy sherman M4A2  is keep shooting the back side with 5 to 10 rounds and shereman player mush be the noob one or afk. And the sherman M4A2 can destroy panzer IIIF with any side 1 to 2 rounds. No one like to get abusing like this and so unfriendly to new players. It only make players give up to play.  Ship and plane is locked for free players (There was free in the past) and I guess there is no more than 1/3 know how to use the ship and tank and no more than 1/10 know how to use the plane. So many tanks no one use except the newest one. Pay for win game .

author: {'steamid': '76561198204416551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1529451175}
review: This game has 22 players on average on steam, of course they also have their website which you can play in, so I'll bump the player base up to say 100. Even if you have that many people that is not enough since the map is 1/2 the size of Europe, another issue with the game is that the devs attack anyone who state any issue with the game. The devs have also actively attacked negative reviewers even going as far as to attack someone who, while unverifiable, seemed to have many hours on the game than what was stated as he said he was a veteran from their website. So in the end I suppose I think that the devs have been quite pathetic and push a completely dead game that they are now dragging it's corpse behind a truck scraping off all the money that they can.

review:
If You enjoy teamwork , logistics, combined arms cooperation. Long term strategic goals, deeply layered game, for those that are prepared to learn and join a active group of players this can be a very rewarding game. Graphics are functional, some of the physics is strange. 

Dont be fooled by the people saying this is pay to win...A humble free account player can more than influence the game if played correctly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161172130', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1688482585}
review:
Pretty fun game. It's a bit like IL-2 where you have campaigns that can last weeks to months. It's a game you must get into with the feel of control (which is decent) and the setting as a soldier, sailor or pilot.
I do like the large maps and cooperation the game forces, as it has led to some fun experiences (genuine fear when germans were storming me and a random guy I found).

However, I do dislike the subscription asset (although I entirely understand why it's there and do support it) in the sense it locks away fun equipment and gear (example: planes and specific guns).


Overall? I enjoyed it and hope the developers give the Free-To-Play players a plane or something instead of feeling forced to buy a subscription to enjoy such a thing.

review: This game is so much fun and pretty much a simulator with dated graphics. It is fun and free to play as all free to play players can play with sub-machine guns, tanks and rifles. There are many people saying it is play to win but that is stupid. Paying a subscription only helps the game and gives you access to more weaponry. You can still play and have fun as a rifleman, tanker, and sub-machine gunner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113643923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1649947984}
review:
This game was basically my teens and early 20s,
spent so many hours flying with friends, He 111 raids to England, fighter sweeps  , paradrops ... installing out of nostaglia

I don't know how new players will react to the graphics or population numbers. the graphics were dated when they were released, due to the engine/scope/small team and have only been incrementally updated.

I'll say that this game was all about playing with friends, people, and if you find people to play with will probably still be a great time

author: {'steamid': '76561197972188144', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1645914393}
review:
ive been playing this off n on through the years since the early days long ago now, still one of the best ww2 games that had a huge effect on how war games were played/made, my favorite part about this one in particular is the deep detail to what matters, the ballistics and thefore tactics needed to survive and prevail. It makes me happy to see the devs stuck to their no pun guns and kept going and making this amazing ww2 sim even better thru the years. I understand most humans these days care and used to only looks and shiny pointless shit, this game has PHYSICS and BALLISTICS where it SHOULD matter and graphics secondary and performance too is high prority im guessing since it does have good performance.  i will love this game for its whole life and if theres an after i will always once in a while think about how great it was that more game devs need to use this as reference (if it ever goes offline that is) and take notes. these devs deserve the very low monthly payment not only for a very unique ww2 that for once tries to be a sim and not "authentic and realistic" meaning simply ONLY the looks when the soldiers run like little bugs and the ballistics are non existant but, u know... everything is shiny...  this is one of my alltime favorite ww2 fps, fell in love with it when i was like 20 as it was first i heard of it, and still happily in love at 37 years old.   

Final, these devs truly deserve good feedback and the very small monthly fee not only for the gameplay "sim play" more like but, their devotion and care to their community AND their very stand out character and loyalty, evidence is how long this game has been going and still is going. Lots of love to the rat colony.

P.S they are even nice enough to offer free version of the game so u can test it on ur pc performance wise and if u can get used to it etc so u know almost exactly what ur paying for.  To those that give this game bad reviews needed to be spanked a whole lot more as a child, and or simply are children.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035001949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1575581061}
review:
I have played this game since about 2001 and I keep finding myself coming back to it. The key demographics for this game is more of an adult crowd. Most kids will not like the game as much due to the fact it is not like most FPS they play where you start a match and you have instant action within a few minutes. This is a game where the campaigns can last from a few weeks to several months long and is very much a first person shooting strategy game. There is a huge learning curve but there are more than enough players and guides to help you through it. Do the basic training then get on the training server and play around with the controls then hop on to the campaign server and join a squad. Find my tag in game Alf99 and fight side by side in a long battle for that key strategic town that could turn the tide of the campaign or get me in your cross hairs and brag about killing me.

Cost? well I prefer monthly sub games like EQ, EQ2, SWG, SWtoR (before it went F2P), WOW. There is a cost to everything and the fact that you don't have to rent a server and your don't have to pay to win it makes it better. If you would rather pay a monthly charge go direct to their website wwiionline.com you can always end your subscription at anytime. I have ended mine then came back a year later and still had all my stats. 

Boring? maybe its because you haven't taken the time to google wwiionline sapper guide and learned that every tank has a specific place you need to place your satchel charge in order to get the result that you are wanting. ATR? well you will want to practice this as it is very difficult as well. I am not upset when I get sapped or shot by an ATR as I know that person has spent a lot of time learning the right place to use their specific weapon of choice on my specific vehicle of choice. Also get a friend or make a friend and multi crew any ship, plane, truck, or tank. This game isn't for everyone but for some this has been the best game they have found for 18 years. 

I nominated them for the labor of love award because for 18 years the developers have been interactive with their player base and constantly adding and improving the game. Heck you will even get to play along side of some of the developers. 

So you can either loosen up those purse strings a bit or cancel one of the things you don't need anymore like Netflix, SiriusXM, Hulu, Disney+, Car Insurance, ETC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011858654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24303, 'last_played': 1696813602}
review:
I have played this game off and on for about ten years. It is a truly unique game. I have never found another game which combines the depth and scale of a whole war with the experience of playing as an individual soldier. Are the graphics old? yes. Are the interfaces slightly clunky? yes. Is there a steep learning curve? Absolutely. But those shortcomings are trivial compared to the experience in this game.

The game plays in cycles called campaigns. Each campaign lasts a month or so. In each campaign, the axis and allies fight over northern france, western germany, and southern england. A high command made up of experienced players moves divisions and brigades around the map. They decide what towns to attack, what bridges need demolition, etc. As a player, when you enter the game world to fight, you use units from these divisions and brigades. This means that your actions in the game use up actual supplies. Furthermore, you fight to take or defend towns in real time. Slowly, as the campaign progresses, the frontlines shift. Some nights you may be desperately defending towns with dwindelling supply and high casualties. Other nights you might be Storming an enemy airfield, or taking part in a huge tank battle, or an amphibious fight, or anything else. And all of this has real effects on the outcome of the campaign/war.

The scale of the game doesnt stop at the strategic level. At the tactical level you can play as infantry, tanks, boats, AT and AA guns, fighters, bombers. Also, as a campaign progresses, so to does the level of technology. In the early campaign, there is 1940 equipment. As the weeks go by, bigger better tanks appear and a lot more automatic weapons start to replace rifles. Finally the americans arrive in the campaign and bazookas drastically change the role of tanks in the fight.

The particulars of combat are very rewarding as well. Yes, the learning curve is high, and yes, it is unrelentlessly difficult. But i'll be damned if that doesn't make the victories ever more sweet. For instance, in tanks, you have to control all your crew members in the first person. No world of tanks third person luxury here. You become instantly aware how easy it is for enemy infantry to creep up on you. There are also no enemy marks on the map. Instead, all enemy marks on the map are placed by other payers as they spot the enemy. This contributes to a real, uncertain fog of war. 

The best advice I can give is to try the game on free to play. But if you do, make sure to use the in game chat for help and direction. Also, there is an official discord for both the axis and the allied side. Get on there and learn from all the veteran players.

review:
super jeu pour les fans d'histoire comme moi. Mais ne vous attendez pas √† des graphismes g√©niales, le jeu est surtout la pour sa simulation. Vous allez devoir vous taper 10km de marche a pied si vous √™tes loin de la bataille, un hit et c'est la mort. Vous pouvez jouer plusieurs classes, conduire un char, un avion de chasse de l'√©poque et plusieurs dizaines de soldats pour chaque pays. Actuellement il y a la France, l'Angleterre, l'Axe ( l'Allemagne) et les Etats Unis. La comu est tr√®s sympa et vous aidera si vous √™tes un d√©butant. La carte de combat est vraiment immense et ressemble √† de l'open world. Il y a le nord de la France, une bonne partie de l'Allemagne, la Belgique et m√™me le sud de l'Angleterre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147660467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1669359940}
review: This game takes some getting used to, but there's a reason it has a community 19 years strong! This is by far the closest you can get to a WW2 simulator as of now. Campaigns going on for months, a map encompassing all of Europe, massive battles, vehicles, naval battles, realistic combat, squad play, four Nations: Britain, U.S., France, and Germany. I could go on but I strongly encourage you to download it and try it out! It can be frustrating in the beginning, but the guys on the allied and axis discord can show you the ropes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198832062889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10069, 'last_played': 1691340300}
review:
The game has taken its toll on me all these years.
Horror is too real here, crawl to enemy town for 30 mins, don't realize your shoulder poking out from the bush, die from one bullet, respawn from 4 miles away and start all over again.
Play allies only, unless you want a severe beating in this game.
Axis get a few armored and infantry brigades with a ton of useless paratroopers. Allies start with weak tanks but double the brigades, hold the line for a few weeks, and simply wait for endless USA shipment of semi-auto rifles and SMGs for the rest of the campaign.
Bombing-runs are inconsistent, axis needs to destroy 18 factories to cripple enemy supply. Allies need to bomb only 9.
However, the amount of players is the biggest factor for steamrolling. One faction spends the weekends with a huge boost spending hours to take a few towns. Weeknights, the opposing one gets a dozen per evening. Respawn timers don't help much because it's all about the current player count. You can have 50 players with 5-second respawn but the enemy still wrecks you with 100 concurrent players despite having 20-second respawn.

Sorry for the rant but I really did enjoy this game back then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198379158673', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 68082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59601, 'last_played': 1707769954}
review: World War 2 Online is a special game. As someone who has dabbled in the game for almost 1000 hours I can tell you that while it may be dated, It is unique and It has a very good community. Once you get past the learning curve, and find a group of people to link up with, you will go far and do well. I found my niche in the German Luftwaffe. After connecting and joining a group of Axis pilots, I found my skills improving and started to see myself climbing the stat rankings. To me, the whole concept of a war playing out on an actual representation of Europe was the immediate attraction for me. The community is small, but the developers are doing the best they can to keep the game alive and improve it, which is no small task for a 20 year old game. It is a game that has been around for a very long time and I hope it is still there a long time from now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198817313872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6294, 'last_played': 1708823557}
review: WWII Online is a great game. The Gameplay is awesome. The Battles are realistic. The Game lets you be in the Army,Navy and Air Force. You can be a German,British,French,American and sometimes an Italian Soldier.This is a great ww2 shooter game. There are a few flaws. The Graphics are outdated. You cant fight on all fronts in the war like in the USSR,Africa, or Asia just Western Europe. The huge map doesnt change. And you cant use many weapons from wwII in this game .There is very little weapons to use unless you have a subscription. There are lack of bombers,planes and just new weapons to use every now and then but this is still a good game. Its WW2 after all. I think people should try out this game,its very interesting.
