author: {'steamid': '76561198006345247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 33891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1713, 'last_played': 1634383323}
review: The idea is great, the strategy mmmh, but the infantry combat just sucks.... you die either before the guy enters the room, OR after he runs through a hail of bullets and drops dead 2 secs later, or after he miraculously appears but only if he fires his gun, if he doesnt shoot then you may never have him render as he lies on the floor ten feet in front of you in what should be plain sight.  I have played on and off since about 2007 and I the lag issue is worse now than it ever was, and there are hardly any players for most of the time, certainly not the hundreds there used to be so you would have thought the lag would have been better not worse in 2019.  If that was fixed, AND the tanks still shooting after they have blown up, AND the loop de looping impossible aircraft flight envelopes, AND the armoured cars that dont suffer any crew damage when heavy calibre shells hit them and are deemed to pass through them! AND the sound audio bugs, AND the ninja anti tank sappers, AND the infantry running through/along thick bushlines, AND the inability to step over or drive a tank over a small log.... AND AND AND.... despite all this it is a great game, but not going to suit most people.
developer_response:
Hi Thomas,

World War II Online is best played during these timezones:
6 PM - 4 AM (UTC)
1 PM - 11 PM (Chicago)
11 AM - 9 PM (Los Angeles)
7 PM - 4 AM (Paris/London/Berlin)
5 AM - 2 PM (Sydney)
9 PM - 6 AM (Moscow)

The patch of today is releasing a new NETCODE3 That will help poor connexions. Also, we will move our servers to a new location with a provider that will provide faster/ priority connexions for non-US countries.

Still, I personally never experienced the lag you mentioned despite playing on a laptop with a WiFi network in Belgium, which is on the other side of the world from our servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084148469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1571281794}
review:
This isn't a bad game, but it's not a very good one either. Given their asking 15usd/month sub for full access, its just not worth it. I was given the impression that the community wants to help new players, but the over all game design ends up feeling like a constant rush the point despite a diverse class system.

Cons:
- Dated, simple graphics.
- Horrible, confusing menus and spawn system.
- Map is suppose to be large, but its mostly large empty gaps between towns.
- Bad HUD design makes it really hard to tell between friend/foe in low time to kill game.
- Small player base compared to the map size.
- Your forced to team up, more so if you pay for one of the lesser subscriptions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043230577', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1570904197}
review:
It was love at first sight when I began to play in 2004 and I don't care about the awful graphics and bugs. 
If you haven't patience, avoid it because the map is humongous, movements from city A to city B can last 1-2 hours and there is a chance you will stay idle till 3 hours before spotting an enemy (TRUE story!).
Why thumbs-down?
1) Subscription payment
2) Less freedom even at low levels. At the beginning, I remember 1st day/infantry players could even cap strategic buildings. (They were encouraged to sub and to invest money because they felt and actually were literally part of a mission, having an active role). *UPDATE* - Valid till 10/31/2019
3) Greenlight farce. I can't remember how many times this game failed to pass the old Steam Greenlight. I wasn't the only one to avoid the "blackmail" by some hardcore players. "Guys, we help you to play ONLY IF you vote "us" on Greenlight). It's not a coincidence WWII online appeared here right after Steam Direct was implemented. *UPDATE* - PARTIALLY WRONG. Passed Greenlight process the first time on 09/18/2013, appeared on Steam 4 years later, between 09/05 - 09/22/2017. Fact it was released after Steam Direct was implemented (06/13/2017) is a coincidence (sic)
4) Most serious reason: if you ask to delete your account, their answer is negative, for security and "business record purposes" (I still have their mail). Seriously???
developer_response:
1) Subscription payment is the #1 reason we've been able to stay in business since 2001. We pay for servers, power, security and bandwidth to provide our world wide services. Unlike traditional non-MMO games, that is our responsibility as opposed to players / guilds having to rent and administer their own servers.

2) Free Play as of November 1st 2019 has been revamped to allow all basic features, like capturing you mentioned (and more). It also includes new vehicles, including tanks.

3) We passed the old Greenlight process the first time, which was quite a bit more challenging and received enough votes from our community to be activated by Steam directly. Reference: https://www.giantbomb.com/steam-greenlight/3015-7583/ 

4) We don't delete accounts but we are happy to remove ALL of your personal information. The reason we don't is because we've had many players come back and request their account to be reactivated. So we store your stats and rank / game related history (not your personal data) to make it easier to come back as you were.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131135503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1506215968}
review:
It just isn't that fun, the graphics aren't too great, and it's complicated to learn at some points. The massive map is way too big for the player size. You also have to pay for the game every month to unlock all the features. WWII Online is not worth the $10 price tag at all.

It was put on Steam back in 2001, so that explains the graphics being the way they are. And the player base has probably died down a lot since that time too. Though what really doesn't make sense is that the game has been in Early Access for 21 years.

I might return one last time, and if it is just like what I said, I will never play it again until it is improved in some way. I last played it 5 years ago since that's when I "purchased" it, so it's probably gotten better over the years by now. If it hasn't, then I still agree to what I've said.

But that's just my opinion. There will probably be people saying this is a good/ bad review, but that's okay. It is how [b]I THINK[/b] the game is, not you. You may like it, or you may dislike it like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972445479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1565891684}
review:
This is NOT early access. This game was a full release MMO in Summer 2001.

I have played this game on and off since the week it released back in 2001. Like every other MMO of the day, it had a monthly subscription fee, so if you're bitching about that, tough luck. WoW has been doing the same thing just as long. This is NOT a fast paced shooter, so if that's what you seek, move along.

Back in the early years this game was amazing, cutting edge, and had a really large player base that generated massive battles regularly, organized bomber wings for strategic bombing, flotillas (river and channel) to fight or move supplies.

Fast forward to 2019. I haven't played in 5 years, now, but looking at the Dev roadmap for the game I cannot see where anything has been accomplished. The only change I see in the roadmap is in the style/layout, with all the same objectives they've had posted as "almost" complete for 7 years or so (if not longer). CRS does not care about players or their experience, they can often be rude and like to silence dissenters (I was never victim of their antics, but I know a few who were). Honestly I think if you went to CRS instead of seeing a bunch of people working on a video game you would find yourself in an old lady's basement where 4-5 middle-aged fat guys are slobbering over a server stack and pretending they know how to write code and run a game. 7+ years they've been promising server side ordinance, machine guns, integrated comms, reworked supply system, etc. Don't listen to the "requested for years" shit they spout, it has been promised as "almost done" for years. Not a single one has been completed.

Again, I want to emphasize that this used to be a real quality game that was managed properly and had a great community, and I have years and years of experience playing independently, in squads, and as a member of both AHC and GHC. But at one point I stopped playing in 2008, came back in 2012-13. Nothing had changed. The new graphics update they did a few years after launch was already severely outdated, no new equipment or armies had been added, cities still had the same generic, repetitive layout as they did in 2001. And surprise, surprise, it's 2019 and they still haven't added any of the features they were promising "soon" back in 2012. You still can't even bomb effectively (tactical or strategic) because the server doesn't track ordinance. In other words, if you can't see it, it ceases to exist. So if I drop a bomb on a FOB that has 30 guys on it, but I can't see them on my screen, the bomb effectively ceases to exist and everyone lives. This game was originally titled WWII Online, before they changed it to Blitzkrieg something or other, because it was intended to be a full world war. It would start early war and proceed time with the war expanded at certain points until the war was won. A bold undertaking to be sure, but let's be honest, it could be done with modern resources. Within a few years from launch it was supposed to expand to include eastern europe/russia, mediterranean, africa, and eventually NA/SA and asia with the relevant armies and equipment. It has been 18 years, we are still in France/Belgium (UK really doesn't count because of how rare it is for there to be any fighting there) and the scant US resources were added 10+ years ago.

I want to love this game again, I want it to be great again, but from what I can tell they're just continuing to scam people for a game they have no intention of actually updating with anything other than minor bugs and the occasional new model of an existing equipment. It pains me to say this, but this game is dead. The devs who are still involved with it don't know how to do anything, they're just trying to make it look like shit is still moving forward like it was before they lost their teams. I honestly imagine a company where literally everyone but the community moderators quit but the moderators spend 13 years trying to convince the world that everyone is still there working and you should pre-order the products that they aren't really making.

If you take nothing else from this, or think I'm full of shit, let me remind you of something. This game came out as a full release MMO in June 2001. I started playing on day 4 of release, so I know it happened. JUNE 2001! And yet it is listed as an early access title on Steam. Don't get me started on the fact that Steam allowed them to do that, but the fact that they even requested that status is totally unreal to me and should be a HUGE red flag to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008368544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1566156054}
review:
WWII Online is like no other game you have played. You think you know what it is, but you cannot know until you've played it. It is difficult, it is unforgiving, and it has a learning curve a mile high. What it is NOT is a twitch shooter. It simply isn't. If you're looking for a CoD or Battlefield experience, you will not get it here. WWII Online is a 1/5th scale map of western Europe, on all the time. There are no "maps" or "instances" - the whole world is open from the start and stays open all the time.

 While it is possible to find fast action, a huge portion of gameplay is a slow burn. You drive your tank, or truck, or boat, or destroyer to battle. You fly your plane from the nearest friendly airfield to the action and back again, which is one of the main differences between this game and most shooters you will play. in WWII Online, the goal is not to do as much damage as possible before you die - the goal is to be as effective as possible and live through it to Return to Base. There is no Red vs. Blue here. The units are modeled after their historic counterparts, with some necessary modifications for gameplay. 

It is a software as a service model - you pay a monthly sub to play. The cheapest one is $4.99 a month, which I think is more than worth it. The steam reviews don't do the game justice - notice they are mostly angry about the subscription fee. Try it yourself - there is a free month trial but you'll know within the first couple of days if the game is for you. 

I've been playing on and off as an "organic" subscriber (subbed through the WWII Online site) since 2003. There really is nothing else like it anywhere. I had to download it here just so I could leave this review because I think all the negative vitriol is really a shame and based on "Free" expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162985415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1702942369}
review:
Grafica datata (non un grosso problema per me ma per i pignoli meglio girare al largo), mappa grande quanto la non voglia che ho di esplorarla e abbonamento mensile per giocare, praticamente un pay to play, dato che le uniche classi disponibili dall'inizio sono quella del fuciliere e l'assaltatore di riserva (dove "di riserva" sta per "con mezzo caricatore e una granata") e se vuoi le altre devi sottoscrivere un'abbonamento mensile, cosa che poteva anche andare nel 32 a.C ma adesso chiederlo √® puro ottimismo. le armi hanno le mire sballate e quando spari fa' lo stesso rumore di un tubo di pringles vuoto che ti cade dal tavolo. millemila km^2 di mappa con citt√† tutte uguali e massimo una ventina o poco pi√π di persone che ci giocano. se per intercessione divina un qualsivoglia mezzo da trasporto ti passer√† accanto il guidatore tirer√† dritto per andare verso sa lui dove e ti toccher√† farti 2km a piedi (sembrano pochi ma a piedi ci stai intere epoche) per poi farti colpire di striscio il mignolo da un colpo sparato da una luger 300 metri pi√π in l√† e morire dissanguato (dato che i medici non esistono in questo gioco). non c'√® il voip per comunicare con gli altri giocatori per cui si possono solo usare la chat (che nessuno legge) o fare ctrl ctrl sperando che l'altro abbia capito.

se sei arrivato a questo punto (e devi essere uno che non molla) l'esasperazione ti porter√† certamente a disinstallare il "gioco" e cos√¨ a porre fine a questa agonia, oppure, se non ti sei ancora arreso, probabilmente spinto dalla voglia di sviscerare questa carcassa per vedere fin dove si spinge o pi√π semplicemente per romperti le balle ulteriormente, ti salter√† agli occhi il campo di prova. 
in esso saranno disponibili tutti gli armamenti e i veicoli del gioco (un bordello, tipo migliaia) e probabilmente, come me, passerai pi√π o meno il 70percento del tempo a massacrare in tutti i modi possibili i bot, che spawni con spazio. 

in conclusione ecco dei consigli per rendere perlomeno quasi giocabile il gioco per quei poveri giocatori che non possono permettersi manco un computer in grado di reggere worms 2 :

-aggiungere il medico, un modo per curarsi o almeno un modo per smettere di sanguinare 
-aggiungere la possibilit√† di uscire dai veicoli se si √® il guidatore
-la possibilit√† di saltare o perlomeno di savalcare oggetti
-aggiungere armi tipo l'm1 carabine, il panzerfaust e l'stg44 che nella seconda guerra mondiale esistevano ma in questo gioco pi√π realistico del ges√π non ci sono
-METTETE TUTTO GRATIS DIO POI

gioco consigliato solo a masochisti di prim'ordine. pu√≤ provocare danni permanenti al cervello, traumi, disturbi del sonno e depressione. se giocato in grandi quantit√†  pu√≤ portare alla morte.

leggere le avvertenze per maggiori informazioni.


P.s.
il combattimento aereo √® fatto abb. bene, ma tanto per sbloccare gli aerei devi pagare 12 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094843009', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1565162353}
review:
The BEST GAME EVER!!
The gun gameplay is even better than Battlefield V as you can press Q and E to look left and right, which means you don't even have to use your mouse. I learned so much Russian from how long the campsite names are and having to pronounce them to my teammates so we can all spawn there!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137805400', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11258, 'last_played': 1703375304}
review:
I've been a WW2 Online player since I was 12, so around 12 years ago and recently I rejoined back to see how's the game going.
I may be biased, but I really enjoy this game as it offers something what no other game offers and that is proper combined arms and large battles which can quite literally last irl days

The community is great too and no question will go unanswered. Keep in mind that when you get into the game, there's a lot that's going on and the other players can have up to 20 years of experience (this game is from 1999!)

Also, the game player numbers aren't all that's shown here because CRS also has their own local game download (like WarThunder has)

Yes, the graphics aren't good, but they just look the perfectly nostalgic to me. And it works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087575315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1578365808}
review:
Did i find it fun?
Yeah.This is a $20 dollar game at best. 

It still gets updates but in what world does it seem reasonable to charge people that much monthly for a game this dated?

It was already dead and the removal of f2p completely from this game is a desperate attempt to squeeze more money outta this.

Does it really cost so much to keep this crap alive that you cant handle a one time payment where people buy the game. At least then the dlc's would have made sense. Who tf wants to get dlc on top of there shitty subscription knowing full well that the subscription runs out 

Im annoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991679403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1701037017}
review: If you like simulators, big scale and ww2 - you have to try it out. There is nothing even close to this game. It's been around for about 20 years and graphics aren't great due to this. But the depth of the gameplay and the combined arms warfare with actual players in every plane, every tank and behind every rifle is still very unique and fascinating. If you like it and can afford it, take a subscription. It's how the game is meant to be played.
developer_response:
Hi groefazke, thanks for your support! We are working hard to upgrade our graphics. We are still strong of some unique game play features never seen anywhere else than in WWII Online, but it will become even better as long as we receive support!

See you in the battlefield!
S!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146996166', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1666044141}
review: 2017 Game? I Feel Like This Game Has In 1999's Dam Is Look Old But Fun!
developer_response:
Thanks cheeki for the support, because of the size of the map and the amount of players it can host (5000, expandable if needed), we must intentionally limit the graphics and special effects to give a chance to everyone to play the same game. It's like spacecrafts using some technologies from ten years ago: old but stable.
That being said, there is room for improvement as the past 8 years nothing much happened on that part. The new team is working hard on it. The more players will keep playing, the faster and better it will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085766276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1649285511}
review:
I've played this game for years and only just joined on steam. It's my favorite game of all time.

Pros: 
Massive map and every person you see is an actual player
Campaigns last weeks and every thing you do matters. Each kill and capture changes the outcome of the battle, and a single battle can turn the tide of the war. 
Gunplay is realistic and feels heavy. I often find my heart racing while capturing an objective waiting for an enemy soldier to run through the door.
Physics simulation is perfect and flying is wonderful once you get the hang of it.
This game is difficult. When I first started playing four years ago, it took many hours to get my first kill and it was an awesome feeling when i finally did.

Cons:
Graphics are outdated, although that doesn't take away from the experience.
A few glitches, mostly when it comes to destroying tanks. Some seem to have a huge amount of health

Overall, this game is a wonderful true to life simulation of combat during the second World War. The negative reviews are mostly from people who prefer more arcade-style combat like call of duty and even battlefield. This game has very slow and very immersive combat, and some people aren't into that. If a massive campaign where every little thing you do matters sounds good to you, try this game out. With some luck, you could be at the center of the turning point of the current campaign.

review: I do enjoy the game. It's complex systems and dynamics comply a very enjoyable experience. However, I am disappointed, for I can't manipulate my second favorite historical implement, The M1 Garand, for I am required to pay to use it. However, nonetheless, I still enjoy this amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204226416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1555328843}
review:
Subscription based service makes it hardly enjoyable. I used to play it for a long time. When they let you be more than just rifleman. Actually let you use planes and what not. I'd pay for it one time but $15 for one fucking month? I get that having a big MMO server is probably expensive and what not. I don't know the exact costs but It makes enjoying the game a non-option. F (6/11/19)


After the F2P purge of recent. I went ahead and bought a subscription plan to continue playing but the plan did offer a lot more. Such as more planes to be used. I only speak for the Air Force aspect of the game but it is a lot more fun being able to actually use the persona. It's a lot different as compared to games like IL:2 and War Thunder. It's a game I like to boot up whenever I want something a little more fresh. It feels satisfying knowing that every single ground troop below is a human player and I am scaring them with the Jericho siren! I'll be honest my negative review was written at first because of the restricted access to planes in the beginning. Although I would rather not pay a subscription, I can see servers being quite expensive to maintain. (9/9/2019)
developer_response: We do also offer several single purchase DLC packages, as well as alternative subscription plans to the 'premium' plan you mention.

review:
Dismiss most negative comments. Either because they didnt join a squad or didnt do something right. I will say right now that this game is old. very very old. but still has a lively community. if you get into intense battles it can be very imeresive. This game is like no other. Its unique.

My awnsers to negative reveiws

-Graphics suck- Yeah but it doesnt effect gameplay? and im young and didnt grow up with this game so I know that they do
-I walked 15 mins to get killed by a machine gun- Yeah when I joined the discord the first thing i was told was you are going to die alot so dont give up. Its not like COD-world war 6 where your flying around on a plane and yo get an epic killstreak, no you wait till you hear shots crack off and then you hit the dirt

-BORING- ... again its not a spawn in get 6 kills and die game.

So I thought that I could bring some light to this game because of how amazing it really is. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029607800', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1707016780}
review:
so, about the subscription, if you want the full game you have to pay, BUT hear me out. 

IT ISNT REALLY NEEDED UNTIL AROUND RANK 7. I promise you, you'll most likely play a rifleman or SMG until then. And if you play to rank 7, then you can prob JUSTIFY THE FUCKING 5 DOLLAR SUB. ITS FIVE. FUCKING. BUCKS. 

if you enjoy what that gives you MAYBE YOU CAN JUSTIFY TEN BUCKS. 

they have so many options of payment its totally fair, 

ONE HUGE IMPORTANT NOTE. 

MONEY. PAYS. DEVS. TO. MAKE. YOUR. FUCKING. GAMES. 
f2p is nice, but every f2p game has its cons, or should i say, PRICE. HMMMM. FUNNY. THESE GUYS WORK TO GIVE YOU A GAME AND GIVE YOU A OPTION TO PAY THEM FOR IT. FUNNY HOW THAT WORKS. 


DO NOT BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS UNTIL YOU'VE TRIED THE GAME.

DISCLAIMER: THE GAMES OLD. 

I grew up watching my dad play this game, but I dove in and spent nearly 2 hours in  an intense back and fourth battle trying to defend, retake, and then defend again with plenty of players from infantry, tanks, aircraft and more to keep it interesting. Its a simulator, meaning this is not a normal FPS. its not incredibly fast paced, it can be frustrating, but the community is well alive and just as fun as its always been. Join a squad, hop in their discord, they'll show you the ropes. you'll have fun. I promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304639488', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1559347879}
review:
The trailer is nothing like the game. Misleading. Graphics are not at all like the trailer.Also you need to PAY for all you see on the trailer,PLUS DLC since armor,planes,weapons,soldiers etc are pay-to-play.PLUS DLC.  First thing i realize upon playing is that there is no configuration menu. i mean, there IS one but it ONLY lets you choose the display at what resolution. Nothing else.

Second,i can't configure controls. I can't configure anything.No menu for it either.

I tried joining games, but there is NEVER enough players to begin a game. I need to play offline to even try the game out. And even that is screwed up because i discovered that, since i can't set aforementionned controls, i can't go prone behind fox holes(Said holes only being knee-deep).Or do anything! Can't even spawn bots to train or even try out the game's core concept!

Third: I do not believe one bit that there was 18 years of ACTIVE development on this game. If this game came out in 2001,then had 18 years of development,it's more than certain the game should be WAY better than this. Sound design would be better,models would not look like a playstation 2 game (Polygonal limitations of the console.No more excuses with even BASIC super cheap Integrated GPU's in processors of the last 5 years,nowadays IGPu's letting you play 1080p 60 fps in a lot of A-class games (CS:GO,Fortnite/PUBG,Overwatch even,etc.)). There is NO excuses on anything hardware-related.

And when it comes to grapical design... this game is LEGITIMATELY low quality in all it's aspects. no water(Or at least barely from gameplay footage i went to see to compensate for no players playing),barely any landscaping done,animations are really low quality,etc. you get it. If it's gonna appeal to 2019 players, it needs a serious workout.

There is not way in hell anyone would pay a SUBSCRIPTION for 15$ ***PER MONTH*** for a game like this. This game feels like a cash grab. With all the money they would have collected over 18 years from it's player base,considering it was never really free, they should have had the money to actually make the game WAY better than it is as of right now.

Good thing this game had free-access this month. Not worth the money investment,with all those EA-style cash grabbing schemes.I mean heck,even EA,***the company that abuses the shit out of DLC*** doesn't have 3/4 of it's game locked behind DLC! EVEN EA! I can't believe i'm saying that!

Anyway,game scores on metacritic are bs,subscription-based game ***with pay to play*** on top of it, WITH DLC on top of it is just the worst,and on top of that there is no player base with misleading trailer(Trailer shows stuff you need to PAY for,along with content you will never get to see in-game anyway due to before mentionned lack of players),and just so much more stuff that i just can't get into words.

If this game is to even be CONSIDERED to be sold/bought to/by ANYONE, it needs to stop the ***15$*** per month subscription (20$ per month for the "Premium" stuff),not make any excuses about hardware (SPECIALLY not in 2019,now that even low-spec computers can run A-class games easily),and actually put some heart in the development. And if budget allows it,get some graphics improvements. In 2019 a game that looks like this is not appealing to the public. And also, actually putting a graphical/audio/controller/keyboard setup menu is MANDATORY for ANY game. No excuses.


Will not play the game anymore. Nor think i will ever play it in the future if it keeps heading that way.
developer_response: All footage contained within our trailer was obtained by real in-game footage from Staff and players. All footage shows real players and actual game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396604989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1559224976}
review:
All right

This game

The only thing bad about it is the lack of players
Its a massive map, filled with what could be truly massive battles and fights
However, that is the only bad thing about it

I myself do not mind that i can not commander a tank, but rather play as a regular Infantry unit, assaulting towns, and small settlements, defending the same, sometimes loosing, sometimes winning

The graphics are not for your modern gamer, but a lot of people make a mistake here and turn the game down as soon as they see outdated graphics. Im not one of them
The lack of players aside, the gameplay can sometimes be dull, because of the lack of player, but when the fighting starts, then you very quickly learn to get your damn head down before you get shot. One bullet is death, just like it should be in my opinion.

There are no more powerful weapons, no damage values. The weapons as far as i have played, are realistic, feel good, and skill is highly rewarded. To unlock an automatic weapon one must simply do well in battles, and earn the weapons, not having to buy them as the only way of obtaining them.

THIS
THIS is what a lot of other WW2 games wanted to pull off
Games like Heroes and Generals, that had the potential

However this game is different
This game not only HAS potential, but is using it and accomplishing it to the fullest.

For whatever its worth, i DO recommend this game
And even if it does sometimes get dull, having to walk some distance in order to get to the battle itself, the sheer atmosphere of battle, the paranoia that behind that corner there could be an enemy soldier just waiting for you to peak your head, the possibility of a sniper held up in a building youre facing, the sheer number of things that you need to count on during a battle, from sudden maschine gun fire, to a sniper firing off a shot, to a tank suddenly appearing out of nowhere, a sudden grenade capable of wiping out an entire squad, and the knowledge that you can indeed overpower, and outplay your enemy if you play it smart is what makes this game so enjoyable. So real, and true to a real battlefield

All of that, and much more, is unmatched in any other game of its type that i have ever played.

If anyone asked me if this game was any good i would say yes, without any thinking. You dont HAVE to pay. True, you will be restricted to an infantry unit, a gameplay i do prefer myself, and just in the infantry gameplay you can find all of these things, and more

One bullet is death, so spend them wisely, reload whenever you get the chance, because just one bullet can indeed make a difference between you winning or loosing a fight.

I recommend this game to everyone who wants to experience realistic WW2 fighting

Thank you developers, for making this game what it is

author: {'steamid': '76561198071561349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1607756193}
review:
Engine is the same as it was 5 years ago, Pay-to-play now pay-to-win, insulting additions to the game (mortarmen)

"Early-Access for 18 years?"
*Laughs in Developer*

Played this game in Middle School and Early High School days as warhero, paid the equivalent to an Xbox live and Netflix subscription and advanced to the rank of to Oberstluetnant. Was one of the top 250 riflemen in game (110ish) and same with captures as I would run with small German groups that would push the villages on the southernmost portion of the map.

I see it's on Steam and come back only to find that my previous account was deleted, that the weapons they should have had in the game earlier are here now but, that now the pay-to-play wall is now pay-to-win. I routinely happen upon lines where I see through the map, there's a freaking Mortar-man, like that's helpful, when you only have that and a pistol... I quit earlier thanks to the notion that Motorcycles weren't around until Harley Davidson was founded and that they wouldn't be added to the game, etc. and the price drove me away as well. I've laid into the developers then (about motorcycles) and have laid into them recently after a startup created a better quality game in less time.
developer_response:
Hi brotherhood,

Your playgate account still exist and is active. If not please submit a ticket 
https://playnet.zendesk.com/hc/en-us?mobile_site=true

New units are being added but the new team requires a bit more time to work on new ones from scratch. We all want motorcycles as well!

The pre-release state is only regarding Steam. A couple of things need to be improved first before getting its full release status here. We know it is being confusing since the project started in 2001. That should come soon.

review:
8/10


Now, people that pick up this game and give it negative reviews seem to not understand that this game is supposed to be a simulation.

Did you walk for 15 minutes to your objective? You're doing it wrong.

Are you using rifles to fight SMG's in cqc? Wrong.

This game is pretty good for a 2001 game, and still holds up today.

Though the subscription prices are ridiculous! Cut that to half at least!

Also, don't play planes without a stick.

review:
When the server population is decent it's a good game. There is a steep learning curve. If you try the Free Rifleman you need to remember, it's a rifleman. You will lose a close up fight against an automatic weapon. You need to engage the enemy at a distance. Let the SMGs charge the buildings. 

The graphics are dated. 

DLCs are a good option if you enjoy the game but do not want to pay a monthly subscription.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979983302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1556330813}
review: Absolutely horrible. It tries to make the battles realistic, but fails miserably. It takes to long to move anywhere, if you're caught out in the open even just a few feet away from a doorway you will have no chance of surviving a 1 on 1 firefight. That, and it takes about 10 minutes on a decent computer to load just the server page. And if you're worried about too many guns don't worry. You only get 1 until you play days worth of battles. Which is grueling, due to the fact that it can take you about 15 minutes just to get to an area of combat, but by then usually the action has passed and you can just walk another 5 minutes to the next area. I played this game of cat and mouse for about 2 hours before I finally got a kill and captured 3 areas all because it took the enemy about 20 minutes to get there. It's like playing Skyrim but only walking everywhere armed with a bow and arrow (except Skyrim has groups of enemies at intervals where in this game you will be lucky to see 1 enemy in an hour). Play Day of Defeat if you want a similar (but way better) game. If none of this convinced you, then let me shout out to those graphics nazis in the crowd. N64 graphics were better than this garbage. Can you believe they want you to pay for the additional content?!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980061430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1556676059}
review:
It‚Äôs great fun, it‚Äôs huge, it‚Äôs difficult, you‚Äôll probably die a lot. The UI is old and can be cumbersome but after a couple hours and some YouTube videos it comes together. This is one of my favorite WWII games and compared to any other combined arms game out there, this crushes all of them. Yes it is ancient but honestly still worth checking out if you lean on the simulation side of the house. They don't make games like this anymore and it's a damn shame. It was one of the first MMOFPS games created for the PC and it‚Äôs still going, because the people who play still support it. The devs of this game are small, but very passionate and helpful about any issues.

I'd say give it a try if you like more complicated unforgiving games. There's nothing quite like being a tiny cog in the wheel, when you see the scale of the game you'll see what I mean. If you want something super easy and shiny then just keep on looking. 


TLDR; If you're a gameplay > graphics person and like hardcore games about WWII it's going to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814938112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1704638601}
review:
Old technology, but the ground game is worth playing. The ground model is enough that you can play without frustration. However the flight model is the worst I have ever encountered. They have nerfed the German aircraft to the point there are no german pilots flying. And this for a game that has been around 15 years should tell you something. If you like flying allied aircraft then you are in for a treat as they rule the skies and can destroy anything with a 20mm round. You may not find any enemy aircraft around, but if you enjoy bombing stuff unimpeded, this is your game.
I cannot believe a game that has been around as long as they say can be broken to the point it is not playable as a flight sim. Very frustrating flying a folk wolfe 190 and watching a over 20 rounds of 20mm cannons do nothing. As a flight sim it is embarrassing.
As a fps and strategy game I would recommend, but the flight sim model is so bad if there is an allied airfield close by it will ruin your experience as the constant bombs and straffing will make it unplayable. Maybe I will revisit when they fix the flight model, but from what I was told in game this is not a priority. 
EDIT: I'll give it a thumbs up, it seems the air sim crowd has migrated somewhere else...for now anyway.  Battles are great when the air isn't saturated with aircraft. The new FMS and trench system is a great new feature. It can be hit or miss though. You may log in and not find much going on, but at other times there are squads on leading attacks and it gets fun. I don't like the spawn delay when you have more players. You need numbers to capture a town, and it gets negated by a spawn delay. The game advertises the largest gaming map in the universe, and yet on a highly populated evening, sometimes no towns get captured. If you get TWO towns it was a great night. I would like to see the populated side cap several towns
developer_response:
Hi tenthstream. Very sorry to hear that bad experience and how it affected you after so many years. 
Part of the team is currently auditing the damage models, including the aircraft armor. If they confirm any issue it will be fixed asap. You know how passionate the team is and we also want to keep realism as high as possible. 

Join us this Sunday 17/03 at 5pm for a joint event and free access for your account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399458390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1546040881}

The game is outdated when it comes to graphics and such, and there was an FPS limiter that had me on 30. If you are looking for a game with more action and an easier interface, I would recommend Heroes and Generals, but even that game is awful.
developer_response:
Hi Joe, the team agrees with you and a new UI is already in the work. Some tutorial videos have been made available and new ones are coming soon. Check the main store page in the description.

Have you joined a discord channel and asked for help? There is always a veteran that will help you.

Join us this Sunday 17/03 at 5pm for a joint event and free access for your account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135280416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1541814318}
review: I think most of the bad reviews of this legendary diamond in the rough game are from guys that don't have the patience to really learn the game and give it a chance, or they are frustrated by the limitations of free to play mode.  IT is worth the sub, let me tell you.  Most of the time it is not an instant gratification game, it takes planning, patience and teamwork to accomplish goals and if you are into that notion you can't go wrong here.  There may be other stuff out there that does one thing or another shinier and more polished than ww2 online, but  nobody comes even close to giving you to the total package experience as this game does. Sure the devs make make some updates now and again that not everyone will agree with, but the point is that they ARE coming out with consistent updates that are largely based on listening to the player base. For a long time the game sat dead in the water just barely hanging on, but the current team of devs has done a ton of awesome things to improve the game and prepare her for what is hopefully a bright future.  I play air mainly, and there is no other air sim that lets you interact with the players on the ground and have a feeling that you have a hand in the fate of the campaign map, while having a somewhat decently not so arcade flight model that is rewarding to learn.   There still is no other game out there like ww2 online. and if you want to get petty about things like the free to play model or the fact that its "hard to learn at first"  ( Getting on discord comms will speed your progress)  Then you aren't looking deep enough.  There is a good darn reason this game has lasted so long.  And right now it  is in the early stages of a fresh new chapter that will hopefully show more folks out there just what a special one of a kind experience WW2 Online is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348828421', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1573774077}

This game is boring af, you get to go 2 classes if you don't pay, one being a truck driver, but you can get out!
2. Being an infantry unit that spawns 20 mins + from the objective and you get picked off and spawnkilled by dive- bombers, snipers and enemy MG gunners, who are all tryhard af and don't want to have fun.
developer_response:
Hi eggmanjames, I heard you and you are right that we need better tutorials. Have you viewed all those added to the main store page? Especially the one about how to navigate on the UI.

As le cack said, you must join the allied or the axis discord channel and stick to an active squad in your prime time. In game ask help on the help channel or ask where to go in the operations channel. 
If there is no mobile spawn available there is someone preparing a ride 100% of the time.

Even if we provided very clear tutorial we can‚Äôt replace the absence of communication or initiative. However we are working on making the UI easier to take such initiatives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989913692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1550523177}
review:
It's unfortunate that this game is now in the state that it's in.  The game itself is a great concept and it was such a good game.  I played the game heavily for 16 years.  I played both sides extensively.  Unfortunately,  WWII Online can't figure out what it wants to be.  It can't seem to figure out if it wants to be a MILSIM, a game, or both.  The problem with that is the development often takes sort of a character of dissociative identity disorder where realism is sacrosanct in some areas and game play trumps realism in other areas.  CRS will often justify a decision based on realism one minute and then defend fudging things for the sake of gameplay the next. Yet all the while you'll be told your playing the most realistic simulation ever created.  The game's home page even cites "Realism is taken to a new level". 

None of this would be a problem if it were not for the fact that it makes it impossible to have a discussion with CRS about game issues.   Based on their take on any given issue you'll be told that they can't do something because of realism or something was done or left undone for the sake of game play.  I'll give an example.  CRS just announced that they were going to fix the LMG so that it gets used in it's more historical role of a support weapon.  The weapon in game has been used as an SMG for years and has been the bane of the Allied side and subject of countless forum threads.  The Axis MG34 was superior to it's counterparts in the non historical SMG role due to rate of fire and ammunition capacity.  There is no question the weapon was gamey and needed to be fixed if CRS did indeed wanted to be used in its historical role.  CRS announced they would apply a fix to all LMGs in the game across the board.  So far so good.  It sounds fair enough.  Except that when you point out that all infantry weapons in game are over done due to the ability to jog and fire accurately, CRS will actually delete your posts on their forums for pointing that out.  With 22 years of weapons training under my belt I can pretty confidently say that it is very difficult to engage a target accurately while jogging.  Furthermore, in a discussion with the CEO he called fixing all weapons to behave in a realistic state "draconian".  This ends up making the whole "fix" appear as bias move by CRS to only "fix" the Axis LMG whether they intended it that way or not.  CRS chooses to hide behind the realism veil here to justify the "fix" while leaving all other infantry weapons in game an out and out falsehood in terms of the same abilities the LMG was "fixed" for.  It's a common belief among the Axis player base that the Axis infantry kit is a trump card in the early tiers, which represent the early years of the war, against Allied heavy tanks and Allied air supremacy. In addition, some players also seem to think the Allied SMGs are superior in game, the same SMGs that are still allowed to jog and shoot. The problem with CRS' selective realism in this instance is that it comes off as side bias to the Axis folks to prize the infantry kit.  

It wouldn't be problem if CRS would just admit that things need to be fudged for the sake of gameplay and balance and call it a day.  However, in other areas they insist on strict realism. Take that Allied air supremacy I mentioned above as an example.  Due to game dynamics the Luftwaffe doesn't really compete in game.  The capture dynamics of the game revolve around capturing flags in a town that has an active attack objective on it.  This means that most air combat in game takes place over these small towns as both sides battle for air superiority for their respective close air support aircraft.  The problem is that Allied aircraft such as the spitfire were designed to "turn and burn" and the capture dynamic of the game plays to that strength. The Luftwaffe aircraft on the other hand were designed to be interceptors that operated at a much higher altitude.  This is especially true as the war went on since they were built to run down heavy for engine bombers at altitude.  Consequently, over time the Allied planes have dominated the skies right over the towns with attack objectives.  Allied planes conducting close air support have all the loiter time they want and are almost completely uncontested.  Axis close air support aircraft on the other hand are shot down almost immediately because their supporting fighters are up at altitude just hoping to use "boom and zoom" tactics to get lucky and catch an Allied fighter off guard who strayed to high.  Not to mention the skill floor for both applying the tactics and tweaking the planes to fly correctly is much higher for the Axis to apply those tactics.  Over time, this has lead to the near complete decimation of the Luftwaffe in terms of pilots willing to fly in game while the Allies enjoy an almost complete air supremacy over the in game battlefield.  Any suggestion that maybe the Axis planes should be tweaked to "turn and burn" for the sake of gameplay immediately gets rejected by CRS on the grounds of realism.  

Yet until recently, equipment was introduced in game in tier sets.  Some of those tier sets were completely off in terms of realism.  For example 1942 tanks like the Tiger were introduced in game with 1944 tanks like the Sherman 76.  CRS always defended these type of non historical introductions as being done for the sake of game play.  Yet no such game play concession was made for the Luftwaffe issue related above.  In fact, to date no contemporary heavy armor from 1944 for the Axis has been modeled in the game with the Sherman 76 or Sherman Firefly.  Again, selective realism at play.

Another issue with the game (assuming you've bothered to read this far)  is the spawning dynamics of the game.  The game heavily revolves around fixed spawns that are easily camped.  Unfortunately this goes for both attackers and defenders.  The current development team changed the spawning dynamics for attacks.  Rather than allowing infantry placed spawns that are dynamic the game now requires trucks to place hardened spawns.  Infantry combat has markedly decreased in game.  Think occasional skirmish rather than massive battles.  The spawns themselves are easily camped by tanks in game because defenders can spawn armor much closer to the action.  So even if you bring your own armor to start an attack it will soon be wiped out and the hardened infantry spawns for the attack will be camped.  The game has become spawn camp online with a good amount of people playing nothing but defense since the game now discourages attack.

All of this had a huge effect on player numbers. If you look on the forums open to the public you will find a large number of threads and posts dedicated to the lack of player numbers.  It's unfortunate, in that, the game is designed around having large numbers of players for the thing to run.  The lack of players really hurts systems like the mobile spawning mentioned above and High Command system which, although integral to the game, often has no one to man it.  When the High Command system has no one manning it, decent attack objectives are not put in place and brigades are not moved at all.  The game flat out breaks.

Last, but certainly not least, this is no longer a professional development studio.  It is a group of players who volunteer in their spare time to keep the game moving forward.  The game cannot really afford full time professional programmers for support and requires fund raisers to keep the lights on.  While admirable that these folks are willing to put their time in and attempt to keep the thing alive, it just doesn't cut it from a development stand point.  All development is exceedingly slow and game flaws like the ones above are defended ad nauseum by the volunteer team.  When concerns such as the ones above are brought up, you are almost guaranteed to have that post deleted and warnings issued to you.  

Stay away.  The game is no longer worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036918401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1703299854}
review:
Where do I start.
First off, don't go by how many people are playing via Steam. Most players log in through the old system.

I am a day 1 player who has a love/hate for this game. Only reason I keep sticking around is the friendships I have formed. I tend to only log in when my squadmates are on. When they aren't on, i log off and play another game. Why? I feel when I play solo I tend to do two things. Guard cps or blow up fbs. It gets old. When my squad is on we plan stuff and piss off allied players by ruining their plans. 
Recently the game has made changes that people aren't happy with. I am one of them. They are limiting armor which people enjoy playing. The allies get an extremely powerful tank that the Axis cant stop. This is when people log off and the fun stops. I hope CRS actually listens, which I think they are. Until changes get made I am have unsubbed. I have hope for this game and I hope somehow it makes a turn around. I recommend trying a free sub before actually throwing money at this game.

Pros
Action packed at times
Playerbase helps new people out
Land, Air, and Sea equipment

Cons
Limited supply
Unbalanced at times
Cost is much for whats offered

author: {'steamid': '76561198044918133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 66137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17470, 'last_played': 1704795127}
review:
I have been a subscriber on and off now for 11 years and have seen this game develop into what it is now.
I have always been a gamer that strives for a bit more realism and this game is hands down the best around!
I came from BF1942 in 2002/03 and then the mod Forgotten Hope. A fellow clanner introduced me to WW2 online and I have never had a gaming experience like it anywhere else.
Yes it may look dated but look at the size of the map? Graphics updates are in the pipeline but if its gameplay you want then stick around in this game for a bit longer and squad up with some veterans that can teach you the ropes.
Planes flying at realistic speeds strafing enemy, tanks rolling in real time with realistic cannon sites and also Navy! Who can forget Navy!
Hell this game just never gets old!

If you are new to this game please ask for help because there is a lot to learn!

ANZAC woodsnz

author: {'steamid': '76561197991480145', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1548904262}
review: This game is the closest you can get to a simulated ww2 war game experience. It‚Äôs scale, community and coordination are what makes this game like no other! Endless war stories unfold at once in this MMO. Whether it‚Äôs going house to house in a bombed out town that has changed hands from allied to axis or plugging in my joystick and hoping in a 109 fighter to prevent enemy bombers from bombing our factories. Everything has a cause and effect, it feels like your actions in game mean something in this all out war. Get it, Try it. Stick with it a bit and you will discover the many layers this game has to offer! Every WW2 buff should get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005164452', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5425, 'last_played': 1694826072}
review: I've been playing this game on and off since 2009, and I always come back. Sure the game is rough around the edges and right now the graphics aren't great, but thats all stuff that in the pipeline. CRS has come a long way since I've started, and I know they are doing their best. If you even enjoyed a few hours of this game then maybe consider dropping a few dollars for DLC or one of their two subscription options because every dollar helps with game improvement. The Dev have always been fantastic and community based, so if you want to play a game that actually cares about its players then this is the game for you, heck even if you want a shooter where your actions effect things on a grand scale, and is a challenge then this is the game for you. This company and game has constantly only gone up.

review:
So dissappointed. I originally got this game back in 2001. It was fun then.

I stopped playing it because it cost way too much per month for what it was.

I saw that it was still around and has gone through 18 years of updates. I was really excited. And now I have a super computer to run it at maximum settings. 

It still looks like 2001. And the game play is even worse. And the price is even higher.

There are way too many other options to choose from than to pay monthly for an overly outdated game filled with players that are younger the the game that have no idea what to do so they just blow each other up.

I used to love this game. This is very sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024594184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1676064017}
review:
It's a pretty serious WWII game, I'd say a simulation or close to one.  The learning curve is pretty steep but if you are patient and put in a little effort you'll see the game has some pretty special elements about it.  Yeah, the monetization model ins't ideal, but you can get a DLC which unlocks some stuff and doesn't require an ongoing sub.

I found that going on Discord and talking with some of the guys helped me figure things out faster, so I recommend doing that.  Best to play this game with a friend or a squad, otherwise you'll probably end up getting lost like I did.

The rifle you get for free is enough to capture points and you get some throwables and explosives to boot.

4/5 as far as creativity, 2/5 for graphics but I dont mind as long as the gameplay is good, and in this case it is.  I'm used to subscription plans and knowing they have one I might just check it out to see how much more immersive this game gets.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198160109219', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1547247103}
review:
In a previous review I bashed on some of the things in this game, but that was before I realised that it was released in 2001. While this does not change  my view of it to a positive one, the "subscribtion" system being kinda like one of those EA memes, it completely excuses it's flawed mechanics and movements and graphics what not.

As with that subscribtion mechanics, they literally charge 7 dollars a month to be able to use the SMGs (only the smgs). It's 25$ a month for the whole thing, which is total bullshit. Why would I want to basically rent a 2001 game ofr 30$ a month?
developer_response:
Hello Daniels,

We are upgrading this old lady, indeed. Hard work is going on and subscriptions allows the bills to be paid. 

Starter account offers access to all DLC content (except medium armor), and premium is 15$/month, not 25.

I will rewrite their descriptions to make it more clear. I am also working on tutorials to let you better preview what to expect from the game. 

S!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053871222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1547249729}
review:
If you are into WWII games, combined-arms MilSim, with physics-driven damage models of air combat, tank combat, andnaval combat all in a gigantic, zoneless MMOFPS environment with no P2W buffs then check this game out. 

In this game everything is player driven. If someone calls in an airstrike on an enemy position it's not some AI script raining bombs from above. Its a real player who flew a bomber from an enemy airfield and physically dropped those bombs... whether they hit on target is up the the skill of the pilot (and whether the ground guys properly marked the drop zone with smoke). And if you are so inclined you can spawn a interceptor and shoot him down before he gives your teammates the business! There is an entire strategic layer to the game where squads and High Command come up with strategies to outflank and surround entire sectors of the front line, and player psychology becomes as much of a factor as it was in the real war... crack the enemies spirit and you have the chance for a big win. Hold off against stacked odds and you will have wind in your sails for a brutal counterattack that will teach the enemy a lesson!

Where the game may lack in the graphics department it makes up with white knuckle gameplay and one of the most helpful communities out there. You won't get shut out of squads for being a newbie and vets here want to show the new guys the rope. Which is important because the learning curve for this game is like Mount Everest. Expect to die. A lot. But you can rank up within a few days to get better equipment and in a few weeks you're rank will be high enough to spawn all but the most elite equipment.

It should be mention now that this is [b]NOT[/b] a Pay-to-Win game (contrary to some other reviews). Even as F2P which is more of a demo/trial of the game, the rifleman you spawn (which btw most vet players use as standard unit due to its range, stopping power, and versatility) has the [b]exact same[/b] ammo loadout, grenades, stamina, health, and bullet damage as the one that a veteran subscriber will spawn. It is all down to 100% player skill. And the rank points you need to unlock more powerful tanks and planes cannot be purchased. So everyone has to earn their keep. No P2W shortcuts here. You will be limited as F2P to only a rifleman, truck, and basic anti-tank gun, but can purchase access to the unit type of your choice via DLC (i.e. tank DLC if you are a WoT fan and don't care for infantry combat). This DLC purchase is a one-time fee that gives you access (you still have to earn your rank like everyone else though!) and you DO NOT have to pay a subscription fee.

If you want access to all the weapons, join High Command as an officer-candidate, and other cosmetic perks (ingame decals, etc.) there is a subscription fee similar to other subscription-based MMO like PS2, EVE, etc. Subscribers however do not have any advantage over F2P or DLC players as the unit damage and stats are [b]exactly the same[/b]. You however only get access to all weapons as a subscriber (mostly tanks and planes) which as the war progress during the in-game campaign and better more modern weapons are researched may leave especially F2P a bit outgunned which means you have to use stealth and brains a bit more to take down the enemy. In case you want to try the weapons out as F2P you have a 2-week trial period where all weapons are unlocked as if you were a subscrber (but you still need to rank up which you can realistically do within the first week).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970525430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1547244122}
review:
I haven't played this through Steam, I downloaded it about a month ago for about the third time since it came out. 
I guess the best way to describe this game is tension. There's a lot of tension in the campaign, driving a vehicle, moving around a battlefield as a infantryman, or anything else in the game. I've found myself getting stressed out sometimes with rounds passing by or large explosions deafening me. I've had running battles with snipers trying to pick me off and knowing that if I stopped moving errratically before getting in cover I'd be taken out. Playing cat and mouse in a ruined city with a Panzer with me holding a sachel charge and hoping the tank commander doesn't see me sneaking up to plant it on the tank.
Riding in the back of a truck with a squad of other Allies on our way to capture a factory.
Tension. Stress. Comraderie. Defeat and victory. Those are pretty much the heart of this rather dated game. Yep, the graphics suck. Yep, it's really a pain to learn how to drive some of the vehicles. Yes, you're going to have to learn how to properly fire a bolt-action rifle. There's certainly a lot about this game that needs improving, but at the same time, the things that make it shine really work.
I'm looking forward to updates to this game, their new years roadmap looks pretty impressive and I sure as heck hope comes to fruition soon.
Till then, I'll be taking this game in small doses of a few hours or so every few days so I don't stress out. But, I have to admit I'm kind of addicted to the stress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038244404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 110259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 365, 'playtime_at_review': 20930, 'last_played': 1710710062}
review:
Epic wwii sim, the reason why this "game" is still alive and kicking after 20years(thus the graphics, but they are OK imo) is because there are no other wwii "games" with the same scale and depth.
You cant reenaact wwii in a limited and controlled setting like in all other wwii games, this game is different.
The rewards dont come fast thou, you will probably have to go throu hell before you even get your first kill.
But that is part of the beauty with this game, its no candy crush where you get rewarded all the time for nothing, here you need to really deserve it! wich ofcourse makes the victory so much sweeter :)
And dont think you will come in and "pwn" just because you are a lit fps-man, that wont help you much in the beggining.
Take your time to learn the basics, read the fffffffin chat guys! 
This game is best for people that wanna engage in teamplay thou, even if you dont even shoot at(or even see) the enemy you can do alot to help your team, you can for example carry ammo for guys with mortars or machineguns etc, you can drive troops in trucks or set up mobile spawns, you can fly paratroopers in planes or tow big cannons with halftracks, or spot enemy troops to mark them on the map for others etc etc, only imagination set the limits.

Just make sure to read and engage in the chat, people are allways willing to help a motivated soldier!
Good luck soldier, S!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020881392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10397, 'last_played': 1584916836}
review:
Excellent game, but has a high learning curve for any new player. It will take time, effort, hopping on discord (to coordinate with other players) and asking a LOT of questions in order to become good at the game. However, once you master the basics, the game opens up and offers unlimited opportunity to enjoy. Whether its as an infantry man, tanker, pilot or artilleryman. There's no more accomplished feeling in a game than working with a  few dozen other players to capture a defended town or city.

Graphics and some of the gameplay are definitely antiquated, but the game has been releasing new content every few months and part of that plan is an overall graphical upgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020536433', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1504908860}
review: This game is an old game being held together with volunteers.  It was developed using technology that went out of date 10 or more years ago and stuggles to keep even a small user base (see the SteamCharts website), and without a good user base you don't get much of a "war".  I played this game heavily about 10 years ago, and I don't see that much has changed, including the fairly toxic comminity and management of the game.  I have had friends who have been kicked out of the forums for trying to discuss the issues with that game, and I am now hearing that the game maker has recruited volunteers and asked them to up-vote positive comments.  Personally i think that should be against the Steam ToS.  Between the lackluster graphics, inadequate free-to-play unlocks, pay-to-win subscription packages, lack of players, and the managed community to ban negative posters, I have to down-vote this title.
developer_response:
Hi Khitan, sorry to hear that. I have personally asked the community to spend time reading reviews and give their support to constructive reviews as there are many ones that have not argued a lot. 

No one had ever been banned for giving an opinion, we are asking for feedback from everyone. We just ask to remain constructive, polite and not violate our forum TOS.

review:
Great WW2 game. High marks on realism vs. spray and pray FPS game types. Steep Learning curve but worth every minute. Been playing this game since original release Beta. If you are looking for an immersive WW2 game experience, this is it. Whether it is on the ground as infantry, in a tank as armor, in a ship as naval, or in a plane as Air, you will not walk away disappointed. Where it may lack some in eye-candy, it more than makes up for it in challenging you to play at your best. 
Highly, highly recommend. 

- Dusty: Out

author: {'steamid': '76561198008640085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3438, 'last_played': 1620112241}
review:
Though a game which posseses assets a bit long in the tooth, and with mechanics which certainly don't fit with the broadest of gaming audiences, World War 2 Online is a game that raelly is the only game out there that captured the war's mass-scale effectively. 

Yes, it has a subsription model. The reality is that the game cannot be funded otherwise, and to suggest that it could survive on a one-time payment for everything model is asinine in the extreme; thus, I don't feel like some of the reviews here are very fair. It's important to keep in mind that this is an old game, and free-top-play and compartmnetalized DLC methods are recently new developments which have opened up portions of this game to people who before did not have access. The game already has made progress giving all players more stuff, and it is still going in a positive direction, the road there is just bumpy for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066240494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1587678241}
review:
WW2 ONLINE
World War 2 Online is a realistic MMOFPS game about World War 2. It has only one server with a map that starts all the way in Western Germany and ends in Normandy, France. The game is Allies vs Axis with 4 playable factions-Germans, Brits, French and American. They fight for dominance in Western Europe. The player has the choice of participating in the Army, Navy or Airborne. WW2 Online is the only game out there that gives so much freedom to a player in World War 2. 
The mechanins, I'm somewhat content about. I love the fact that you can run crouched or that you can start running after being prone and go prone again, because not many games focus on the movement detail. On the other hand, gunplay is a little clunky. What I mean by that is that it is tough to understand in the beginning wether you've killed an enemy, because when they get hit, they still still for almost a second and then do the death animation. It is also really difficult to hit moving targets, espescially in a long distance. I like the granade mecahnic-it offers something differant, unlike what we have seen before. Other than that, I like that when you get hit, you can't get healed, nor you can sprint, then you start to breathe more heavily and your vision becomes blury-great level of detail. And the map is amazing. Yeah, the textures are low quality, but that's becasue of the map size and other than that, it has been greatly designed. There is a paywall and what I mean by that is-Monthly subscribtions. You need to subscribe in order to get the full content of the game, but so far I have been playing only with the Free to Play limitations and I can tell you that it is not that bad. It let's ypu know how the game feels and plays. If you are intrested, you can read my experience with WW2 Online further down below.

HOW I FOUND OUT ABOUT WW2 ONLINE
I started playing WW2 Online about 2 weeks ago. I was browsing through war games because of the upcomming Winter Sales. All of the sudden, saw the title "WW2 Online". I clicked on it, without much expectations, because let's face it-Whenever you see a game that has "Online" 95% of the time you would expect it to be some Internet Explorer game that is utter thrash. So let's get back to the story. So I'm sitting there looking at screenshots, watching videos and thinking to myself-"I like the graphics and the idea of fighting throughout Western Europe was FREAKING AMAZING!" The I saw that the game had been released in 2001 and I was like-"I love WW2 games, I own a lot of classics like Medal of Honor, Battlefield 1942, CoD 1,2,5 etc. and I've never in my life heard of this game". So for a few days I was just watching videos of it because I wasn't sure wether to install it or not. But one night a friend told me-"F*ck this, let's try the game, we can't lose anything after all." And so we did.

MY FIRST EXPERIENCE OF WW2 ONLINE
So we played the tutorial and hoppe in to the action. We were German Infantry in the city of Prum. We were told that the city was attacked by the French and that we had to defend it. After running around the area for about 45 minutes, searching for those red tanks and soldiers which were on the minimap we gave it up and decided to follow the guys that were rushing outside the town. So we crouch run for about 10 minutes and they lie down, because an enemy tank approaches. We're hiding down in  bush when we here some footsteps, but think that is a friendly, but all of the sudden, a French guy comes out of our bush rushing towards that thank. We are scared, because that's the first time that we see an enemy. So my firend and I start shooting our Kar98 rfiles rapidely at the guy and he dropped on the ground. That was the first time I got a kill. Then for the rest of  the night, we crawled for about 30 minutes to flank an area which was full of enemies and at the end realised that we were in their spawn point and the game forbid us to shoot. We played in a few differant cities later but that was about it.
My friend didn't like the game that much, because it was slow and boring to him(can't blame him, as I know that realistic games could be dull, but I love them to death). I on the other hand felt something special. I really enjoyed that game and wanted more of it. I wanted more of the action, risk  and danger! So I got about 10 hours in about two and a half days. I didn't care that I got pretty much crushed in the first 10 hours. I was addicted at that point and nothing could change my mind. I enjoyed reading guides about the game-learned how to cap points, what a MS was etc. I became better, helping the team capture objectives, serving as a meat shield when under fire from MG's so that the more experienced and important guys could move up and I started getting more kills(I swear, even now I get butterflies whenever I get a kill haha). So far I have really enjoyed the game, in spite of the limitations of the Free to Play players(in my opinion it is not as bad as people make it out to be, I mean a few bolt-action rifles and SMG's  and a drivable truck is good enough for me, although I'd also love to pilot a plane, even if it is the absolute worst one, but I'm grateful for what I'm given) and I don't have any plans of stopping. 

CONCLUSION
I'd recommend WW2 Online to every person who's into war games and especially into the realisitc ones. This game is truly unique and despite it being from 2001 it deserve a chance. Just overlook the dated graphics(which in my opinon aren't even that bad) and enjoy the experience. The only things I'd love to see are a tank and a plane for the Free to Play players. I know  I may be asking for a lot, but if it could happen, I would be extremely happy! Phew, it has been a long writing session! I appriciate if you read everything! Now go to the frontline soldier, choose a side, and become a part of World War 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198134888983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1688994051}
review:
I have played this game for a few years now (only recently got it on steam). It took me a while to get used to it, but after meeting some great and helpfull teammates on Discord, I managed to get the hang of it. 
Now, first of all, I love the way this game works; there's a campaign during wich the axis and allies fight against eachother by trying to capture many towns and strategic point. I also love the way the game includes land, air and sea that can all be used in just 1 battle! Ive had more than a few moments where stuka dive bombers would bomb a bridge with spitfires chasing them, and then the tanks start firing!
Eventhough I am really enjoying this game, I find it quite annoying that players who have played for so long, still have to buy an expensive subscription. I am definitely not a fan of subscriptions, and would rather pay a solid price once. 
I think many people think this way and therefore I suggests to the Dev's that if they want to get more money out of this game, they should make a solid price. This will mean more and more people will start to buy it
I mean look at the latest steam reviews for god's sake! These are almost all negative just because of the damn subscription way!
