author: {'steamid': '76561198163879882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1510259444}
review: Okay friend and i downloaded the game (huge fans of ww2 warfare games), the game play was simulation like, no "hitmarkers" or "aim assist" just all visual indicating you killed the tank (which btw is manned by an actual crew,not just one guy" had fun for a while until we realized that 15 bucks for a game that is nearly 21 years old but has ALL the vehicles and an enourmous map to actually go city to city wiping out enemies to capture said city, it just wasn't worth the 15 bucks like that, player base is a bunch of large headed dick bags that just bag on the new guys, so we learned basically nothing besides if you lay down a decent ammount of cash it becomes the game you have always really wanted to play, graphics are out-dated (21 years old) but if you didn't have to buy EVERYTHING just to play it normally or lock everything behind a pay wall this game would be hugely popular for players that enjoy a military sim based soley on the battles in Europe. Would love to give this title a huge thumbs up and call it the game i've been looking for but to lock everything i need to actually play with, its not worth a little over 75 bucks and a 15 monthly sub, its not worth my time, so if you like to captain patrol boats, tanks and tank destroyers, air craft and Anti aircraft not to mention all the iconic ones and some you have never heard of and have a decent ammount of money stashed away for just such a thing then by all means this is the game you are looking for, if not then just stick to heros and generals or bf5 or even warthunder lol which btw two of those are free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008750799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1553036733}
review:
Terrible. 

They introduced some big patch a while ago and while they say "only some" of the players get crashes, I think the actuality is far, far more common. I had been away for a while and decided to see how the changes affected the awful gameplay. Nope. It doesn't WORK.
Making players copy and paste code to get the game to run is lazy -especially when it's a subscription to play it.

This has been going on for months. People downloading it and not even being able to play because of runtime errors. When someone complained in the forums about it, all that guy got were bad excuses and eventually the guy was called a liar! Of course, they delete posts that reveal the reality of their crappy software, so don't expect to see honest information about the game in their forums... they spend more time policing the forums and deleting posts than they do actually developing the game... which is obvious the second you watch a youtube video that shows actual gameplay.

Also... For a game that they charge $16.99/month for, the software is so out of date that even the cheat engines people use are all freeware now. That means anyone can cheat and ESP hack, and you'll never know who is using hacks -because they rely on people watching you from a mod-cam to catch cheaters. One player... used to fly his spitfire around below 500M sniping infantry for hours on end and nobody ever "caught" him cheating... even though he'd shoot you as you lay inside a bombed out building with a hole in the roof. He did this for YEARS and never got caught. 

Summary: 
-It doesn't work.
-The graphics stink
-infantry movement is slow and you can't freelook, can't even step over a log or climb out of a window.
-when crewing a tank, and finding your tank disabled and just a pincushion for enemy fire, you can't get out of that tank at all.
-flight and damage modeling is borked; there are many planes that defy gravity and shear forces, and no damage is sustained even when being hit with over 100 rounds of 20MM HE.
-The developers spend more time cleaning out bad commentary in the forums than they do actually developing the game.

Stay away.

It's crap.


Oh, and while Steam only shows me as having 0.2hrs on record, I started playing this game back in 1999 before it even went live.
I paid subs off and on throughout the years, but the game just keeps sucking and the devs only add new vehicles -but the gameplay and mechanics are FACKED. It's a piece of crap and they ban anyone for calling them out on their scam.

A friend of mine, who was once a High Command darling, (and ran the map so well we won like ten campaigns in a row under him,) says they are just ripping off seniors out of their pensions. He claims that the players still in this game are all older and have crappy rigs that CAN'T run new games, and they throw money at the devs constantly... and continually buff their own gear while ignoring the game's function. 

I will also ad that the same player told me that CRS would take him aside and ask him to slow down and not steamroll the map, and that they manually manipulate supply to help out the losing side so they don't all rage quit. They screw with the game constantly while a campaign is under way, and it's rigged. 

What a scam this game has become.

review: question how do i go to fullscreen again for some reason i only play in windowmode i try every possible way to fix it wont work at all is there some way i can fix it?
developer_response: If you play from a Windows system, try to change the compatibility mode.  Go to the install directory (C:\Program Files (x86)\CRS\Battleground Europe is default)  the right click on the ww2.exe look for the compatibility tab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165042893', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1542825179}
review:
Step 1: Download and Install
Step 2: Error
Step 3: Download Client from browser
Step 4: A different error
Step 5: Make a Thread on steam
Step 6: Developer responded quick which was nice
Step 7: Told me how to fix it rather then them just fixing it and patching it (kinda lazy to have your players fix a bug you created)
Step 8: Fix works but then you find out 99% of the game is locked behind a paywall.
Step 9: Spawn on a "Active Battle"
Step 10: Run around a barren waste land seeing maybe one or two allies if your lucky
Step 11: 30 minutes later not a single fight or bad guy
Step 12: Lay down some explosives
Step 13: Kill yourself
Step 14: Uninstall
Step 15: Write a review

Overall 

Graphics: 2/10 (Expected from a game made almost 20 years ago)
Performance :1/10 ( I was getting 30 fps in the open area from a game made almost 20 years ago)
Gameplay: 0/10 ( All it was, was a walking simulator)
Community: Error 69 - Doggy Style Corruption (Parrameters couldnt be found)
Monetization: 0/10 ( you have access to maybe 5% of the game, the rest you have to pay for)

author: {'steamid': '76561198354995291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3257, 'last_played': 1566817446}
review:
Alright,
I do like this game, and feel like you should give it a go as well.
im a free-to-play player (But i think i might get a subscription soon) and i've got many fun and amazing experiances from WW2 Online, even today i watched a Tiger tank roll into our small defences, crushing everything. all from the safty of a bell tower ;). 

give it a go, its free.
dont like it? the delete button is always there.

Thanks for reading.

review:

Interessanti aggiunte, ma sappiate che se disgraziatamente avete usato l'email per giocare, una volta disinstallato non potrete pi√π giocarci dalla stessa mail oppure dovrete contattare l'assistenza. 
Di per se una procedura lunga per poi trovare pochi server e poca gente. 
Dovrebbe aver bisogno di un sistema d'ingresso integrato all'account Steam e magari pagare delle sponsorship per veicolare il pubblico per un progetto retro ma interessante. 

---------------------------
Non √® nemmeno lontanamente paragonabile a un videogame. 
Lento, baggoso, pochi player per la vastit√† del teatro.
Situazioni e compiti poco chiari. 
Livello simulazione 2 su 10.
Poligonale e texture pack del 2001. 
Assolutamente non passa la fase successiva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121176706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1541224660}
review:
I wanted to like this game. really did. but after some hours of playing-attempting to play, i just can't do it.

this game is trying to combine two interesting concepts: overarching strategy game with a huge life-sized map, with a basic-arse, unintuitive, "realistic" first-person shooter.
then proceeding to cleave 4/5ths of the latter idea behind a bullshnit paywall/subscription service.
what you got left for free is just the following:
a basic rifle, 4 grenades, 2 smoke grenades, a shovel for building a sandbag wall, or a foxhole thats actually a dugout and not a hole, and a demo charge and ammo ressuply thing.
thats it. everything else you have to pay for. 

so playing the game, you either spawn inside a town your supposed to defend, leaving you inside a cramped room with all hell going loose all around you, you dont know where to shoot, or where the enemy is, which is bad, because in this game you get insta killed by everything, so you want to try and see the enemy before he sees you. and you end up dying anyways from an enemy you definately saw, tried to click and shoot at, but he had a machinegun he bought from the dlc store and he was already firing anyways even before he actually saw you, and you only had a shnitty rifle, so effectively you accomplished nothing just then.

its either that, or you spawn 10 miles away in a campsite "origin point" and have to run all the way back to said town and pray you don't get sniped outright when you get there.
while having to take frequent breaks just to go prone to refill your stamina meter, because for some reason only having half a stamina bar left means you can't keep running still in this game.

really, I just think theres no point to this game at all. its not even a game really, its just a shnitty looking war simulator. 
if all the DLC was put up for FREE, then I wouldn't be feeling like I wasted 7 hours of my life. albeit, if i did try and buy a tank or airplane, and considering this game is crushed by realism, I probably wouldn't enjoy trying to learn how to use those either.
the only rebutal i have for those who'd say "oh, his review doesnt count, he tried to lone wolf it." 
is:
"I keep dying trying to do anything with, or without my squadmates anyway, and half the time i died it was me trying to catch up with my fugging squad mates!"

true story by the way, they keep mentioning this game is mainly squad based, but everyone ends up not waiting for you, or just being too far ahead of you anyhow. 
so what the fugg are you supposed to do?

I really wanted my last act before uninstalling this game was to buy a bomber plane, learn how to drive it from not crashing on the runway because again, realistic controls = unintuitive bad controls people! $50 joysticks be damned!
and navigate the mission menu until it lets me have a mission where i just bomb the shnit out of every enemy town i see, because nothing matters anymore.
but I didnt, because my rent is more important than some $12 DLC bomber aircraft thats likely too difficult to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159556213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1540721585}
review:
I found WW2 online when you had to downlowd the .exe which was in 2015 - 2016 when i was heavly into HNG at the time i had a horrible PC and thought this was going to be amazing.

Then this year i upgraded to be able to play games like fallout4 on high specs so i finally gave this a go (At the time of review i am not into  mmo or online games).

When i saw it was a monthley subscription i was not pleasesd and most ranks were locked unless you payed an additional $10USD which converts to about $15 AUD, plus you have to give an valid email (just create a new one).

Practaly this is a p2w / p2p game which gives you limited ranks and is horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972089936', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 586, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1540654875}
review:
could do the practice/training mission nor play online since it says error connecting.
but after learning some vehicle controls, managed to drive the tanks, etc.

Some helpful keys:
E - start/stop engine
(wait for engine to warm up)
] - shift up (speed up)
A/D - steer
1,2,3,4, etc. for seating positions (like in Battlefield games)
NUM0/NUM-. for instrument/guage meters

all in all, not a bad simulator.

review: I would just like to say based on all the reviews and also playing the game myself i cannot recommend this game. For one thing the game is extremly old and the devlopers arent doing anything about it which is a shame the game could have been great. For one thing take down the pay wall and for another thing UPDATE THE GRAPHICS ITS 2020 AND OTHER FREE TO PLAY GAMES ARE WAY AHEAD OF YOU. i personatly play heroes and generals which is a awesome game in my opinon because for one thing it has great graphics and for another its not locked behind a pay wall and i even spend money on there memberships which is only there to bost your ingame earnings like XP and ingame curency to buy the vehicles once there unlocked. and the funney thing is i dont have to have a so called subcription to unlock them. But i must admit H@G is not a massive open word like your game but theres a huge differance between the two that is H@G is always being updated and they listen to the community. Listen im not going to keep going i said what i said and ill just leave it at that but PLEASE listen to reason the game is VERY MUCH OUTDATED AND NEEDS A MASSIVE OVERHAUL. AND TAKE AWAY THE PAYWALLS TO UNLOCK EVERYTHING I BELIEVE THIS CAN BE A GREAT GAME BUT UNTIL THE DEVELOPER LISTENS TO REASON THATS NEVER GOING TO HAPPEN. AND ONE MORE THING ITS 2020 SO PLEASE WAKE UP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275466937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1505244030}
review:
If you'd like to see videos of how to REALLY play World War 2 Online, check out my tutorials and our squad's gameplay, here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiUP-MOPy7PCxBDq5FwErRQ

The folks who've offered negative reviews on this game commonly have no idea how to play it. They expect an intuitive shooter where you log in, find a battle, and get to the fighting. WW2OL is far from that. Despite it's dated graphics, it is intended to be a simulator PLAYED IN SQUADS. I cannot stress how important the latter is to this game. It is very difficult to make a difference in the war as a single player. It also takes a lot of time to learn how to survive, not die, and avoid having to walk. Many people walk because they have no clue what a mobile spawn is or how to use them. THIS GAME IS VERY COMPLEX AND REQUIRES LEARNING IT WITH PEOPLE.

As for the game itself, the tutorial doesn't teach you the REALLY important stuff about the game: the grand strategy; the supply structure; how to set up a town defense; a town attack; how to raid a forward base and why; how to sap tanks with charges, etc. It simply shows you the controls for fighting. As I said, fighting is only part of the game. The critical part is understanding where you should be, what you should be doing when you log in, etc. This requires speaking to high command to figure out what the strategic and tactical situation is. 

If you just want a quick World War 2 shooter, there are plenty of other games you can play. WW2OL is not intended to be played that way. In reality, the combat plays much more like Arma 3, where you must listen, sit, pull out your binoculars, communicate, do recon and mark targets for the rest of your team (so they know where things are; everything is player-marked), etc. There are so many roles you can fill in each battle that newbies often get turned off by the game. Understandable.

The game isn't for everyone. And I must stress, once again, THE IMPORTANCE OF PLAYING IN SQUADS. The community in WW2OL is composed of many veterans from "the old days" when the game first came out (I'm not one of those). They are really nice folks, older, who will help you out no matter what your age. 

If you enjoy complex strategy games like Hearts of Iron, you will probably enjoy this. It combines a piece of that with a first-person combat element.

We have plenty of younger folks in our squad, but I'd like to say that "this is a game for adults" who will take the time to appreciate it. The game isn't built around having great battles every time. Sometimes, as in war, you have horrible battles where you get run over. Other times, you mount a stupendous attack or defense. That's what makes it great--you never know what will happen. It's all up to you to try and influence it. AGAIN, SQUADS.

review: Do away with the Montly Subscription!!  $10/month for an 11 year game is crazy!  It is a fun game with a very hard learning curve.  I do not recommend this game even though I love it.   If you dont pay the $10 to $15 a month depending on subscription you chose then all you get to do is use a rifleman.  Trust me there is no fun in that!  Without paying a subscription you hare only allowed the crappiest units on the battlefield!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962699879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1534, 'last_played': 1694034542}
review:
It's a fun game despite its aged graphics, poor performance and wonky slippery infantry movement. Unfortunately it doesn't appear too many people play these days. Been playing as a reserve rifleman for a few days and it's pretty fun, although a bit limited in the activities you can excel in. Hope for more people to join the ranks. 

Personally, for me, this game brings out either the most stalwart camper who sits and defends a town against incoming troops from a window or a bushline or I go on a capping spree where I try to capture points. Reserve rifleman feels rather biased toward long range camping than assault, as smgs will mow me down indoors rather easily.

Some rather hilarious moments occur once in a while. Was defending a town from a perimeter, facing inward when an AT gun came rolling slowly past next to me. Easily taken out :) 

Been thinking about getting a subscription or a dlc, however the lack of larger scale combat turns me off. There appears to generally be a lack of players certain hours and I feel that an investment is a hit or miss. Some battles appear to have less than 10 players on my team and I fear I will lose interest if I continue to see a decline in activity.

Still, in my personal opinion, it's rather satisfying oneshotting infantry as the reserve rifleman so I'll likely hang around for a while hoping for a surge in player pop, and to build confidence in investing in a subscription or dlc.

That said, the game is not always low pop. I've been in a few great fights. I just wish there was more of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049658446', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1539467476}
review:
My first online game was Forgotten hope, a realistic mod for BF 1942, ive played ive played many war games since then and i can tell you that WWII online battleground europe is the best WWII simulator.  If you are looking for a fast arcade fun this game is not for you, prepare deep imersive experience.

Up sides
- First thing to know is that the game is HUGE, its not a instanced 20 x 20 match kind of game, forget it, in WWII online theres no n¬∫ of players limit and ALOT of cities and fire bases, the "match" is about atack and occupe the cities untill the army reach the enemy main city.  The players gain experience and at some point you can chose and become a general, generals are the ones who chose wich citys, bridges or fire bases need to be atacked or defended considering strategic elements.
- The nunber of each equipament avallible is limited for the armies, and they are replace based on how much fabrics you have. More fabrics means more strategic choices and battles sustentability. 
- Multimple battles occur on the same time and you chose wich one you feel its better to participate, bridge sabbotage or repair, missions to destroy a enemy advanced fire base or to defend your own fire bases, missions to find and destroy enemy mobile spawn points etc.  
- Rifle, sniper rifle, smgs, mgs, granade, anti-tank granades, anti-tank guns, anti tank "rifles", bazookas, explosives against tanks or to destroy anything, from fire bases to buildings, tanks, planes, bombers, dive bombers, ships, anti airs, artillery etc etc etc...all the warfare is there.
- Sounds of explosions, anti air etc are all very loud, wich grants imerssion. If you are sound sensitive play the sound at low, but that will also prevent you to hear the enemy steps or shots in some situations.
- One shot one kill if you hit the dorso or the head, from any weapon.
- Engeneers can build gun pits, wood bunkers, trenches etc.
- Squad leaders and trucks can build spawn points.
- Tranport planes can carrie paratroopers for sneake atacks
- Trucks and apcs can carrie players for fast deployments.
- Realistic physics and equipaments aspects like, tanks armor values, cannons damage etc are all historicaly accurate.
- Im certaily forgeting some more ups of the game.

Downs
- Graphics are dated
- If you are on a loosing army, the only joy left is to just do what you do and keep playing the battles. But as a single match here can take weeks to end this bad aspect is agravated.
- This is a up side to me, but some missions take alot of time to go from the spawn point to the mission target, if you die you have to go all the way again and i know for some people this is a bad aspect.
- Despite the player base, number of players are not as big as before, you will not see 30 paratroopers atacks anymore, but that dont make the game dead, not even close.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003291719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4394, 'last_played': 1589677404}
review:
I have been playing WW2 Online off and on since it first released so many years ago. I have always said that a game.. any game.. can only be judged in comparison to it's peers. Even today.. WW2Online has no peers. There are other WW2 shooter games .. there are far prettier games .. but none rise to rival WW2Online as peers. 

WW2Online is a massive game of capture the flag. Where players set the strategy.. bond together to accomplish goals.. and do so with real supply, and authetic equipment. Everyone plays on the same massive map with no zones or loading screens. You can travel from one end of the map to the other. 

Typical Gameplay: You log in with an infantry unit into a town under assault.. you run to a capture point and kill the enemy trying to capture it.. but run outside again to be face to face with an enemy tank... who blows you up.. so you spawn you own tank and careen through town till your looking directly face on with that enemy tank.. and you fire, but your face on.. and your shot goes richocheting off of his strongest armor. Realizing your time is limited you throw into reverse and try to fade back the alleyway you emerged from.. exposing your side... the shot is quick and precise. So you swap personas.. and log in a Fighter Bomber.. and drop two eggs on his head. So on and so on.. it can be a lot of fun. 

WW2 Online still remains the uncontested sole entrant and absolute reigning champion of the genre that they created.

One last point.. the devs have always played this game... lot of respect to the Rats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069463126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1531434266}
review: I've logged 5.2 hours, now for some that may not seem like a lot but to others it may, Now the reason for these low numbers is because I, in my opinion, find this game to be utter shit, Its a nice thought process but how they went about it was wrong, Either you're running all the damn time, or your being shot by the people who pay for monthly access to things like Tanks, planes, and sniper rifles, Idk how many times We'd just take a town because no one was there, or we'd be hammered by tanks for hours on end until we gave up or they pushed. You either pay to play, or you don't pay and often find yourself with the shortest straw, It would have been nice if they gave those who don't pay some weapons here and there but unless you pay you're given a basic rifle, some generic gear, and told to go kill those guys there, but those guys pay and have all this extra gear you cant use or have access to similar gear. its just a plain old Pay to win game except you can't have a relatively enjoyable experience unless you play, and because of that the game is slowly dying even its its EA set.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066586522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1537728963}
review:
Ok, i played like 1.5-2 hours in this game in 3 different areas (2 cities and one random ass place i ended up spawning in for some reason that was completely barren) and all i can say is holy shit is this game terrible. This is what i gather.

Amazing Concept: 10/10. open world across all of europe where allies v axis fight for cities n shit is what i see which sounds amazing, but its executed so poorly.

Subscription model is absolute aids, like 10 dollars a month just to play the game, if i want to play a ww2 shooter ill just go play h&g for free and be able to use whatever gun i want and whatever vehicle i want. They seriously need to look at h&g as an inspiration. If they really want to milk the f2p game for money like they already are make it so that the pay model doesnt give players things other players cant have just make it speed up their progress and maybe give them access to ways to skip grinding. In this subscription model if you arent paying 14 dollars a month (or less if you pay for more at once) you literally cant do anything but play rifleman, which is using a bolt action rifle. 1 rifle. No options at all. If the devs are wondering why their game gets so little traffic thats exactly why, most people dont like paying for free to play games. Mostly because of the "free" part.

The graphics and overall gameplay is terrible also, everything looks like it hasnt been updated since the game was made in 2001. the map is really barren aside from trees and bushes outside the cities and there are a lot of open areas with nothing in them. Spawn camping is also a serious issue, people can sit literally directly behind your spawn so you are facing away from them and they can stand so close they cant even miss if they wanted to. sounds are terrible also, not necessarily the sounds themselves id say but you cant tell where anything is coming from, you hear spraying gunshots and unless you see the person shooting you wouldnt realize the direction its coming from at all. +you cant jump which is annoying as fuck because a bunch of houses have staircases which are like 3 feet off the ground the only way youd get up is jumping up onto the staircase BUT YOU CANT

I really hate to see such a great concept being executed so poorly. It hurts mah soul 

also i managed to place a satchel charge on top of a tank and when it exploded nothing happened at all. no damage to the tank which kinda sucked. (idk if its supposed to im just sayin). I clipped through the ground 3 times in the little time i played this and had to despawn to fix it once which is terrible. a lot of bugs. Also grenade throwing is also terrible its so unpredictable either that or it takes way way too long to get the hang of because thats mostly what i did for the last 30 mins or so of my gameplay and i just couldnt figure out how to get it to go where i wanted, it seemed easier in the tutorial but i guess its cuz it didnt really have a target you needed to throw at you just threw it.

Finally the pros. I love the realism, you cant spot enemies and make a big red dot appear over them, you cant see something well hidden unless someone tells you where to look or you find it yourself. Also damage is realistic, you dont have to shoot someone 500 times to kill them which is nice. 

I may play some more and if i find anything to add i will, but as far as this goes i know for a fact id never reccomend this game in its current state. I honestly would start from scratch if i was the devs as far as graphics go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255718657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1605470025}
review:
Probably the most accurate WWII online game I have played, and the most diverse. While it's not perfection in terms of graphics, its a nice, somewhat simpler feel, yet gives you the feel of being on the battlefield (or out in some remote town screwing around with a gun I don't know how to use). A great part of this game is the fact you can choose almost any european town to "spawn" in, giving you the opportunity to get in to the middle of the fight, flank it from another town, or just go into some remote location to target practice at trees without the risk of being shot by a kraut (or a yankee, if you choose to be the kraut).
Quite a fun game, I completely recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067055814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1536832962}
review: Unfortunately the game was not what I anticipated. First of, let's start with the tutorial and how it impacts the gameplay later on, on the "front line". The tutorial is rather useless, except when it comes in learning how to pilot planes, as it teaches the very basics of the game, without giving you any further analysis. The reason, why I started off with the tutorial, is for the showcasing. The tutorial introduces you into a world with no further periplexes, easy to spot, easy to do, no weird phrases or words and when the time comes to "enter the battle", as the game calls it, you enter in a completely different world, different simulator. A simulator, where you constantly run, then prone to recharge your stamina, then start running again, the go prone to recharge again and when you finally decipher what those "remarkable" allies of yours are actually typing on their keyboards, you decide to move forward to make the attack, you kill a few other newbies (I proudly can say that I did, it is rather difficult for inexperienced players to make kills, truth be told) and then you get gunned down by freaking NPCs. The game has NPCs, that cannot be killed. The look on my face when I found out, rather stooopid looking if you ask me. Apart from that, you're stuck with Rifles that can barely do anything. While, there is a huge variety of weapons to use, you've got to buy the DLCs first, so you see where this goes, armored trucks, tanks, it's all in the basket. I'll finish off saying that, this game is looking more of walking simulator rather an actual war-like simulator with no fancy graphics. I really don't recommend this game, unless you're a patient lad, with enough expertise in walking and running through ungodly terrain, then go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089558526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1697316187}
review: As someone who enjoys slower pace battles and an eye for detail, this game fits the bill well. The graphics may well be a little dated (something that does not concern me), but you can tell a lot of work has gone into other elements of the experience. In particular, the sound design is highly immersive and makes up for any short-comings in the graphical department. I look forward to playing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201553619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1519533468}
review: For the week that i had the premium subscription i liked the game a lot, it has a nice concept and many different ways to play. But the issue comes when the account expires, it becomes boring since you can only use the rifleman. The game has lots of potential if they could make it completely free or they could charge one small low price it would be for the best. I understand that it is very old ad the dev team is most likely tired but don't charge 15$ a month to play this game. Please, i know people who would love to return to this game if it were not as expensive.
developer_response:
Thanks for your feedback and I am glad you appreciated the game. The subscription has been the lifeblood of our continuation. We‚Äôve been around since 2001 actively because of it. Going ‚ÄúFree‚Äù would mean our game‚Äôs death, so we won‚Äôt be exploring that.

In terms of pricing, I hear ya, but we offer some pretty great value as you experienced (which I am super glad you did). We also take a hit on every transaction through Steam by a pretty decent percentage.

Salute!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004899373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1536273954}
review:
Played this game a lot about 10 years ago.  It pretty much became my hobby/obsession for a while.   It looked a bit ropey back then, though some graphical upgrades have taken place since.   It's still marvellous to behold at times though; big landscape and combat with all sorts going on.  

I dont think you can call the game EA as such; its just in constant slow evolution.   Its been around a long time, is pretty niche and has a strong core following.

Gotta say i would have played it a lot longer, but I had problems with my subscription.  Devs were like 'well yeah, our systems having problems so what do you expect? - stop bothering us!, we will get back to you once its fixed'.  Maybe they actually do decent customer service for paying customers now?  

Tried the free version on Steam, but the aspect ratio is all messed up on my nice large 4K (and the fixes did not work and i could not be arsed to keep trying).

Still, I give this game the thumbs up, cos it is unique, and has given me many great gaming memories like no other game can.  The air comabt alone is decent (similar to orginal IL2).  If you have the patience, this game will reward you.  

I'll try it again at some point, once I have the patience.

One general point:  this game is NOT like Battlefield 1942 or any of its successors, even ARMA is arcady in comparison.  It's not like the game is overly complicated, but you ARE and WILL feel vulnerable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995935948', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 149370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1708569945}
review:
Fantastic game, albeit with a selective appeal. Most will not stick with the game long enough to give it enough of a chance for it to demonstrate just how brilliant the gameplay can be. The battles when a few hundred people are playing are great fun and when you consider the entire map/campaign you really do feel like you are a small part of a big war.

I played a few hundred hours over a few years before this game came to Steam. If you are willing to grunt it out with your very basic five bullet bolt-action rifle then you can always just play that. Personally I have found even at times when I have subscribed and had access to all manner of equipment that, whilst it is is undoubtedly much easier and a lot of fun to have better guns, getting kills and capping and generally doing well in the game is very satisfying when you can do it with the most basic rifles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966248079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1676668509}
review:
I'm changing my review, and I'm now recommending this game. The devs have been hard at work improving a lot of visual and gameplay elements. Additionally, the option to purchase DLC for your free account to play as units that were previously locked to non-subscription players is a great feature. It allows free players to support the game, and also move into roles that might interest them and drive their investment further into the game as a player.

The devs should be able to realize that while WWII Online looks dated, there is a burgeoning indie game scene that embraces the older visual styles, and even takes stylized approaches to low poly/low resolution pixel art based graphics. Whereas 5-10 years ago, this was less the case. I think this can help the scene as more and more players aren't turning away from a game just based on visual fidelity alone.

I'd recommend anyone who wants to give large scale, combined arms, persistent warfare simulations a try. If you enjoy games like ArmA, Project Reality, and other slower paced sim type war games, you may enjoy WWII Onlne.

*** OLD ORIGINAL NOT RECOMMENDED REVIEW BELOW ***
I've been playing WWII Online/Battleground Europe since it was released. I've still got my CD hard copy. I have put more hours over the course of my life into this game than possibly any other game. I've been a payed subscriber, a free player, all over the board.

The graphics are dated, yes. The UI and premise can be confusing, yes. The optimization is almost non-existent. However, none of those are reasons I couldn't overlook. There is no game quite like this on the market still. 

The problem though, isn't any of the things listed above, it's the way the game is presented and how the players can partake in it. Currently, if you aren't a monthly paid subscriber you're limited to the most minimal of ranks and weapons/vehicles available. This is the real killer. In a day and age when games like Unturned or Minecraft have player bases many thousands wide, dated graphics aren't the problem.

MMOs simply cannot be pay to play anymore. Especially when your game already has a small player base. I want to recommend this game, but I can't as it is now. The player base is so small because of the subscription system that no one who picks it up will give it more than a few hours of their time.

The WW2 Online team need to raise the limits of what a free player can utilize, it should be subscribers as officers only, there should be voice communications or a discord dedicated to the game players can use.

review: I would not recomend this game to anyone. The grapics are so bad you can not tell when you have killed a tank. The community is even worse. there are not enough players to make this game fun. You can easlily spawn in and not see a enemy for 2-3 hours . Im not complaining about the dificulty of the game. I loved the fact that it was difficult. But the game is unplayable due to the fact that you must message a player in "high Command " in order to cap an objective. And in my 60 hours playing i never once got a hc to reply to my message often times wasteing hours of my time just to have to despawn . This game is horrible concitering I was paying 14$ every month. dont waste your time with this game. You will regret it to be completely honest. -- PS im the lead dev for a game company so i understand how games are made. > COULD OF BEEN DONE BETTER.

review: Honestly, the game was fun while it lasted. I liked it as a MMO game while I had it and even a smaller subscription fee would still make it a fun game, but I don't want to pay 130$ a year just to play a single game when I could buy 10 games that could last me years past this game's shutdown date. If the cost of subscription went down then I'll reconsider playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111254866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1678256852}
review: This game has always had its moments. but i can no longer sign in normaly, it asks me for a email for support reasons or whatever and when i put a email in it says its invalid and is being used by another player. which is me. Please fix this. and this game isnt worth the money for everyone only hardcore ww2 fans would ever buy a subsciption at least make the starter pack perm. because if anything drops replay value of this game it would be wasting money every month just for the same old pack with very limited content. if this limited content was perm. or you just made the game $5 and gave paying customers the content in the starter pack. this game might last longer. its certainly been a long and joyful journey and im sad to see it slowly dying, rarely do you get into larger 100man town skirmishes anymore. the concept is still amazing and the scale is great. im still looking forward to new content and new development of content. but i cant reccomend anyone pay for a subscription. but i can reccomend you at least check it out not only as a Historical vist of ww2 but as a Classic Game that has def. inspired many players and game dev. the community has always been my favorite part. but even the best of the community that made the game actually fun has started to disapear. This will always be one of my favorite games.

review:
i surprisingly enjoyed the game even it's terrible and old, it haves some unique things in it what other games does not have but okey.... the key binding buttons are weird and you gotta change those manually because heck, i got none of those buttons in my keyboard and second thing is it use to be free. now you have to pay for it ? 

i can't recomend anything what was even little bit of fun (getting shot by sniper or extremely skilled tank crew over half of the time)  but then taking it away by putting it behind payment system... nope, i'm out and never touching it again if i have to put money into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271877113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2682, 'last_played': 1665478652}
review:
At first, you could get all the tanks and planes through leveling up and you didnt have to pay.
Now Cornered Rat Software have made it so you only get two guns 1 plane and 1 tank, and I dont have the money for a 15$ per month subscription.
If they dont change their practices, this game will probably be dead by July or August as of writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147644764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1647833111}
review: This game is honestly a fucking mess. While it does have some pretty cool vehicles like Stukas and Spitfires you have to pay 15 bucks on a monthly subscription which is alot for me atleast since i work a 8$ - per hour job, and if you don't pay the subscription you get stuck with 2 classes a rifleman and SMG but the SMG is always taken aswell as a truck which runs 2 mph. The playerbase is also decent they help and all but there are no new players its just old veterans of the game which minimizes player size as none is never completley full. Oh and there's also the controls now i know they tried to make them realistic but they are so confusing considering the tutorial doesn't tell you much also this also adds another 30$ because you forcebly need a joystick to fly planes there is no easy way to fly them with a keyboard so. If the devs would simply take out the subscriptions or even minimize prices i think this game would be very succesful.

review: This is a practically unplayable game. The barrier for entry is quite high considering it touts itself to be a simulation-type game with realistic World War II elements, but at the same time the game is incredibly unoptimised, the animations are amateurish and ridiculous, and the graphics seem to be stuck in 2003. It really isn't worth it. I got it for free and I still want my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201388518', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1685494734}
review:
Antes de comprar esto, Jueguen Heroes and generals, es gratis, tiene mejores gr√°ficos y sacan m√°s actualizaciones que en este juego. Mejor en todos los aspectos ya que podes modificar las armas que te dan y tiene un sistema de niveles decente, no es perfecto. Lo unico distinto es que no podes recorrer el mapa infinitamente y llegar a otro campo de batalla. 
En resumen, no es malo, el problema es que para tener todo el juego se necesita una subscripcion de 5 o 6 dolares aprox, yo creo que en el momento que cambien eso y pongan algun sistema de progresi√≥n de niveles para adquirir ciertas cosas el juego seria mucho mejor de lo que es hoy en dia.
As√≠ que esta en ustedes probarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354451094', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1611472549}
review:
do not bother with this game, tbh heroes and generals is better. the game has a very good concept and does it well

HOWEVER... the shitty interface, unclear progression and not being able to tell if you killed someone and bugs make this game bad... just bad.

the two worst bugs i come across is NOT BEING ABLE TO SHOOT AND KILL A MOUNTED MG GUNNER(the bullets fly right through him) AND KILLING THE TANK COMMANDERS WHEN THEY STICK THEIR HEAD OUT!

trying to spawn in a different location is a fucking nightmare, you first have to exit your current division find another, then join that one then, walk 1-3 kilometers to get killed by a fucking mg gunner YOU CANT KILL! there are spawn points like origin and moblie spawnpoint(good luck figuring out how to change which one you want to spawn at)i couldnt figure it out.

overall good concept and FUCKING HORRIBLE EXECUTION.

review:
Updated as of 4/4/2019(See comments for update, worth the read)

Reviews must have gotten reset. They were mostly negative and now theres only 35....wtf? I guess as long as Xoom keeps getting his free mortgage payment out of this hes gonna drag it completely through the mud on steam till the name Cornered Rat Software is like a plague name for game development.

I am seriously disapointed in where this game has gone. Pay to win model, antique graphics engine, and the money grab keeps getting worse and worse. When this game came out the sub was like $9.99US a mo. for complete access to everything. Now it's up to $17.99US?!? Come on Xoom, you're killing this once great game.

Bring this back down to $10 a month for full access to everything and i'll come back and push it on my friends, until then its really gonna rot away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109202559', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1523626248}
review:
So yesturday, and today, i decided to get out my joystick and fly some dive bombers on WWii online, afterall its been awhile and.. well i guess it has been a year. So after an hour or two remembering the controls and messing around i decided to go onto the campaign. Immediatly regretting it. After hovering over the JU87B in the spawn menu, it said the following "Upgrade you're subscription inorder to fly this vehicle, needed rank 1 current rank 1" or some shit like that. After getting some help a guy looked it up and appereantly F2P cant fucking fly.


This game, is constantly degrading. Stay away from it,

review:
Es un juegazo,el echo de tener un mapa inmenso y que sea mundo abierto lo demuestra,realmente es una gran experiencia el mejor juego de guerra online en mi opinion,tiene variedad de tanques y su comunidad es realmente muy buena ademas su realistica es increible,un claro ejemplo de no juzgar un juego por sus graficos,en resumen una joya para mi,el unico punto negativo que le pondria es que es muy dificil volar los aviones sin un joystick es practicamente obligatorio

SI TE GUSTAN LOS JUEGOS DE GUERRA,ESTE NO TE DEFRAUDARA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054463479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1523025795}
review:
Pro: This is NOT a small arena game like so many "purdy" games out now. This game takes teamwork. 

Con: Aged graphics (but even though it's aged, it's still running, so half a con)
Con: Command structure or the HQ structure on how to get into battles is weak at best. 
Low player count. I just logged in, in early morning US central time and not 1 Aircraft mission (I like to fly.) So that is a big negative.
Con: Despawn timers. I HATE timers in any game.
The additional upgrade, and donate SPAM in game that you have to click off just to get get back in to a mission/battle. Very big negative. We all hate spam....
 
Do I think the game is worth it? 


Yes, barely a thumbs up. 51%

At the moment, you can literally assign any key or attached device button to a function on a per unit basis (so 'v' on a French Rifle can be prone, but on a Brit Rifle fire the weapon).  What would you recommend as a 'default' ?  and yes this is a serious question - part of coming to steam is to keep up with the current trend vs Niche.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986304855', 'num_games_owned': 1412, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1505248066}
review:
Cool concept, but should not be in Early Access 17 years after release, nor should it have a subscription model. It's comatose. The devs should have pulled the plug a long time ago. Don't bother with it.

Edit: Now with DLC to milk even more money out of a dead cow. Definitely avoid.

Edit 2019: The above edit isn't true anymore as they changed their business model again by axing the DLC in favor of two types of subscriptions.
And because the game's as dead as it is, they're again begging for $40k in their yearly fundraiser, and some rich people even shove them thousands of money down the throat. For next to nothing in a dead game. And it's still in "Early Access". Two years after Steam release. 18 years after it's real release and at least half of that time being kept alive artificially.  Hilarious.

By all means... stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305841679', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1700968425}
review:
This is the best WWII game you will find. There is nothing else quite like this and to be able to play for free is amazing! Yes, the free subscription is very limited but you can still play the best game ever and the developers need to make their money somehow. It is still under development after 17 years and the devs are constantly working to bring new stuff into the game. Ignore all the negative reviews because they just want to get everything for free. The game wouldn't still be alive if it was made completely free. Why don't you just try it for yourself as it will cost you no money!
S!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970479724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1690501421}
review:
After 17 years there still isn't anything else like WWII Online.

One hugh persistant map, fought over on land, sea & air. Campaigns that last from a few days to many months.

As combined arms games go this is still the best. Whilst the graphics aren't up to the standards of a AAA sandbox shooter, it really doesn't matter at all as it's all about the game play.

Been playing this since 2002 and although I play a lot of other games this is still the only one I play every day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146051331', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1640582238}
review: good, game, love how the planes sound like a real plane flying over head, machanics are great,map is huge, community is perfect, and the game is easy to access.  the one thing i dont like about it is that the games vehicle machanics are kinda much, the planes are hard to actully get into the air, i still havent got a AAA to work. cant say i hate or like the graphics though. it could be updated, but the thing is, you got a almost infinite map that was started to be produced in 1997! it is was probably great graphics until 2012, but it is still great graphics for what it is, and its not like i can complain, as i havent a game. Overall, its a great game, with good historical accuracy!

Ce jeux est super ! Le fait de tuer et mourrir en une balle est stressant et gratifiant quand les kills s'enchainent. Les graphismes sont passables mais cela ne me choque pas plus que ca et n'empeche pas le gameplay immersif et tellement unique.

pour moi c'est le meilleur jeu de simulation de la seconde guerre mondiale !

La communaut√© est nickel ! Ici on est sur des adultes de 20 √† 65 ans qui sont sympas et qui jouent bien. Il n'y a pas de Jean-Kevin qui se croit dans COD ou en tout cas ils ne survivent pas longtemp hahaha

MAIS ! ( il y a toujours un mais :D )

Le prix de l'abonnement est prohibitif ! Environ 8‚Ç¨ par mois pour ce jeu de niche... ca fait 96‚Ç¨ par an...

EDIT : 

AMEN !

Ils ont ecout√©s leurs joueurs et on cr√©es des packs DLC √† vie √† acheter !
J'esperes quil y en aura d'autres :)

Merci ;)

ps : post scriptum n'a rien a voir avec cette pepite !

author: {'steamid': '76561198014578304', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1531157798}
review:
Garbage.

EDIT: I bought a starter sub, which was a total mistake. 

[list]
[*]I still get interrupted with an "UPGRADE NOW" screen after every mission that I can't ignore and have to click through
[*]Can't spawn any fighting vehicles except IIc and 232 which is laughable when there are mid and late-war tanks driving around.
[*]despite being half the cost of the premium sub the starter sub only allows a handful of units, it's barely better than F2P
[*]the stuff that my sub does allow I still can't spawn because there is a massive grind wall, 100 points for rank two, 300 points for rank three and 500 points for rank four...and basic units like mortarmen are rank five for some reason
[*]I can't spawn semi-automatic rifle units even though I have enough rank for them
[*]every rifle is treated like a sniper rifle in that it has massive sway applied to it unless you hold your breath, even when proned out
[*]nearly all of the infantry combat is at very close range and uses automatic weapons
[*]SMGs are shotguns and there's no point to holding your fire, just run and hose while zig-zagging
[*]animations and rubber-banding are so bad that you can run through an open field and avoid rifle fire just by zig-zagging
[*]melee is a joke so fights between riflemen at close range are comical as both players dance while reloading 5 feet away
[*]there is no grenade key, grenades are thrown very slowly, hard to aim and switching to and from grenades takes forever
[*]footsteps are so loud that you can use them as radar, you can hear another player literally crawling around a depot 50 meters away through two walls and upstairs 
[*]capturing a depot takes several minutes even with multiple people
[*]tanks are everywhere, way too common for a WW2 simulation, and frequently ruin any fun infantry fight you might be having
[/list]

There's one battle on the server right now and it's maybe 15 vs 15. The system is spamming their fundraiser, and when you finally go to it you see they're asking for 35 grand, and like nine people are responsible for half of all the money raised. So they're reliant on whales to fund everything and not subs like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339924460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7957, 'last_played': 1541640772}
review:
I'm sorry, but, what new people pay per month for terrible documentation, screwball scoring and dialup-era graphics makes it difficult for me to engage as a modern gamer or even an old Warbirds fan.  For this much money per month per user, it's hard to identify what we're paying the developers to -do-, since most of the documentation has been developed by players, and the game looks like it would be right at home on Windows95 and a 56K dialup connection.  

Be prepared to get slaughtered, especially as a pilot, as the best weapons aren't available to you and there's no clear way of leveling up.   There's not even a significant training mode to go out as a pilot and get some target practice. The infantry stuff is no different than any other FPS, but, they've got an adequate little firing range so you can get that sorted out.

The forums talk about the hardcore players who have been at it since 2001, which is great for them but, basically, as a new player you're paying a monthly fee to be their target practice. 

As a flight "simulator" the modeling is not that bad even though you'll fly for 20 minutes on the way to a target just to get killed by something you never even saw.  There's no customer service: I had a tech support issue and they forgot out be, but fortunately another player answered my question in a forum.  Otherwise, you just get flippant responses from forum moderators and long-time players who seem to want to make you feel bad for preferring games with better graphics, documentation and playability but which aren't as strategically "realistic."   (Uhh...)   Basically, you hear a lot of excuses for why it's the way it is, but, it's literally a lot to buy.

I've been paying the monthly fee for about a year now, and I keep coming back to it about once a month to see if I like it, but, at this point I've given them enough of my time and money that I feel like I can say what I want, which is that this game is terribly disappointing especially for the cost.   I'm simply not sure why I'm paying for this each month, because there's only one server, there's not very much data involved, and, it's just not that entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118974135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3352, 'last_played': 1591186681}
review: Seeing the game, It's fun and all, but with subscription for membership, it's really upsetting to lose everything once you run out. Plus the membership is really expensive. Wouldn't mind paying that much for a year, but ONE MONTH? REALLY?
developer_response:
Yes, really. We have to pay for the servers and for our service and people, we're not a big outfit so this is required.

Providing the two weeks free trial and the product free for you to try was an introduction we wanted you to have in the best way possible. I am glad that you have played as much as you did, that's really exceptional. It tells me you had a great time.

Other games nickel and dime you via micro-transactions and we provide a solid, flat rate for all you can get access, and our players prefer it. It has kept us running since 2001 and it's something we plan to do to keep going that much longer.

Hope to see you turn around and support this game you enjoy playing. 

Salute

author: {'steamid': '76561197982660409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 34, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1709799924}
review: Been playing the game since 2001 at release.. And im still playing today that should tell you somthing. The game has a very big learning curve and your avarage fps gamer has no clue how much depth this game has. Dont judge a book by its cover.. get on allied or axis discord join a squad and you will enjoy the hell out of this game once you learn it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157383516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1592192797}
review:
Now for me not to be hippocrictical, and not have comments saying "well this is a OLD game, give it some slack!" which to me is a mouse trap. The game's old, simplistic yet challenging gameplay sound like the ultimate veteren's game? It is to an extent, for players who have been brought up with C.O.D, Battlefield and others, WWII Online is a game that will frustrate the heck outta them. The mechanics are clunky (because its old), the controls over weapons can be unpredictable (because its OLD!) and movement couldnt be anymore 'blocky'. To put it simply, its like using a toothpick to clean your teeth instead of an electric toothbrush. This is the rawest gameplay I've played ever and  I will get aggiatated at a lagged point during a gunfight where one has an SMG and another as a Bolt Action Rifle it is a 50/50 chance. The developers even say "You will die alot".

Now the developers are intriging, they have a communication lane, they update weekly, there is always to usually a sale (Ive looked at the time line from 2001), but I have a feeling that they have a identiy problem, not in a brand but by the developers themselfves, these developers have revived this game in a very complicated manner, it is hard to see, but the tangled cob web is there. This game has a rusitc structure, every so often players or the develpoers have to poke it or some cases give it an ol'good whack to get it moving.

The game itself is supported by a large majoirty by players, so when a new player joins, they are exspected to be apart of the community supporting it nuturing it etc. Now for casual gamers they will be tunred off by this, "Starter Account, Premium Acess!". Yet those funds are put into running the game itself and its updates, the game itself is on a an old safety net, it wont hold long if it is not attended to.

Casual gamers wont appreciate this antique of a game, it will come down to the "pensior" gamers who enjoy classics like this game. It is a devotion to and hard will to stick to the game. Even though I've played a bit over an hour, I can see and feel what the atmosphere is and why it is so attractive and why there is players playing a game like this, it is an exspriance like no other, you ethier dispise it or you love it with passion.

My rating for this game is a 4.5/10, You'll have to try it out for yourself to see if you like it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981885128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1610751564}
review:
Wow. I haven't played it for the last 8 years and I have to say... that nothing has changed. Many of the old timers are still there! (and they were old timers 8 years ago already). So we still have poor performance for this 15+ years old graphics (no kidding, the game is around 17 years old). Also horrible sound, but, 3D at least; since one of the keys of this game is spotting enemies by hearing them.

Despite of all. It was a good game. Quite unique persistent campaign in a world with no loading screens, officers and commanders are a part of the player base so everything, offesives and counter attacks, were coordinated by players. Lonewolfs couldn't do much by themselves but to get a rifle or a tank and wait to find a couple of enemies. 

But then... version 1.39 happened. Well. Or it didn't for a long, long, long time. After more than a year without a patch (seriously), they delivered just a couple of small features such as PPOs and the definitive death of player logistics (no more moving material to the front from the rear when needed, infantry could place respawns so no routes had to be opened with trucks and scouts...). Oh! And 2 3D buildings to replace the old 2D ones! (welcome to 2010).

In the meantime they just banned a good amount of people on the forums, which were complaining about the wait or how more pressing issues had to be addressed. Such as player numbers being unbalanced or the eternal lag (yes, game was so constantly lagging that you could not feel it unless you killed an enemy, because it would take 3 seconds before falling to the ground).

And then... we had F2P. Well actually it is not, because to actually play with more than a rifle, you need to play more than back in the days (when it was around 13-15‚Ç¨) now it is 16,50‚Ç¨!!!. I mean, wow. So we have a lot of newbies running around with no squad to introduce then to the game, wasting those supplies and giving away secret ops. I don't blame them. That's what the squads were for. As it wasn't F2P, there were not too many newbies without a unit before, so anyone could teach them to play along other players.  F2P just bought more players, with no interest in coop, and they are not even enough to keep the servers populated! So this was another bad choice.

Not mention the death skull, so no communication or spotting was needed. Because everytime someone got killed, you would see it on the map. So you always know where is the enemy coming from, wich one is the main attack, if they are flanking you...

So now, it is a "F2P" were you just can take a rifle (literally) move around an almost empty map, were things happen because... I don't know. Entropy? And also you can pay 16‚Ç¨/month to drive a tank around those 2D buildings and vegetation. Or maybe you want to try to walk over that flat water?

It was a GREAT game. Sadly, it was turned down by it's developers and now it's kind of a zombie. It's walking, yes, but it's also dead. And it's rotten.

I wish in the future we can see more games like this was. But actually working.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979961965', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1540175315}
review:
The game has enormous potential and has endured for the most part. This game has existed since 2001. I remember trying to play this game back in like 2002 or something, but I couldn't afford a subscription. Back then this game was the creme de la creme.

They are trying to port this game to Unreal Engine 4. That will probably take at least 5-10 years, and by the time they accomplish that there will be newer game engines out there, like Unreal Engine 7 or something. But I will still play it then, only because I can't play it now.

It's really outdated. I understand the devs need and willingness to make money and make a living, and it's probably the only reason they've been able to finance this game being alive for so long. 

But you have a great concept here, with enormous potential, no other game does this even to this day - not even Heroes and Generals comes close. Heroes and Generals might have better graphics, and an assault teams, which add to the realism of the game, but Heroes and Generals DOES NOT come close to an open world map where every city is different, where in Heroes and Generals even Italian cities have British architecture and every map is generic. I realized that every map is generic after a few hours of playing HG, especially when my hometown on the map in Europe has British architecture lol. It looks nothing like that in real life. I reckon with today's technology you can easily scan Google Street View or something or even a map from back in the day to populate the city's layout and then put generic buildings around it, as long as the layout is similar, then you have the jest of what WW2 Online does. This permits a small team of devs to create an enormous game without having to put effort in to design environments, which can be a very time consuming task. I know - I created a huge settlement on Spectacle Island in Fallout 4. I've put over 30 hours into it and it's still not finished yet - not even half.

Let alone a 300,000 sq km map.

But seriously - if not anything keep your damn subscription - I might not fork over $12 a month for a subscription but if you release a starter pack with a heavy HG style grind I will fork over $12 to buy the game one time, and then grind my way to each weapon and vehicle. AS LONG AS YOUR PORT THE GAME TO UNREAL ENGINE 4! Because nobody is going to spend money on something with graphics this crappy. I really doubt that GTA 5 Online will be as popular if it had Minecraft's graphics. 

See I was not willing to fork over $80 for The Elder Scrolls Online and then pay $15 a month for a subscription, so I just never even bothered with that game until I heard they waived their subscription fees, all of a sudden I became interested but not interested enough to pay $80 when I can use that money for a one time ordeal with a hooker(I have pimp friends so I get discounts, also prostitution is legal where I am). 

But when it got lowered to $40, and it included something other than just....the starter pack, I forked over those $40, even though I haven't played more than maybe 20 hours of the game so far, and I bought it more than 2 years ago. 

But I still think it was worth it, even though I don't play it right now and I'm playing other games. I'll play it eventually. 

Yet why should I fork over $150 in one year worth of sub fees? For an outdated game with a great concept, mind you, not very optimized even for new computers, when I can eat with that money myself for a month? 

Also nobody is going to play the free to play version with just a rifle. Seriously. I was never a rifle player in WW2 games. I don't have the patience to shoot people with bolt action rifles. I'd rather go to prison than shoot with a bolt action rifle in a video game for 10 hours a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007219484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1511622097}
review:
Theres still nothing out there that I can compare this game too. Sure there are other FPS games set in WW2, but not at this scale and with the combined arms(Air/Inf/Tank... and Sea).

War Thunder comes close in comparison but it's still not really the same (Simulation... Air/Tank... but no Inf) , but is at such a small scale that it¬¥s like playing on a size of fotball field in comparison, and this naturally limits the number of simultaneous players in the game, and War Thunder is not a continous world where theres a front line being pushed towards victory.

The war in WWII Online goes on 24/7, starts at a certain date and then goes on until one or the other side has won (which means an ongoing war for several weeks), that triggers a reset and the war starts over again, all happening on the same server together with thousands of players.

Algorithms within WWII Online keep tracks and makes it possible to display up to 128 players simultaniously in the area around the player, this means that you are able to have battles with several hundred players within the same area of conflict(towns/depots and other areas of conflict) without having your computer bogging down in performance due to trying to display to many objects in the area that might not be of interest or a threat to you for the moment.

This also means that the battles in WWII Online can take on epic proportions when it comes to battles, this is something that no other game set in the WWII has accomplished before.

Trying to compare WWII Online with something else is hard as none has tried to do something comparable to it.

And as a end note, this game needs time to play, if you are short on time like I am quite often now then play something else, when I have 30minutes to 1 hour to kill, I'll just start up War Thunder and play 2-3 battles and try to be happy with that, but If I have 2 hours or more to spare I rather start a session of WWII Online instead and try to help the war effort and push those frontlines.

developer_response:
Appreciate the positive review Psycho, Salute. Our game is intentionally supposed to be a flight simulator, so if you're playing with Mouse and Keyboard it's going to be very hard.

Since we do offer some M&K control options, I'll talk to the guys and see if there's anything that could be done to smooth it out a bit however.

If you would be interested in receiving a free joystick (I'll buy you one personally), contact me on Steam.

review: The concept for this game is amazing and, in my opinion, it has great potential. But from my experience the game isn't very fun, as you spend most of your time trying to find the enemy, which is incredibly boring and the fact you have to pay ¬£15 to access everything is ridiculous, the games graphics are shite, I know that some people say that shouldn't affect whether a game is bad or not but they are incredibly out of date. As I said the concept of this game is great, a full scale map of the low countries and France, but I don't think I can play this game for more than an hour without getting bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980262694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 6233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3437, 'last_played': 1706468602}
review:
Best overall FPS WW2 warfare simulator available.
Very good tank simulator.
You can also use towed guns, ships and planes.
First game I signed up for a subscription this week.

I love the game engine. (reminds me of good ol' Operation Flashpoint)
I love the projectile physics.
I love the big map.
I love the distance fights in terrain as well as close combat in woods and cities.
I love the damage model.
I love the complexity. Players who think this is too complex should just stop playing it, because they are too stupid :) Take some time to work into it, god damn it!

Anything can happen in this game.
Enemy can be everywhere.

Friendly Fire is off, which sucks. But on the other hand, there are so many stupid underage newbie recruits online and they cannot resist shooting at their own side's soldiers, just because there is not enough COD action in the first minute of the game...
And my PzIIC tank jumps and sometimes falls over when driving over a little hill, which indicates that the physics of vehicle vs. terrain could be improved.

But in general this is a beautiful masterpiece.
I simply do not care about the bad reviews.
It is better than Planetside 2 in many ways. There are no goofy invisible infiltrator classes or such stupid things.
Never seen any cheater or other broad misbehaviour. (Except many retarded newbies.)
Support was cool and answered my questions about subscription etc.

It's a pity you cannot download the game for free anymore. Even for free to play you have to buy the lowest subscription for one month and cancel it to get the game and the account. That is bad because it is harder to convince friends.

Use WW2online via Steam only and your Steam account will be tied to one WW2online account and the subscription can be managed easily and without error directly from the Steam user interface. It is working well.

Regarding subscription please note that the in-game unit types you can use are subject to these rules:
- Locked because your rank is too low
- Locked because your subscription model is too low

With subscription model 1 you can use these types: 1 air 3 Infantry 2 tanks 2 towed 1 soft vehicle
That is good.
The battles are superb. I love them. Go get subscription type 1 and cancel if you want and play further for free. Joining vehicles is always for free. (If any commander is requesting crew... ask your friends :) Crew can man any position in any vehicle regardless of subscription and rank.)

Overall the new subscription model is not unintelligent. It balances the game well. The new system encourages use of soft unarmoured unit types (infantry and towed mostly) and crew. I like it. But I think subscription model 1 for 4,99 EUR would be more reasonable. Really.

I knew the game for many many years and started this year. It is good as I always thought it would be. Except for the visually abstract engine it really simulates warfare in a nice way.
