author: {'steamid': '76561198259572027', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1570829519}
review:
"not a good game at all the tutorial is really basic and theres alot of reading
the player base is almost empty and you cant dismount from a vehicle"-first review 

[  WHY NOT GO BACK TO FREE PLAY ON STEAM?

We think our game was incorrectly advertised by acting as a "Free to Play" game and we learned pretty quickly that we needed to alter expectations of new coming users to realize that this isn't your typical MMO or free to play monetization system. What we were offering was really more of a "demo." Since our change to being "starter only" we've found we attracted the right folks who spend more time in the game and get better value. Opening the Free Play floodgate and hoping something sticks, was simply not working, so it doesn't make sense to go back and try it again.


Hence why we've developed this new strategy from the feedback we've received ] - developers words

they posted a chart about monetization that tells you to pay for a member ship and ontop of that pay for each individual dlc which cost 10 to 20 bucks each and on top of PAYING FOR THE GAME

i got it for free when they had the free sale 

Pros:
*cool premise

*revolutionary gameplay for the year (it was published 2001)

cons:
*you pay 7 dollars for the base game but you have to pay for either the starter membership which is pretty bad or the premium member ship which used to give you it all until they said in september f 2018 you will have to pay for vehicles and classes that should come standard

*non existent player base most of the action happens over 1 or 2 towns even do they advertise the map as being the biggest one ever created (biggest for 2001)
the map has a shit load of cities btw

*you have to grind for a vehicle like a tank and guns like anti tank rifles and anti tank guns which is ok but the grind is confusing and you will die alot since most players are in tanks or sniping 

*you cant dismount any vehicle in the game if you are driver or crew
so no you cant drive to the front you have to walk or tell some poor sucker that has a car to pick you up

*graphics are bearable until you realize you cant hide because soldiers stick out like sore thumbs 

*the controls for vehicles are cool but so spread over the keyboard they get confusing

*animations are bad for this day and age

*the game menu and navigation as a whole is confusing and broken like in online mod if you pick a vehicle and hit the start thats under the vehicles selection screen that spawns you in a soldier brigade because you did not hit the vehicle spawn start thats really small in the corner of the screen

YES THE GAME IS OLD BUT THAT DOESNT EXCUSE THEM CHARGING YOU 7-8 DOLLARS THEN DEMANDING YOU PAY FOR A MEMBERSHIP MONTHLY or yearly(122$$$)  AND THEN HAVING THE PRIDE TO BLAME THE COMMUNITY FOR THE GAMES FAILURE WHEN IT WAS PLACED AS FREE TO BRING IN NEW PLAYERS

on top of ALL that they want people to pay for dlcs that where once part of a membership

verdict:
2/10 good premise terrible monetization scheme for 2018 

go play some actually good mmos that are free a great one is planet side 2

planet side 2 is free and its a massive pvp mmo with 3 factions of 100+ player fighting in a huge map at the same time everything can be grinded in a month EVERYTHING each faction has different gear and the community is triving

or if you want a ww2 mmo play war thunder sure the devs are not very smart but they are friendly and they bout to add ships boys

PLANET SIDE 2 AND WAR THUNDER > this game that coulnt keep up with the times

review:
*** WARNING NORMIES ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH THIS GAME ***

+If you like long online campaigns, this game is for you
+if you like flight sims, this game is for you(Trackir works*also as infantry*)
+if you like tank sims, this game is for you
+they are still updating the game... just now actually
~i have to say the infantry combat is kinda lame... but it can get exicting, just like any competetiv game you get into.
~the graphics are really old, but atleast the map is so big that you have alot of diffirent terrains!
-the UI is extremly outdated and takes time to get used to
i have not yet tried the Naval Assets

This game is very slow(sim) with occasional spikes of action where you either die or win
make sure to cooperate with your squad and do some para jumps with some people its fun!

review: Awesome game that i used to play back in the early 2000's and its just as great today, a lot of good changes, BIGGEST map i have ever played on and great content all of the different missions and vehicles and even the different sides to choose from!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092465985', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1656894955}
review: I love this game, but if you play this for a while, you start to notice certain repetitious loops and things that just don't make sense. I notice an arguement about the "Anti-Cheat" system and after an hour or so's worth of me staring at my screen looking for anything, there looks like evidence of an attempt of one being there but there is none, I also notice that the game is over priced for a subscription from a game of which would be decent or well-done back in 2001-2004 but now it is the same price as years before and the game has not improved much at all except some simple details. If this game had a cheaper price for subscription and the developers actually listened to the community instead of banning people without warning or any attempt to communicate to the individual. (Like my friend was banned for THREE YEARS for accused of "Hacking") So I have to say, this game hit the gutter and until it improves financially and whatnot, I have to say I don't recommend this game. (PS: They base this as an "Early Access" game but it does not improve in any way at all and has not in many years, might as well put the "Free To Play" version in the Demo section)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964449583', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7601, 'last_played': 1512017601}
review:
I remember even back in 2001-2002 that this game was pay to play, you'd just buy a boxed copy in store and then play this game and then with yourself when you got home. Then after your first month of standard or premium or whatever you'd be soft down there because you'd have to do more chores for your parents to rack up an extra $15 to pay for another month of this game. The base game with the one month membership in the box was around $40.

You'd think it would be totally free (or at a fixed price), but no, the devs haven't changed the pricing system 16 years later and it really pisses me off, because the only people who really play this game nowadays are retired USN veterans and Russian kids who still have Windows XP SP1. Like why do I need to pay $15? It's not exactly a cinematic gaming experience in 2018; it's becoming fossilized and I merely just want to play it for nostalgic/old replayability value. 

Still giving this game a thumbs up just because it's pretty damn good, even though it costs $5 more each month than my fucking gym membership.

review:
Primeiramente: 

Se voc√™ busca jogos pela qualidade gr√°fica e n√£o pela divers√£o e imers√£o que ele te proporciona, aqui n√£o √© o seu lugar. 

Segundamente: =D 

Explicando resumidamente o que √© WWII online... 
Segunda guerra pura, combate em tempo real, um mapa, um server... muitos ou poucos jogadores dependendo da hora que voc√™ entra no servidor. 
Voc√™ precisa entrar no jogo fazer o treinamento b√°sico de infantaria e partir para a batalha, neste ponto o jogo peca um pouco pois n√£o ensina sobre ve√≠culos blindados, aeronaves e navios, o que te faz perder um pouco de tempo indo ver o que cada bot√£o faz em cada veiculo que voc√™ pega. 
Voc√™ com certeza vai demorar um pouco para se familiarizar com todas as op√ß√µes que o jogo te proporciona, e muitas vazes vai se sentir frustrado em morrer... dar respaw... morrer... dar respaw... ai voc√™ vai entender que como na guerra real... Voc√™ precisa de uma equipe para cumprir as miss√µes. 
As miss√µes s√£o dadas pelos l√≠deres com n√≠vel alto, determinando aonde atacar e aonde defender. 
O mapa √© incrivelmente grande, o que faz que batalhas durem horas, e dominar uma simples cidade demore dias ou at√© semanas. 
Espero ter agu√ßado a vontade de quem tinha d√∫vidas sobre o jogo, ele √© antigo mas os desenvolvedores est√£o querendo implantar a Unreal Engine 4, o que sem d√∫vidas vai chamar mais players... Aqueles nutella que gostam mais de gr√°fico do que de divers√£o. 

Vlw Flw.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132886636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1550341940}
review:
Vedo molte recensioni negative di gente che evidentemente non ha capito lo spirito di questo gioco. WWII Online NON √® uno sparatutto alla Call of Duty, bens√¨ una SIMULAZIONE. Questo vuol dire che si pu√≤ morire con un solo colpo e non sapere nemmeno chi l'ha sparato, che si possono passare ore in trincea ad aspettare l'assalto nemico, che pilotare un veicolo √® dannatamente difficile e un carrista non pu√≤ guidare, mirare e sparare allo stesso tempo come nei vari Battlefield.

Sicuramente √® un gioco meno immediato degli altri, la grafica √® un po' datata (ricordiamoci che √® un gioco anzianotto) ma la comunit√† √® fantastica e matura. Non ci sono bimbiminkia ma solo gente cordiale e sempre disposta ad aiutare i novizi.

Per me √® il miglior gioco di guerra mai realizzato, e ci gioco da molto prima che arrivasse su Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057611744', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1516594768}
review:
It's a shame the devs are so greedy. This game was really fun. I was playing the other day and it said for the low low price of $14.99 a month you get everything.

This game isn't even worth 5. It's built on an old engine, with horrible textures and everything. $14.99!
The original Counter-Strike is 5 bucks and you get EVERYTHING!
This is complete BS.
developer_response:
I understand if you don't want to subscribe, but I don't think it's fair to call us "Greedy." Please take a look tat how we explained the subscription model, why it has worked for us and more importantly why it has kept us going. The majority of our team are volunteers who came from our community and love the game. There's a lot for us to do (agreed). Thanks for listening.


You can check it out here:

http://steamcommunity.com/games/251950/announcements/detail/1450576044656383147

Pros-

Helpful playerbase
It's kind of like Arma

Cons-
No tutorials for planes
Can't fly planes without joysticks
Nobody uses boats because there's no reason to use a boat when all of the battles are away from water
Graphics are awful
It claims to be the "largest gameworld ever created" that may be true, but the world isn't interesting enough.



The gameworld can be as large as eternity itself, but if it doesn't have any content, or is just the same reused assets, what's the point of it being that big other than to prove that you can make a boring world?

author: {'steamid': '76561198418014671', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1573250151}
review:
Keep in mind, I played this before it went on Steam, I have around 500 hours, back when I wasted some extra money I had on this garbage. Worst decision of my life.

Got banned for 7000 (thats like 10+ years) days because I asked why the game hasn't changed in 10+ years and theyre still charging $15 a fucking month for it.

Here's the skinny in pros and cons.

*Pros:* 

-Can be fun. Sometimes. Rarely. And it doesn't last for long.

*In-between:*

-Can be run on any computer. Which means there's a lot of potato-laggers on the servers.

*Cons:*

-Lots of potato-PC laggers.

-Graphics equal to a game from 2001.

-Physics equal to a game from 2001.

-Animations equal to a game from 2001.

-Models equal to a game from 2001.

-Sounds equal to a game from 2001.

-Game literally has not changed a single bit in over 16+ years.

-Ballistics are fucking god-awful. Matilda tanks are practically impenetrable by anything that isnt an 88mm cannon.

-No in-game voice chat.

-FIFTEEN DOLLARS A FUCKING MONTH FOR THIS JUNK. Planetside 2 looks better, plays better, and is at least being developed and that's still F2P. 

-These twats have the audacity to force a paywall while they do NOTHING to develop the game at all. (F2P literally locks you to two incredibly basic classes with next-to-zero vehicle options.)

-F2P literally locks you to one incredibly basic class with zero vehicle options.

-Allied vehicles are incredibly overpowered in all aspects because the skilled players are on Axis, which means the Allied players scream and cry for buffs instead of actually getting better at the game instead of trying to zerg everything. Me a a single other pilot in BF-109E-1's took out 15 Spitfires because their pilots were absolute garbage. A couple of their extremely rare elite pilots got sent out to actually give us a challenge.

-Oh did I mention you have to pay $15 a month for this garbage already?

-They have no intention of actually making it fully F2P.

-They have no intention of actually developing the game.

-The tutorials teach you absolutely nothing about game mechanics, I had learned this years ago and had to figure everything out myself from playing.

-The only required tutorial before playing is basically just teaching you how to move and shoot, which means all the newbies are completely useless cannon-fodder because the tutorials teach them nothing thats actually required to advance in the game.

-No anti-cheat. If you face a hacker, you have to manually report them, which the admins/moderators likely WONT investigate at all, so the hackers will get away scot-free.

-If you trash-talk their game on the forums, you get perma-banned. Same for mentioning hacks or hackers, even if you're just trying to tell them to ban someone WITH evidence.

-THEY ALMOST GOT REMOVED FROM STEAM BECAUSE THEY WERE PERMA-BANNING PEOPLE WHO GAVE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. Then they gave in and stopped. But they didn't stop on their forums or anywhere else.

-Did I mention the devs are awful people who're just trying to take your money?

I would literally rather go into a prison and take 3 dicks to my butthole than pay for this game. It'd probably be more enjoyable too.






---------For anyone reading the dev response, he's full of shit lol--------------

This link took me all of 1 minute to find: http://mmofallout.com/wwii-online-removed-from-mmorpg-com-by-cornered-rat-software/

Here's the main takeaway: "We‚Äôve discussed here at MMO Fallout before that Cornered Rat Software doesn‚Äôt exactly have great track record on dealing with criticism, what with a very heavily moderated forum that is mostly closed off to the public and only accessible to accounts with active subscriptions. Being a third party website, the WWII Online forums at MMORPG have become a platform for current and ex-customers to vent their frustrations with Cornered Rat Software without fear of being banned in retaliation or simply having their threads shut down. As a result of the clash between former and current players, the forum subsection ultimately became a never ending, out of control flame war."

Soooooo yeah. They removed their listing and forums from MMOFallout because they had no control over the users and couldn't take the rightful criticism of their game. It's pretty much guaranteed that any issues the users complained about then, are still ingame today.

So congratulations, Xoom. You seriously must lack some braincells if you think you could just blatantly lie on a public review and not have it come back to slap you. Also, I laugh at the claim of "clearly a biased review intended to damage our reputation".

What reputation? Your rep for being a bunch of cucks who ban people because you cant take criticism? Or maybe your rep of not developing anything noteworthy in 16+ years. Or how about your rep of Stalin-grade forum enforcment?

Every review is intended to do something. Good reviews intend to bring players to the game. Bad reviews intend to steer players away. Thats the entire fucking point of a review. Also, news flash, look at the reviews on your Steam page and tell me if its good? Well its not. Recent reviews are Mostly Negative, with overall reviews being Mixed. In the case of public Steam games, thats pretty fuckin bad.

Honestly, it pains me to say this, but you're now worse than APB Reloaded. It pains me because APB was good and then it fell, hard. But somehow, SOMEHOW you managed to be worse than them. I'll be watching your game's imminent downfall from the sidelines while laughing and eating popcorn saying "I told you so."

GG no re.

Update 7/8/2023: In an email to existing players, these clown ass devs claimed their "full steam release" had ***THOUSANDS*** of new players joining. Steam charts has recorded a whopping 30 new players joined since the "full steam release". Not only do they blatantly lie about everything, but they dont even put in the effort to lie anymore lmao
developer_response:
It's acceptable to write your thoughts and comments, but to say we were actively hunting down negative reviews and banning them, is just outright wrong and immoral. We would never do anything like that. We were also NOT almost removed, because that never happened.

There are anti-hack counter measures in place and not everything has to be manually reported, but we certainly do respond to those as well.

I hope anyone who is reading this can tell by the level of exaggeration being demonstrated here that this is clearly a biased review intended to damage our reputation. Which is, extremely unfortunate.

That's not to say we don't have several improvements to make, we're not perfect. Thanks to all of those out there giving us fair reviews, even if they're not a positive, fairness is all we ask.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073161167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 18275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11464, 'last_played': 1668984692}
review:
Not gonna let some of these negative "reviews" convice me that this game isnt a blast. Most of those reviews come from people who put no time in that game at all. 

Store page is clear that the "free" version is just reserve riflemen. It's a way for newcomers to get their feet wet and see if this game is worth them committing to it. Past that, players can choose one of the DLC's to build themselves a custom experience for themselves if they don't see themselves playing every unit type. Or go premium to play around with everything as they unlock it like myself. and the dlc's are a one time purchase and available forever after that. no addition money needed with that option. 

This game isn't like any other game out there. Don't even think of it as a typical "game" for it would be more acurate to call it a War Simulator. Everything is player generated. Every tank, plane, ship & soldier is controlled by another human. No battle is the same, no campaign is the same. 

Once you get into your first big battle, it'll all click. You'll see what the hype is about. You'll see why this game and its community is still around. And like myself, you'll get hooked.

And to add one more positive about this game, its community. This community took me in as one of its own the very first day I started playing. I never came across another communtiy that's as open and friendly as this one. How many other games can you say that for? I would bet you could count them on one hand and that's if you can name ay at all. 

So if any of you guys are on the fence about trying this  game out, give it go! You literally have nothing to lose by checking it out, charging across some fields under LMG and artillery fire. Storming into enemy held  towns and cities, liberating sheep fields across a MASSIVE open world. 

So grab your toothbrush, pull up your socks and hop on The Bang Bus. 'Cause we're going to war!!!

review:
It's just a bad game, plain and simple. It's probably one of the largest games of its time, but it's just too big, you will run for half an hour to get to the objective, run around for another 20 mins, maybe get a kill and then either the game ends or you die and have to run for another 50 mins.

Conclusion: Boring

p.s You have to pay real money to play any class other than rifleman. This game deserves a mostly negative rating on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011724675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1553945290}
review:
I spent 30 minutes running to combat, I crawl around in a battle for another 30 minutes get one kill then the battle is over...
Was honestly a great first experience and it was fun..but then
I spent the next hour looking for another fight and then then being fed up of walking I try to figuring out how to drive a truck for another hour because wasd is too easy. This game plays like the people who made it have never seen a keyboard before w is break toggle (YES TOGGLE) and [ is the gas you can rebind it, but still.

It's just too complicated, I like complex simulation games but there is a limit before it just becomes clunky and work. a good example is the driving. you have a button to start the engine, a button for the break and centerbreak,a button to open the door a button to shift gears and a button for every gear..and the map is a nightmare.


This games just too old and not worth the learning curve it's gonna die soon or atleast it feels like it will. it plays bascially like rising storm but with a paywall so if you want a good wwII simulation go there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389960133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1680480018}

edit: it works now, game is lots of fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198430075708', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1514245077}
review:
Eu jogo World War II Online desde 2004 muito antes de vir para Steam.
jogo ter vindo para steam est√° surgindo muitos player ressucitando novamente o game, isso muito bom ver novamente jogo no seu real pot√™ncia novamente.

- jogadores do mundo inteiro Conectados num Unico interino mapa. (enquanto se trava uma batalha no norte da belgica, pode est√° acontecendo batalhas ao sul tamb√©m ao mesmo tempo.)
- Mapa Gigantesco da Europa, cont√©m praticamente todas cidades da Belgica, Holanda, Parte da Europa e Alemanha... OPS voce pode percorrer de uma ponta do mapa a outra, isso vai levar horas da vida real de t√£o grande o mapa √©.
- N√£o Cont√©m BOT, jogo todo movido por player's, 
- Combates intensos, podem durar dias numa unica cidade, mapa √© destrutivel, tanto que se combate for intenso cidades v√£o ruindo at√© sobra apenas escombros, jogo tem base em Campanha, Campanhas podem durar meses at√© quando um dos lados perde pontos vitais estrategicos do mapa, for√ßando se render incondicionalmente, e por fim na campanha e recome√ßar nova campanha
- jogo tem cronnologia de desenvolvimento de tecnologia, campanha come√ßa em 1939, passando dias, v√£o surgindo equipamentos novos, at√© jogo chegar data de 1945 aonde jogo vai disponibilizando diversos equipamentos que foram utilizados na Segunda Guerra mundial.
- Jogo tem base forte sobre logistica e Cont√©m 3 for√ßas militares, For√ßas Armadas, For√ßa A√©rea, For√ßa Naval, aonde ambas 3 for√ßas d√£o suportes, em conjunto.
- Quando Voc√™ tem experencia, voc√™ pode fazer parte Alto Comando do Exercito, Eixo ou Aliado, assim comandar brigadas e divis√µes do jogo.
- Comunidade Forte e unida, tanto que manteve o jogo ativo desde 2001.
- Desenvoldores atentos, sempre escutando novas id√©ias dos players.

Recomendo esse jogo para todo mundo, apesar de seus graficos serem de 2001, jogo cont√©m muita complexidade, vale apena jogar e ter uma experencia do jogo.
quem quiser um help e entender mais do jogo, s√≥ me adcionar na steam e bora jogar junto!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978275211', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1513716129}
review:
I don't care about the graphics, the sound, the ui. The gameplay is a mess. I tried playing for over an hour. I played several character types, from sniper, AT rifle, Some sort of tank thing, AT bazooka, a motar guy. Other than repeatedly pot shotting some of the AT rifle shots off a Tiger tank (no point I guess since it couldnt penetrate) I never saw a single enemy. I saw hundreds of teammates die. I got killed a dozen times. I'm not sure what the fuck was happening at all. At one point I checked the map and saw all these red markers that people had "reported" enemy. So I walked all the way out there and it was just a small wooden building and 3 of our tanks were sitting around it constantly firing tank and mg rounds into the thing... for 5 minutes.

When you hear a game is older than 15 years and still active, You sort of assume that at least some parts of it would have been updated in the last decade.

Thankfully the game has a FORCED tutorial that makes you learn that WASD is for walking, and mouse1 is how you shoot! What a fucking pile of shit waste of asstime, fucking losers. I want this to be a good game.

review: I played this game off and on since 2002, it wasn't worth it back then and it isn't worth it now. Back then, I remember waiting 30 minutes for it to load, only to end up crashing or getting killed soon after. At least that is fixed, but the premium content is not worth the cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072059927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1515699172}
review:
This is a great game.

No, the graphics are not amazing, and yes, it can be a bit tough to get into how everything works. However, once you join up with some players, you will have a great time. This game has more tactics and team play than most. You can really get to know the people you are playing with and develop relationships that make you all better players.

The interplay between infrantry, armour and air forces is fantastic and if you spend the time to learn how it all works you will really enjoy yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186720283', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1508471935}
review: Oh god this game is bad, holy crap. Where do I even begin! The graphics look horribly awful, and the "Massive map" that the game so proudly toutes is probably the biggest I've ever seen in gaming but its soooooo ugly and devoid of any semblence of recognisability. The gunplay is hilariously bad and controls feel clunky at best. As I was playing with my friends, we also noticed that the entrance to a town was guarded by soldiers, or at least we thought they were, they turned out to be statues! It's not even funny how bad this game is. If you want a solid ww2 open world shooter, go and buy foxhole on steam for 20 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018878859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1513540317}
review:
Overall first when I started playing this game there was nothing wrong with it and thought to myself why are all these reviews so bad about this game?

At first the gameplay was great and you could take up all classes etc which was great fun, but now after playing for some time and after like a month or so. I couldn't take up all the classes but 2 anymore and now started asking me continously to start paying a monthly subscription. This in my opinion is a sneaky and bitchy move to do as a developer, first have you playing and seeing how the game is without having you know you'll have to pay then shove the subscription into your face ruining the gameplay.

Now looking at the subscription costs, 16 euros a month, this for a year is 192 euros for an outdated old game. let that sink in....

Overall, if you have too much money and are up for a game that wastes your time at first by letting you play everything to lure you in to then shove subscriptions into your face. This is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072843614', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1665708575}
review:
I have played this game for 8.7 hours since I got in on Steam. I used to play it back when it wasn't on steam so I'm already familar with controls and how things work but I just needed to get back into it.

Pros:

You can play it on almost the crappest PC out there. You can't complain about graphics or your PC would be dead even with a good PC can you render the entirety of Europe? With HQ HD objects. I don't think so. 

Centrallised objectives, this makes getting action from this game easy on it's large scale map.

Good Community, lots of helpful and kind people.

It's free.

It's really fun if you take your time to learn it

Cons:

Terrible net + Very Shitty PC = You can get alot of kills because the LAG Delay doesn't block you from killing someone. ((I stabbed a guy yesterday, he didn't die about a minute or two later we both die and I see him shooting at nothing...))
It's kind of pay to win when I use to play it but I think you get the Starter and Premium for a month at start, not too sure

Noobs waste good Assets, They don't know how to use it properly but attempt to use a tank. I suggest having a tank tutorial where you would have to assault an enemy tank and retreat from a few tanks firing back at you before being able to use tanks on a large scale.

AI is too op and requires tank or airplane to take them out. (the solider is visible, you're shooting at it but doesn't kill them.)



In all, the game is great, I'd suggest you download it now and get in battle

author: {'steamid': '76561198017952526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1638384671}
review:
First, I only installed this game via Steam to write a review about it. I played well over 800hrs in the non-steam version over the past 8 years. I was one of the people voting for Steam's green light.  Thus I cannot comment on the steam free to play versin with only two classes available.

In my opinion, many negative reviews I read were putting the game into the wrong drawer, so I wanted to explain the scale and possibilities it has over others.

[h1]But first things first:[/h1]

- yes, the graphics are compared to anything newer than 2001 shocking
- yes, the UI befits the graphics and needs a lot of good will to getting used to.
- yes, you do not know what to do once you logged in.
- no, it is not a CoD-ish first person shooter. 

I played many games like World of tanks, planes, ships, etc after I played sudden strike, blitzkrieg, CoD, Red Orchestra and panzer general in my early days. I always hoped for a game combining all elements of an army (Land, Air, Sea) in first person on the very same map and a large map at best.

At one day, I found WW2OL. It topped my wildest dreams. Not only did it combine all elements, but the map was whole western europe and it was a war, going on without me being online, but also without me losing any property while not there.
Let me give you some examples:

- Additional to infantry, you can play as fighter pilot, bomber pilot, the one using the bombsight, tank driver, commander, gunner, anti-tank-gunner, flak-gunner, commanding a patrol boat, destroyer, stuka, etc.

- all these roles play together on the same map, attack together the same target or support each other. 

- you could sneak as infantry close to a town and observe with your binoculars the defences, marking enemy guns or tanks or soldiers.

- a nearby bomber sees the markings or reads the callouts and begins to circle the area to find the enemy and take him out.

- this game has no minimap with automatic display of enemies. Only marked enemies by you or other players are visible on the map. This of course means, that an enemy infantry or tank could from the time of your marking til the time your bomber sees the mark be well away of your originaly pinpointed location.

- while you fight a town, some players decide to cut supply for the defenders by blowing up a bridge 1km away with explosives, while other players fly a bombing run against another bridge far to the east.

- others boarded a transport plane and prepare for a parachute jump over town.

- some players driving tanks settled on a hill nearby town, while other guard them against sappers as infantry and others drive ammo to them.

- other players spawned in fighter planes to clear the air of enemy fighters and make it safe for the bomber pilots.

 - you see 2 ducked enemy infantry rushing through some bushes. Do you shoot at them, or do you let them pass by and search sneakily from where they came? maybe they have a mobile spawn, from where more of them could come. If you could find it and take it out, you might well have influenced the outcome.

- towns/villages have districts. These are marked by a building with a flag. these are the focus of the fights. You have to capture such a building with a timer, to capture that district and possibly aswell an enemy spawnpoint like a depot, from where he spawns infantry, anti-air/tank guns or even large army bases, from where he spawns tanks to defend the town.

[h1]So..[/h1]
These were only some examples of possibilities you could meet. I saw it all. From a para jump with well over 30 players, while flak shells exploded around us and machine guns shot at us from down below, to house fights in towns and villages to long dogfights high above etc or ruse attacks on one village to attack short after the real target. It has a nice layer of tactical decisions, usualy the average joe doesnt see, as others take care of it.

This game is so much more than just 10 tanks vs. 10 tanks or 10 planes vs. 10 planes. Do try to lift off one before you judge the complexity of this game. Never had I a better feeling in a ww2 game, than when a friendly plane bombs the bunkers in front of me and I can advance as inf deeper into the town.

Everything is player driven. Even the high command (the ones calling targets to attack and defend) are players.
A campaign doesnt last hours. it lasts days to weeks!
The sound is actualy quiet superb imo. You can hear the direction of it, including footsteps, can judge the gun and with that even if its an enemy or friend you hear.

No other game managed to combine all this on one battlefield even a 100th as large as this and on that level of "realism", difficulty and immersion.

[h1]early access[/h1]
I supported green light out of a simple reason. All this features and possibilities are awesome. But only epic, when many people play it. The comunity is certainly one of the finest out there, but kept ofc dwindeling over the years. I wished the developers and the comunity an influx of many new players, since this game was even for me very hard to find, as it has basicaly 0 press.

It all feels a bit odd and ugly and old and indeed has a steep learning curve. 
If you like such content, give it a try. If you can't get past the clunkienes and graphics, no problem. A foot soldier is indeed all you need to give it a sniff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978832149', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1710166181}
review:
not being able to link my steam with my old account is a MAJOR thumbs down, along side the fact the game has been around for a long time and not much has changed

Cons:
poor graphics
to many tanks
no one wants to fly
no para missions
spawn camping
dumb squad leads
noobs giving away possition of spawn *also known as an ant trail*


Pros:
it is a good shooter if you play it right
good city combat
air combat is insainly fun but hard to learn
navy support is a large boost but no one plays navy
slow skill gain *so noobs dont burn through elite gear*
when you do find a good group of people there is a great feeling when a group of 10 people take a city vs over 30 defenders. its all about team work.


been playing this game for ages think im rank 8 or 9 in everything on my other account for all factions but graphics are horrible and not enough players to make the game as deadly as it used to be so for now a thumbs down. even though i do love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014847479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 15612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2564, 'last_played': 1691186261}
review:
Greetings all :)
This is very complex game, there is a lot to learn.

Oddly though, there is still no instructions or manual in game.

CRS recently made a tutorial for new Steam users - but it's useless - a clunky time-waster that teaches common basics like how to move, and how to fire.

Nothing about how to drive a truck, spawn into battle, or use an AT gun; how and why to capture a spawnable CP, the importance of an MS tick for an attack, the tactics in taking a town etc. etc.

New users must either spend time outside the game reading the wiki, forums, guides and you-tube videos - or try to learn by trial and error.

Which means many trials and many errors - most new players experience the frustration of spawning in and running towards battle, only to find it is miles away and takes literally hours to get there. A few experiences like that will send them away.

Or driving miles to a town which cannot be captured as it has no AO - but no explanations of AOs and DOs are given.

The chat channels are critical in this game, but this is not made clear. Recruits are not automatically tuned into the vital Side chat channel and are not instructed to do so - missing much comms without realising it.

Meanwhile vets get frustrated at recruits who don't know what to do, and openly abuse them for it (including in Side chat which they cannot even hear.) There is view in the CRS forums e.g. that Steam recruits are not smart enough for this game, and that the game's problems are caused by players who don't know how to play the game properly. 

Over the years, CRS has suffered much criticism (some deserved, some not) and this has lead CRS into a 'bunker mentality' - they are extremely defensive about criticism. New leader Xoom is trying to do a good job, but some in his team are blind - like one who denies every single criticism of the rats or the game, every time - such as denying any problem with any weapon even while CRS is doing an audit to fix various weapon problems.

Currently, there is a problem with FMS camping which is seriously spoiling game play. The view of many vets and rats on the forum is that this is simply because new recruits are too stupid to know how to handle it. There is far more abuse and criticism than communication and co-operation. Every problem is apparently the fault of stupid players. Reports about cheaters are ignored/rejected.

There is much to like about this complicated and challenging game - but not if you simply want to jump in and have some quick & easy friendly fun.

Kapyong

Player base is really newb friendly and there isnt a better combined arms WWII sim out there.

review:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Early Access - 21. November 2017
:
[5/100]
When I first saw the game I wondered how a game can have such a bad rating so I downloaded it to give it a chance but after completing the (not skipable) tutorial the only thing I was doing for almost a hour was walking or driving towards the enemys just to die through 2 Shots that came from bushes in which you can't see in but you. The maps are really really big, the graphics are sh*t and the gameplay boring. Why would you make a stamina bar which is just filling up while standing still on maps like this?! But it's for free so just try it out to get your own opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980791513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1553207634}
review:
Not sure why this has negative reviews. I thoroughly enjoy it, on a "when I feel like it" basis. 

I can see the graphics are dated (none of us are blind) but this doesn't negatively affect the game itself. I think it is a fun simulator with a very vast, ambitious outlook on how an online MMO shooter can be built. 

I think the biggest downside would be the network issues -- can get terrible lag in massive fights. Hopefully to be fixed soon, and I know it wasn't an issue before the userbase massively spiked after releasing on steam. Personally, I stick to smaller battles and choose not to deal with lag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306551549', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1509116808}
review:
Questo gioco non √® nulla di eccezionale, ma per gli appassionati della seconda guerra mondiale o per chi vorrebbe Arma 3 ma non se lo pu√≤ permettere va benissimo. Giocato su Intel Core i7 7500U @3.5 GHz 2 Core, Intel HD 620, AMD Radeon R7 M440 2GB, 8 GB RAM.
DESCRIZIONE: Il gioco, per coloro che vorrebbero Arma 3 ma, per via del suo prezzo, dei suoi requisiti o altro non possono permetterselo questo pu√≤ essere divertente. Il gameplay non √® male, si nota subito che √® un po'datato, la grafica sa accontentare, essendo gratis conviene tenerlo sul proprio PC. Una cosa molto insolita: in questo gioco di guerra √® possibile andare in bici.
PRO: Una versione di Arma 3 pensata per chi non pu√≤ averlo, accessibile a tutti per via della bassa grafica, grande vastit√† di veicoli, mappa Abbastanza estesa, ottimo rapporto peso/qualit√†.
CONTRO: Molto confusionario, si hanno piccole interferenze nel men√π inizialmente perch√© √® abbastanza datato.
CONCLUSIONE: Nella norma, c'√® di meglio ma c'√® di peggio, essendo gratis e leggero, vale la pena tenerlo per qualche partita con gli amici.

review: I use to play this game on and off for the past 8 years. I always enjoyed it then and was excited to see it come to Steam, thinking the player based would have a much needed expansion... Well I am extremely disappointed in how they have locked the free to play classes. You use to be able to unlock classes up to level 5 then had to pay to unlock the rest, now the have locked EVERYTHING, but a rifleman and a SMG class. Why not let those who game casually use a bloody low tiered tank like the use to? I would've paid the subscription if they left the old level 5 model in. Not getting a dime out of me now. Rat Corner has become EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995874352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1567200291}
review: I like this game, it has a sweet retro feelings to it and he concept is unique, a persistent open world battlefield 24/7 where everything is possible. This is the nightmare of every CoD player and the wet dream of every war gamer. What I like about this game is that you are not going to do the same crap over and over again as seen in other war games. You are not going to fight El Alamein, Stalingrad, Ardennes, Normandy over and over and over again. There is nothing fixed here in this game. Sometimes you may experience only small clashes, other times you may be in the middle of a battle for Berlin style of fight hiding in the bunker surrounded by enemies. Major battles can boom up anywhere anytime, with no or little warning so be always prepared. Its to complicated for CoD lovers but if you love realism and struggle. This is for you. Trust me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013902498', 'num_games_owned': 3281, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1573060709}
review:
Spent 20 minutes doing a tutorial that I'm still not sure I needed to do to then press every button I could in the confusing menu to end up in a game, spent 10 minutes walking to the first objective as the stamina bar refuses to let you run when it hits 50% and then got shot in the head and alt-f4'd. 
 
The only thing I've learned from this is that WWII Online cares more about teaching you how to play than it does about user-friendly Menus/UI or actual gameplay. Even then it doesn't teach you enough about the actual mechanics of the game to actually allow you to play confidently. It taught me how to move, shoot, stab, throw grenades, prone and crouch. The game doesn't even have a pause menu, you hit Escape and it asks you if you "really want to quit" to the menu. I'm fully aware this game is almost 14 years old but thats no excuse, especially when they say they're actively working on it again. They need to re-design a lot of the game and sit down and think about how to make it more appealing for users, maybe stop worrying about the $15 subscription which I assume nobody pays for due to all of the other issues with the game and actually read the criticism given to you by Steam users and re-build your game around that. Maybe move to Unreal 4 or some other pre-built engine where you can worry more about making the game and less about dealing with having to find a copy of Visual Studio 2005. 
 
All in all I can't recommend this game, its bland, there is no communication and it really is showing its age. If you're looking for a Mil Sim then you might as well go buy Squad or Arma, unfortunately this does not live up to expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011795801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1510526427}

gameplay :

on est dans la simu , rien de simple mais pas trop non plus ,  avec 3 /4 heure de jeu on comprend les touches a utilis√© , on met 5 a 10 mn a pied pour rejoindre une ville en combat , moins si vous √™tes une ville a d√©fendre. une ab√©ration par contre c'est qu'une fois que vous avais choisi un v√©hicule (tous confondu) impossible d'en descendre jusqu'a la mort : vous avez spawn en camion transport de troupes , vous mourrez en tant que tel , vous vous retournez , vous resterez dedans.

la taille de la carte, une des plus grandes dans un jeu video 30 000 km¬≤ enti√®rement disponible a pied , voiture , camion, char, avion, bateau sans chargement. lien pour la carte en ligne et en temps r√©el  https://webmap.wwiionline.com/

pour les avion , √©tant pratiquand de DCS world , c'est pas mal, physique bien  respect√© , les avions se comportent bien avec d√©ccrochage , inertie etc .... , on est pas dans l'arcade mais pas non plus dans la grosse simu avion,   

graphisme :

bin la c'est MR patate , retour 15 ans en arri√®re , le jeu propose autre chose de plus important , (revoir gameplay). et en m√™me temps le jeu date de 2001 et  en alpha sur steam depuis peu septembre 2017 donc en terme de d√©vellopement long , dayz sa est largement battu :) , 16 ans pour √™tre en alpha c'est quand m√™me costauds ........

dur√© de vie:

mon avis final:

Malgr√© un potentiel √©norme de gamplay , la surprise est que, passer les deux semaine de prenium offert , il vous faudra payer abonnment pour acc√©der au avion, char , bateau , grade superieur , impossiblme de devenir g√©n√©ral sans payer le max

review: eine gute idee eigentlich. aber das wars auch schon wieder. die alte qualit√§t st√∂rrt mich nicht wirklich aber der singleplayer ist nur ein langweiliges sanbox spiel in dem man alleine die klassen ausprobieren kann und der multiplayer geht nicht so haben wir aus WWII online nur mehr ein WWII. der titel passt schon mal nicht und niemand spielt es und das zurecht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049345535', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1508177806}
review:
Es w√§re ein vermutlich gutes Spiel, wenn man wirklich mal etwas an der Grafik machen w√ºrde. Dieser Punkt ist nun wirklich unumst√∂√ülich nach all den Jahren. Das Spiel war 2001 ein Unikat bis heute in diesem Genre und mit all seinen Fehlern dennoch spielbar. Das Aufbohren der Grafikengine und vieler Features war 2007 dennoch brauchbar und hielt das Game soweit auch weiterhin spielbar. Leider ist das Spiel technisch bereits in diesem Zeitraum stehen geblieben.

Die Idee zu diesem Game ist wiegesagt ungeschlagen, nur die Umsetzung, Qualit√§t ist miserabel nach heutigem Technikstand. Genauso das verprellen der Fanbase √ºber die Jahre dieses einzigartigen Spiels. Ich denke viele w√ºrden dem Game eine weitere Chance erneut geben, wenn sich schon allein in diesen Punkten alles positiv √§ndern w√ºrde.

Das Spiel als "Early Access" hier an den Mann/Frau zubringen ist eine weitere Blendermethode, genauso wie der viertelj√§hrliche Spendeaufruf um das Game vermeindlich weiterzubringen. Das Geld kann man besser in andere Spiele investieren. 

Empfehlen kann ich das Spiel nach heutigem Stand auf keinen Fall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152929309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1569851974}
review:
could be an alright game but...

-the controls are confusing especially for vehicles
-finding a guide for simple controls and even slightly more advanced controls seems almost impossible
-couldn't find a vehical training guide or tutorial
-how do you bail from a truck your driving or plane? can you? i have no idea because it doesnt tell you!
-and many more user friendly issues

would be fun to play with freind especial who like a more stratergy based combat game. except me and my friends are clueless on how to play the game.
developer_response: In this game, you are the vehicle (or aircraft) - so once you spawn it - You are the vehicle.  This is a bit different from most newer games, takes a bit of an adjustment to get used to.  I'd encourage you to join a squad within the game, most squads are looking to help newer players learn and get better at the game - and it is admittedly a lot easier when you've got someone covering your 6

author: {'steamid': '76561198208593239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5252, 'last_played': 1535533975}
review:
Gioco decisamente datato, ma se vi piacciono i giochi di guerra ve lo consiglio. Come han scritto molti altri non fa per chi √® abituato a call of duty, ecc ecc... perch√® √® molto realistico, anche come dinamiche di gioco. Quindi, soprattutto le prime ore di gioco, bisogna avere molta pazienza per capire come funziona (ci sono comunque molte guide dettagliate) ed anche per poterci prendere la mano.

Mi piacerebbe aggiungere anche il fatto che, dopo aver riscontrato problemi in seguito agli ultimi aggiornamenti, ho contatto il supporto clienti, e con molta pazienza, cordialit√†, e tempismo hanno risolto tutto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004155305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1660506606}
review:
This game is pretty fun, and im glad they released it for a CONTINUOUS free subcription. I did read/watch reviews on "after the one month subscription you have to pay for it". That is not true at all. Let me clear that up. Yes, there is a free one month subscription, but it has to do with being able to use a smg class, airforce, tanks, etc. After the one month is up you can only use specific things like the rifleman class, a truck to haul things, the AA guns, and some reserved smg classes. It's very limited but if you just wanna keep on playing and it doesn't matter what you use. You can keep playing for free. IMO when you wanna use other kinds of classes, they are limited with how many are allowed at a spawn point, and before you know it. The SMG class is all used up at times, and you might of been able to spawn as one maybe a hand full of times. Especially when a town is being hit and you have to defend it. Certain classes will run out quick. So seeing people compain about the subscription stuff isn't accurate, and doesn't matter. But if you intend to play this a lot, and want to use more. Then yes, you must pay a subcription fee. Hope this was helpfull, because this subscription thing wasn't clear for me, and i had to figure it out myself.

TL;DR After the one month subscription, you aren't forced too keep paying for it. That's only if you wanna use more than four allowed classes. Which are very basic. But if you don't care and just play to play, then you can keep playing for free with limited things.

review:
World War II Online si potrebbe definire una copia di arma, infatti ci assomiglia molto. Qello che per√≤ li differenzia √® la grafica, arma OP, WWIIO mh, ma questo consente anche di poter far giocare praticamente tutti; parlo io per esperienza che ho un  pentium e a grafica media pratcamente nessuno scatto. Il bello √® anche la realisticit√†, a modo del gioco ma realisticit√†. Es: fucile bolt-action anche non da cecchino 1 colpo e l'altro muore a meno che tu non lo prenda al piede, le case si distruggo (si fanno solo dei buchi nei muri) non completamente ma si vede che c'√® stata l'esplosione. 
Lo consiglio assolutamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032748219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1704858637}
review:
For those among you who aren't afraid of a learning curve and are fine with slightly dated graphics,WWII Online is definitely worth your time.

It is not a game for the immature: it is best played with tactical sense and planning, just like real war. Though it is visually underwhelming, it is far from outright ugly and only helps ensure solid performance on almost any machine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055495644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1825, 'last_played': 1509549929}
review:
Gra jest bardzo specyficzna i trzeba wziƒÖƒá na to poprawkƒô.
Od momentu debiutu, wiele, wiele lat temu (najstarsz MMO na ≈õwiecie), nie wiele siƒô zmieni≈Ça.
W zasadzie to minus, bo wszystko w tej grze jest bardzo stare. Mechanika, Interfejs, animacje, grafika.
Gra jest mocno symulacyjna i bli≈ºej jej do takich produkcji jak np. Arma 1-3, ni≈º do CoD.
Realizm oddany maksymalnie - jak by≈Ço to mo≈ºliwe 15 lat temu.
U≈ºywanie pojazd√≥w, broni, zasady gry - jak w symulacji.
Symulacja samolot√≥w (ka≈ºdy inny), symulacja dzia≈Ç (ka≈ºde inne), symulacja statk√≥w, piechoty i czo≈Çg√≥w ( tak - ka≈ºdy inny).
Gra jest trudna, wymaga po≈õwiƒôcenia, zginƒÖƒá bardzo ≈Çatwo. 
Stara mechanika sprawia, ≈ºe wiƒôkszo≈õƒá gry siƒô nudzisz, nudzis, biegasz, szukasz... a potem dostajesz kulkƒô, bo kto≈õ mia≈Ç wiƒôcej cierpliwo≈õci od ciebie.
Po drugie, gra jest p≈Çatna. Bez p≈Çatnego konta i aktywacji, pobiegniesz z karabinem jednostrza≈Çowym przeciw KM-om i czo≈Çgom...
Je≈ºeli chcesz mieƒá prawdziwƒÖ frajdƒô - trzeba niestety kupiƒá subskrypcjƒô.

Je≈ºeli nie lubisz symulacji, realizmu i masz w nosie starƒÖ i kiepskƒÖ grafikƒô, to nie jest gra dla ciebie.
Je≈ºeli lubisz symulacje totalne i nie przeszkadza ci minimalizm, to jak najbardziej za,
Z zalet - jeden serwer, najwiƒôksza chyba mapa w grach MMO, setki i tysiƒÖce graczy na raz. Dynamiczna kampania. Miasta po kilku godzinach walk, mogƒÖ siƒô zmieniƒá w gruzy.
I mimo tylu lat na rynku, przy braku zmian - ciƒÖgle ma fan√≥w. To co≈õ m√≥wi.
Ale nie jest to gra dla kazualowego gracza i mi≈Ço≈õnika CoD-a czy CS-a.
Pierwowz√≥r wszystki OFP, ArmA, WOT, WT, itd...

author: {'steamid': '76561197969358885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1686901701}
review:
Me parece increible que aun aguante y hace unos a√±os tenia gracia pese a las cuotas, pero a dia de hoy duelen los ojos solo con ponerte a jugar... Los graficos siguen igual que anta√±o, igual de malos,digo... antes eran simples pero cumplian, pero hoy ya no cumple ni el minimo, por lo menos para mi, por muy bien que este la idea del juego ya no llega solo con eso, sobre todo como tengas un monitor medio decente.

Tienes juegos que han intentando copiarlo como el Heroes and Generals, pero claro, este tiene los graficos decentes pero lo demas es solo medio pasable, no se puede tener todo.
En definitiva que como no seas un veterano combatiente te va a ser dificil "verlo" con buenos ojos, pero todo es posible...jeje

review:
Das Spiel WWII Online dreht sich wie zu erwarten um den zweiten Weltkrieg. In der epischen Schlacht um Emskirchen bek√§mpft man nicht nur die Alliierten, sondern auch den General Rainer Winkler (aka den Drachenlord). Zusammen mit seinen Kameraden rettet man Deutschland vor dem Untergang und der Unterdr√ºckung des Drachenlords.

Pro:
- sehr realistisch
- VR ready
- gute Sounds & gute Grafik
- einfache Steuerung (v.a. bei Panzern)

Contra:
- Drachenlord ist zu d√ºnn

Fazit:
Im gro√üen und ganzen kann ich das Spiel nur weiterempfehlen. Der Realismus beschreibt den Schrecken des 2. Weltkriegs detailgetr√§u. Einfach fantastisch was die Entwickler gezaubert haben lol

review:
Quite possibly the worst FPS I've ever played. Only played for a few minutes after basic training.

Movement feels like you are ice skating, graphics are slightly worse than lets say, Minecraft and crazy expensive subscription plans. I'm actually shocked to see anyone playing this at all.

If you want a good WWll shooter, get Red Orchestra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275817631', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1525458720}
review:
first thing 
its trash dont get it
if you do ignore me and get it expect the following:
no fullscreen just a tiny box you can barely see
a lot of walking i mean a lot 
if you manage to snatch a vehicle you cant exit them so your in the vehicle for the whole time
dont try flying youtube tutorials dont work i tried 
you will get shot and not know from where your screen will just dim until its complete black
navy: there is none 
you cant use the weapon you want because they are already taken so your stuck with the garand or some other semi gun or bolt
DO NOT i reapeat DO NOT use the AA or any other deployable gun you cant zoom in and have to guess where your shooting
the screenshots the game has are a complete lie 
the training the game has is the worst since the game sometimes doesnt work right and cant proceed making you restart the game and the tutorial 
you cant play the game if you dont do the turotial
the game has a wierd driving mechanism called manual not automatic so you press E then another button and another to change gears
this review is long i know your almost done reading
you wont see an enemy for your time in the game i've only seen 4 in my 3.4 hours playing
highly detailed game? no if you go in one of the cities not under attack theres barely any detail
you dont get to play your favorite nation all the time because you will have to wait 15 min or sometimes its unavailable due to aliens killing the united states or something i dont know
you see the screenshot with the infantry supporting the tanks eh not correct the infantry is just running around trying to find where ryan is so they can save him
oh markers DO NOT LOOK AT THE MARKERS THEY LIE. how do they lie you may ask they are markers to tell you where things are? and for asking that i smack you, the markers show in the worst places i ran for about 30 minutes trying to find a truck where the marker appeared never found it and it was in our spawn.
oh the inside of cars are poorly detailed the knobs looks like someone tried to design a straight line and messed up causing it to bend at a 134 degree angle. also get a welding mask or some sunglasses because the sun is brighter than my future (original joke right) 
This was Dr.John Zoidberg's review on WWII Online ill see you next time on the game blacklight retribution Zoidberg out WOOB WOOB WOOB WOOB WOOB.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970738257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1509152139}
review:
This game was released near the turn of the century, and I played it then. It was buggy, the devs were slow to update, and I remember for the first few days I couldn't even get it to load. I don't think anyone could. The devs were apologetic at the time, because they knew they had a plan. Which seems to be this:

Milk this cow for all it's worth. Do as little development as possible. Do not, for any reason, put any money into the game. Just charge ludicrous monthly fees for a game that was superceded by other games a decade ago. 

And a 16 year old game is now ALPHA on Steam? Come on, Steam, you're better than that. You have a responsibility not to push turds like this game off on your customers. Oh wait, you did let us buy No Man's Sky, didn't you? So I guess you can't consider this a one time Steam screw up. 

There are much better games than this available today. And there were much better games available than this one when it was released. Do yourself a favor and avoid it. Don't sully your hard drive with a game that can't even get the movement of the soldiers to look natural after 16 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336762078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1509108329}
review:
Great concept. Poor execution. 
The idea of a large scale ww2 game is great however this falls short in many areas. For example, the graphics look very dated, as if they haven't been updated since the game's 2001 release. Furthermore, very little is explained about the game with the exception of the most basic how to walk tutorial. Once you figure out what your doing, things don't get any better.

When heading online, first you are give a complex menu. Once you manage to get your head around it and launch into the battlefield, you run around for several hundred metres to get into a town you are meant to be attacking/defending and you get shot at from god knows where and you get killed. If you get yourself into the rare circumstance that is seeing an enemy player, chances are you won't be able to do anything with the very limited weapons that are available to you in the early game.

If you enjoy games where you run around and do nothing then this game is for you!

review:
Been playing this game for four minutes and it already has a massive impact on my life. The incredible visualisations of WWII Online is what made me love gaming in the first place.

Would reccomend playing the game in 4K if you truly would like to experience World War 2 : Online. The game does need heavy CPU and graphics card operation, but if you have dollar then it wouldn't matter anyway. 

$15.00/ month is what makes this game even more worthwhile, get access to insane weapons. My favourite is the dildo ofcourse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097559368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1614580686}
review:
First off, I wasn't expecting much when i installed it, but i was pleasantly surprised. It's definitely worth a try if your looking for something challenging, have alot of patience and don't care about graphics. 

But sadly, i have to give this a thumbs down because of the ridiculous subscription system. This game is simply not worth $180 a year to have access to all of the content. I would gladly pay a one-time fee to play this game. I would even be fine with having to buy permanent access to individual weapons and vehicles (for a reasonable price), But what this game offers simply isn't worth as much as it costs. 

Pros:
~Challenging
~Weapons are well balanced
~Community is generally helpful, if a bit snobby at times
~Better than it's closest counterpart, H&G

Cons
~Dated engine, gunplay, and graphics
~Tanks absolutely dominate the battlefield
~Walking simulator at times
And by far the worst part of the game;
~The subscription system.

review:
Start game.

Screen resolution is tiny.

Set resolution to my desktop resolution.

Game sets resolution to literally twice that so I can no longer click on the settings menu.

Configuration tool does nothing.

Re-installing does nothing.

Mfw rendered game unplayable within literally 2 minutes.

10/10 just kill me already.




EDIT: Apparently you can fix this by disabling DPI scaling by editing the properties of the .exe. Still kind of a bullshit issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968564926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4792, 'last_played': 1511109263}
review:
Als liefhebber van dit spel is het lastig om een neutrale recentie te schrijven, maar ga het toch proberen. Eerst zal ik kort wat vertellen over het spel, daarna wat voors en tegens op een rijtje zetten.

Het spel speelt zich af in een grote open wereld en deze map is gebaseerd op West Europa. Het doel is om steden te veroveren op de tegenstander, dit is mogelijk door het veroveren van commandposts (gebouwen met een vlaggetje). Veroveren is mogelijk door je als speler (wel als infanterie) in dit gebouw te begeven. 

Beide zijden (geallierden en de axis) hebben een HC (high command). Dit zijn officieren die bepalen welke steden aangevallen en dus veroverd kunnen worden. Dit zijn de steden waar de gevechten op dat moment te vinden zijn.
Zij verplaatsen ook de brigades. Brigades bestaan uit een bepaalde hoeveelheid voortuigen, kanonnen en infanterie.
Als je dood gaat in het spel wordt jouw gekozen personage, of kanon van de beschikbare voorraad van deze brigade afgehaald en het kost enkele uren voordat deze weer in de brigade beschikbaar komt. Een deel van de tactiek van dit spel is dan ook om te proberen om ervoor te zorgen dat de tegenstander niet genoeg voorraden meer heeft in zijn brigade.

Voor:
-Er zit veel tactiek in het spel, zoals proberen om vijandelijke brigades uit te putten
-Er zijn veel verschillende squads actief en in een squad spelen = leuker en deze spelers kunnen je helpen
-Zeer complexe mechanisme wat betreft explosies ed., het is daardoor een uitdaging te weten welke tank je met welk kanon en van welke afstand kan uitschakelen. Tevens moet je dan ook nog leren waar je moet richten
-Een gewone map van de omgeving waarop je vijanden die je ziet kan vermelden. Afstand bepalen van wat je ziet moet je leren (moeilijk). Voordeel als je dit kan is dat je medespelers zien waar de vijand vandaan komt
-Grote map
-Veel verschillende wapens (moet je wel premium subscription hebben)
-Gratis te spelen als je alleen met een geweer rond loopt. Rifleman lijkt saai, maar is wel 1 van de beste wapens in het spel

Tegen:
-Zeer complex (het duurt wel de nodige uren voordat je weet hoe bepaalde voortuigen te besturen zijn, hoe de wapens werken en je ze dus effectief kan gebruiken, hoe je de map gebruikt om vijandelijke posities te bepalen en te markeren)
-Verouderde graphics
-Kan zonder subscription alleen rifle gebruiken (vinden veel spelers niet leuk genoeg)
-Kan gebeuren dat je een kansloos gevecht probeerd te winnen, omdat je brigade bijna alleen nog infanterie met rifle hebt en je wordt aangevallen door meerdere vijandelijke tanks
-Prijzig als je subscription (met alle wapens) wilt

Conclusie: 
Als je van een tactisch spel houdt in een open wereld dat ook nog moeilijk is om onder de knie te krijgen dan is dit een aanrader. Heb je weinig tijd en wil je gewoon beetje knallen, dan kan je beter battlefield of call of duty gaan spelen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324896502', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1540158637}
review: This world war two first person shooter is a great strategy based game. When I first played it, I was impressed by how many players were on such an old game. What I liked about it was how it was tactical and realistic for an older shooter, also how the maps were so long and there was a lot of transport. This game requires a lot movement, strategy, and teamwork in order   to win. What i disliked about the game is that the controls were very complex and crash sometimes or would freeze because of how old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129517056', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1584387016}
review:
tl:dr - is a persistent ww2 mmo game, based on the Western Front.

[h1] Main Review [/h1]
You have the whole, Western Front in one map. Compared to other ww2 games like Heroes & Generals, sure they have a campaign map that covers the whole western front but this game takes it to another level. Every inch' of ground is actually generated and fought for, what you see is a living world, a persistent world where players can shape the war themselves.

This is the Western Front, so you'll only have the Allies and the Axis, sorry no Comintern..
Axis, being the baddie germans under Hitler's control or the Allies fighting together trying to take down the Hitler's tyrannical expansion over Europe.

In the Allies side of things, you have 3 countries to fight under. You have the tea drinking Commonwealth (I'll be calling the British as the commonwealth), the baguette loving French, and the freedom loving A'murica! Who only come in later stages of campaigns.

on each faction & countries. You have the Navy, Infantry(& armoured, paratroopers, etc.) and Air Force. All players are expected to cooperate and play with teamwork in order to succeed, players can also command individual armies, assigning them on attack/defend/qrf missions. And I also think supplies is player controlled, haven't really looked into that. Any player can choose any branch they wish to play.

However Play-for-Free accounts will only be locked on certain amount of roles on each branch such as Rifleman and SMG(smg is unlocked at level 2 if I remember correctly. If not then you're only locked on Rifleman) and won't be able to progress from Recruit to Private. But that does not matter as that by no means DOES NOT hinder your gameplay experience. So essentially subscriptions are just there if you want to progress through the ranks and play different roles, no any other restrictions are present other than those two reasons.

review:
100% deacuerdo con los analisis de Zakalin y Erasmo (recomiendo su lectura).

S√≥lo a√±adir un par de cositas... Estoy deacuerdo que haya gente a quien no le guste, faltar√≠a m√°s, pero TODO aquel que DESACONSEJE jugar a este juegazo no sabe de lo que est√° hablando o no sabe jugar en equipo.

Lo he jugado hace unos 5 a√±os (no por Steam) y si... sigue igual, con sus gr√°ficos, sonidos y animaciones simples. Pero si te apasiona la simulaci√≥n y la estrategia b√©lica en 194...5, este es tu juego, perd√≥n este es EL juego. 

Y eso que todab√≠a no les perdono que no exista la facci√≥n rusa, pero 300.000 km2 de TOTAL libre acci√≥n por tierra mar o aire, por 800mb de descarga, para m√≠ no tiene precio.

ACTUALIZO RESE√ëA:
He aqu√≠ otro ejemplo de como un juego que era F2P se ha convertido en P2W. Hace un a√±o aproximadamente desinstal√© el juego y no aconsejaba a nadie jugarlo, debido a que pusieron suscripciones mensuales y limitaron el contenido gratuito a s√≥lo poder usar fusileros, tambi√©n a√±adieron DLCs bastante absurdas. Ahora mismo es pay2win, si no pasas por caja no tendr√°s acceso al mejor contenido (armas, tanques, aviones, barcos). 

Dicho esto  y aunque el juego recientemente ha desbloqueado algo m√°s de contenido para los jugadores que no pagan, sigue manteniendo las suscripciones mensuales para desbloquear todo el contenido y sus DLCs absurdas. As√≠ que muy a mi pesar no recomiendo este juego a nadie, (a no ser que te guste ser el pato de feria de los m√°s pudientes).

author: {'steamid': '76561198006886600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1692469372}
review:
Been playing since day one back in 2001. This game is great and I can't believe CRS is still trucking along. 

Very steep learning curve and you'll need a joystick to fly or drive. It's a great plane/tank/ship simulator mixed in with a FPS all on area with one of the largest mmo maps ever.

It is old graphics, but the game play is great once you learn everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013409405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1508186952}
review:
I played this game alot "back in the days" and loved it and after 8years off i decided to try the steam release and see what improved..well not so much

The graphic and game engine is outdated years ago..like least 10years ago, even if graphic doesnt matter so much it feels very cheap, buggy, clumpsy and stiff

Infantry is smooth as a lego character and u cant jump

vehicles are bulky and some feel u drive a soap on a wet iceroad 

hitareas feels random and surprise of the day if u hit or not

small mini lag spikes makes it feel enemies are killing u after u hitted them, or that u hit them but miss

Mouse sensitivity are horrible 

U get stucked everywere in invisible terrain 

"biggest game world" yea...like that matters when fight is concentrated on small areas, yes u can fly to other map to bomb a town, or swim over to England...but what does it matter..u cant do a shit there if theres not a "AO" that only HC can put...in frontline towns only, so no its just a cheap marketing trick, yes its a big map...but ur limited to 98% most of time

One big positive thing is tho that its a one big campaign, not "matches" or "maps" like in games like warthunder or world of tanks etc

Community is mostly good, lots of hardcore fans, i was one too once, but the game has just fall behind is so many areas and time has run away from it.

Its not worth the monthly price and free to play? sure if u only want to play as a rifleman...

Its impressed that it survived for 16years
And the whole idea is great with potentials
But its not unique anymore and very outdated and the improvments over 16years are a joke...even if its by a small team and company.

Its fun sometimes....but not that fun anymore..not for that price

author: {'steamid': '76561197989177711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1509829465}
review:
First off let me preface this by saying, I like hard core games and penalty for death. And I don't walking for 15 minutes to get shot by a sniper who I don't even know where they are.

But it's why I like RO2 more than Heroes and generals. Keep in mind I played this in 2001 and yes I would agree that this game hasn't really evolved as much as EVE Online has in a similar timeframe, but is has aged well. I still don't like the fact you can't get out of vehcile and pick up a weapon and the graphics are really dated, but the game play is what I remember and I just get tired of Heroes and Generals DLC crap and grind and all that BS where you can survive several shots where in this game one hit = one kill.

And armor penetration system is way better than World of Tanks. And its one big mega map with infantry, tanks, trucks, artillary,  planes, and boats all interacting with each other.

Still need an hour long tutorial to learn how to play and I am not even going to try to learn how to fly... So yes. It has a lot of flows. But its still better than Heroes and Generals and Call of Duty (I still like RO2 slightly better since its setting and focus on realism though).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991286750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2725, 'last_played': 1624058866}
review:
O jogo possui mec√¢nicas realistas muito boas, por√©m peca em cobrar t√£o caro (8 d√≥lares/m√™s por um plano super limitado e 15 d√≥lares/m√™s pelo acesso total liberado) por um jogo t√£o velho e ultrapassado.

Comecei a jogar WWII Online em 2005. Fui e voltei diversas vezes porque at√© hoje nunca foi feito um jogo com a mesma proposta: um simulador online massivo de guerra. 

Antes do jogo entrar na Steam estava √† beira da fal√™ncia. Agora deve ter ganhado um novo f√¥lego.

Mas enquanto os desenvolvedores n√£o se tocarem de que sua pr√≥pria gan√¢ncia √© o que ir√° matar esse jogo, nada poder√° ser feito. Certamente pre√ßos menores ir√£o fazer com que muito mais jogadores comecem a achar que vale a pena pagar e assim o jogo crescer√° e os desenvolvedores arrecadar√£o pelo volume maior.
