author: {'steamid': '76561197980810850', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1709607127}
review:
*my hours are in the standalone game. Downloaded Steam version just to leave a positive review. Player since 2008.

Incredible single server combined arms world war 2 mmo. focus on simulation and accuracy (although dated) provides one of the largest game maps created with a full sandbox of world war 2 faction based weapons and vehicles. Track IR works in game to add to the realism either in the air or on land in tanks. Ranks are gained allowing you access to better equipment. The fanbase is solid and long time users are there to help newbies learn the ropes of an old goldie. Its old for sure but dont let that fool you. Loads of our favorite games are touched by time but still nothing exists that compares to a game with nearly no ai thats populated with real people from all over the world raising hell on the frontlines. Massive multiplayer the way it was meant to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052903881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1557615006}
review:
First off, don't write many reviews so go easy on me. But this is a game that vexs me with a love hate scenario.  Ive been gaming for almost 20 years. This game has graced my desktop once before in 2011. Even then, i felt the immense potential in what this could be.  But now its 2017....

I understand this game is under management and the player base is loyal. They say that the new management has great things in mind. And as much i hope they do.  However, In the games current state i cannot break myself to pay a subscription for a game that hasnt been optimised or worked into for almost 2 decades.  I think it great they still provide a Free to Try model. To give players a taste of what it "could" be like. But your locked out of so many things i feel it doesnt do it any justice. Offer the poorest light tank, or one air role.  So that free to try players can sample air, land and sea.

NOTE: This is for the developers and owners of the game.  I want to make this a positive review because I do want your product to succeed. and I hope you take my advice in a positive manner.  

-Free to try model needs more. (Never forget, increasing player base increases revenue. More people playing will generate more hype, which also equals revenue. 

-Dont sell a product on hopes and dreams. Congrats on your new buy, but this baby needs alot of work.  Loyal players who have subbed for years need to show you care. $15 a month for this? no....no..

-Offer more  buy options.  A La carte vehicles and infantry loadouts.  subscription is 2000's market ideology. your seriously going to hurt yourself in the long run. 

-infrastructure. Alot of money has gone into this product. with the recent steam launch you now have a player base. which will go pretty quick if you show no or slow development. keep them engaged.  Events, news, youtube, twitch, alot of cool new tools since the early 2000's

-Thumbs up, Really hope you guys can wake up this sleeping giant. thank you for your time. hooa

author: {'steamid': '76561198026085248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8075, 'last_played': 1509010402}
review:
Battlefield 1939-1945 in Europe AKA World War 2 Online:


EDIT: THIS WAS A POSITIVE RATING UNTIL CAMPAIGN 143 ENDED ~
NOW YOU NEED TO PAY 7.99 A MONTH TO DO ANYTHING BUT DIE A LOT

Fuck these greedy bastards. Game was amazing until this. 

Looks and plays like Battlefield 1945 mixed with an old school war-game. Join a brigade in Army, Navy, or Airforce. Switch anytime between personas. 
Every Campaign starts in 1939 with Tier 1 Technology. Starts with Germany vs England and France.
By Tier 3, USA joins. Which is usually just in time to save Allies from annihilation.


Pro:
Mix between realism and strategy. Anyone can become part of the high command in time or you can pay.
Rewarding on many levels.
GIANT OPEN MAP. 

Middle ground:
Graphics look like 2000-ish era. Which is useful when battling with dozens of tanks and troops on both sides fighting. Literally no lag.
Sherman Tanks are OP as hell. Literally takes 2 or 3 Tiger Tanks to kill a Sherman Tank.

Con:
Learning curve is huge.
No getting in or out of vehicles.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My biggest complaint is being unable to leave vehicles, or get into vehicles. Making the game feel more strategic in many ways but frusterating when your tire gets shot out and you have to respawn because of it. 

Learning curve is pretty steep I gotta say. Even after the tutorial I struggled to actually understand what the hell I had to do. Having said that, with every bit I started to understand, it drove me to want to play more and more!

review:
I don't believe that a game where devs have been focused on milking cash for 16 years with their insane subscribtion plans and have not done any actual work to improve the product has any place on Steam.

It's exactly the same like it was 10 years ago when I last played it. It's clear that even now F2P will be severly limited and focus will be on subscribtions of 8-16 eur per month.

Devs promise new content, but I believe they should focus on reworking existing game before making new stuff. How about UI that is up to modern day standards or tutorials for new players, or in game help menu for overcomplicted controls? Or perhaps bug and glitch fixes....or graphics improvements? There's like a TON of work to be done before pushing out new content!

With all the money they have milked over the years I think improvements is what they owe to their playerbase:)

review: Just not for me I guess, just got shot by a lot tof things I never saw. Never actually saw an enemy soldier, whether I team played or moved around, nothing. Even when I was killed right at spawn, nothing. Maybe it's  ahigher leaning curve than I care for, who knows. But, despite trying just about everything suggested in the community and guides, I can't ever see myyself paying for this game, and I always prefer to pay a sub. Repeititive, lousy graphics, bad gui and comical tutorial. Nice team play game, or at least the possibility of it. But too dull overall to do that grind of learning. And for the record, the only other combat game I play is Aces High III, never played call of duty in my life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045792460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1507301397}
review:
When you're playing WWII Online, just remember that it's not like other games. The gameplay is incredibly realistic, almost to the point where you have to be paying complete attention to it to even remotely understand. I remember playing a match (though I can't remember where it was), where I thought the graphics was absolute bollocks during the play. Then, I closed my eyes for a second, and all of a sudden the game had an entirely new meaning. It was insane the way WWII Online could just become something so different when you take a look into the all out war on a massive scale.

Another thing you should note about WWII Online is that it's easy to get a headache playing it. Not because the graphics are bad, but because of how many highly detailed damage models the game is riddled with and how complex they are. Soon enough your head will fill to the brim and the rest will just look like smoke to you. Just turn it off and give it a play the next day.

If you don't like the game, you'll definitely at least enjoy reading through the serious historical accuracy, and picking apart the game itself and all of the artistic values that go into making it the complexity that it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999170037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10219, 'last_played': 1619803896}
review:
After a few years of not playing, I see the same issues exist. To list just a few;

The ability of infantry to jump from a 3 story building and still function without any difficulties. Bear in mind, this is the same infantry that cannot jump at all or swim very well due to the "weight of your gear".

The "people" who can snap shot in any direction instantly for a kill. Including, when they are running away from you, with their back to you, you fire at and hit them, they instantly fire back and kill you through a window, 300 meters away. Mind, 180 degrees from where they were "facing".

The inability of pilots to change missions/targets while in flight.  You take off intending to go to point A, your mission is to point A. You fly 20 minutes toward point A, too late, town lost, however point B could use you.  No way to swap missions in order to see chat or target info while in flight.  Must go all the way back to airfield, land, despawn, change brigades or missions, start all over.

HC not being as communicative/active as they need to be.  I understand they are volunteers... but at the same time.. [b][u]they volunteered[/u][/b]!  Some days the past week or so, there has been as many as 8 or 12 hc on at a time and yet, "silence".  To include not answering pm's, and I am not typing about for 10, 15 minutes as they were busy. I am typing about for an hour or more in several cases as brigades depleted and fallbacks were missed.  This has always been the largest flaw in the game for me. Having to rely on volunteers to make things happen, brigade changes, swapping, setting fallbacks etc.

The enemy shooting you, with hand carried weapons, around corners, through walls/concrete/sandbags, buildings, walking through walls, materializing in front of you, ignoring your rounds into center mass.  Lag, packet loss server hiccup, whatever you want to call it, it is an issue and extremely frustrating.

Warping - Yes both sides can use it, but it is as frustrating as mr SUPERLMG jumping from a 3 story building unharmed.

The ability for the enemy to be INSIDE the barracks spawn and kill you before you even start moving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197226889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1659618367}
review:
Si vous cherchez un jeux Pew Pew je fonce dans le tas sans reflechir et bien ... Passez votre chemin ce jeux n'est pas fais pour vous.

WW2 ONLINE est un jeux Oppossant Fran√ßais et Anglais (+US) contre les Allemands durant la 2nd guerre mondial avec plus d'une centaine de vari√©t√© de vehicules d'armes d'avions etc... et tous sa sur une map avec une ligne de front de plus de 800 Kilometre a taille r√©el bien sur :)

Bon certe les graphismes et le sons sont vraiment mais alors vraiment depass√© (2001) mais l'immersion est la ! Des assauts coordonn√© avec plus d'une centaine de joueurs incluant Char, infanterie, artillerie, chasseur, bombardier etc ... Et ici la moindre erreurs vous coute chers et vous ne serez jamais d'ou sa viendra !

Bref je recommande a tous les amateur de jeux massivement multijoueur qui aime la strategie ainsi que les jeux de simulation militaire assez complexe , a oui a notez que la prise en main pou un debutant sera assez difficile

PS: Arretez de chialez en disant << Oui mais faut payez donc c'est pas FreeToPlay >> supportez les devs merde ! Il sont comme vous il trvaillent pas gratuit hein !

author: {'steamid': '76561198204680941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1538501802}
review:
This game is dead confusing. The Screen is a tiny, nonadjustable square/rectangle, leaving black space on all edges, making it harder to see smaller objects. The graphics definitely need updating! Tutorials aren't particularly useful as they only show basic controls, which are clunky as hell... The character walks like he's wearing a 60lb suit of lead, and has a slow regenerating stamina metre. Driving is a chore, I was confused as all hell when I began to drive... The mechanics are slidy and make the screen consistently shake. To have any fun, you need to pay ¬£7.99 (Which I won't be) for prenium, which basically LETS you ply with a wider variety of vehicles. The camera sensitivity is slow and glidy, too, and switching weapons   is tediously boring and has unnecessary mechanics, make it more like the Half Life weapon GUI! There is one mechanic that is great, whilst running etc, press e or q and the character will look 90 degrees in the chosen direction, which I'd like to see more games do... So basically, the game is good, from a 2001 standpoint, but it just doesn't meet modern 2017 standards. Also, the games community is pretty small, making it hard to run into anyone on the battlefield.

EDIT: THIS GAME SHOULD JUST BE CALLED "POINTLESSLY WALKING AROUND SIMULATOR!"

In all fairness the only fun part of the game is the OFFLINE PRACTICE! And thats saying something. Also, FIX THE DAMNED GLIDING.

EDIT 2: Okay, now I have a bit more playtime in this... erm... game(?) I can solemnly say that the game is good IN CONCEPT, but in execution, its absolutely appalling. Maybe if it had;

A) A change in game engine to make it look better, but still optimal for low spec laptops and PCs
B) FIX THE GODDAMN GLIDING, Its like the player is ice skating when walling around, sure its not a huge problem but when irl do you decide to begin gliding before stopping?
C) Make ranking up a LOT EASIER! I've had the game for months, sure I haven't played much of it though, but I'm still rank 1! And all the good things to unlock are unlocked at like, level 3 +.

Also the animations for sprinting are pretty comical over serious lol.

EDIT 3: I still don't get why this game had been in early access for 17 years...

EDIT 4: FUck me I used to be bad at spelling

review: I like this game a lot, but I have a few complaints. First of all I think the $15 price point for the premium addition is a little too high, and the standard edition si good but does not have nearly enough content to be worth upgrading to. I beleive that the standard edition should be replaced by the premium edition at the $8 price point. With the premium edition being $15 dollars it is trying to compete with monsters in the MMO industry such as World of Warcraft. I believe if you made this change it would bring many more paying customers to the game which in turn means more money. I love this game especcialy the sniper class, but paying 15 dollars is jsut not worth it, Another idea is allowing the standard accounts to pick 2 extra items to include in there account, wether that is infantry or vehicles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003103654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4254, 'last_played': 1517761778}
review:
WWII Online has been around for a long time. It is a massive simulation of WWII Europe. 

Its dated graphics, clunky controls, and somewhat steep learning curve can lead to a rough few opening minutes in the game. Dont give up! This is not a BF1 or COD. It is a deep and thoughtful simulation. Since its original launch, it has provided me with some of my most memorable gaming memories. 

I recall lying in a field clutching my rifle as two opposing armored columns converge on my position, rounds flying overhead, the din of battle drowning out all other sounds. From my position i could see the enemy infantry dismounting trucks to the rear of the enemy armor. From my exposed position, i began picking them off, secure in the knowledge that they would never look for a sniper lying in the open with only tracer fire and smoke to conceal me. I lay there, tanks dueling all around me, enemy infantry falling as I squeezed off my shots.

I dont recall how many of my targets fell. I never saw the errant tank round that ended me. I just recall the whole scenario that played out over 10 years ago. 

Its that kind of memory that keeps me coming back and its one of many. From dogfighting above contested cities to taking part in an armored assault, this game is gaming memory machine.

Use the training resources in game to get your footing. Locate an active battle and spawn in. Join a squad to REALLY get solid guidance and advice. In short order you will find yourself engaged. 

I cannot recommend this game enough for any simulation, history buff. I have played from its original launch day and keep coming back. I cant think of any other game that has pulled me back so many times and for so long as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981789943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9509, 'last_played': 1688903293}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel Rundabout 2013-2014 bereits gespielt mit einer l√§ngeren Pause und bin mit dem Steam Release jetzt wieder zur√ºckgekehrt.
Ich verstehe das es sehr verwirrend sein kann f√ºr den Anf√§nger. Das war ich auch. Aber man muss sich √ºber eines unbedingt im klaren sein: Dieses Spiel ist eine SIMULATION. Kein Arcade Shooter!!! Man sollte alles verwerfen, was man √ºber konventionelle Shooter wei√ü und sich stattdessen eine Geschichtsdoku reinziehen. Das hilft mehr. Man sollte also eine Neigung zu authentischen Settings und historischer akuratesse haben um mit diesem Spiel etwas anfangen zu k√∂nnen.
Die Steuerung ist ungewohnt aber durchaus so gewollt. Als Infanterist dreht man sich langsamer und man  braucht beim zielen mehr Feingef√ºhl. Herumsprinten und sich innerhalb von 0.5 Sekunden umdrehen wird so verhindert.
Panzer und Trucks fahren sich nicht einfach mit WASD. Der Motor muss angestellt werden und man muss, je nach Drehzahl, schalten. Wieder ... ungewohnt aber so gewollt. Das ist eine Ebene an Komplexit√§t f√ºr die man einfach eine Neigung haben muss und die dem Spiel mehr Tiefgang gibt.

Auch das Fliegen ist ungewohnt, wenn man nur War Thunder Arcade kennt. Man BRAUCHT einen Joystick und man muss lernen das Flugzeug abheben zu lassen und auch in der Luft zu halten. Auch hier handelt es sich um eine Simulation nicht um einen Arcade Shooter.

Ich verstehe das eine Simulation keinen Reiz ausmacht f√ºr die meisten Leute, aber die schlechten Reviews hat dieses Spiel nicht verdient. Das, was dieses Spiel sein will schafft es auch: Eine authentische 2. Weltkrieg Simulation als MMORPG. Wer schon wei√ü das er keine Lust hat sich ein wenig in ein komplexes Spiel einzuarbeiten (Wie alle MMO's komplex sind) und sich einzuarbeiten in komplexe Steuerung (Wie alle Simulationen komplexe Steuerungen haben), der soll doch weg bleiben. Wer denkt so etwas k√∂nnte einem gefallen: Probiert es aus!

Einziges Manko: Das Teamplay ist leider tats√§chlich relativ schlecht in diesem Spiel. Die Kommunikationskan√§le bestehen halt haupts√§chlich aus Textchats der teilweise zu schnellebig ist, um Informationen zu sehen. Schreiben ist sowieso sehr zeitaufwendig wenn es hektisch zugeht. Die Devs haben jedoch gesagt das im Laufe der n√§chsten Zeit ein integriertes VOIP System hinzugef√ºgt wird. Hoffentlich schafft dies Abhilfe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116141483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1778, 'last_played': 1651540732}
review: I have grown up around this game. My dad played it during the original beta until now. He was one of the people that gave rides to the rats in his airplane to help them develop a more realistic feel to them. And I've played this game on my own account for the last 5 or 6 years. I love this game. And when I heard it was coming on steam, I was thrilled. It's been amazing to see so many new people to the game. I recommond this game very highly, but I'm also a little biased

author: {'steamid': '76561198026809950', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11465, 'last_played': 1664569094}
review: Pretty good game if you're looking for a bit of strategy with a bit of combined arms combat. It has a Navy, Airforce, and Army with a full compliment of vehicles and weaponry to choose from. Not for someone who wants a fast-paced shooter. The gameplay is similar to a World War II, slower-paced Arma 2 CTI mission with less-advanced graphics. The developers are constantly on Discord, and very responsive to players. This is not a free-to-play game, however, as you must pay a subscription to have access to a majority of the content. If you do not wish to pay a subscription, then Riflemen are always available to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198406548453', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 38337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37186, 'last_played': 1620084482}
review:
Sorry to say. This game. Don't waste your money on it. Go get something that works. Not only that but the staff are rude, they are lazy, and will not return your money for any reason... And they charge a monthly sub.. For something thats outdated, has more bugs than most pre release games (and this one has been worked on since 1999) and now they have a new broken system that is supposed to auto depsawn laggers. However this is also a buggy system and ends up kicking players who connections are fine. 

All in all. save your money for a one time buy game. One with better graphics and actually works. Seriously, save your time and money.

If you dont care about up to date grapics, and you do ejoy a good large community, long campains lasting up to a month or more at a a time.

This is the game for you. 

Mechanics are great as well! Planes, tanks, infantry. All Great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040203279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4087, 'last_played': 1694198527}
review:
Some people probably won't be able to get past the outdated graphics and that understandable. Hopefully the steam release allows the devs to hire some graphics artists and start a quick update cycle. Additionally, the learning curve for new plays is quite steep because the tutorial and control schemes are somewhat convoluted. However, if you are like me and enjoy playing games with a "purpose" where its not just match after match of the same thing with no real objective besides getting the most kills than you will really enjoy this game.  The massive scale and combination of air, land and sea action makes for a truly amazing experience.  

If they could bring the graphics and the infantry gameplay up-to-date then they would really have a mass market product here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977417954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 9600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5782, 'last_played': 1550804667}
review: Fun game, massive scale, graphics are dated but still playable, and they are updating some of the more outdated ones. Infantry game is fun and rewarding. Tank combat is very well done with tanks having weak points that you can use to your advantage if you take the time to learn them. I give it two thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976742360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1506278881}
review: This game is great. It is, bar none, one of the greatest WW2 tactical experiences available. Ignore a majority of these negative reviews - they are fucking retarded Call of Duty players with absolutely no patience. The game's strong point is its tank and air combat. People will bitch about anything, including units like better infantry weapons and tanks/planes being restricted to subscribers. Running costs aren't zero. Be glad you get to play for free at all and stop bitching or man up and pay for the damn thing. It's been around since 2001. Your shitty review based on your Counter-Strike experiences aren't going to matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030943971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1506853802}
review:
The running around part is fun.
The [i]getting shot at from god knows which direction[/i] is also somewhat fun.

The getting spawncamped by a sherman is not so fun.
Also not fun is only having access to a Rifle or a SMG, without any option to take out said Sherman without shelling out $7.99 monthly.

It's not fun.

More fun games about the second world war are abound, even in the "large-scale battle" genre that this game is included in. Sure, the persistent battlefield is cool, but that just means that each identical not fun battle continues forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136576858', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1506789368}
review:
World War II Online ist ein Massively Multiplayer Online First-Person Shooter (MMOFPS) und Simulationsspiel, welches an der Westfront in Zeiten des Zweiten Weltkriegs spielt. Das Spiel bietet eine strategische und anhaltend gewinnbare Kampagne, welche sowohl in der Planung als auch in den K√§mpfen vollst√§ndig spielergetrieben ist.

WWII Online bietet eine gigantische 300.000 Quadratmeter gro√üe, zusammenh√§ngende, nicht aus einzelnen Zonen bestehende, Spielwelt. Dieser Ma√üstab sorgt f√ºr eine wirklich umfassende combined arms PVP Spielerfahrung. Die Kommunikation zwischen den im Kampf befindlichen Armee-, Luftwaffe- und Marineeinheiten wird den Ausgang bestimmen! Es gibt keinerlei Restriktionen in der Anzahl an Spielern, welche im Kampfgeschehen interagieren k√∂nnen.

Alle Waffen, Fahrzeuge, Munitionsarten und Sprengk√∂rper operieren basierend auf realistischen Werten. Wir konnten dies durch direkten Zugang zu historischen Archiven, ein Netzwerk von milit√§rischen Experten sowie durch unsere fortschrittlich propriet√§re Spiel-Engine sicherstellen. Panzerungen in Panzern und Flugzeuge, sowie deren internen Komponenten, sind auf den Millimeter genau modelliert. 

Unsere Schadensmodelle sind sehr detailliert, wobei jede Komponente in Fahrzeugen einschlie√ülich Mannschaft, Waffenspeicher, Gastanks und mehr zerst√∂rbar ist! Du schie√üt nicht einfach auf eine Hitbox! Mit jedem abgefeuerten Schuss finden mehrere Berechnungen statt, die die Auswirkungen des Einschlags bestimmen. Einige der Berechnungen sind: Winkel der Schr√§gstellung, Geschwindigkeit des Geschosses beim Aufprall, Dicke der Panzerung, Splitter, R√ºstungsdurchdringung, Besch√§digung von einzelnen Panzerkomponenten, etc.

Wie im realen Leben wird der Ausgang eines Gefechts durch Strategie, Taktik, Zusammenarbeit und deiner F√§higkeit mit deiner Waffe umzugehen bestimmt. In WWII Online gibt es keine speziellen Power Ups oder √§hnliche Items zu kaufen, um einen besonderen Vorteil gegen√ºber anderen Spielern zu erlangen. Im Gegenteil, jedes Gewehr ist genauso t√∂dlich, egal ob Premium Abonnent oder freier Spieler. 

Seit unserer urspr√ºnglichen Ver√∂ffentlichung im Jahr 2001, hat unsere Community und unser Spiel unvergessliche und herausfordernde Gameplay-Erlebnisse mit sich gebracht. WWII Online ist in Bezug auf den Ma√üstab der Karte, Realismus und der Wiederspielbarkeit un√ºbertroffen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008809808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1670165571}
review:
Es muy d√≠ficil hacer un cr√≠tica de un juego que me ha dado tanto y que sin embargo hoy en d√≠a, aunque me pese, no est√° a la altura de los tiempos que corren. He estado al frente de una squad, la 250H y he disfrutado como nunca lo hab√≠a hecho y creo que como nunca lo volvere a hacer, as√≠ que lo primero es mostrar todo mi apoyo a este proyecto y desearle la mejor de las suertes.

El coraz√≥n me pide poner por las nubes sus caracteristicas positivas: mapa enorme, campa√±a persistente, rangos, presencia de los tres cuerpos del ejercito y una capacidad de inmersi√≥n en la acci√≥n de lo mejor que he vivido nunca en un videojuego. Adem√°s, a todo esto le sumamos una comunidad volcada con el juego, squads coordinadas por un mando controlado por jugadores, compa√±erismo, buen rollo y en definitiva una experiencia √∫nica.

En el campo de la simulaci√≥n estamos sin duda ante una obra de arte inmersiva a m√°s no poder.   

Sin embargo el juego no ha aguantado el paso del tiempo, 16 a√±os son demasiado y el apartado t√©cnico est√° completamente desfasado, los gr√°ficos son malisimos. 

 Solo espero que el lanzamiento en Steam haga que alg√∫n mecenas se de cuenta de el fil√≥n poco, poquisimo, explotado que este juegazo supone y poder as√≠ actualizarlo debidamente, nadie ha sido capaz de profundizar en la idea de jugabilidad tan atractiva que plantea.Espero  que las ratas ( CRS. Cornered Rats Software )  consigan el dinero necesaro para actualizar esta joya, porque hoy por hoy el pobre est√° muy muy viejuno.
Y con todo lo peor que tiene el juego es el precio, excesivamente caro y con un sistema de subscripciones mensuales solo al alcance hoy en dia de grandes titulos, en eso tampoco a sabido adaptarse a los tiempos que corren y una subscripci√≥n mensual de 12 ‚Ç¨ es m√°s un lastre que una ventaja, hoy en d√≠a nos gastamos m√°s dinero en videojuegos pero para subscribirse necesitamsos mucho m√°s

Larga vida y mucha suerte para este juegazo, hoy por hoy lo veo viejisimo.

Ex-CO 250H Zalacain

author: {'steamid': '76561198152761217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2020, 'last_played': 1709675976}
review:
Kurz und knackig: Das Spiel bekommt die Kurve nicht mehr.

Ich habe mir 2001 das original Spiel gekauft. Da hat es wirklich Spa√ü gemacht. Kein anderes Spiel hat mich jemals so gefesselt wie dieses. 

Heute? Ich sage mal so, ich hatte noch nie so viel Frust in diesem Spiel wie in den letzten vier Tagen.

Ich habe in diesem Spiel noch nie so viel hirnlose Leute rumrennen sehen wie die paar Tage. Die verheizen die paar wenigen guten Einheiten, die 1944 zur Verf√ºgung stehen, im Rekordtempo. Unterst√ºtzung von denen? Fehlanzeige.
Kommunikation? Gegen 0. Gegnerische Einheiten melden? F√§llt denen ja nicht mal im Traum ein. Das √ºberwiegend unf√§hige High Command tut sein √ºbriges.

Weitere Minuspunkte

- √úberwiegend total veraltete 3D Modelle
- Veraltete Texturen
- 2001 angek√ºndigte Einheiten sind bis heute nicht implementiert
- √úberall B√ºsche und B√§ume
- Geb√§ude sind oft unsinnig plaziert
- Total √ºberfl√ºssige und dumme KI
- Wichtige Dinge fehlen, damit z. B. Neulinge eine halbwegs realistische Chance haben. Z. B. eine aufsteckbare Hohlladungsgranate f√ºr die Pak 36, um gegen Sherman etc. was ausrichten zu k√∂nnen. Mit den Waffen von 1940 kann man 1944 nicht mehr wirklich was anfangen.
- Usw. usw. usw. Ich k√∂nnte noch massenhaft Dinge auff√ºhren.

Als ich angefangen habe waren Dinge, wie die schon damals veraltete Grafik usw., noch verschmerzbar. Selbst heute k√∂nnte ich da noch dar√ºber hinweg sehen, wenn sich das Spiel in anderen -  wichtigeren - Punkten weiterentwickelt h√§tte. Aber so? Nein, heute akzeptiere ich das nicht mehr. In den vergangenen 16 Jahren ist so gut wie nichts passiert. 

Konstruktive Kritik usw. scheint den Entwicklern - auf gut Deutsch - am Arsch vorbei zu gehen.

Gestern wurde ich sogar im Chat verwarnt, weil ich es gewagt habe Kritik zu √ºben. Uhhhh.

Die Entwickler werben damit, dass das Spiel NICHT Pay-to-Win ist. Das ist richtig, da jeder Spieler bezahlen muss.

Trotzdem wurde und wird immer wieder von den Entwicklern eingegriffen, um die Spielerst√§rkste Partei zu pudern. Damals war es f√ºr l√§ngere Zeit die sogenannte Achse, also die deutsche Seite.
Aktuell ist es speziell die US-Seite. Klar, da spielen ja auch die meisten Neuen, welche √ºber Steam dazugekommen sind.

Und das ist genauso verwerflich - wenn nicht sogar kriminell - wie die Manipulation in den meisten P2W-Spielen! Denn Pay-to-Win Spiele, wie z. B. WoT, sind zumindest kostenfrei spielbar. Dass man gegen die zahlenden Kunden nicht wirklich was rei√üen kann steht auf einem anderen Blatt Papier.

Hier bezahlt jeder Spieler die gleiche Summe, also MUSS auch eine gleichwertige Behandlung gew√§hrleistet sein. Dies ist aber nicht der Fall!

Und das bricht den Entwicklern letztendlich das Genick, da sie nicht endlos Leute verprellen k√∂nnen. Der Pool an potenziellen Spielern ist stark begrenzt und nun fast ausgesch√∂pft.


Schade um das Spiel. Es hatte viel Potential.

P. S. Ich habe gerade einen Kommentar gel√∂scht von einem Zeitgenossen, der - als das Spiel auf den Markt kam - noch nicht einmal geboren war.

Ja, ich habe in den letzten knapp sechs Jahren immer mal wieder, nach einem gr√∂√üeren Patch, in das Spiel kurz reingeschaut. Desweiteren wird der Download sicherlich auch als Spielzeit gewertet. Von daher sind nat√ºrlich dadurch heute mehr Spielstunden zusammen gekommen als zum Zeitpunkt der Rezension.

Der Schreiberling hat den Text nicht gelesen und nicht verstanden - oder nicht verstehen wollen - da√ü ich das Spiel an sich wirklich mag, es meine alte Liebe ist und ich deshalb von den Entwicklern einfach nur ma√ülos entt√§uscht bin.

Ich hatte damals 150 Mark + Porto + jahrelang monatlich f√ºr das Spiel bezahlt - das war in der Summe nicht gerage wenig. Das Geld wurde von den Mitarbeitern in Motorr√§der und √§hnliches investiert - deshalb habe ich auch aufgeh√∂rt, diese finanziell zu unterst√ºtzen.

Als der "F√ºhrungsstab" bei Cornered Rats Software ausgetauscht wurde, wollte ich eben sehen ob tats√§chlich - so wie vollmundig angek√ºndigt - alles besser wird und schaute hin und wieder - kostenfrei - in das Spiel.

Ich hatte sogar dem Boss von CRS eine Mail geschrieben und ihm angeboten, f√ºr CRS 3D Modelle zu erstellen - gegen einen Obulus versteht sich. Ich bekam nicht einmal eine Antwort.

Das Geld, welches monatlich von den Spielern bezahlt wird, flie√üt nur in die Taschen ein paar weniger. Die meisten entwickeln "ehrenamtlich", seit dem geht es auch mit dem Spiel wieder bergauf. Das ist einzig und allein den freiwilligen Helfern zu verdanken.

CRS war immer schon ein Sauhaufen und ist nach wie vor einer. Gierig und selbstgef√§llig ohne Ende und keinen Respekt vor der Spielerschaft.

Ich wollte sehen ob den Worten auch Taten folgen, deshalb die √ºber 300 Stunden Spielzeit mehr, seit der Erstellung der Rezension.

Aber dumme Kommentare von Leuten, die von nichts eine Ahnung haben, die l√∂sche ich einfach, Punkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136975055', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1513987988}
review: Old and hardcore F2P WW2 MMO. People expecting a game with pretty graphics and easy gameplay shouldn't even bother, this is a slow, tense and realistic battlefield game. I'm a newcommer to the game so I'm yet to learn a lot about it but I have been meaning to try it out for quite a while and now that it's on Steam I had no excuse left. It deserves full respect as it was doing things thought not possible back when it originally came out (2001 - same year as another amazing game, Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis). The fact that it's still populated and active is testimony to it's uniqueness and emphasis on deep gameplay mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960615818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1506029824}
review:
Un exelent jeu pour ceux qui aiment le r√©alisme des batailles inter-arm√©es. 
Ici pas question de foncer dans le tas ! La moindre erreur et c'est la mort qui vous tombe dessus sans savoir d'ou elle vient.
Malgr√®s les graphismes anciens l'immersion reste exeptionnel et on ne retrouve pas d'autres jeux qui donne l'impression d'une v√©ritable bataille comprenant les avions , les blind√©es, les canons, l'infanterie et tout ca dirig√© par un Haut commandemant incarn√© par des joueurs.
Ajouter √† cel√† la gestion du r√©approvisionnement entre les villes avec un front dynamique sur une √©norme carte et des campagnes qui durent plusieurs semaines et vous obtenez un exelent jeu pour ceux qui sont pr√™t √† passer outre la technique ancienne.
Je recommande mais il faut savoir √† quoi s'attendre, les parties peuvent √™tre longues et on est souvent √† plusieurs minutes de d√©placement avant d'entrer dans l'action. La patiente est de rigueur dans ce jeu et donc ce n'est pas fait pour tout le monde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128204415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1701650238}
review:
Flying into battle with a 20 minute flight with your squadron, acting all dramatic, finally aproaching the targetted town and you begin to attack, so you look around, realise that as you're looking around your plane starts to go with where you're looking, really slowly... Plane crashes into floor after losing control. Respawn and get a bomber instead this time, fly high above the target, takes 20 minutes still, on the way you wonder how you deploy the bombs, you right click a few times to see if it changes your ammo, then you notice the fact that you have no bombs in the bottom left, and they have infact been dropped on nothingness, so you convert your epic bomber into a hardcore fighter and dive down, after losing control of your ship, with bullets, bits of planes, and everything flying past you, you manage to regain control of the plane, right before you hit the ground. You then proceed to fly around looking for enemies, before your plane gets shot out of the ground in a matter of seconds, crashing in a large explosion after a long, dramatic downfall, where you tell everyone how good they've done, how sorry you are, and that you love your wife...

10/10, really fucking good, quite hardcore in aspects of health, which is fun, you can get 1 shotted by near enough anything, this was only one of the 3 things I've used so far, Army, Airforce, and Navy. Airforce has been my favourite so far, really hard to fly, which is good fun to learn, worth the play, especially for being free2play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024915009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1532961367}
review:
For a FREE game, this game is super awesome. It's a huge zone that's full of bases, vehicles, and unending war between Infantry players. You will -not- be told when you kill a player, so its' realistic in the way that you sometimes are having a 200 meter+ gun battle between 20 players or more. 

Fantastic community who wants to talk and chat! No bugs I'm really aware of. . Leveling takes some time to get into! 

4/5 because I can't play as Russians hehe

review: What the fuck it this resolution?!?! You can't even change it! And why is horizontal mouse sensitivity 3 times faster than vertical one. To think that this game even have playerbase... This game probably haven't been updated since 2001 yet it is "Early Access Game" on steam. And it have monthly SUBSCRIPTIONS   HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA. Last time I laughed this hard was when Reto RedBjarne said "it's working as intended!". This game makes Heroes and Generals updates look good in every way possible.

review:
I enjoyed this game alot, especially when with people to play it with on the wwII online axis discord (havent been on the allied one) 

Firstly this game is from 2001 dont expect the graphics to be good, they arent terrible but they are... 2001 graphics

Gameplay is smooth I have a older rig for this game (10 years) and it runs perfectly fine. Personally I feel there is no ww2 game that compares in its style and ontop of it all its FREE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088301741', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1612258111}
review:
>Get into game
>Have to complete gay totorial
>Get into actual game
>Game is so loud that you will get legitimate shellshock and PTSD
>Try to fly a plane
>Realize that none of the controls are true, they are lies
>Once you somehow manage to get into the air you fly for 20 min straight just to get shot down by another plane doing loops and barrel rolls and they do not miss
>You try barrel rolls, you pass out and crash into the groud
>You say "Fuck air force, seig heil
>You try to drive tank
>Controls are lies
>You hold W but you reverse at mach 2.87 into the wall behind you
>Now nothing works
>You try to aim but all you can see is a scope that has two pixles
>You try to shoot, controls are lies
>You say "Fuck vehicles, seig heil"
>Go infantry
>Get immedietly spawn killed by what sounds like a Minigun with explosive rounds on crack
>Respawn and see an enemy
>You shoot
>Hit
>Enemy ignores your boolet and continues running
>You throw a frag at them
>You just cucked yourself its really a smoke
>You get sniped from 800M away
>Realise that this game has absolutely zero protection from cheaters
>Respawn as a AA truck
>Drive around because you cannot figure out how to shoot
>Run enemies over as you are invicible and their boolets do nothing against you
>They simply morph through your truck as physics do not exist in this universe
>Respawn for the last time
>Get killed by friendly plane corpse as they were shot down instantly like you
>"Kek"
>And the cycle continues.........

review:
Bad... Very Very... Bad... Comparable to a Derek Smart game! The admin/mod team is terrible, they dont help you at all, the only thing they want to help with is making sure people do not over use the help channel and thats all. Community is real nice and fun to play with, but the staff of the game act like trolls. It's sad something like this could not be better developed and better staffed. At least having a good staff would make the game playable.

Wrote this sep 25th 2017, Updating

author: {'steamid': '76561198014306012', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1512726857}
review:
Si vous cherchez du facile vite-vite,que vous √™tes plut√¥t un impatient:passez votre chemin.
Si les grahismes sont pour vous aussi importants que le gameplay:passer votre chemin.
Si vous pensez pouvoir donner un avis sur un jeu en l'ayant test√© 10 minutes,sur ww2 plus qu'ailleurs: ne le t√©l√©chargez m√™me pas !
Si d√©marrer un moteur avant d'acc√©lerer est trop long lourd ou compliqu√© (et ce n'est qu'un exemple): vous savez d√©j√†...ww2 est un jeu de niche dont la vocation est de vous rapprocher de lexp√©rience r√©elle.
Concernant le lag: IL NEST PAS GRAPHIQUE,c'est de la latence le jeu est sur serveur unique et une augmentation de 600% de la pop forc√©ment au d√©part ca peu causer des soucis,mais √ßa se r√©glera.
POUR TOUS LES AUTRES :
La guerre grandeur nature et l'un des rares jeux s√ªr lequel je reviens r√©guli√©rement.
En terme de sensation je n'ais jamais retrouv√© celle de ww2 dans les autres fps
et dans ww2 c'est le gameplay qui fait la sensation pas les graphismes.
Ww2 online de son ancien nom ww2 battleground europe est de ces perles cach√©es
facile √† comprendre et dur √† ma√Ætriser,si vous chercher du skill et un conflit massif 
dans le plus vaste open world que je connaisse ce jeux est pour vous.
 Avec les principales armes de la seconde guerre,infanterie tank avion bateau AA...
 et une strat√©gie port√©e par les joueurs les plus impliqu√©s qui choisissent ou placer leurs troupes et qu'elle villes
attaquer ou d√©fendre (ce qui ne vous empeche pas d'aller ou bon vous semble.
Avec un but final,un vrai pas un ladder :
Envahir ou √™tre envahis finit la campagne qui peu durer de quelques semaines √† plusieurs mois
Certe les graphismes ne sont pas de toute premi√©res jeunesses mais omg qu'elle profondeur de champ
ww2 n'est pas super-beau mais super-fun et exigeant,il tourne sur un serveur unique mondial donc
forc√©ment, il peu y avoir un peu de latence mais on s'y fait,on s'adapte et on est tol√©rant car ce jeux n'as jamais eu autant de monde ni trouv√© les sponsors qu'il m√©ritait et il a probablement faillit mourir,ce qui aurait √©t√© une perte dramatique pour le 8√©me art ! 
En tant qu'amateur de fps je positionne ww2 en premier en terme d'experience immersive et r√©ellement massive
Quelques conseils pour √©viter la rage suivie de critique n√©gative :
1) Courir √† d√©couvert = mourir,dans ww2 vous allez manger de la terre et profiter du moindre couvert
2)Un fru (spawn que lon pose en amenant physiquement un camion √† un endroit) est camp√© c'est normal
votre spawn √† √©t√© d√©couvert il ne faut plus l'utiliser,communiquez ,planquez le bien et quand vous l'utilisez
ne le grillez pas, couch√© vous direct et de pr√©f√©rence n'allez pas tout droit sur votre objectif car l'ennemi observe vos mouvements.
3)Un seul serveur mondial c'est le top mais ca peu cr√©er un peu de latence,particuli√©rement sur les cibles mouvantes
√† l'√©poque on anticipait un chouia en tirant l√©g√©rement devant la cible,au bout de quelques heures de jeux on y fait m√™me plus gaffe c'est une formalit√©,si c'est toujours d'actualit√©.
4)Chaque spawn c'est une unit√© prise dans vos reserves,quand yen a plus cela devient difficile de d√©fendre ou d'attaquer,NE PRENEZ PAS UNE UNITE QUE VOUS NE MAITRISEZ PAS,√† fortiori les chars et avions qui sont pr√©cieux ! communiquez et organisez vous car un cot√© qui g√¢che ses unit√©s finie g√©n√©ralement par perdre la campagne.
5)Capper est plus important que fragger,j'ai vu des batailles √™tre remport√©es par bcp moins de joueurs que le camp adverse comme √ßa.
6)Quand un ordre d'attaque est donn√© par le Hq la premi√©re chose √† faire c'est... de la reconnaissance !: par ou allez vous passer pour poser votre spawn (camion/pelle) et ou allez vous le poser pour qu'il ne soit pas vu et offre une voie d'acc√©s avec couvert pour l'attaque,ne jouez pas √† ww2 comme aux autres jeux,ww2 √† ses propres m√©caniques.
8)Interdisez vous de mourir,adoptez le bon comportement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977520041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1937, 'last_played': 1527522692}
review:
For those of you accustom to the plug and play run and gun genre like Call of Duty, this title is probably not for you. If you load in and start screaming "HoW DuH EyE FlYyYyYyY," this title is probably not for you. If you lack the ability to think critically and make an effort to learn how something works as apposed to screaming for someone to tell you, this title is probably not for you. If you're a whiny millenial who wants to feel like a badass and cannot play a game that isn't an exercise in egotisitcal masterbation, this title is probably not for you.

Now, if you like a challange and have the ability to: carefully plan out your actions, understand how to follow orders, read a map, exploit experience, adapt to a constantly changing enviroment, and most importantly LEARN for your self. This title is most definatly for you. WWII Online isn't a mindless fragfest, its an RTS where you are one of the pawns sent to do the work of the generals. It's on a scale no developer these days would have the balls to attempt a good chunk of France, Belgium, Germany, and Britain are modeled. Yes the graphics are primitive by today's standards, but the gameplay is more advanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176429147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1543861102}
review:
Hi Cornered Rat Sortware,

   I will be giving my brief thought on this game as a short term player. i have played in total maybe 50 hours of time between the non-steam and steam versions. 

Pros: 1.the game shows a whole new light on gameplay and is based on realism, which i like this piece as it makes the game feel real. 

2. I enjoy the community they seem nice and eagar to help new players grow and understand the game. 

3. The large Scale warfare with multiple class choices Navy, Infantry, Tanks/Vehicles, As well as Aircraft make this game unique and enjoyable for anyone who enjoys world war 2 era games.

Cons: before i say anything i believe this game has more Pros then Cons and if anything have a good mix between the two, right then Cons.

1. I believe the game shows it's age to roughly though improvements have been made this game needs an engine increase and better Graghical improvments to models and characters as well as environment. 

2. An easier tutorial to present new players who struggle with such an aged game, i suggest making a video and including the link so players may recieve a visual on how to play the game. make the tutorial video no longer then 5 or so minutes and get them training to go into the real Campaign battles.

3. Lastly, i would like to see a more improved free to play account as new players will join and find little value if all they can control is a bolt action rifleman as well as an inaccurate submachine gun. my suggestion is to include a single rifle or new vehicle for them to use every month. it will keep them interested in coming back and trying out those weapons if they have success with the rifle/vehicle they make decide it is worth the money $7.99 a month to enlist as a full subscriber. 

My suggestions on this game if you like them cool if you don't feel free to tell me your thoughts in the review section.

Respectfully,
InsertingBanana

author: {'steamid': '76561198127874126', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1533698816}
review:
Un jeux qui apporte l'espoir d'une simulation de guerre comme aucun autre jeux, certe depasser graphiquement mais l'envie de faire un bon jeux la. Seul probl√©me, les commande, elle sont bcp trop compliquer et illogique, pour faire avencer un camion par exemple il faut allumer le moteur(touche e) et pour le faire avancer g reussi par hasard en tappant sur le clavier, la touche pour rouler est donc ($) et la touche pour marche arriere est (*) c'est tres tres problematique etant donner que je suit arriver en enfoncent le bouton z comme un abrutie. je n'est pas encors tester les avion et les navires. 

autre probleme: c'est VIDE, tu ne croisera jamais personne appart tes potes, et desoler je n'est pas 3heure a consacrer pour faire charleville-sedan a pied, vue que personne a l'intelligence de prendre des vehicule. tous le monde est a pied, g vue 2-3 avion allemand et 6 chars anglais dans tous le jeux. Mon coeur me laisse penser que ce jeux a encors de l'espoir, c sympa, mais on send que c d'une autre epoque, et mon dieux que les controlles sont chiant je me repeterai pas asser! M'enfain, a tester.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226193424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1523042263}
review:
Persenally i think this game had and maybe still has lots of potential even if the graphics are outdated and it's not very new player intuitive but the community is very helpfull and helps to compensate  a bit .
The idea of the game being a constant dynamic war that can last months really exited me and i waited all summer only to find out that its a subscription model that if you don't pay 8 euroes per month realy restrics what type of vehicle and weapons... you can use in game and so this really kinda turns me off and i am sure i am not the only one.
So if you can afford to spend 8euroes per month =96 per year witch is 114 dollars! 
wich i think is totally ridiculos at this price. Hell i maybe could even give 30 or maybe even 40 euroes paid once and then you get the game and dont need to pay again rather than this model .
So i personnaly dont recomend this game if you expect to download the game and get the full expirience like most other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344237237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1522359791}
review:
For the first time it looked badly but when i lanched it everything changed. First the size of map. It's unbelievable huge and you can have a lot of fun fighting there. You can use multiple vehicles like armored cars, half tracks, tanks, bombers.
I recomend it to every ww2 fan : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198295540828', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1506213151}
review:
This game is trying to be historically accurate. I get that. In fact, I like that. But the problem is the fact that it is not fun.

The first thing that set me off is the long, tedious tutorial. I usually play the tutorial so I can get used to the controls but not the whole thing. Maybe this so to harsh though, but when I spend 27 minutes on the tutorial something is wrong. The worst part is that you can‚Äôt skip it, what if I don‚Äôt want to play the tutorial and can figure it out on my own?

Once you get to the battle the field is vast and your character is slow. Sure, you can sprint, but as soon as you run, you stamina bar goes down and it refills slowly. It is hard to find people to fight, especially when your enemy is a cross a river.

All in all, I would not recommend this game. I applaud the attempt to be as historical accurate as possible, but it is not fun. If you are courses however, it is free to play so you don‚Äôt have to give anything up to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987444488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1506173313}
review: Maybe 15 years ago was this a top game. Unfortunately we live now in 2017 with much better graphics and gameplay.
developer_response:
I wil let it pass on the graphics, we don't advertise being pretty.

But I will say, our game play is fantastic. 0.4 hours is not enough to make that judgement. I would recommend the following, please genuinely do this.

1) Join a squad, immediately. 91st if Axis, 4 Wing if Allied.

2) Get on discord, http://www.wwiionline.com/discord.

3) Give that squad and you being on discord at least 2 hours of time.

I guarantee you will have a lot more understanding AND fun of what's going on. I am willing to personally meet you and run you through the ropes if you're interested. Email me at xoom -at- corneredrats.com.

I want you to work out in this game. If you're solely graphics it won't happen, but you will be ultra amazed if you like large scale WWII battles. Nothing like it out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001457608', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1655234405}
review:
One of the best games I¬¥ve ever played. I played this from 2001 to 2005 on my self-build 1.2 GHz AMD :). Later I lost interest, but always loved to come back for a few months.

There is no game out there that gives you a similar large battlefield feeling. The battles are intense. You drive, fly, ride a long way just to run into an ambush.  On the other hand, if you find a hidden place, you can be the death himself.

You walk on the battlefield, in the skies dogfights, bombs hitting buildings next to you, somewhere MG fire, grenades, terrifying enemy tanks closing in. The guy next to you falls. Heart pounding...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960799913', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1506239854}
review:
Been playing off and on since October 2001. I pop back in every few years to see if the game has improved. They add things here and there, but the gameplay is still wonky. Animations are strange, netcode is bizarre, people will fall dead 2 seconds after you've shot them. 

Mouse seems to suffer from some sort of irreparable acceleration which causes your iron sights/optics to jump several pixels at a time, killing any sort of precision shooting that's found in every AAA title for the past 15 years. I made a post on the official forums about 10 years ago, lots of young competitive gamers notice it, but the older devs and veterans don't seem to care.

If you aren't playing during peak hours, it can be pretty dull. Yeah, the map is huge, but that is also a drawback, especially considering 98% of it is just barren landscape littered with shrubs and trees. I popped in to check out the Steam release on a new account just to find that the largest battle happening was maybe 25vs25, and it was taking place over a large town. Massive game in scale, but not when it gets down to the fighting. You could find that size of a battle in pretty much any shooter on the market nowadays, with modern mechanics and graphics, without paying a subscription.

There is an unskippable tutorial at the beginning which the dev claims, "Anyone who wouldn't go through it would be instantly lost in the game." Yeah, the tutorial is literally showing you how to walk, crouch, go prone, fire your weapon, throw grenades, and chat on the radio. These are all instantly familiar controls to anyone who has ever played an FPS on PC. This game seems to be developed and aimed at people who are in the 45-60 age bracket.

Air combat is probably the only decent thing about WWII Online; the flight models are fine, and it is pretty fun strafing infantry on the ground and divebombing tanks. Air to air combat is satisfying enough, even if the entirety of it feels incredibly dated (because it is). If you are strictly about air simulation though, there are plenty of better titles on the market for cheap or for free (War Thunder, IL-2, DCS).

The most egregious thing about WWII Online is their subscription model. If you want to experience the whole game, be prepared to pay $18 a month. Free to play accounts are restricted to Riflemen only. Most modern gamers would find this incredibly dull and boring, but again, I think this game is mostly now aimed at a senior demographic.

[b]TL;DR:[/b] Should you play this game? [b]No.[/b] Back in the day when there were actually massive battles, you could look past all the glaring issues, and it was a good time. But now it's on life support, and somebody should pull the plug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127880897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1550303861}
review:
(I Edited in something I realized I kind of left out.) 

Let me give the Dev's some advice. Because I don't feel they quite understand how this market actually works. Do, you want to know why Paid Subscription models are dying? Because they're dated, and no-longer profitable and people have options now. There's a reason they're being dropped across the MMO market in favor of other means (Whether they're fair or not.) If you want more people to play your game?

1. Drop the current Payment Model (I realize the game is free but hear me out.) the reason you're not really gaining the people who want that Open-World War Simulator. Is not only because your game looks like dogshit (I say this from a loving place I promise.) but because you also use a dated model. You don't have the stranglehold or cornerstone on the market like WOW, or EVE where they can get away with it because these people are locked in that until those games go down out of loyalty. Your fanbase might be loyal but it's small. Think about the continued longevity of your game and the prospect of making it larger.

2. (I mentioned this earlier) your game looks like dogshit. Okay, look I know you're using an old engine and you're working on updating Textures and working within the Engine. If I could make a suggestion? Don't Scrap WW2 Online right away but do get rid of it, instead of trying to build on top of dated architecture your team is talented enough where they could just build a new game and keep WW2 Online around to float/fund this game. However, I could understand if you're coming from the place where you guys are struggling which is very likely based on my perception of your concurrent player base.

3. This kind of goes along with the last point, your guy's UI is clunky and old. It needs a refresh like the game does. It's not very New-Player friendly, and is largely unappealing I'd Imagine to even the most loyal of fans. 


Now, I saved my praise for this for last. While I like this game as a thought experiment. Whether the game is fun or not remains to be seen. It's a cool idea, a cool concept, and even has its moments. But the game due to the lack thereof of player-count will probably never grow to something it could be. They will not attract a large player-base for the reasons I outlined, and until these are addressed. You will not see a large-gain in a player-base.


(Edit:) Okay, so I realized I didn't add any suggestions on what to replace your present payment model with. 

1. There's the option of selling your game 1 time with the expectation of semi-premium vehicles that people might elect to purchase. (What I'm suggesting is done by Wargaming and Warthunder (not entirely) but is also done by GW2 (not entirely. What I mean by this, is they do one/the other. Not both.). To elaborate further, you can add-in certain models or vehicles of historical significance that people might want. Like the Tirpitz for example, which World of Warships did alongside the free version of the Bismarck-Class Battleship. 

2. This is another option, now I'm not personally in favor of this. It can break games and make the experience unfun for your players. Now there is the possibility of Micro-Transactions without making the game Pay-2-Win, there's something I and many others. Call Paying for Convenience. Perhaps, have a progression system that gives players something to work for maybe towards more specialized combat-vehicles and allowing players to purchase XP to opt out of the progression to get to that level of combat. This has done to mixed-success with many other games and is regarded as not awful. If implemented in a fair way. 

3. You can sell cosmetic Items, but I could understand how this would be looked at as unfavorable by the Dev-Team because you're going for a more realistic tone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020950392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1506034664}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963017995', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1506901644}
review:
TL/DR - A much better Planet Side 2 (for those that aren't familiar with this game having come first.)

This is the only tactical FPS / flight sim / tank sim game out there where the battles matter. This is not an arena shooter. This is not a fast paced action game. This is the type of game where you may sit around guarding something for say 20 minutes with no action, and then suddenly get plunged into 15 minutes or more of pure carnage.

The best feature of the game is the absolutely massive map. Seriously these guys put every other FPS out there to shame with that.

Some of the downsides are that the learning curve is straight up vertical especially in the seat of a fighter plane. Everyone mentions the graphics being bad, but honestly they aren't that bad. They wont be winning any awards for it, but it does its job well. 

There's so many good stories that come out of this game, as you battle it out for a hard fought victory across the map. Once a map is completed it resets again, and technology advances as the time of the current campaign does.

Being a free to play player allows you to play with weapons that are slightly out dated. Now a lot of folks may see this as a disadvantage but it's truly not. In certain match ups maybe, like a tiger vs a matilda mk 2 perhaps, but you shouldn't try to engage a tiger with a matty 2 anyway lol. 

This is the only game I have played where it felt truly awesome to win a map, or even to lose one for that matter. I feel that now that it is on steam and has a wider audience the game will only get better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040658014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1506005865}
review:
Come gioco √® difficile da capire all'inizio, ma dopo qualche ora ho capito come si gioca.
Il brutto di questo gioco √® la lentezza, passi un'eternit√† a camminare, perch√® i punti di respown (messi dai comandanti) vengono messi troppo lontani, in pi√π i camion non si fermano ad aiutarti e a trasportarti verso il fronte, quindi rende il gioco uno strazio, ho passato molto pi√π tempo a camminare che a sparare e uccidere o farmi uccidere, va bene camminare un p√≤, ma farsi le passeggiate per ore... tanto vale uscire, prendersi un aereo per l'Olanda/Francia e visitarsela nel mondo reale.

Il fatto che sia 300.000 km2 √® una cosa entusiasmante, ma ovunque vi giriate c'√® sempre lo stesso paesino, con gli stessi cittadini (non ci sono realmente), con le stesse chiese, con le stesse strade e il tutto con gli stessi palazzi in cui difficilmente puoi raggiungere il piano superiore, appunto perch√® non c'√®, ma non in tutti; questo √® per quanto riguarda i paesini, se andassimo in campagna sarebbe ancora peggio, lande vastissime, con alberi, prati e di persone che camminano per ore.

Non ho voluto addentrarmi di pi√π perch√® l'ho trovato una palla, un girone dell'inferno, la quinta essenza della rottura di minchia, una tortura e una strafumante gonfiatura di coglioni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040965157', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1506886164}
review:
First of all, anyone looking for a COD or Battle Field game.....just fuck off..............

Ok for everyone remining, yes this game is difficult, its like a full blown WWII Arma on a persistent map that is constantly being contested by both sides. Shooting is a very finely balanced combination of skill and luck with things like bullet drop and proper leading of the target being key. There is no such thing as running and gunning in this game, the only way to success is through cooperation, paitence and well thought out movement. This game was amazing before it came to steam and will only get better as time progresses. With a dedicated and very community oriented group of developers who have constantly been working on this game for years you can rest assured that for a free to play game you will be challenged to find an equal.

Are the graphics top of the line? NO nor should they be in a game that has a map the size of western europe during early 1945 running non stop with no loading screens. Bottom line, if youre trash and wanna cry about it after putting in less than an hour in then complaining about it in a review and then uninstalling. Good, go away, we dont want your kind of player in this game.

Fantastic if you put a little time and effort it and definitely something thatll be around long after other games of the same style vanish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360279151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1505918815}
review:
Update: I did not really like the game, but I will try to go back to it soon, after the friendly response from the developer. I'll try the squad and discord options. Anyway, here's the impression of my first playthrough.

The first time I played I hiked for hours on foot, just to be shot down by a machine gunner, who saw through thick foliage, leaves, etc. This happend a second time. Crawling, in a gully, shot by a machine gunner miles away.

Then, a city battle. I have a good computer, but my framerate was extremely low. Tried to shoot, missed a thousand times, died. Next, spawned in a bunker, got shot right away. Just like the other players spawning. Corpses piled up. 

Next, Germans drove into the bunker in a truck. We could not shoot them through the glass of the front window, and died of collision damage. Then, a piece of artillery with two germans on it raced into the bunker, running people over and killing them. We could not shoot the guys on the artillery...they just sat there, looking through binoculars...

Then, some of the corpses got stuck in the artillery and started to do some kind of macabre dance...
developer_response:
Hey Fasold, I'm wondering if there's some optimization that could be done to improve your performance. I would HIGHLY encourage you to do a couple of things to improve your game experience, they include:

1) Get on discord (www.wwiionline.com/discord)
2) Join a squad

Our game has a steep learning curve and those two things will help you more rapidly understand what's happening and why. Your immersion will go up and you'll be able to work with veterans to better learn the game.

I hope you give that a chance, and if you mail me directly at: xoom -at- cornered rats.com, I would be happy to personally meet you on Discord and show you some of the ropes. Let me know.

Salute

author: {'steamid': '76561197961104929', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1506315004}
review:
Fair warning, this is not your usual run-and-gun or twitch shooter. It doesn't feature the latest in high-end graphics. If these are what you are after look elsewhere. This is a game that takes patience and perseverance - you may find yourself many miles from a battle, with the subsequent need to travel from where you are to where you need to be.

What you get in WWIIO is a simulation of the battlefields of Europe of World War II. It is a true combined arms game with infantry, armor, aircraft, and naval forces working together to achieve goals. Supplies are limited - each death removes that asset from battle until resupply can be achieved. It is a game of attrition where your goal is to destroy enemy forces, cut off their lines of supply, and destroy their factories. All this is a gross simplification of a very complex game mechanic.

You have a choice of four nations: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, and the United States. As an Allied soldier you can switch between the Allied nations at will, but to change from Allied to Axis there is a lockout period where you have to log out and wait before changing sides. As a player you start out on the bottom, a basic private, with limited access to your side's armory. As you progress you will receive promotions allowing greater access to certain assets. More infantry units, armor, and aircraft will be available for you to choose from. During a campaign new units will be introduced as technology becomes available. The headquarters staff will be forced to make difficult decisions as to which units to produce and which to withdraw from combat. Old, outdated units will no longer be produced so that newer, more effective units can be made.

This is not a 10-minute game, but rather one that takes months for each full campaign. At the end a victor will be declared and the game will reset back to the beginning. Lessons learned in one campaign will be carried into the next. The player will carry what they have learned and the rank they have achieved into the new "season" if you will. You will run into folks who have been playing this game for years as well as those who are new. 

All said this is a game for the long haul.

Now, for dislikes...

It is easy to get overwhelmed, especially if you try to enter a large battle only to find that your chosen spawn-in location is heavily besieged by the enemy. Frustration levels can become very high very quickly.

Very little has changed since this game was first released in 2001. There have been improvements, true - no more titanium trees for example. But overall this is the same game we were playing 16 years ago. No new theaters - North Africa, the Russian Front, the Pacific. The same visuals with only slight improvements.

There is still much room for improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007065419', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1666647988}
review:
I will keep this short. 

If you want:

- A Half sized map of the Battle of France area of Europe to play on (seamless - no zones, you can fly from Calais to Essen or swim from Dover to Calais and then walk to Essen....)
- Endless replayability (Town x from direction x in unit x vs enemy units x........= lots of permutations)
- Weapons Physics developed by a specialist in the field
- Multiple Unit choices (Mostly Land, Air with some Sea)
- A gaming experience in such a cinematic scope (Friendly air comes in over you and bombs the town (they flew from an airfield behind the lines) as you head into town, to see them get engaged by enemy aircraft who then get jumped by your air support etc....)
- Big fights!

This game is for you!

It is NOT:

-Pretty grafix (see the first point above, the scope and scale of the ballistics go against this prettiness)
-COD
-Instant gratification (it is a "thinking game")
- WOT and its ilk

WARNING: Downloading this game may yield lots of epic fun.

SMYTHES - WWIIOL TAG 2004 - Present

author: {'steamid': '76561197992197447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1506026478}
review:
I tried it few minutes and I can see it's one of these highly realistic massive war games.. I dont care about graphics. I will give this thumbs up even after few minutes of playing because I can see it's just the game I will like
----
I'm changing my mind. After playing for a while and reading and asking questions ingame, I found out that this game really is crappy.
This is what happens: I started walking to a enemy city and few other too, then truck came.. I got in and we travelled faster now. suddenly the truck disappeared and we had to walk. then our tank came from the enemy city to my spawnpoint city. for some reason all of us jumped on it and now we were back in the spawn city, I have no idea why. then half track came and we got in. we were travelling faster now. for some reason the half track suddenly ended up in river. all other guys were in the land but I ended up in the river. I closed the game, it was such nonsense. it's all about walking for 5 minutes then dying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160204901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1505805903}
review:
Pros:

Become a soldier in wwII, with graphics from the same era.
There are people with purple heads.
You can jump into the water and not drown.

Cons:

I dont know how to change the resolution from 512x512
They say accurately modeled.... but I don't think there's enough shit in the world to make that blend in.
Beware that you might spawn in and be wondering for 1.3 horus without seeing anyone.

0/10

(Although my screen name was DonkeySpank, friend was HorseChoker. So I'll give them that)
developer_response:
You need to get on Discord and join up with some veteran players, go to http://wwiionline.com/discord. Your resolution issues can be solved by going to http://wwiionline.com/dpi ~ sorry about that one, still trying to find a fix.

Finding where the battle is requires a little bit of understanding, don't be afraid to ask for some help. By getting on Discord with a veteran team you'll learn quickly and find the game to be a substantially better experience.
