author: {'steamid': '76561198030528041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1688793391}
review:
Enfin une visibilit√© publique bien m√©rit√©e pour cette simulation in√©gal√©e dans son genre et repris au Guinness Book des records comme √©tant le premier jeu de guerre massivement multijoueu.  http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/first-massively-multiplayer-online-war-game!

Voici un bref r√©sum√© apr√®s des milliers d'heures consacr√©es depuis 2002 au sein de cette premi√®re "communaut√© virtuelle hi√©rarchis√©e massivement multijoueur", sur un simulateur initialement d√©velopp√© pour les forces arm√©es am√©ricaines et ayant pour th√®me les combats en Belgique, France et Hollande. 

Si vous n'avez pas peur de perdre la vie en une seule balle sans possibilit√© de vous soigner par magie, lisez ceci.

WWII online a √©t√© lanc√© en 2001 et a fait l'objet d'innombrables mises √† jour sans jamais alt√©rer l'essence du jeu : un serveur unique pour tous, tournant 7/7, 24/24, une carte repr√©sentant l'Europe √† l'√©chelle 1:2, une combinaison des armes air/terre/mer de la seconde guerre mondiale (France, Angleterre, Allemagne, US), une balistique r√©aliste, le tout dans une dynamique o√π chaque unit√© est incarn√©e par un joueur r√©el. 

En d√©coule une organisation virtuelle hi√©rarchique, o√π les squads (√©ph√©m√®res ou persistants) se forment, se coordonnent, en suivant des directives d'un haut commandement virtuel indispensable √† la r√©ussite des manoeuvres qui durent parfois plusieurs mois. L'action de chacun peut durablement influencer toute l'√©volution de la campagne (bombardement des usines de production √† l'arri√®re du front, interdiction des renforts √† l'arri√®re du front, capture d'un b√¢timent de ravitaillement, ...).
Depuis la publication sur steam, les combats de 100 vs 100 sur une ville sont redevenus courants, mais tout reposera toujours sur l'initiative et la communication des "mission leaders", que vous pouvez incarner avec un compte gratuit et quel que soit votre grade. Les possibilit√©s apport√©es par les nouveaux "spawns mobiles renforc√©s" de 2017 et les objets d√©fensifs plac√©s par les joueurs sur le terrain, ont fortement intensifi√© la violence des combats et am√©lior√© la possibilit√© de cr√©er de v√©ritables fronts autour des villes.

Inutile de le comparer avec un FPS. Le public est mature avec en moyenne 30 ans d'√¢ge et a compt√© dans sa communaut√© des membres c√©l√®bres (journalistes de France t√©l√©vision, star hollywoodiennes, personnages publiques...) tous passionn√©s par la seconde guerre mondiale et qui se sont ponctuellement retrouv√©s IRL.
Des milliers de personnes √† travers le monde se retrouvent pour exp√©rimenter des tactiques de combat multi-armes, limit√©es par les forces/faiblesses des armes d'√©poque, tout en jouant le jeu d'une organisation hi√©rarchique virtuelle (planification des op√©rations via les forums, communication radio live via Discord). 
Il faudra travailler votre anglais si vous voulez profiter pleinement des ressources de la communaut√©, car la communaut√© francophone doit rena√Ætre de ses cendres gr√¢ce √† Steam. Avis aux community leaders en herbe parmis vous !

Les graphismes repousseront certains, mais une recherche d'images sur google vous montrera √† quel point les d√©veloppeurs sont partis de rien avant 2003. L'objectif n'a jamais √©t√© l'immersion graphique mais l'immersion tactique d'√©quipe et de simulation des armes historiques. Compte tenu des faibles moyens disponibles pour d√©velopper le projet, il est difficile de leur en vouloir pour ce retard de modernit√©, et qui pr√©sente n√©anmoins l'avantage d'apporter un jeu fluide m√™me sur des laptops bas de gamme.

Soyez patient pour comprendre les m√©canismes du jeu, pour r√©ussir votre premier "kill", et pour vous adapter √† la dynamique des missions. Selon votre style de jeu vous vivrez un combat d'infanterie f√©roce et instantan√©, une mission d'infiltration en tant que sniper parachutiste, un d√©ploiement de batterie anti-char ou anti-a√©rien en haut d'une colline apr√®s avoir √©t√© tract√© par un camion pendant 10 minutes, une escorte navale de destroyers traversant la manche sous les bombardements, ou encore la mise en place d'une soutien aux combatants de 1ere ligne (logistique, mortiers, ing√©nieurs...).

Prenez le temps de lire le WIKI du site officiel et les guides pour d√©butants. Surtout ne vous attendez pas √† faire d√©coler un avion sans joystick ou √† faire entrer un char dans le feu de l'action d'une offensive en moins de 10 minutes. La communaut√© est incroyablement disponible pour vous aider, profitez-en !

La nouvelle √©quipe b√©n√©vole de XOOM a repris le projet en main depuis ao√ªt 2016 et les perspectives sont tr√®s prometteuses (nouveau moteur graphique, nouvelles unit√©s, gameplay am√©lior√© pour le jeu en squad, nouveaux mod√®les 3D d'unit√©s et de batiments, nouveau pays...). Cela m√©rite donc amplement 15‚Ç¨/mois pour soutenir cet effort de guerre !

author: {'steamid': '76561197999281326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1654263338}
review:
Great game.  

Sure, there are problems.  Your FPS can crash during large battles and the infantry controls feel a bit cluncky compared to Shoebox FPS.  However, this isn't a Shoebox FPS.  This is combined arms warfare.

Wanna be a rifleman in the German Army?  Be a rifleman in the German Army.

Wanna be a Spitfire pilot in the Royal Air Force?  Be a Spitfire pilot in the Royal Air Force.

Wanna be a French tanker?  Sure, why not, if being French in WW2 is your thing.

The game does have a mandatory tutorial for new players which may annoy some players.  However, it's short and should only take 5 to 10 minutes if you read the instructions and follow them.  It was longer until a recent patch when the devs reduced it.  OMG!  Devs who listen to the community.  

The easiest way to rank up, at least in the army of your chosen side, is to create Mobile Spawns.  You get points for everyone who spawns on your mission.  I quickly ranked up by doing this.  It does require driving a truck so if driving a truck is your thing this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974725758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1506013913}
review:
awesome game, good community, active discord channel. The Devs actually play with you. 

So a little about this game, It Is pretty complex you really do need to do the training missions first to get the hang of things. but even then people are very helpful in game and are more than willing to help new players. want to be infantry? you can, want to drive a tank? you can!, fly planes? yup!, hell you can even be a crew member on a ship. If you dont want to fight just run logistics with supply trucks and build defenses. This isnt as fast paced as other FPS out there this game makes you think, makes you plan and coordinate with the other players, but is set up so you can quickly find and join a fight in progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966154307', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1934, 'last_played': 1702779812}
review:
I think this is an awsome game

Yes you have to do a few mandatory tutorials
They do not take long though, and the amount of people that ask how to do things covered in the tutorials show that they are needed.
Take your time, read through them, ask lots of questions, you can talk to the playerbase while in the tutorials to get help.

It isnt a shoebox shooter, the game varies constantly from day to day from battle to battle even from one minute to the next.
Sometimes you spawn in and barely have time to breath before someone is shooting at you, other times you have plenty of time to get situated and figure out what you want to do.

There is no hard and fast rule about where you have to be and what you have to do.
If fighting in town is not for you, you can venture out into the countryside and scout out a location to ambush enemy units at they make their way to town, or you can decide to go assault and destroy their field position.

The game is hard, there are no helpers. no assisted aiming, no units that are normalized to be less than what they might have been in real life, so some things are very difficult to kill, and when you first start out you die a lot until you start getting the hang of things, but the players will help you learn anything and you will get it sorted and you wont die near as much. At least not all the time :) 

It isn't the kind of game you can make much judgement about in an hour or two because you are still trying to figure everything out, and there is lots to figure.  Its all human beings, no bots, so you can never quite predict anything.
You might die 10 times in a row, but on your 11th try capture a choke point and kill 8 guys while defending it.

The graphics are simplified, but then in other games you dont have to see and track potentially 100+ players just in your area all running around on one single map that is 1/4th real scale.

I cant think of any other game where i have looked up to see 40 human enemy players parachuting from the sky, while 20 human operated enemy tanks are trying to crush me from the east, and an uncountable number of human operated enemy ground soldiers are running at me across a field trying to shoot me to pieces with everything from rifles to light machine guns to mortars while a dozen enemy aircraft try to strafe or bomb me to death.

Try the game, give it a week before you make up your mind on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981478168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1505523755}
review:
Steam doesn't reflect this, but I've been playing this game...an ungodly amount of time, on and off for over 10 years now. In that time I've seen WW2 Online go through massive changes and population flux's, and I've always come back for more. There's simply nothing else like it out there, bar none. There's admittedly a big learning curve to it, but the Squads in game are more than welcoming and eager to teach newbies the tricks of the game. Of all my greatest memories in gaming I've got a dozen just from this game alone, and hundreds of screenshots, from giant armor clashes, massive paradrops, to thick dogfighting furballs above contested towns. The last few years have seen the pop slowly wane away, but with Steam the battles are back to what I remember, just the other day I was part of a para drop on Luxembourg with 100 other Fallshirmjager. While in the end we didn't take the town, it was crazy to see the chutes blocking out the sky, as I ran around with 2 other green tags helping them capture control points. 

I love this game, but I'm ready to admit it's faults, the biggest being graphics. But again, this game is older than some of the people playing it, and the devs are working to fix this. It should also be noted that this is a small Dev team who are totally devoted to the game, and you'll often see them running around in the game themselves. I can't tell you the joy it would bring me to shoot down Doc. They're passionate about the game and aren't in this for the money, they're working to keep the game and studio alive to keep the community together, running and having fun. 

If you can look past the graphics you've got the perfect blend of simulation with action, and though it can be incredibly frustrating it's also insanely satisfying. When you're the sole anti-tank gun in Huy holding back a horde of Sherman‚Äôs from pouring across the bridge and cutting off the army base. Watching destroyers fight it out in the Zee's while you're up a bush line to get to a CP. Taking off far in the back of the map to interdict Allied pilots heading for Axis factories. After a campaign, you'll look back on the map and remember hard fought battles around Amsterdam as you're invading England. 

I'm a lifetime Axis player, and more than happy to help and train anyone who's looking to learn more about the game. I'm KaisrJoe and you'll find me in the air, ground and sea. Feel free to message me.
S!
developer_response: We thank you for your support Kaiser Joe, it means a lot to all of us here at Cornered Rat Software. Salute!

author: {'steamid': '76561198403819028', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2420, 'last_played': 1709125754}
review: For a game made in 2001 i'm very impressed with it. Other than a few bugs with the German StuG III G and the StuG B gunner optic not allowing the player see the aim reticle, but overall the game is worth the download. Largest MMO game i've played.
developer_response:
Thanks for the review. In the STUG you need to use your "deploy weapon" key, which is "Z." Press that, and then proceed to use the decimal (.) on the numpad to zoom in.

One cool fact about the STUG's, you can use your commander's center point on his binoculars to determine a precise range ( it has a range finder integrated ). Press R on the commander while zoomed in to do so, and you can use PAGE UP / PAGE DOWN on the gun to range in your weapon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974307087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1573928502}
review:
A game of nearly 17 years despite its dated graphics, aesthetics, and aged subscription plan has managed to grasp the air, land, and sea of World War 2 in a highly immersive and in-depth video game. Coming from a non-vet and first timer through steam I have quite enjoyed this game, and this is very much thanks to various veterans and a friendly community who were more than willing to show me the ropes (ADVICE FOR NEW PLAYERS: Go out there on the battlefield and ask questions as you go. It will be a much better experience than trying to learn everything in one go!). 

While the graphics can be an eye-sore to some, it was outshined by the massive depth and complexity of the war mechanics of the game. Being able to capture towns through great teamwork and careful planning is highly rewarding. Many games fail to offer the big picture and consequeces of a player's actions in the world, but WWII Online has definitely delivered in this aspect. I cannot shake off the experience of what started as a defence against a German armoured attack at Verdun to finally taking back Bastogne the next day after much bloodshed.

For many f2p players however, in this day and age the subscription business model is one that does not cater to a majority of gamers today as it doesn't with me. While the f2p access offers a good sample of how good WWII Online is, it is not compelling enough to put in a monthly subscription investment towards further development of the game. Albeit, I will still continue playing this game as a f2p player and hope a better business model can be offered! 

P.S. Check my topic on a potential business model that will help f2p players enjoy the game and keep playing!

http://steamcommunity.com/app/251950/discussions/0/3223871682611920807/

author: {'steamid': '76561198024221634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1506047294}
review:
I was looking forward to this game's steam release. I'd been hoping I could find something else to scratch that Planetside 2 itch. But when I finally got ahold of it, oh boy.

First, the interface is incredibly user unfriendly. It took me a while to figure out how to spawn somewhere because I didn't realize that I am obligated to join a mission or a brigade to do so. There is no crosshair on anti-air guns and the fire is just enough off-center that you can't use your normal FPS instincts to aim.

Second, the open world is certainly massive, but it doesn't seem to add anything. Maybe it's one of those things where you need to be a pilot to enjoy it, but as infantry the open world is almost a downside. There are huge gaps in between the smallest fights followed by even bigger gaps which puts the pacing in this game into a death spiral. So I'm left wondering, why open world? What does it add? If it adds nothing, why is it there?

Third, the controls are really flaky and I can't find an option to adjust my mouse sensitivity. The running feels so weird in this game as well, like I'm in a perpetual ice level straight out of mario. When you let go of the key is not necessarily when you stop moving. It's not just an inch or two trying to simulate inertia either, it's like my character's sliding or running for a good 2 feet past where I want to stop.

Fourth, this game has a habit of not telling you shit. Did you know that you have to press Z to go into fire mode with your AA gun? I certainly didn't, I had to figure it out through trial, error, and a google search. Did you know that snipers are locked away until rank 7, which apparently takes quite some play time? I didn't, and if I did then I may not have bothered with this game in the first place. In fact, I'm starting to wonder if the developers intentionally locked it like that so you'd have to subscribe for a while before you get to try and and see if you like it or not.

I expected some faults from a game from 2001 but I didn't expect it to feel like it hasn't been developed since 2001. Counterstrike feels a lot better to play and it can have massive battles that put a lot of the ones I've had so far to shame. If you must have an open world, and I can't believe I'm saying this, play Planetside 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151080123', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1509566763}
review: I've been playing that game way before its released on steam. Worked hard to get to level 5 (months) Now I need to make a new account start all over again. I would love to keep playing and give it a great review but I can't. Game is really hard on almost 5 hours of playing I killed only 3 players and died more than 100 times, some missions the spawn points are so far so you walk and walk and walk to the objective just die again and again and again, I stay with the group follow orders but still keep dying and can't get any sort of leveling to use better equipments. author: {'steamid': '76561198200253628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1629253567}
review:
The thing is, is that I don't understand why people over judge this game, I've played it for 18 hours as you can see. And yet, I've been completely sold from day one, first 30 minutes. This game offers a HUGE map, and I'm not reviewing this game over a map. I'm reviewing this game because of how well done it is. The devs have managed to keep this going since 2001. The teamwork is flawless, weapons, flawless, everything else (other than a few bugs here and there but I'm sure they can be fixed.) are flaweless. And the numer one thing you should never over judge a game on, is the subscription option. Yes! Yes! Yes! I know! "Subscription sucks!" How else are the dev's going to earn money? DLCs? gtfo. Honestly. Yeah Tagging a game Free To Play is an asshole of a move. But good lord throw away your canisters of salt. The least that the devs and the WWII Online Veterans want is people complaining about the subscription. They made a deal where you pay $14.99 for 3 months... 3 months... By then you'd already have another $15 ready to go. 


Pros: 
-Good mechanics (+2/10)
-Amazing map size (+3/10
-Classical Graphics (+0.5/10)
-Amazing teamwork (+4/10)
-Non pay to win (+0.5/10)

Both:
- Subscription

Cons:

-Terrible Axis Officers (-0.5/10)
-Minor bugs (-0.5/10)
-People switching sides every 2 minutes and mainly giving the Allied forces the upper hand. (-2/10)
-Too many spies in the Discord and the game. (-2/10)
-Dev's not paying too much attention to player demands. (-1/10)

Overall, I rate the game 5/10. To see reasons why, please scroll up and look at the pros and cons. 

I hope you found my review helpful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031149890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1577448813}
review:
I've been playing this game on and off since 2001 (who knows how many thousands of hours I've acrrued, I had over 20,000 posts in the forums). It's great seeing it on Steam now, but I'll probably play with my non-Steam version (I couldn't find much difference between them). Some will love it, some will hate it. As far as reviews go, there are the typical fanboy players, and typical troll at all cost which have overwhelming hate for CRS. Something to note, basically a few years ago players had to band together to take over development. The old CRS is gone (I think the old CRS group last had a content patch around 2011 or so).

I'm not a typical modern gamer, perhaps why this appeals to me. I prefer simulators and 4X games over other types of games. I've made many friends from this community. Teamwork is key for success (especially if you are new). I suggest finding a squad. 

PROS:
pretty much the only online first person war simulator of its kind
I've been playing for 16 years so that should say something
map is huge (Europe modeled in half scale, with no loading screens)
damage models are interesting
vehicles have more real feel than other games
community, the devs were all players

CONS:
old graphics (I don't care about graphics much personally)
subscription based
where are the Italians?
you need a joystick for flying (not an issue for me, I have a Warthog HOTAS)
probably won't see many content patches like in the old days
mandatory training is annoying (especially for a vet like me)

author: {'steamid': '76561198051004489', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1505276430}
review:
An aged relic of days long past that has clearly aged beyond it's expiration date.
- Running simulator
- Can't see what everyone is shooting at simulator.
- tedious spawn, respawn, and despawn times that slow the pace of the game to a grinding slog.
- manditory game tutorial that is both annoying and worthless in teaching you game aspects. 
- Options are severely limited and features such as resolution do not seem to work at all. 
- Incredibly clunky and unresponsive controls, very VERY low mouse sensitivity.

Pros
You can actually shoot people. Yay, I shot a guy laying down in a bush from 145m and only confirmed the kill because I ran up on his corpse. 

60 minutes of gameplay only saw 1 enemy and he happened to be camping inside a bush, shot him when he crawled out.

Waste of time.

EDIT: This game's community is one of those communities that talks shit on all the reviews that are negative of the game. Just think about that for a moment, this game's community is one of (((those))) communities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077033222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1693785696}
review:
This game is amazing. If you've been looking for a WWII game that's persistent and realistic, it doesn't get any better than this one. Give the graphics a pass because it's the gameplay that is the true star. This is a game where consequences matter. You can feel proud for each kill you get knowing you've denied the enemy access to that vehicle for a short while. You're also more careful with equipment because you know that if you die then you've wasted that vehicle. So if you're flying Close Air Support or a Combat Air Patrol and take a bit of damage, you want to nurse that plane back to base so you can respawn a fresh one. No longer is a game incentivizing you to just kill yourself so you can respawn quicker. 

It is so satisfying to be in an aircraft and strafe a truck full of infantry or towing an AT/AA gun. Or driving a tank to the edge of a hill and going hull down to snipe enemy tanks from a distance. Or running around a town as infantry listening for tank engines so you can flank around them at the next building hoping to get a satchel charge on one of their weak points. The highs this game gives you is unparalleled because of the environment they've set up and cannot be reached in any other game. 

You'll want to join a squad and get on voice coms to get the full experience. Give this game a chance and you'll be hooked. If you do not have the patience for this type of game that's understandable. Know that maybe this game isn't tailored for you but thanks for giving it a try. I do know there is a large community out there dying for a game just like this and for those of you that have been waiting for it, you won't be disappointed.

S! WWIIOL Community! I can't wait to meet you on the battleground.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353809375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1632006520}
review: I used to play this game with a brilliant squad named "The 1st RatPack" I was thirteen at the time and having a flight stick + a good squad led to some epic air/ground and spec ops battles against what felt like an actual army. The engine and graphics are outdated although that assuringly allows you to run this on any budget rig. I don't prefer some of the outdated interface and button mapping but it does have a sort of challenging gameplay. Tanks planes boats... manable and placeable anti-tank and anti-air allows for those without flight sticks or tank skills to take on enemies. Some of the gameplay can be excrutiatingly slow but after 9+ years of being aware of this game... I am definitely recommending it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008419042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 120242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 908, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1710709577}
review:
There is a learning curve but it is worth it. The scale of the map is huge, huge I tell ya!

The LARGEST non-instanced map I have ever played.

Arma, Squad, etc. No comparison this is the most massive battlefield ever encountered. 

I engaged a target city from 7 miles out with a destroyer.

I bombed strategic targets from 20,000 feet, diminishing enemy supply

I rolled out a Sherman and mowed down enemy infantry and Panzer 4's only and got taken out by an enemy Tiger from 1.5K out,

I spawned an Anti-tank gun and later an anti-air gun and was towed by  another player in a truck to an over watch position where I engaged both enemy armor, air craft and infantry with my weapon platform.

I stormed an enemy Armybase with a tight crew, tactically moving til we popped smoked and rushed the target, highly disciplined, captured the main enemy CP in the town, opening up a line on the map for another advance. HUNDREDS of towns, thousands of objectives to fight over during a campaign.

Later I joined a paratrooper mission and made  a 90 player drop over an enemy town, and captured it with the help of friendly  armor, infantry and air, who were decimating the the Attack Objective with a hundred or more  friendly players supporting the attack.

 The whole time more than 100 enemy, real life players were defending the objective. 
This was just one objective; there were hundreds of other players from both sides slugging it out over other targets on an unbelievably gargatuan map.


The learning curve is a bit steep but if you pay attention to the tutorial on the training sever you will do fine. Join a squad, learn the ropes.

I have heard a campaign can last from a few weeks to 3 months with a player high command driving the strategic initiate on offense and defense, and skilled players on the ground leading point attacks and area defenses.

Hands down the the most complex, the most challenging, the most re-playable, the most MASSIVE MMOFPS you will ever play.

Stick with it, this game is worth the loot and worthy of your attention!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198097964681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 4329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1690594236}

Big downer!)  and infantry! gosh how i wanted to play as infantry in war of thunder but never came true. i guess this game beat em too it! i love the idea and i want to play more. but the down side is even at direct 9, having windows 10 with no-graphic card, and everything the game works and its graphics are handled better than antcipated. but i am getting low Frame rate like 22 non populated areas to 9 or 6 or yes even 3 FPS in combat area/ majorly populated (sometimes droping even in unpopulated areas.  and worst yet is i am getting warping players. like they major De-sincronization  like they litterally flying around through walls and fliping and tilting sometimes and i cant see them in front of me even for a minute. id not mind so much if it were my allies but  the bad news is the germans are doing it too! one minute i am ready to pop em or throw a grenade and the next they behind me laughing and shooting me untill i go KIA. i would like to do two things. one ask for people help in solving the issue and two recomend that if you want to play this make sure you got buggs worked out or that your comp can handle it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170105971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1533774701}
review:
I don't understand some of these reviews on this game. Majority of this review will be countering ignorant people posting crappy reviews and they only have played WWII Online for what? Like 20 Minutes? World War II Online takes time to play but its Hella fun. 

@|TG-Irr| Socomseal
First off, Its not optimized because this is a redeveloped version of the Original from 2001 by a completely different Developer. 

Second of all people are complaining about the "Hard" Tutorial, Well if you would have read the instructions instead of rushing through it, it would be alot easier to play.

@FD_Stalker v
Third a person that I've seen said that the Developers are "Greedy", now how in the world are they greedy when they returned a 2001 game that you can actually get everything for free. (No one buys the Membership because the Membership literally is that you get everything early.)

@Chaos panda
Another review I saw was a person who had difficulty finding the Resoultion button in the settings and decided to put in his review that it was a Tiny Ass screen even though you can change it if you just look for the button. This is COMMON SENSE! Also the same review claimed the Gameplay was terrible and that it took him or her 45 minutes to reach the front. (MY GOD, Where in the fucking hell did you spawn!?!?! Did you literally spawn in Germany and run to fucking France?! Or did you spawn in England and Swim to Belgium?)

Misc Info:
Now onto a part of the game I want to discuss with people because people don't understand the Leveling system in WWII Online. In WWII Online, its not like any other First Person shooter where you just shoot and pray you get a Kill, no no no! WWII Online takes time... You need to earn Kills in the game or participate in enough battles to gain Experience. The Experience is then put into a Rank in that Army you chose to fight for say like you were fighting for Germany and you gained experience, that experience would only count towards a Rank advancement in the German Forces.

Some of these Reviewers that posted negative reviews claim to be "Veterans of the game" with years of experience. IF YOU PLAYED THE GAME BEFORE AND LIKED IT THEN, THEN YOU SHOULD LIKE IT NOW. THE GAME LITERALLY HAS NOT CHANGED ITS JUST REDEVELOPED BY A DIFFERENT COMPANY! 
There is such a reviewer whom says the game is just as bad as his grammar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105198306', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1696197243}
review:
WWII Online has won a place in my heart as a "classic" to enjoy , despite all of its quirks and kinks. Fair warning, this may be a bit biass due to my love of this game since 2004. I also want to caution that I use the client and not the steam version, due to the two accounts not being able to be merge-able (for now?) so the hours played will be misleading but here's what I'd say about this game.

[h1]pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Open-world, with half-of Europe being represented in-game at approx half the scale, in other words its HUGE.
[*] Heavily focused on teamwork and communications, being a lone-wolf and being solo will lead to frustration and boredom. Don't alienate yourself from the community if you wanna "git gud"
[*] Realism is not just a 'fancy' buzzword here, they mean it.
[*] People play in "brigades" which are lead by players, and those players are apart of a High-Command, where they coordinate what their entire faction will do, where it will attack and where it defends. Again, heavy on communication
[*] Community is a word which applies in this game, as in ask and many will come to help instead of "gg ez nub".
[*] Destructible buildings and constructible objects  such as sandbags, bunkers, etc, want to experience something close to Saving Private Ryan or Dunkirk where you bunker down in a city and hold despite all hell? This is the game.
[*] Combined arms warfare is extremely fun to participate in and experience, playing a key-role in the movement of units
[*] Guild mechanics or "Squads" make it extremely easy to state important information to your guild mates such as urls and homepages
[*] Community API and tools such as a live web-map of the campaign, a squad stat system, all neat stuff allowing the community to make awesome game tools.
[/list]

[h1]cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] UI is obtuse, it's bloated and  still hard to use (Although the devs have noted this, and are working on it), examples are marking things on the map, joining vehicles, the chat bar itself is easily avoidable and hard to distnguish chat from all the radio chatter, etc, the theater map needs to present more ready-able information none of these "toggle this, toggle that".
[*] Graphics haven't improved from 2004, so you'll get nostalgia of the old days but it definitely is an eye-sore at times
[*] Animations are clumsy, you look goofy when you run, and as some of my friends say "feels cartoony"
[*] Server recognizing hits, at times you'll run into "ghosts" people whom have some on-going network issue thus are unkillable because they already "died" like 5 minutes earlier, also the "quickness" of death takes a while, you have to wait a few seconds before the persona actually dies
[*] 
EDIT: With their revision to the payment model, I still feel the following point stands but I appreciate the fact they finally listened to their player base and prior to steam sale did in fact shave a few dollars off of the subscription packs all across the board. 

Payment models, needs a revision, 12-month locked-in payment with a penalty fee for cancelling early , I know cellphone plans do this but games? Also, the 30-day plan is more expensive at $18.00 USD, not sure if that reflects a "competitive" price to other MMOs; WoW,EvE, SWTOR to name a few. Also the Free to play, is still limited albeit better than original (Only rifles). I'd suggest remove starter subscription and make that the Free-To-Play, and keep $15.00 as the base-line.
[/list]

Nonetheless, it still is a great game despite all its quriks and kinks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035053746', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1555693608}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006212800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1692051349}
review:
Easily one of the best game i have ever played, been a member of this game/community since 2002!

This is a true combined arms game, FPS, Tank simulator, Flight Simulator and a strategic layer which is the TOE (table of equipment, movable  brigades/supply), that players in the high command move around the map, trying to get the upper hand vs their high command oponents. Also it has a bit of Navy combat/play.

** Pros **

True combined arms game
Massive game world/map, no loadingscreens (over 230km map!) 
Physics Based PVP Combat, really well done ballistics model
24/7 persistant map
Friendly community
Devs in touch with community
Not many games model this era in WW2 where u get to fight as french and british during the Axis invasion 
Directional audio is very good, and also very important to learn to survive longer in game
One server to hold all players
The feel of accomplishment when you take a town you've been fighting for 3-4 hours

** Cons **

Graphics and effects
UI (should be easier to get into battle)
Visible limit (currently you can see/render 128 players/enemies inside your rendering zone which is still more then any other game AFAIK)
Very addictive gameplay ;)


See you on the frontlines, S!

/Maxios

review:
Game in a nutshell

open game, find out you play on this tiny ass screen.
pick a army to fight for.
find out you got to do this shitty tutorial.
see everyone spamming smokes in the tutorial.
Every second you hear gunfire and get ptsd that triggers vietnam flashbacks.
pick a army... No ONE PICKS THE FRENCH.
find out that roblox has better graphics. ill give it that it was made in 2001 but still it hurts to look at.
you start running to the frontline that takes 45 mins.
when you finally make it the germans just fuck you up with there mgs.
rages then, joins the air force.
find out that planes are harder to handle than camel cock.
then joins the navy. find out the game never teaches you how to use a fucking boat.
finds out you waited all summer to play this game.


0/10 could of used the time to play with myself.

review: I came back for the steam release after about 7 years. It's still supprisingly fun, particularly with the large battles, tactical pacing, and the ability to dig in.  Balance of infantry to armor is now much better with the majority of players being on free accounts. Technology is just about getting to the point where this game could be replicated with a better looking engine. I hope they are able to somehow licence the star engine from starcitizen when they manage to sort out their netcode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986656590', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1689330599}
review:
one of the best wwii games out there, massive battles, infantry, tanks, atg/aa guns, planes, ships,  the community is   Helpful and great. If you are confused by this game don't worry, just use the help chat in game, people respond instantly and help and you can ask anything.

Don't be put off by the graphics, they're not so bad and then again this game is not about the graphics. Also if you are a new player, I suggest joining brigades that seem to have their bars filled(full) as those are usually where the main battles are happening. 

One more thing, this game is not pay2win. There's no such thing here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041581763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1709514887}
review:
I've been playing this game on-and-off for about 11 years and I still love it. No it doesn't have amazing graphics and you need a subscription to unlock a majority of the content. But what you have is an very difficult game with a steep learning curve. If you're new it will take you a couple of hours to start figuring everything out. And once yu do, everything is extremely rewarding. From the time it may take you to drive a tank to a battlezone, to taking off and flying to a contested airspace, to setting up an AT gun in a bush and lying in ambush, you'll grow an appreciation for this game. The more time you put in, the more rewarding it is. Plain and simple.

For a game that was released in 2001, this game and community has had incredible staying power. It's been a long road getting onto steam and seeing the server so full of players again has really brought a tear to my eye.

*Update* It's now 9/11/17 and the mixed reviews are still coming in. It seems that people don't 'get' what this game is. IT IS A 16 YEAR OLD GAME. No, it's not gonna have great graphics or be optomized or be inherently intuitive. This is because IT IS A 16 YEAR OLD GAME. Take it for it's face value and don't hold this to the standard of modern games. This game has staying power and the playerbase has shown that there is more to a game than just graphics and easyness to play.

Also get this! You need to verify your email address before you can play online, I did try to verify...multiple times....NO EMAIL WAS EVER SENT. You can't even play this fucking game. The idiots that made and run this game are morons. And to this day I am still playing Heroes & Generals. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS GAME.

I've played off steam since 2004.

I'm a Major in the German Army- and I jump out of JU 52's for a living. It's hard work, and it doesn't pay well. But I get to blow stuff up, and cause lots of trouble...(if a spitfire doesnt shoot our plane down first)

My problem is: I need some more crazy f*cks to para with me...becasue all my friends are dead, or probably stuck surrounded in some French town you've probably never heard of.

Join today - to get shot down, shot at, or shot dead - and have fun while doing it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013109127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1504927760}
review:
I hope that this review provides a comprehensive overview of the game. There seems to be some misunderstandings about the game, and there are also some perhaps overly-favorable reviews out there that don't really communicate the strengths and weaknesses of the game.

So, first off. I began playing this game about 6-7 years ago, and had a Free Trial account (that went through many different evolutions and devolutions as the devs tried to hammer out what they wanted as far as a Free to Play trial account went) until late last year, after I subscribed to the game.

I have played a LOT of games, of many different genres. Most of these are WW2-related, including the first real computer games I ever played: the Close Combat series. The originals, not the re-releases.

This game is a WW2 Massively Multiplayer First Person Shooter/Tanker/Pilot/Sailor Historical Accuracy Simulator game. This is not an Arcade shooter, like you might see, for example, in titles such as Call of Duty, Heroes & Generals, Planetside 2, Squad, etc. There are no medics to magically heal you up to perfect, there are no mechanics that can magically repair vehicles. There are no crosshairs allowing you to accurately fire from the hip. The flight mechanics are not arcade flight mechanics. It is very unlikely that you'll be able to even attempt to fly with keyboard & mouse controls, because there is just too much fine control required to actually pilot a plane. There is bullet drop, even from large-caliber guns.

Given that the game is a Historical Accuracy Simulator, there is definitely some Asymmetical Warfare going on. The different guns and equipment of either side are NOT carbon copies of things on the other. There is no equivalent to an 88mm Flak gun on the Allied side, and no equivalent to a Matilda on the Axis (at least not at the time that the Matilda is used). Fighter planes and bombers are not identical to each other, and have very different flight models. However, it is still a game, so sides are roughly balanced with the types and amounts of equipment they can bring to bear in the game.

The game is also absolutely massive. It uses a 1/2 scale map of Western Europe based on satellite data. It is the largest MMO world map, period. It's also completely open: you can spawn in at one end of the map and fly to the other; this actually happens when players organize bombing runs on enemy production factories. Keep in mind, however, that means it can take literal minutes when initially setting up an attack on a town, because players have to drive out, set up mobile spawn points, etc. Walking from one town to another, or even from a forward base to a town, can definitely take 10+ minutes. 

There are 2 layers to the game: Fighting as soldiers/tanks/planes/ships, and moving around Divisions and Brigades on the world map as well as coordinating attack and defense objectives. Only High Command players have access to moving supply around the map, and HC accept applications from individuals and train them up on how to use the game tools to move around supply, and when it's a good idea to do so. As for fighting on the ground, in the air, or on the seas, players spawn in, using up supply from said divisions and brigades, in order to achieve objectives. These objectives can be attacking or defending towns, blowing or repairing bridges, blowing or defending forward bases, etc. When players are killed, despawn without being in a "Return to Base" area, or are sufficently wounded/damaged, then that supply doesn't go back to the division or brigade it came from. Supply trickles in based on the production rates of a side's factories.

Additionally, it can be said that there are two different ways to play the game in terms of fighting in the actual game world: tactically and strategically. Tactical play is basically anything that's fun and exciting: attacking a hotly contested area, defending a hotly contested area, assaulting defensive positions, shooting down planes, bombing towns, etc. Strategic play is basically anything that your side really needs you to do that's NOT fun or exciting: defending critical control points from sneaky enemies infiltrating behind enemy lines, defending forward bases from intermittent attack, etc. It's VERY LIKELY that some newer players will happen upon these strategic missions, and may mistake the lack of action that's due to the strategic importance of a given mission for the game being boring. In this case, newer players should leave that mission and go to one that's more immediately satisfying, so they can get a feel of the actual meat of the game, which is that wonderful tactical play.

At the present time, there is no integrated voice chat. You will have to rely on the third-party application Discord. However, Discord is a very solid application to use in the mean time while the developers work on integrated natively supported voice communication in the game.

The in-game groups are known as "squads" - these are basically the same thing as "clans" or "gaming clubs" that you might see in other games. Playing this game solo is like playing a single individual soldier who knows no one around them while fighting in an actual war. You're going to die A LOT. Everyone does, even 16-year veterans to the game. Doing that over and over, without being a part of a group, is going to wear you down. You're just not going to enjoy the gameplay, because it's not going to feel personal. You're not going to be able to know what's happening around you. You're not going to be able to coordinate movements or attacks while playing if you're not in a squad or if you're not on voice comms. I implore new players to use Discord whether or not they're in a squad, and to immediately try using Discord. Almost all of the current players have been trying to do everything they can to help the new players coming in, and that includes helping them out on voice comms.

The biggest thing I have been seeing is that there are complaints about the Free to Play accounts. There are accusations of hiding content behind a pay wall. There is a lot of disgruntlement over just what and how much Free to Play accounts should get access to. The reality of the situation is that World War II Online uses a PAY TO PLAY business model. This is the same business models that MMOS up to and prior to World of Warcraft use, in that to actually play the game, you need to pay. However, your account is still left ACTIVE after the initial trial period. This is meant to allow you to continue to see what the game has to offer, in the hopes that you eventually subscribe. Therefore, once an account loses its premium status, it is HEAVILY RESTRICTED. You get access to the mainstay of the infantry, which is the standard bolt-action rifles everyone, including premium players, use. This is because weapons are tied to supply, and there could be hundreds of bolt-action rifles to spawn with, but only a few dozen sub-machine guns. You also get access to early sub-machine guns, trucks, and perhaps some other early equipment. You can, and this is the HUGE one, create your own missions, and run out and make your own mobile spawn points. That allows you to not only play at the tactical level, but also on the strategic level, so you can contribute meaningfully to the side that you play on. Considering that the game is Pay to Play, in my personal opinion, the Free to Play accounts have enough content, because they're meant to keep you around if you're interested but can't afford it or aren't sure until you can afford it or until you're sure whether or not it's worth it for you.

Lastly, there is simply nothing else like this game. I mean that very seriously. A lot of people have been throwing out "Heroes & Generals", but that's not close. A better comparison is a combination of Foxhole and Planetside 2, but with the mechanics of a Red Orchestra game. Still, none of those, on their own, offer what this game does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028059946', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 28186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8507, 'last_played': 1605487774}
review:
Eu jogo World War II Online desde 2004 muito antes de vir para Steam.
jogo ter vindo para steam est√° surgindo muitos player ressucitando novamente o game, isso muito bom ver novamente jogo no seu real pot√™ncia novamente.

- jogadores do mundo inteiro Conectados num Unico interino mapa. (enquanto se trava uma batalha no norte da belgica, pode est√° acontecendo batalhas ao sul tamb√©m ao mesmo tempo.)
- Mapa Gigantesco da Europa, cont√©m praticamente todas cidades da Belgica, Holanda, Parte da Europa e Alemanha... OPS voce pode percorrer de uma ponta do mapa a outra, isso vai levar horas da vida real de t√£o grande o mapa √©.
- N√£o Cont√©m BOT, jogo todo movido por player's, 
- Combates intensos, podem durar dias numa unica cidade, mapa √© destrutivel, tanto que se combate for intenso cidades v√£o ruindo at√© sobra apenas escombros, jogo tem base em Campanha, Campanhas podem durar meses at√© quando um dos lados perde pontos vitais estrategicos do mapa, for√ßando se render incondicionalmente, e por fim na campanha e recome√ßar nova campanha
- jogo tem cronnologia de desenvolvimento de tecnologia, campanha come√ßa em 1939, passando dias, v√£o surgindo equipamentos novos, at√© jogo chegar data de 1945 aonde jogo vai disponibilizando diversos equipamentos que foram utilizados na Segunda Guerra mundial.
- Jogo tem base forte sobre logistica e Cont√©m 3 for√ßas militares, For√ßas Armadas, For√ßa A√©rea, For√ßa Naval, aonde ambas 3 for√ßas d√£o suportes, em conjunto.
- Quando Voc√™ tem experencia, voc√™ pode fazer parte Alto Comando do Exercito, Eixo ou Aliado, assim comandar brigadas e divis√µes do jogo.
- Comunidade Forte e unida, tanto que manteve o jogo ativo desde 2001.
- Desenvoldores atentos, sempre escutando novas id√©ias dos players.

Recomendo esse jogo para todo mundo, apesar de seus graficos serem de 2001, jogo cont√©m muita complexidade, vale apena jogar e ter uma experencia do jogo.
quem quiser um help e entender mais do jogo, s√≥ me adcionar na steam e bora jogar junto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198243575116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1510614345}
review:
Very fun game when played with a team of friends, grab a SdKfz 222 and do a recon patrol on the flank of a major city across the western front. Get together as a Fallshrimjager squad and paradrop with others into fields lined with 100's of enemy tank, players and aircraft. You get the picture, you might not bump into anyone for 40 minutes straight but that's where the simulator and large scale war feelings comes in, not a game for someone who expects contact and pvp every 2 seconds. 

The air combat is probably my favourite part, comparable to IL21946 where real flight physics and dogfight tactics matter. Energy fighting and tons of aircraft to chose from. A LOT of very skilled pilots out there so beware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036248822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1504881489}
review:
CLARO Y CONCISO: Si eres genuino y verdadero amante, freaky o estudioso de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, este juego es el tuyo. Y punto. Lo dem√°s, ni te lo plantees.

Para m√≠ y muchos otros compa√±eros, este juego forma parte de nuestra vida. En mi caso, no hay ning√∫n otro t√≠tulo al que SIEMPRE me haya mantenido enganchado. Me alist√© en febrero de 2009 y aqu√≠ sigo. 

Visualmente no es nada extraordinario. Su motor gr√°fico, del 2001, est√° desactualizado. Pero, ¬øy qu√©? Lo importante del World War II Online (el WWIIOL, para los amigos) no radica ah√≠, sino en su realismo (salvando las distancias, claro, es un videojuego), la credibilidad de su sistema bal√≠stico, la fidelidad del comportamiento de cada arma o veh√≠culo etc etc. Aqu√≠ los blindados no explotan con una granada, ni la infanter√≠a necesita 5 o 6 tiros para morir, como si llevaran capas y capas de chalecos antibalas (con un tiro mueres, y punto). Pero sobre todo lo que hace √∫nico a este juego es su sistema de armas combinadas (hay unidades de tierra, mar y aire), que luchan en un √∫nico mapa, constante y permanente, en un √∫nico servidor mundial para todos y en un terreno vast√≠simo (300.000km2, escala 1:2, una BRUTALIDAD). 

En esencia: esto no es un "arcade" cualquiera. Este juego es muy complicado de aprender y se tarda en disfrutar y comprender en profundidad. Pero una vez que lo haces... No hay NADA M√ÅS en el mercado de videojuegos de la SGM que se acerque a esto. Si te atreves a meterte aqu√≠, hazlo de la mano de jugadores veteranos. Los que llevamos aqu√≠ mucho tiempo estamos para ayudar, ense√±ar y entrenar a los nuevos. As√≠ lo hicieron en el pasado otros tambi√©n con nosotros.

Porque, s√≠, lo mejor del WWIIOL es la gente. Unidades (squads/clanes) que llevamos muchos a√±os en esto, que forjamos amistad y competitividad sana entre nosotros, entre gente de todos los pa√≠ses del mundo. Seguimos jugando al WWIIOL porque hemos forjado una comunidad que es, sin exageraciones, la envidia de muchos otros videojuegos m√°s modernos. 

El juego tiene sus "peros", claro, como todos. En realidad, es un juego que, aunque lleve 16 a√±os en el mercado, SIGUE EN DESARROLLO y ha pasado por momentos dif√≠ciles. Es un juego indie, desarrollado por una empresa muy peque√±a que se financia b√°sicamente (√∫nicamente, dir√≠a yo) con las suscripciones de la comunidad. El juego tiene, como cualquier otro, sus bugs, sus momentos 'WTF' y sus problemas de Lag. No todo es perfecto. Pero, sincera y honestamente, estos problemas no empa√±an en absoluto lo que es el WWIIOL: una idea brillante, un juego √∫nico y una m√°quina de hacerte pasar momentos inolvidables. 

Gracias por leer, y espero que lo prob√©is y lo disfrut√©is. 

ACTUALIZO A 20/01/2018: Se acaba de publicar aqu√≠ (https://www.wwiionline.com/game-news/development-notes/16497-2018-roadmap-for-wwii-online?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+battlegroundeurope%2FeKII+%28World+War+II+Online%29) el plan de mejora del juego para este a√±o y se adelantan algunas im√°genes de c√≥mo se empieza a construir su versi√≥n 2.0 en motor gr√°fico Unreal Engine 4.

review:
El juego se siente muy antiguo en todos los aspectos, s√≠ el mapa es grande puede haber muchos jugadores y tal pero... para mi no es un juego que valga la pena, √≥jo que a alguno le gustar√°.

- El sonido deja much√≠simo que desear, es muy malo, ya no es cosa de la calidad de los sonidos (que son tambi√©n malos) sino que no puedes ni diferenciar la direcci√≥n por el sistema tan antiguo que usa.

- Los gr√°ficos son antiguos pero es que aparte de eso en lo que es el terreno es muy pobre, los edificios y dem√°s se siente muy "early 2000s", no me importa que no tenga gr√°ficos punteros pero que sea tan pobre en otros aspectos pues como que no, por no nombrar que el juego va a 1080p 32hz/fps.

- El gameplay se siente muy random, el disparar las armas, recargar, etc. Se siente muy random y poco trabajado para ser un juego que lleva en desarrollo m√°s de 15 a√±os, se deber√≠an haber esforzado m√°s en calidad y no cantidad.

Tienes sus cosas buenas pero eso, yo simplemente no puedo jugar un juego que el sonido no sea ni 3D y que el gameplay se sienta tan poco trabajado y random.

Como dije antes seguramente a otros les guste pero yo me quedar√© con heroesandgenerals aunque tenga sus defectos.


Aparte estamos en 2017, esto en el 2005-2010 puede que cuele pero 2017 no, los desarrolladores deber√≠an actualizarce un poco, no les vendr√≠a nada mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960626849', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1705802658}
review:
Ignore my short play time, I have played 100s if not 1000s of hours since 2001.

This game is an mmofps.  There is one persistent game world that is 1/4 scale of many parts of western europe.  Every new battle starts with half the map belonging to the allies and the other half belonging to the axis.  You must go city to city capturing each city and pushing the other side back.  

There are infantry, air, sea, and land vehicles. Supply lines determine what you are capable of spawning. There are not unlimited vehicles.

The graphics are quite dated but the game makes up for it in game play.  The developers are also the best in the industry.

The only downside is the monthly fee.  You get a trial period to level and use what you unlock, but when the trial ends you are locked to extreme limited game play choices. 

It's free, so you might as well try it.  You can keep playing as limited  infantryman, or pay to unlock the rest.

The is one of the top 5 best games I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008818553', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1505343592}
review:
Founding Member 2001

Don't let the graphics fool you.  I started playing this when it was released in June 2001 and I'm glad to see it finally released to a much larger audience.  The amount of detail, the variety of roles, equipment, tactics, vehicles, physics/damage model and the sheer number of players that are on the map at any given time is unsurpassed in this type of sub-genre.

Want to be a lone-wolf and roam the country looking for unsuspecting tank commanders who like to drive around with their hatches open and their heads exposed?  That tank is now immobilized by your superior tactics and a cheap bullet.  Want to be a part of a massive paratrooper drop? Then hop on a flight and hope a fighter doesn't find you first.  My point is that you may think this could be a pay-to-win model, but it's not.  

You can have lots of fun and do some real damage with even the simplest of weapons.  Although I've been a paying subscriber, my favorite tactics are those that involve guerilla warfare.  "Kill em with a stick".  There is nothing more fun than beating the player with the biggest, most powerful weapon by using better tactics and a cheaper, less powerful weapon.    

I can't even begin to tell you how many unique and fun experiences I've had playing this with hundreds of people from all over the world.  This game never died.  That's right, its been around since 2001, but was never been exposed to the masses on Steam until now.  

There is a reason why the new team behind Cornered Rat Software is finally bringing it to Steam.  The gameplay has proven to be sustainable/fun and exposure to a successful game service model with a huge pool of potential players will surely extend its already long lifespan.

It is a social experience (If you want it to be) and a never-ending war on one map that saves your progress.  Don't worry about the graphics not being top-of-the-line like todays releases.  This will simply be overlooked after you discover whats really available under the hood and it also makes this game accessible to more gamers who won't need the latest, most expensive equipment to play.    

Nobody thought Minecraft, CS-GO or PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds would be a hit because of their outdated looks.  It was their superior/addictive gameplay that pushed those titles to historical highs.  I hope the same happens to WW2 Online here on Steam.  It already has its longevity award. 

Give this a try.  There is a big learning curve and you will be required to complete an initial training tutorial, but you will be glad you did later.  Read more about this games history here:        

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_Online

author: {'steamid': '76561198012114767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1682202533}
review:
This game does have dated graphics, but for me that is a worthwhile trade off to have such a huge playable map.
The small indy team of devs deserves support and I really hope the game continues to improve.

Be warned though: This game is hard mode. Don't expect to be good just because you play cs:go or any regular shooter. To excel in this game takes practice with each and every unit.

Grab a rifle and I'll see you in the fields!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070713555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1523051045}
review:
I've played this game pretty much all my life, my father introduced me to this game when I was really young back in 04-05ish, and I've been playing it ever since. 

To me, this is the perfect WWII game, combining a massive map with Land, Air, and Sea combat, sure the graphics are lacking and the movement isn't perfect, but the overall gameplay experience makes up for it.

To see this game have another shot at getting back even somewhat to what it used to be is great. I'm excited to see CRS steadily working to improve the game and bring new artowrk to make it more apealing. It's incredible to see a game that released in 2001 still being regularly updated.

I strongly reccomend at least trying out this game, and giving it a fair chance.

iEliTe, in game name: Mustang.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085736968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1592690397}
review:
[h1]*re-posting since the EA reviews were wiped*[/h1]

i've played for 3 years as major0noob outside of steam, the 4.6hours was just me testing steam version and providing feedback if nessesary. outside steam i've clocked at least 2000 hours, it used to be very fun.



[b] i really want to stress this one point:[/b] you can go 1 hour with no contact with the enemy.


 they're not hiding, it's just a 10km march. thats no joke or exaggeration, a litteral 10km hike.
as i said i've played for 3 years, i know how to get to the action and i know how to get a battle started.
the DEV's refuse to go in game and see people hiking 10km, no spawns being set up and the only spawns in game being spawncamped (as in spawn-instadeath). it does not exist to them and therefore is not a problem...

in the past 10 months i spent 2-5 hours per game session with less than 5 encounters with the enemy... the devs love it.
3-5 hours... i can't stress this enough, i counted 50+ people playing but i only encountered a handful and the devs are saying we're "playing the game wrong", all 50 of us, for 3 hours...

the gunplay is silly. while aimed down sights SMG's have 1m spread at 20m... (IRL 10-18cm)
riflemen drop their gun after every. single. shot. like they're shooting a musket

the air game is famously broken, for years the axis air force has been spitfire pilots swiching sides.

default keybindings are unintuitive, there are basic functions spread all across the keyboard.

the starter account is: the worst SMG's (with 2 reloads) + tankettes (no or pathetic cannons) + obsolete AAA & ATG (literally obsolete at the start of WW2, they only work on *some* tankettes)
they're all useless after 1 year in game (5 days-2 weeks IRL) when the next teir is introduced
*this has been split to ALL DLC*


3 hours with almost no contact... it's unbelievable, went on for a year and only got a minor fix

author: {'steamid': '76561198031547557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1504634257}
review:
Conoci este juego en 2005, desafortunadamente no podia jugar con mi conexion de 56kbps.... En cuanto puse cable lo volvi a instalar y buuuuuf, cambio mi concepcion de los videojuegos para siempre. Un unico servidor, un unico mapa sin interrupciones ni cargas... y una campa√±a entera "player driven" que llaman ahora. Todo en un mundo totalmente persistente abierto las 24h del dia los 365 dias al a√±o. Todo, absolutamente todo, es movido por los jugadores. El juego esta en constante mejora y elimacion de bugs.

Simula la campa√±a de Francia del a√±o 40.Existen dos bandos, los aliados (Francia, Fuerza Expedicionaria Britanica, USA) o el Eje (Alemania... de momento). Actualmente es la campa√±a n¬∫ 141 y para que os hagais una idea, estaremos en el 50 dia de campa√±a.... Es la mejor experiencia online que he tenido sin duda. He jugado muchisimo al antiguo OFP, despues al ARMA el ARMA 2 (en steam no tengo muchas horas) y el ARMA 3, juego al Squad tambien algo, Foxhole...Elite, Battlefield... Y NADA, absolutamente NADA, me ha dado lo que este juego me ha dado. Maneja carros de combate, aviones, barcos, casi todo tipo de infanteria.... Unete al Alto Mando y encargate del movimiento de divisiones por el mapa estrategico, remuniciona a los carros, protegelos de los zapadores enemigos o los bazokas. Olvidate de rollos historicos, por que el juego es un "Y que pasaria si....??". 

Tecnicamente hablando, los graficos son malos, SI, y de cojones ademas. El juego data del a√±o 2001, pero la jugabilidad, el hecho de volar un carro con un infante, ser mas listo que el oponente, adquiere en este juego dimensiones que no encontraras en ningun otro. El mayor problema de los jugadores EURO es el lag, ya que el servidor esta en Texas, pero se puede jugar sin problemas, eso si, no te esperes una conexion como la de un servidor de Holanda. El servidor o mejor dicho, los servidores,estan en Bedford, Texas y tienen capacidad de albergar a unos 4.000 jugadores a la vez. Ahora mismo, acaban de mejorar toda la nfraestructura de red.

Matar aqui es jodido, tardas tiempo en conseguir ver al pu√±etero EI del que todo el mundo habla (EI es como llaman en el juego a la infanteria enemiga), pero cuando empiezas a conseguirlo, a ser mas listo "cazando" que otros, el simple matar de otros juegos, adquiere en este una gratificacion sublime. Aparte de todo esto, el juego es un buen simulador, simula la balistica de los proyectiles, la penetracion de los blindajes.... No es perfecto, por supuesto, y es mejorable, pero en breves sacaran una version con nueva balistica muy mejorada. Y ahora mismo, la que tiene, ya la querrian muchos AAA que rondan por ahi. La curva de aprendizaje es larga, tardas en situarte en la batalla, en matar, en ser efectivo, en distinguir el sonido de cada arma y vehiculo pero cuando aprendes y ademas lo haces en equipo, es una experiencia muy muy gratificante. Llevo una decada jugando y aun sigo siendo un paquete.

La comunidad es muy buena, de hecho yo juego en la 250 Hispana, si quieres probar el juego y jugar con nosotros, pasate por nuestro foro http://www.250-hispana.es/foro/ estaremos encantados de ayudarte. Llevo jugando en esta Squad desde 2009, para que os hagais una idea. Los desarrolladores son gente voluntaria, con sus trabajos etc. Participan en los foros respondiendo al personal y, la verdad, es que son buena gente y jugadores del juego. Si, juegan al juego y coincides de vez en cuando. Ahora mismo estan trabajando en otra version futura del juego con motor Unreal4.

Sobre el tema de suscripciones, el juego, todo hay que decirlo, no es barato, son unos 12‚Ç¨ al mes la premium, aunque a veces lanzan ofertas. Yo por ejemplo estoy pagando la premium a 8‚Ç¨ al cambio. Con lo que cuesta un cubata en cualquier antro de barriete o el polvo de ladrillo del tonto del pueblo, las horas de diversion que me ha dado este juego, son impagables. 

En fin, si eres un jugador que busca un juego algo mas hardcore que 16x16 de Heroes & Generals, MMO persistente y todo el mundo en un unico servidor con capacidad de 4.000 personas, le daria una oportunidad SI o SI. Si lo haces, tomatelo con calma. ;) !S

author: {'steamid': '76561198031462937', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1556741263}
review:
This game has potential but here are the things i really wish and propably alot of other players wish that would like to be fixed

Be in mind im not an expert Reviewer im just a guy who likes to play games i rarely make any reviews.

For now the things i wish to be worked on

1. Tutorial:
For now the tutorial seems to explain things quite alright but i keep getting stuck at the map tutorial when i hower over an Army base in the tutorial city and that means since im stuck there i can't be able to finish the tutorial because they are locked until you finish all the tutorials one step at the time.

So it will also mean you wont be able to actually go online until you finish the tutorials ( wich i think should be changed to suggest training instead of being forced to do it)

Ship tutorial needed.
plane tutorial needed.

So please make it so you can chose wich one of the tutorials you want to chose.
and fix the map tutorial cuz im stuck there ;~;


2. Menu and graphics: The menu can be a little confusing sometimes but it's no problem for me, i can get used to it.
But my GOD why is there no button in the menu that can let me leave the offline servers to the online servers?
I literally have to quit the game first and THEN i can chose a one way ticket that in the end if i don't want to do online anymore and tutorial you "Have" to quit the game before you can do that, please add a button please! (there might be a button that i havent seen and if there is then please make ot more visible)

Now to the graphics: i don't mind the current graphics as it is supposed to be, because it's meant to be played by ALOT of players so it wont be to hard for the server, and games doesnt need Insane graphics to be good makes.
But the resolution is just too much i would love to have more resolution options please.

3: gameplay/engine ( I have not found anything that needs to be fixed so far so this is more of a oppinion of it )

So far ( with the lack of tutorial ) there is no problem about the gameplay everythings seems to be in order and, it has good physics, a giant map tio play on.

And you have your own smaller map that can help with cordinating artilerry strikes or assault/invading on a city.

bassically alot of things are not broken because of the game, it's a game that needs to be learned and there will be trial and error so don't get disccouraged :>

That was it for my review, again not expert reviewer just a gamer that likes games

My overall personal rating: 65/100
If the tutorial were fixed and more tutorials added to it my ratings would be higher.


This game has alot of potential for a big community who shares their love for classic tactical warfare that requires cordinations and teamwork to win.

So if your a fan of military tactic games with alot of potential people then this is the game for you.

This game is early acces it cannot be denied that there is always something that is missing or needed to be fixed, but hey that's what reviews are for.
To help the developers make a better game for us players :D

So do follow them and see what they will do more, i know i will.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978592439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1676224841}
review: The graphics may not be the most modern, it may look a little old to young eyes these days. But the gamplay which has always been the core of WWIIOL still holds up. I just jumped on to play and see how the steam release is doing and it's looking good. So many players online right now, makes me happy to see this game still going. I played this religously between 2004 and 2011. I always keep coming back to it, very few games come close to the depth  and scale that WWIIOL provides. Hopefully the influx of players will help the Rats be able to finish the engine upgrade, the future looks promising for this game. The game can have a bit of a learning curve, so be sure to take your time and work through all of the tutorial missions, it'll pay off learning how to use the various weapons, map and even how to operate a tank.

review:
This is a fnatastic game!  I have played it for years.  it has a steep learning curve, lacking the real eye candy of a Call of Duty or Battlefield; however with it's HUGE map, physics and demand for team work, it is in a class all on it's own.  If you like to fly in combat you are going to love the air game.  This game continues to be a work in progress.  Are there bugs, sure.  Do the developers work hard to correct them YES! This small development team is amazing with their level of community engagement.  The release onto STEAM should be huge for this game.  Over the next months and years,  lots of fantastic new units and features are scheduled.  Get hooked on this game it is amazing and it also helps support the little guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198151417106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1505934734}
review: It's... Meh. Not Much fun. And the Tutorial is Taking FOREVER to Learn.
developer_response:
Our game play cannot be judged on the tutorial experience Jack. I would strongly advise completing your tutorials and then logging in to the main game. Graphics is definitely not our appeal but our game can hold up. It's the sheer awe of hundreds of players in a single battle zone duking it out. If you don't give it the proper chance to experience that, you'll miss out on a lot.

The tutorial is a necessary evil and I can understand you perhaps are not interested. If we don't teach you some basics, you will be completely lost by the time you enter the actual Campaign. 

My hope is, you try it out some more. This game has been around since 2001, there is a reason. Give it a proper chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970824102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1522620530}
review:
WWII Online is an old game. I played it first in 2005.
The question is, why should you play such an outdated game?

First, It is a MMOFPS. All the War Thunder and Heroes and Generals and other wannabe MMOs are basically 16x16ish games. Here you can play with thousands in massive battles on massive seamless map with persistent campaign. The only other game that can itself MMOFPS is Planetside II, with a much smaller map. There is no other game that attempted the same goal and I doubt any other game will. Period.

Second, there is no money / xp / golds, etc. There is only a rank - newbie can't take a Tiger tank because he would waste it in two minutes. You play long enough and you can drive / fly anything. No microtransactions, booster packs, no bullshit.

Third, you will join a great community of mature players.


Now, this is all great, but there is the other side...

The graphics is outdated. A lot. But this will be changed in the future, if you care.

This is not a game for casual players. The game is hugely teamplay oriented, rambo style will not get you far. 

Be prepared to invest some time into learning the actual tactics with the given vehicle, before you have any success ... For example, you can shoot all your 30mm rounds from an AT gun into a tank and still do nothing to it - the armor plate might be too thick. You need to learn where to hit and under what angle. Every tank has its weaknesses. All this is based on the real stuff research.

If you do not recognize that and play it as a one man action, you are about to get into running / dying / waiting simulator.

Ok, even after all that, why should you give them your time and / or money?

If you support them, they will make the game up to date, even with new graphics (they considered UE4) and things like VOIP. The game had a long history and was having a slow death with limited updates and the playerbase decreasing. Now, there is new dev team in the house - they mean it and they can deliver.

The question for you is, what are you going to do about it?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971197167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1608410094}
review: S!... I have actually been playin WWII online MANY years since closed BETA. My ingame name "Warfinge" was created in this game. LOL, because it wouldn't accept "Warfinger" as one letter too long.  The scale of the game actually makes up for the crude graphics.  Combined air, land and sea battles with pretty good simulation physics has kept me coming back all these years. Teamwork is absolute in your experience. If you are a lone wolf, I don't think you will thrive in this game. The "High Command" in the game is of course real people. You can actually rise in rank in game but within high command as well. I am excited that it has arrived on Steam because of the hundreds of new players it will bring. I think you will all find the Developers of this game are accessable in-game and the whole experience is a personal one. Give it a shot! See you ingame... S!
